loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan Monday is currently in the business of selling rice, soda, sugar and soap at her shop and is requesting a loan to stock cartons of salt, bags of sugar and bags of beans to sell.  Susan is 28 years old and is married. Her husband is a soldier. She has 2 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house and pay the school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy supplies of cartons of salt, bags of sugar and bags of beans to sell

loans.name: Ishaka

texts.en:
Ishaka B., 52, has now been running his poultry-rearing and transport service business for 12 years in Nakasozi-Mpigi. Being relentlessly steadfast, resolute and purposeful in his business operations has enabled him to obtain a footing in his business. This former government employee and happy-go-lucky married father of seven sturdy-looking children says he initially reared chickens for home consumption. Upon learning of poultry's commercial possibilities he made the decision to start this enterprise which, with time, has proven to be lucrative. 

Ishaka also runs a rental business, and both enterprises earn him a monthly income of 1,100,000 shillings.  His current situation of supporting family and relatives has not favored the expansion of his business, as he has to shoulder the responsibilities of providing welfare for many people. He is very optimistic, however, that with a loan, he will be able to buy more chicken feed for his young sprouting chicks and also more chickens. He anticipates buying about 300 new birds.

loans.use: The purchase of more chicken feed and chickens

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina F. is from the town of Trento. She is 30 years old. Gina is married and has four school-aged children. She is involved in farming and has been planting and harvesting rice crops for 12 years now. She also started growing pigs recently. She works hard to improve her business and to earn better. She says it is quite difficult for her because her children's school fees keep increasing.

Gina joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gina has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Gina is requesting a new loan of 6,000 Philippine pesos (PHP), which will be used to purchase fertilizers, such as manure, and livestock feed. This will be the second loan taken out by Gina from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, such as manure, and also livestock feed

loans.name: Joice

texts.en: Joice A. is currently in the business of selling charcoal, cooking oil and cassava at the market and is requesting a loan to stock more cassava, fish, Irish potatoes to sell.  Joice is 35 years old and is married to a husband who is a soldier. She has 4 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a restaurant.

loans.use: Stock more cassava, fish, and Irish potatoes to sell

loans.name: Perla

texts.en:
Perla O. is from the town of Trento. She is 40 years old. Perla is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Perla owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Perla has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

Perla joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Perla has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Perla is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the second loan taken out by Perla from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years.  Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.  CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha B. is from the town of Veruela. She is 48 years old. Editha is married and has 3 children. To make a living, Editha owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Editha has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities. Editha also runs a sari-sari (general) store where she sells a variety of different products.

Editha joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Editha has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Editha is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to purchase farm inputs and additional store inventory. This will be the second loan taken out by Editha from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to their house.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and additional store inventory

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose S. is currently in the business of selling tomatoes, beans, and rice at the market  and is requesting a loan to stock bags of charcoal, dried fish and onions to sell.  Rose is 28 years old and is married to a husband who is a nurse. She has 2 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house to rent out.

loans.use: Stock bags of charcoal, dried fish and onions to sell

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce N. lives in Ntinda, a neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has 3 children, all of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members (her sister).     Joyce has a business of selling weave-on braids and hair plaits.  She has been in this business for 3 years, and she works 6 days out of every week. 

Joyce sells her products in a shop, retail.    Joyce has requested a loan of 1,500,000/= Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more boxes of weave-ons, creams, and braids.     The main business challenges for Joyce include   defaulters and seasonality.  Her aspiration for her business is to own two salons.  She decided to join MCDT because of their giving out timely loans. 

Joyce lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include paying utility bills, food, rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of weave-ons, braids and cosmetics

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn M. is from the town of Veruela. She is 42 years old and married with eight school-aged children. She is a farmer and earns her living through planting and harvesting rice crops. She also owns a sari-sari store where she sells various products. Marilyn works hard to provide for her family and to give her children a proper education. She wishes to have all her children finish college someday.

Marilyn joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marilyn has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Marilyn is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers, such as manure, and additional store inventory. This will be her second loan from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and additional store inventory

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene C. is from the town of Veruela. She is 39 years old and married with seven school-aged children. To make a living, Arlene owns and operates a business venture raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Arlene has been engaged in farming for over two years and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month from these activities. She also grows pigs for fattening and sale. 

Arlene joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Arlene has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Arlene is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to purchase seed, fertilizer and feed for the pigs. This will be her second loan from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to pay her children's tuition fees.

loans.use: To purchase seed, fertilizer and feed for pigs

loans.name: Rudy

texts.en:
Rudy C. is from the town of Bunawan. He is 56 years old and married with five school-aged children. To make a living, Rudy owns and operates a business venture raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice and corn for sale.

Rudy joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rudy has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Rudy is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase seedlings and fertilizers. This will be his sixth loan from CEVI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase seedlings and fertilizers

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is happily married and has three children who attend school. She owns a home with electricity and piped water. She says food is her greatest expense.

Veronica is a tailor and has run a tailoring school at her home for over ten years. She joined Yehu so as to access financial support. With the Kshs 20,000 loan, she wants to buy clothing materials for her tailoring business.

Veronica’s greatest challenge in her business is seasonality as most of her customers’ needs occur mainly during special days such as during wedding ceremonies which mostly happen during the holidays in the months of April, August and December.

Veronica also owns a rental house as her other source of income. She hopes to open a bigger shop for her tailoring business.

loans.use: To buy more clothing materials for her tailoring business

loans.name: Shirly

texts.en:
Shirly D. is from the town of Bunawan. She is 52 years old and is married with seven school-aged children.

Shirly owns and operates a business planting and harvesting rice and corn for sale. She dreams of seeing all her children finish college and have bright futures.

Shirly joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI.

Shirly is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase rice and corn seed, fertilizer and other farm inputs. This loan will be her sixth from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children’s tuition fees.

loans.use: To purchase rice and corn seed, fertilizer and other farm inputs

loans.name: Digna

texts.en:
Digna D. is from the town of Bunawan. She is 47 years old and is married with two school-aged children.

Digna operates a family member's business, planting and harvesting rice for sale. She works hard to increase the size of her harvest.

Digna joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI.

Digna is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seed and fertilizer. This loan will be her fourth from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children’s tuition fees.

loans.use: To purchase additional seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Hadjah

texts.en:
Hadjah N. lives in Ndeeba, a neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is single and has four children, two of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (granddaughters). She lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity but no piped water. Her major monthly expenses include utility bills and school fees.

Hadjah has a business selling bananas. She has been in this business for six years, and works seven days a week. She sells her produce at the market, both wholesale and retail. She sells to all categories of people both women and men.

Hadjah has requested a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bunches of bananas. She buys her bunches of bananas from villages in the Masaka and Mbarara districts.

The main business challenges for Hadjah include transportation and seasonality. Her goal and aspiration for her business is to own a delivery van.

Hadjah decided to join MCDT SACCO because its people are honest and it gives out timely loans.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas to sell

loans.name: Mame Marie Fall

texts.fr:
Madame Mame Marie Fall B. est une femme de 46 ans qui habite a la cite Ousmane Fall dans la localité de Dalifort. C’est une enseignante de profession. Mais parallèlement  elle a opté de s’adonner a u commerce d’habits qu’elle  revend a ses collègues.
Madame B. est membre de la caisse de Dalifort  depuis 3 mois. Elle sollicite un crédit de 400 000 frs .L’objet du prêt est l’achat de tissus et habits pour satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle  en cette veille de fêtes  de Korite. Ce financement pourra contribuer  a l’augmentation de ses revenus et a l’amélioration du niveau de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mrs. Mame Marie Fall B. is a 46-year-old woman who lives in Ousmane Fall, in Dalifort. A teacher by profession, she has a sideline reselling articles of clothing to her colleagues. Mrs. B. has been a member of the Dalifort credit union for three months. She is requesting a loan of 400,000 francs to purchase clothes and fabrics so as to meet customer demand on the eve of the Korite celebrations. This loan will help to increase her income and improve her family’s living conditions.

Translated from French by Nathalie Pelletier, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To bolster her working capital

loans.name: Restituta

texts.en:
Restituta E. is from the town of Bunawan. She is 53 years old and is married with seven children. Her younger children still go to school and she works hard to sustain their education. She owns and operates a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. 

Restituta joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI.

Restituta is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase seed, fertilizer and other farm inputs. This loan will be her second from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To purchase seed, fertilizer and other farm inputs

loans.name: Sévérin

texts.fr: T. B. Sévérin est née en 1954 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Depuis une vingtaine d'année, Sévérin vit au quartier Zounga à Cocotomey, dans la commune d'abomey Calavi, avec sa famille. Sévérin est marié à AHADJI Afi et est père de trois enfants, tous scolarisés. Sévérin se fait aider de sa femme dans les charges de la famille. Sévérin n'a jamais été à l'école. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges, Sévérin fait l'élevage de moutons qu'il commercialise ensuite à Cocotomey. Sévérin s'approvisionne dans le Nord du Bénin. Sévérin exerce cette activité depuis cinq ans. C'est la première fois que Sévérin sollicite un prêt de ALIDé, en vue de renforcer son activité et d'accroître sa clientèle, ce qui lui permettra de se faire plus de revenus.
texts.en:
Sévérin T. B. was born in 1954 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Since about twenty years ago he lives with his family in the Zounga district in Cocotomey in the municipality of Abomey Calavi. Sévérin is married to Afi Ahadji and is the father of three children, all of whom go to school. Sévérin’s wife helps him provide for the family nees. Sévérin never attended school. In order to support himself, he raises sheep and later sells them in Cocotomey. Sévérin buys his livestock in the North of Benin. He has been in this trade for five years. This is the first time that Sévérin is seeking a loan from ALIDé, in order to bolster his business and increase his customer base, which will bring him higher earnings.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing 40 sheep

loans.name: Mwanaharusi

texts.en:
Mwanaharusi has been selling khangas and kikois (a piece of colored cloth used as clothing and wrapped around the waist and legs or shoulders) for 4 years. She is a married woman with three children and is expecting a fourth one. Her children attend school.

She visits the nearby town to purchase khangas at a wholesale price. The khanga is a dress that is mostly won by the coastal women who are her major customers. She sells khangas door-to-door. With the Kshs. 40,000 loan, Mwanaharusi wants to diversify her business by buying clothes for both ladies and men. 

One of her greatest challenges is transportation of the khangas from the town. Her husband supports her when the business goes down.

She owns her home which has both electricity and water. She cites her greatest monthly expenses as school fees.  In the coming years, Mwanaharusi hopes to own a shop and purchase khangas and clothes in larger quantities.

loans.use: Clothes for both ladies and men

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon G. is from the town of Bunawan. She is 52 years old. Corazon is married and has 4 children. To make a living, Corazon owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Corazon has been engaged in her business for over 10 years. She is thankful for her farm because it helps her sustain her children's education.

Corazon joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Corazon has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Corazon is requesting a new loan of 13,000 PHP which will be used to purchase farm inputs like seeds and fertilizers. This will be the sixth loan taken out by Corazon from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs like seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Nulu

texts.en:
Nulu N. lives in Ntinda Kigowa, a neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has 8 children, all of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members (a sister and a brother). 

Nulu has a business selling bananas. She has been in this business for 8 years, and she works 6 days out of every week. Nulu sells her products from home, wholesale or retail.    Nulu has requested a loan of 800,000/= Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of charcoal. Her customers are families around her home. 

 The main business challenges for Nulu include   transportation and seasonality.  Her aspiration for her business is to own a delivery van. She decided to join MCDT because of low interest charged. Nulu lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include paying utility bills, food and school fees.

loans.use: To buy bags of charcoal

texts.fr: Monsieur Boubacar B. est un jeune commerçant  de 30 ans qui habite à Dalifort. Il est marié sans enfant. Sa spécialité est la vente de fruits comme bananes, pommes, poires et mangues. Ce financement pourra lui permettre d’accroitre ses bénéfices et de soutenir ses proches.
texts.en:
Mr. Boubacar B. is a young 30 year-old salesman who lives in Dalifort. He is married without children. He specializes in the sale of fruits, including bananas, apples, pears and mangoes. He has been a member of the credit association of Dalifort for 3 years. He is requesting a loan of 250,000 frs which he expects to use to strengthen his stock and satisfy the needs of his customer base, which usually increases during the period of Ramadan. The financing could allow him to increase his profits and to support those close to him.

Translated from French by Martha Schmitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Josephine 2

texts.fr: B. Josephine 2 et née en 1966 à Adjohoun, dans le département de l'Ouémé. Josephine 2 habite depuis près de vingt deux ans, le quartier Minontchou à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Mariée à HOUNKANRIN Jerôme, Josephine 2 a quatre enfants qui sont tous scolarisés et qui sont toujours à la charge du couple. Josephine 2 assure avec l'aide de son mari, les différentes charges de la famille, grâce au revenu que lui procure son activité. Josephine 2 a fréquenté l'école jusqu'au cours secondaire. C'est une aide soignante qui mène comme activité secondaire, la vente de tissus, de vêtements et des plats, par le système de distribution. Josephine 2 s'approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Josephine 2 exerce cette activité                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     depuis une dizaine d'année et a déjà obtenu trois crédits auprès de ALIDé, crédits qui ont été tous bien remboursés. Face à la demande de plus en plus importante de sa clientèle, Josephine 2 désire élever davantage le niveau de son activité et mieux répondre à sa clientèle. C'est la raison pour laquelle Josephine 2 sollicite auprès de ALIDé, un quatrième prêt.
texts.en:
Josephine 2 B. was born in 1966 in Adjohoun, in the OUémé department. For about 22 years she has been living in th eMinontchou district of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Married to Hounkanrin, Josephine 2 has four children, all of whom go to school and are still in the couple’s care. Josephine 2 takes care of the family expenses together with her husband, thanks to the revenue from her enterprise. Josephine 2 left school at the high school level. She works as a nurse aide; as a secondary activity, she sells fabrics, clothing and dishes, through a distribution network. Josephine 2 stocks up in Dantokpa at the international market of Benin. She has been in this line of business for about a dozen years and obtained ALIDé loans three times in the past, always repaying them properly. Faced with an ever increasing customer demand, Josephine 2 would like to expand her business and better respond to customer needs. This is why she is seeking a fourth loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing clothing and fabrics of the Vlisco brand

loans.name: Rahimjon

texts.en:
M. Rahimjon is 32 years, married, and has one child. He owns a shop in which he sells spare moped engine parts, a business he has been running for the last 2 years. The income he earns allows him to support his family including his parents, too. To meet his customers’ constantly growing demand, Rahimjon would like to increase his shop’s capacity. The profits from these sales will allow him to continue to improve his family's living conditions. The loan will greatly improve Rahimjon’s income and his family's living standards.   

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing spare parts for mopeds

loans.use: to purchase general farm supplies & equipment

loans.name: Lili

texts.en: Lili G. is currently in the business of selling cabbages, beans, fish and sweet potatoes at the market and is requesting a loan to stock more fish, beans and some bags of maize flour to sell.  Lili is 35 years old and is married to a husband who is a business man. She has 3 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a restaurant.

loans.use: Stock more fish, beans and some bags of maize flour to sell

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi is a married woman with eight children,; five are in school and the rest are out of school. She has a poultry business and breeds broilers. With the KShs. 20,000 loan she wants to purchase more chicks and broiler mash. The challenge of her business is from thieves as they get away with her chicken at night. She has been in this business for four years. She gains additional income from the sale of piped water to her neighbors. She owns her home and has both water and electricity.

She cites her greatest expenses as the broilers' mash. She hopes to get a reliable customer for her chickens as she depends on her neighboring customers at present.

loans.use: Buy chicks and broiler mash (feed)

loans.name: Mashhura

texts.en:
M. Mashhura is 33 years old. Mashhura is running a beauty salon. In the salon she is providing the various services of hair styling, hair cutting, manicure, and the services of cosmetologist. The salon is rather successful and generates stable income for the family. Now Mashhura is planning to remodel her salon and for this purpose she requests 1200 US Dollars. Mashhura thanks all supporting her and promises to repay the loan promptly. 
 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Remodeling her beauty salon

loans.name: Ibrahima

texts.fr: Monsieur Ibrahima N. est âgé de 34 ans .Il est marié et habite a Dalifort. Il gère une  petite cantine de divers produits tels que cosmétiques, thé, sucre etc. C’est une activité qu’il a choisi par amour mais aussi par nécessité car il doit trouver les moyens de gagner sa vie. Il est membre de la caisse de Dalifort depuis 06 mois. Il sollicite un crédit de 100 000 frs prévu pour renforcer son stock de produits en vue de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle. Ce financement lui permettra d’accroitre son fond de commerce et  de mieux  prendre en charge ses quelques besoins personnels.
texts.en:
Mr. Ibrahima N., 34, is married and lives in Dalifort. He runs a small store selling a variety of products such as cosmetics, tea, sugar, etc. He chose this line of business both out of love and out of necessity, since he has to find a way to earn a living. He has been a member of the Dalifort savings institution for 6 months. He is requesting a loan of 100,000 francs to increase his stock so as to meet customer demand. The loan will allow him to increase his working capital and better meet his few personal needs.

Translated from French by Sarah Puchner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase working capital

loans.name: Jumaboy

texts.en:
A. Jumaboy is 63 years old. He is married with two adult children. Jumaboy is a farmer. He plants wheat, onions, carrots, cabbages and garlic. At the same time he raises cattle. Jumaboy tells us that he comes from a farming family and that he does very well financially because he takes good care of his land. 

Thanks to his savings, he was able to arrange the marriage of his son. His wife is his biggest supporter. She helps him in anything she can and takes good care of him and the house. With this loan, Jumaboy would like to expand his irrigation system which is fundamental when it comes to farming. The loan will greatly improve Jumaboy’s income and his family's living standards.

These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

loans.use: Purchasing seed, mineral fertilizer, fuels and lubricants

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah A. is currently in the business of selling beans, rice, sugar, boxes of soap and groundnut paste and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of sugar and boxes of soap to sell.  Sarah is 30 years old and is married to a husband who is a carpenter. She has 4 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay the school fees for her children.

loans.use: Stock more bags of sugar and boxes of soap to sell

loans.name: Muhabbat

texts.en:
Muhabbat is very hardworking woman. She tries to make more money for the family by working hard each day. About 15 years ago, she decided to start raising and selling animals. This way Muhabbat pays for the education of her children who have high hopes for the future. She raises calves and later sells them according to her clients' demand at the markets. She prepares them ready to eat for the eating pleasure of the people in her country.

 Since Muhabbat hopes for a great future, she decided to expand her businesses with the sole purpose of improving her family's living conditions and to help pay for her children's education so that they can one day become good citizens in society.

loans.use: Purchasing calves in order to expand the business

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia R. is from the town of Bunawan. She is 45 years old. Delia is married and has 4 children. To make a living, Delia owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. She used to plan corn, too, but now focuses on planting rice crops. She is hopeful her next harvest will improve.

Delia joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Delia has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Delia is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Kobiljon

texts.en:
M. Kobiljon is 34 years old, married, and has three children. He grows vegetables and sells them in the market for income. He has been working in this business sphere for almost 15 years and has gained a lot of experience. 

Kobiljon has a large family considering that he is living with his parents. With his large family, Kobiljon works almost every day to generate revenue to support his family. Because of his family relying on vegetable growing, Kobiljon needs a loan to purchase necessary supplies for his current harvest and in that way to earn enough money for supporting his family. This will be his first loan with IMON International and Kiva, and his evaluation shows he is qualified to receive the loan.

loans.use: Purchasing seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Janifa

texts.en: Janifa K. is currently in the business of selling beans, sorghum, maize and charcoal at the market and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of maize and sorghum to sell.  Janifa is 30 years old and is divorced.   She has two children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to care for her children by paying their school fees and providing good quality food at home.

loans.use: Stock more bags of maize and sorghum to sell

loans.name: Oñondivepa Group

texts.es:
El comité “OÑONDIVEPA ” está integrada por 11  mujeres del distrito de Acahay, compañía Pintos, departamento de Paraguarí,  entre ellas se encuentran mujeres quienes tienen actividades  como , ventas de comidas , cría de chancho y pollos  otras  se dedican al almacén ; entre ellas también existen  mujeres  quienes desean emprender otras actividades ya que todas son  de escasos recursos. 
Agradecen a la Fundación Paraguaya por haberles dado la oportunidad de poder realizar una actividad en su propia casa sin descuidar la educación de sus hijos.
         El comité demostró la intención de trabajar  para salir adelante,  se han comprometido en ser solidarias  y responsables ante las situaciones que se puedan presentar.
Una de las integrantes es la señora Amelia quien se dedica a la cría de animales como de cerdos, aves (patos y gallinas), además tiene vacas lecheras.
Todo el trabajo que ella realiza se dirige a al mantenimiento de su familia y de sus animales que es una de las fuentes e ingreso y de alimentación de su familia ya que vende sus animales en el mercado de Ybycui o en ferias productivas que el comité realiza.
Comenta que seguirá trabajando para salir adelante y solicita el préstamo para la compra de tejidos de alambre para la construcción de corrales para sus animales.
texts.en:
The Oñondivepa committee is made up of 11 women from the Pintos neighborhood in the Acahay district in the Department of Paraguari. These women make a living through, food sales, raising pigs and chicken as well as running stores. In the group there are also women who wish to start up in other activities though they are all of modest means. They are thankful to the Fundacion Paraguaya for giving them the opportunity to have a business in their homes without having to neglect their children. The committee has the intention of working to be successful and are committed to being supportive and responsible in the face of any situation which may come up. One of the members is Amelia who works raising pigs, poultry (chickens and ducks) as well as keeping dairy cattle. All her efforts go towards maintaining her her family and her animals which are her sources of income and food for her family. She sells her animals in the Ybycui market or at street markets organized by the committee. She says that she will keep working to get ahead and is requesting the loan to buy wire mesh to build animal corrals.

Translated from Spanish by Solson Scherman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wire mesh

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita T. is from the town of Bunawan. She is 39 years old. Mercedita is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Mercedita owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Mercedita works hard to keep her farm free of weeds and pests. She makes it a goal to keep the farm productive.

Mercedita joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mercedita has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Mercedita is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase general farm supplies & equipment. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase general farm supplies & equipment

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen Y. is from the town of Bunawan. She is 26 years old. Helen is married and has 2 infant children. To make a living, Helen owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting & harvesting corn for sale. Helen is saving for her children's education.

Helen joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Helen is requesting a new loan of 13,000 PHP which will be used to purchase general farm supplies & equipment. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support her family.

loans.use: to purchase general farm supplies & equipment

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is a married woman who sells new clothes to her neighbors at her home. With the Kshs. 40,000, she wants to buy more new clothes. She has been in the business for over 10 years. Her main challenge is seasonality as she sells less when there are no important occasions such as weddings and also in the middle of the month when her customers have exhausted their monthly salaries.

She owns her home with electricity but does not have piped water. Her greatest expense is food. She decided to work with Yehu so as to obtain a loan. Her aspiration is to grow economically and open a shop where she can sell her clothes from.

loans.use: Buy more clothes

loans.name: Rajabboy

texts.en:
Y. Rajabboy was born in 1948 in B.Gafurov region, where he now works as a farmer. He is married and has 3 children. His main business is agriculture, which provides him with the means to meet the needs of his family. Rajabboy owns a large piece of land where he cultivates different kinds of vegetables, but due to the poor quality of the soil and the insects, he is no longer able to satisfy market demand. Very hard-working, he is asking for a loan of 5000 Somoni to buy seeds, fertilizer and also calves. The loan will greatly improve Rajabboy’s income and his family's living standards.

loans.use: Purchasing seed, mineral fertilizer and calves

loans.name: Charity

texts.en: Charity S. is currently in the business of selling beer and local brew at home and is requesting a loan to stock more crates of beer and purchase more brewing ingredients such as yeast, etc .  Charity is 40 years old and is married to a husband who is a serviceman. She has 4 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a bar at the market.

loans.use: stock more crates of beer and purchase more brewing ingredients such as yeast, etc.

loans.name: Ginabelle

texts.en:
Ginabelle S. is from the town of Bunawan. She is 24 years old. To make a living, Ginabelle owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. She said she is happy to have a source of income because she is able to support her family financially.

Ginabelle joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ginabelle has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Ginabelle is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP which will be used to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary B. is currently in the business of selling mixed goods in a small shop such as biscuits, soap, perfumes, etc. and is requesting a loan to stock bags of sugar, cartons of salt, etc. to sell.  Mary is 38 years old and is married to a husband who is a peasant. She has 4 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business by extending the floor of her shop from a small floor to a larger floor.

loans.use: Stock bags of sugar, cartons of salt, etc. to sell

loans.name: Helida

texts.en:
Helida is a married woman with three children who attend school. Her husband is a business-minded person and offers a lot of support to Helida in selling food.

With the Ksh. 20,000 loan, Helida wants to buy more maize flour, wheat flour, and beans. She has been in this business for 10 years and sells the food to school children at lunch time. The sale of food forms her sole business and source of income. 

Particularly challenging to her business is when the schools are closed on holiday. Her goal is to open a cafe which will be operating throughout the year and have a diversity of customers. She owns her home but it does not have water or electricity. She cites her greatest monthly expense as school fees.

loans.use: Maize flour, wheat flour and beans

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena A. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is 42 years old. Lorena is married and has 4 children. To make a living, Lorena owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Lorena has been engaged in her business for over 3 years.

Lorena joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lorena has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Lorena is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children and improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future

loans.name: Annabele

texts.en:
Annabele B. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is 32 years old. Annabele is married and has a 14-year-old child. To make a living, Annabele raises pigs for fattening and sale. Annabele has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 3,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it.

In 2008, Annabele joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Annabele has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Annabele is requesting a new loan of 11,000 Philippine pesos (PHP), which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to expand her business and pay for her child's tuition fees.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta B. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is 43 years old. Julieta is married and has one child. Julieta is involved in the farming and hog-raising business. She helps her husband plant and harvest rice crops. She also grows pigs for fattening and sale. Julieta says she does all these activities because she wants to provide for her family. She also wants her child to have a bright future.

Julieta joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Julieta has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Julieta is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase farm inputs and additional piglets and feed. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support her family.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and additional piglet and feeds

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose M. is currently in the business of selling onions, "simsim" (sesame seeds) and groundnuts at the market and is requesting a loan to stock fish, tomatoes and bags of beans to sell.  Rose is 25 years old and is married to a husband who is a policeman. She has one child and her child goes to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house to rent out.

loans.use: Stock fish, tomatoes and bags of beans to sell

loans.name: 30 De Agosto Santa Rosa Group

texts.es:
El comité de mujeres 30  de Agosto Santa Rosa, conformada por 12  mujeres de la zona rural  de la compañía de Pintos del distrito, Departamento  de Paraguarí; quienes se encuentran trabajando en forma organizada desde hace tiempos atrás, lleva adelante la presidencia la Sra. Nicasia G. Amarilla.

          Los miembros del comité trabajan en conjunto haciendo actividades de venta de comida, torneo de futbol, vóley  para solventar los gastos de pago de cuota, aparte de que los miembros el dinero prestado de la Fundación Paraguaya utilizan para compra de pollitos, cría de cerdos, ampliación de almacén, compra de accesorios para bijoiteria  y para utilizar en las actividades agropecuarias para la siembra de los cultivos para el sustento de la familia durante el año.
  Cada unas de las integrantes se dedican a diferentes actividades dentro de la comunidad.
La señora Nicasia es una mujer muy trabajadora, se dedica a la cría de animales y a la producción agropecuaria y al negocio de ventas de productos de uso domésticos.
Todas las actividades lo realiza con la ayuda de sus hijos y su marido y así tiene una familia luchadora que progresa constantemente.
Ella solicita el préstamo para la compra de pollitos, cerdos, inversión en la actividad agropecuaria y en su negocio.
texts.en:
The committee of women 30 de Agosto Santa Rosa (August 30, Santa Rosa) is composed of 12 women from a rural area and the Pintos company of the district, Paraguarí department. They have worked together in an organized way for a long time. Their current president is la Señora Nicasia G. Amarilla. The members of the committee sell food at soccer and volleyball tournaments to make their loan payments. In addition, they use money loaned by the Fundación Paraguaya to purchase baby chicks, raise pigs, expand warehouses, purchase accessories for jewelry, perform agricultural work, and sow crops to sustain the family during the year. Each of the members works at different activities within the community. La Señora Nicasia is a hard-working woman. She raises animals and cultivates crops and also sells products for domestic use. Her children and husband help her in all these activities; they are a family that is constantly working hard and progressing. She requests this loan to buy baby chicks, pigs, and to invest in agricultural work and in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of baby chicks and pigs, raising livestock, cultivating crops, warehouse expansion.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda M. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is 47 years old. Rosalinda is widowed and has three children. She is a farmer and has been planting and harvesting corn crops for over 10 years now. Rosalinda says it has not been so easy since she lost her husband. She works hard to provide for her children. She was able to put up a sari-sari (variety) store to help with their daily needs. Rosalinda is eager to have all her children finish college and have bright futures.

Rosalinda joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosalinda has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Rosalinda is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase farm inputs like seeds and fertilizers and additional store inventory. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs like seeds and fertilizers and additional store inventory

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en: Hellen S.  is currently in the business of selling foods such as maize flour, cassava, and sweet potatoes at the market and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of maize flour and tomatoes to sell.  Hellen is 39 years old and is married to a husband who is a peasant. She has six children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a restaurant to sell ready cooked foodstuffs such as local Sudanese beans ("ful) and "kombo" (a vegetable).

loans.use: Stock more bags of maize flour and tomatoes to sell

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza F. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is 55 years old. Flordeliza is married. To make a living, Flordeliza owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Flordeliza is grateful she has the farm that helps her provide for her family.

Flordeliza joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Flordeliza has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Flordeliza is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase general farm supplies & equipment. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income and make improvements to their house.

loans.use: to purchase general farm supplies & equipment

loans.name: Mariata

texts.en: Mariata T. is currently in the business of selling dried fish, tomatoes, onions and beans at the market and is requesting a loan to stock bags of rice and jerrycans to sell.  Mariata is 45 years old and is married to a husband who is a soldier. She has 4 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for her children to live in.

loans.use: Stock bags of rice and jerrycans to sell

loans.name: Cissy

texts.en:
Cissy W. lives in Ntinda  Kulambiro, a neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is single and has  five children, all of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (her sister's children).  Cissy has a business selling charcoal. She has been in this business for 5 years, and she works 7 days out of every week. Cissy sells charcoal from home, wholesale or retail.    Cissy has requested a loan of 700,000/= Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of charcoal .      

Cissy also generates additional income through farming. The main business challenges for Cissy  include transportation and seasonality.  Her goal for her business is to start selling wholesale only.  Cissy lives in a home that she rents; she doesn't have access to electricity but has access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include  paying utility bill, food and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Lilias

texts.en: Lilias D.  is currently in the business of selling food in a restaurant in a Bussy market and is requesting a loan to stock more foodstuffs to cook and sell.  Lilias is 35 years old and is married to a husband who is a peasant. She has six children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy more chairs and tables for better accommodation.

loans.use: Stock more foodstuffs to cook and sell

loans.name: Cayetano

texts.en:
Cayetano G. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. To make a living, Cayetano owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Cayetano works hard to keep his farm free of weeds and pests. He does his best to keep his crops healthy.

Cayetano joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cayetano has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Cayetano is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Loice

texts.en: Loice N.  is currently in the business of selling various items such as "simsim" (sesame seeds), onions, tomatoes, beans, etc.  and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of beans, "simsim" and some tomatoes to sell.  Loice is 40 years old and is married to a husband who is a businessman. She has three children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business by building a restaurant.

loans.use: Stock more bags of beans, "simsim" and tomatoes to sell

loans.name: Lazaro

texts.en:
Lazaro O. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. He is 46 years old and married. He is a hard-working father to 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Lazaro owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Lazaro dreams of having all his children finish college and have bright futures.

Lazaro joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lazaro has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Lazaro is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase general farm supplies & equipment. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of his children and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase general farm supplies & equipment

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita G. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is married and has six children. Her younger children still go to school and she works hard to sustain their education. To make a living, Teresita owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Teresita has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and she hopes to expand her farm.

Teresita joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Teresita has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Teresita is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase general farm supplies & equipment. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase general farm supplies & equipment

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Faith M. lives in Nalukolongo, a neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has  three children, all of whom are in school. Faith  has a business selling second-hand clothes . She has been in this business for 8 years, and she works 7 days a week. Faith sells her products from home, retail.    Faith has requested a loan of 600,000/= Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to bales of second-hand clothing.   She also generates additional income through selling charcoal.

 The main business challenges for Faith include  transportation and seasonality.  Her goals for her business is to start selling wholesale only.  Faith lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include  paying utility bills, food, and school fees. .

loans.use: To buy more bales of second-hand  clothes

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita C. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is 50 years old. Merlita is married and has seven children. Her older children are adults now and help her at the farm, while her younger ones still go to school. To make a living, Merlita owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Merlita has been engaged in her business for over 15 years.

Merlita joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Merlita has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Merlita is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase general farm supplies & equipment. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase general farm supplies & equipment

loans.name: Lea

texts.en:
Lea G. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is 47 years old. Lea is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Lea owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Lea has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

Lea joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lea has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Lea is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Lea from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana N. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is 50 years old. Ana is married and has two school-aged children. Ana owns and operates a rice farm. Ana has been engaged in her business for over 25 years.

Ana joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to do business. Ana has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Ana is requesting a loan of 6,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) which will be used to purchase general farm supplies & equipment. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Ana from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children.

loans.use: purchasing farm supplies & equipment

loans.name: Annalyn

texts.en:
Annalyn O. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is 28 years old. Annalyn is married and has two children aged seven and 3. Annalyn owns and operates a rice farm. Annalyn has been engaged in her business for over 10 years.

Annalyn joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to do business. Annalyn has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Annalyn is requesting a new loan of 6,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) which will be used to purchase farm inputs like seed and fertilizer. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to expand her business and support her family financially.

loans.use: purchasing seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Alberta

texts.en:
Alberta L. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is 61 years old. Alberta is married and has nine adult children. Alberta owns and operates a farm where she grows rice and corn. At her age, Alberta is still strong enough to work at the farm. She also said she is happy maintaining her farm.

Alberta joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to do business. Alberta has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Alberta is requesting a new loan of 6000 Philippine pesos (PHP) which will be used to buy rice and corn seed, fertilizers like manure, and other farm inputs. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: buying seed, fertilizer, and other farm inputs

loans.name: Alegria

texts.en:
Alegria N. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is 47 years old. Alegria is married and has four school-aged children. Alegria owns and operates a corn farm. Alegria has been engaged in her business for over 12 years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it.

Alegria joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to do business. Alegria has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Alegria is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase general farm supplies & equipment. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Alegria from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children and for business expansion. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: purchasing general farm supplies & equipment

loans.name: Kasifa

texts.en:
Kasifa N. lives in Nalukolongo in the neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is widowed and has 6 children, two of whom are in school.  Kasifa has a business of selling yellow bananas. She has been in this business for over 10 years, and she works 7 days out of every week. She sells her products at the market, by means of retail.  

Kasifa has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bales and clusters of bananas.  She also generates additional income through rental rooms. 

The main business challenge(s) for Kasifa include thieves and seasonality.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are going directly to farmers for bananas.  Kasifa lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and has access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include  utility bills, food, and school fees.

loans.use: buying bananas for resale

loans.name: Dionesio

texts.en:
Dionesio M. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. He is 50 years old and married and the father of 6 school-age children.  To make a living, Dionesio owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Dionesio has been engaged in his business for over 12 years and earns approximately 2400 PHP a month for these activities.

Dionesio joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Dionesio has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. He is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to purchase seeds, fertilizer and other farm supplies. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Dionesio from CEVI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of his children.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena R., 48 years old,  is from the town of Sta. Josefa.  Elena is married and has 2 adult-age children. To make a living, Elena owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice and corn for sale. Elena has been engaged in her business for over 30 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

Elena joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elena has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Elena is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Elena from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Enecita

texts.en:
Enecita R. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is 51 years old. Enecita is married and has 6 children. Her 2 younger children still go to school and she works hard to sustain their education. To make a living, Enecita owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale.

Enecita joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Enecita has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Enecita is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to purchase supplies like seeds and fertilizer. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children.

loans.use: To purchase supplies like seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Inocenta

texts.en:
Inocenta M. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is 52 years old. Inocenta is single. To make a living, Inocenta owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Inocenta has been engaged in her business for over 20 years.

Inocenta joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Inocenta has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. She is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds, fertilizer and other farm supplies. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Inocenta from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Juvelin

texts.en:
Juvelin L. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is 30 years old. Juvelin is married and has 2 school-age children. To make a living, Juvelin owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Juvelin has been engaged in her business for over 8 years. She works hard to sustain her children's education. She wants them to have bright futures.

Juvelin joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Juvelin has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Juvelin is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to purchase general farm supplies & equipment. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Juvelin from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children.

loans.use: To purchase general farm supplies & equipment

loans.name: Edith

texts.en: Edith K. lives in the Ntinda Kulambiro neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has 3 children, all of whom are in school.  She also takes care of her mother. Edith has a business sewing sweaters. She has been in this business for 2 years and she works 6 days out of every week. Edith sells her products at nearby schools by means of wholesale/retail.  Edith has requested for a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more thread and needles for making sweaters.  The main business challenges for Edith are transportation and seasonality. She also generates additional income through rental rooms and rearing chickens. Edith lives in a home that she owns and has access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include paying utility bills, food and school fees. Edith's goal for her business is to one day own a sweater factory.

loans.use: To buy more thread and needles for making sweaters

loans.name: Nicanora

texts.en:
Nicanora M. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is 51 years old. Nicanora is married and has 3 children. To make a living, Nicanora owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice and corn for sale. Nicanora has been engaged in her business for over 13 years.

Nicanora joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nicanora has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Nicanora is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & fertilizers. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Nicanora from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings & fertilizer

loans.name: San Cayetano Group

texts.es:
Este comité se formo en el Bº Toro Blanco son 19 mujeres quienes se agruparón para formar un  comité solidario, las mismas son señoras muy responsables y trabajadoras, poseen un espiritu emprendedor.
Son personas que se reunen semalmente, con el compromiso de no fracasar y sobresalir con el trabajando en equipo con el Apoyo que le ofrece la Fundación Paraguaya. 
La señora Sebastina es una de las integrantes y se dedica a la venta de dulce y masitas dulces.
Esta actividad ella lo realiza para ayudar a su familia y de esa forma salir adelante.
Solicita el prestamo para la compra de  masitas dulce y tambien dulce de varios tipos.
texts.en:
This communal bank, made of up 19 women, was started in the Toro Blanco neighborhood. They have come together to form a mutually binding group. They are very responsible and hard-working women that posses an entrepreneurial spirit. They meet weekly with the commitment to not fail and to succeed in working together with the support of Fundación Paraguaya. Señora Sebastina is one of the members. She sells sweets and sweet pastries. With this activity she is able to help provide for her family. She is requesting the loan to buy pastries and also various other types of sweets.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Achilli, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sweet pastries and other types of sweets

loans.name: Rogelia

texts.en:
Rogelia E. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is 52 years old. Rogelia is married and has 7 school-age children. To make a living, Rogelia owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Rogelia is doing her best to keep her farm productive. She wants to have a stable income so she can provide for the increasing needs in her household and to sustain her children's education.

Rogelia joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rogelia has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Rogelia is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to purchase farm supplies like seeds and fertilizer. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of the her children.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies like seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Maria Pastora

texts.es:
Maria Pastora C. A. tiene 40 años.  Es casada y vive en el cantón de Guaranda en la provincia Bolívar de Ecuador. Tiene 4 hijos.  

Maria Pastora es socia de la ventanilla rural Gradas Chico, que está ubicada a quince minutos en carro de la ciudad de Guaranda. Son 20 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican al cultivo de maíz, trigo, papas, y la cria de animales.  Este es el tercer préstamo que sacan con la cooperativa. 

Maria se dedica a la agricultura, al cultivo de maíz y trigo. Realiza las compras y las ventas de sus productos cada semana en el mercado de Guaranda.

Solicita el préstamo para comprar 2 o 3 bacas. El apoyo del préstamo lo ayudara a invertir para poder hacer mas cosas. Su meta para los proximos anos es aumentar su trabajo en la agricultura. 

Le gusta pasar tiempo en la casa con su familia.
texts.en:
Maria Pastora C. A. is 40 years old. She is married and lives in the canton of Guaranda , part of the Bolivar province in Ecuador. She has four children. Maria Pastora is member of the Gradas Chico rural bank, which is located 15 minutes by car from the city of Guaranda. There are 20 members in total, who for the most part dedicate themselves to growing corn, wheat, potatoes and the breeding of animals. This is the third loan taken out with the cooperative. Maria devotes herself to agriculture, that is growing corn and wheat. She gets her supplies and sells her products at the weekly market in Guaranda. She is requesting the loan to buy two or three cows. Supporting this loan will help her to invest in other activities. Her goal for the coming years is to increase her agricultural work. She likes to spend time at home with her family.

Translated from Spanish by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy several cows

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Flowers, flower-pot stands

loans.name: Mujeres Liberadas 1 Group

texts.en:
Tanya is the coordinator of her group Mujeres Liberadas (Liberated Women), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients (many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti) generally. Her group is located in Los Alcarrizos, an industrial town north of the capital where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. 

She makes her home here in a simple structure with her husband and their six children. She says that her most difficult challenge is to continue her efforts to reach and fulfill all her goals. 

Tanya is excited to be taking third loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan. She has had her business for 1 year, starting with her first loan with Esperanza, after having received an invitation to join a group. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling bed covers and pillows by purchasing more merchandise. She will use the profits to invest in her business and to save. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: to buy linen, bed covers and pillows

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.es:
Erlinda S. C. tiene 32 anos. Es casada y vive en el cantón de Guaranda en la provincia Bolívar de Ecuador. Tiene 3 hijos de 10, 6, y 3 anos.
