Erlinda es socia de la ventanilla rural Gradas Chico, que está ubicada a quince minutos en carro de la ciudad de Guaranda. Son 20 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican al cultivo de maíz, trigo, papas, y la cría de animales.  Este es el tercer préstamo que sacan con la cooperativa.

Erlinda hace tejidos. Vende sus tejidos a personas conocidos o a los que piden. Vende 2 o 3 tejidos al mes. Con el apoyo del préstamo podra comprar hilos y materiales para hacer mas tejidos, asi que la permitiria mantener a su familia y a sus hijos. Su sueno para los próximo 5 anos es tener un negocio estable. Es difícil comprar las cosas para hacer tejidos por razones economicos. 

Le gusta pasar tiempo con sus hijos.
texts.en:
Erlinda S. C. is 32 years old. She is married and lives in the canton of Guaranda , part of the Bolivar province in Ecuador. She has three children who are 10, 6 and 3 years old. Erlinda is member of the Gradas Chico rural bank, which is located 15 minutes by car from the city of Guaranda. There are 20 members in total, who for the most part dedicate themselves to growing corn, wheat, potatoes and the breeding of animals. This is the third loan taken out with the cooperative. Erlinda is a weaver. She sells her weavings to acquaintances or to those who ask her. She sells two or three weavings a month. With support from the loan she will be able to buy yarn and materials to make more weavings, which will enable her to take care of her family and children. Her dream for the next five years would be to have a stable business. For economic reasons it is difficult to purchase materials for weavings She likes to spend time with her children.

Translated from Spanish by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy yarn and materials to make weavings

loans.name: Gotitas De Amor Group

texts.es:
El Bancomunal Gotitas D. amor inicia su 6to ciclo con 16 socias.
Graciela tiene 8 meses en FINCA, primera vez que asume el cargo D. secretaria en la Junta Directiva D. su Bancomunal, le gusta la facilidad con la que recibe sus prestamos y el ahorro.
Graciela es conviviente, tiene casa propia donD. vive junto a sus 3 hijos D. 15, 12 y 7 años D. edad, todos están actualmente estudiando. Graciela se dedica a la venta D. productos naturales como BioLife, HerbaLife, Esika y Unique, ella ofrece a sus amigas y familiares al crédito, también lleva productos a la selva pero los venD. al contado. En la selva tiene chacras donD. siembra cacao, cosecha cuatro veces al año y el cacao lo venD. allá mismo. 
Su préstamo lo utilizará para la compra D. productos naturales y también ropa, pues desea incrementar la venta D. ropa en su negocio. 
El sueño D. Graciela es incrementar y hacer crecer su negocio y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
The Gotitas D. Amor Community Bank is beginning its sixth loan cycle. Graciela is one of the sixteen members of the group and has been with Kiva partner FINCA for eight months. She is now taking on the role of Secretary to the Board of Directors of the bank for the first time. She enjoys the simplicity of obtaining loans and the opportunity to save money. Graciela is in a common-law marriage and lives in her own home with her three children aged 15, 12, and 7, all of whom are students. She earns her living by selling natural products from the brands BioLife, HerbaLife, Esika and Unique to her friends and relatives on credit. She also takes her products to communities in the rainforest and sells them on account. Graciela has land there too where she grows cocoa. She harvests it four times a year and then sells it. She plans to use her loan to buy more natural products as well as clothing as she wishes to expand her business and sell clothing too. Her dreams are to have a bigger business and to see her children in good jobs.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy natural products

loans.name: Mujeres Exitosas 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Susana is the coordinator of her group, Mujeres exitosas 1 & 2 (Successful women). She makes her home here in a simple structure with some of her family. She has two sons. She says that her most difficult challenges are to have charisma and patience working with people.  In the meantime she plans to continue enjoying singing as a hobby every moment she can.

Susana is excited to be taking her second loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She has had her business for two years, starting with a loan she had of $200 US to buy some clothes. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying pants, skirts, underwear, shirts, etc. She will use the profits to improve her business and make it a successful one, with a better structure and bigger store. 

This Esperanza associate began with us because she wants to invest in her business and likes the facilities Esperanza offers.  Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) generally.  Her group is located in Puerto Plata, a port town on the north coast where the economy is based on tourism. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity.

loans.use: To buy pants, skirts, underwear, shirts, etc.

loans.name: San Antonio Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Ramona O. de D. es una emprendedora que trabaja en la venta diaria de Empanadas, ella trabaja en este rubro hace mas de 10 años tiene 2 hijos y esta casada hace 15años, ella tubo conocimiento del programa de comité de Mujeres y le encanto la idea de formar un grupo de señoras que tengan una misma visión de progreso personal y familiar, asi mismo el grupo se formo en el Bº Empalado Ari de la Ciudad de Caaguazú, son 12 señoras que integra el comité cada una tiene un trabajo, las mismas poseen la responsabilidad, la voluntad y las ganas de salir adelante gracias a la Fundación Paraguaya.
Solicita el prestamo para la compra de carne, condementos harina y otros.
texts.en:
Señora Ramona O. de D. is an entrepreneur that sells empanadas everyday. She has been working in this profession for more than 10 years. She has 2 children and has been married for 15 years. She learned about the women's group program and loved the idea of forming a group of women that have the same vision of progress for themselves personally and for their families. This is how the group was formed in the Empalado Ari neighborhood in the city of Caaguazú. There are 12 women that belong to the group and all of them are employed. They are all responsible women and possess the will and ambition to succeed thanks to Fundación Paraguaya. She is requesting a loan to buy meat, condiments, flour and other things.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Achilli, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy meat, condiments, flour

loans.name: Maria Elizabeth

texts.es:
Maria Elizabeth A. P. tiene 26 anos. Es soltera y vive en el cantón de Guaranda en la provincia Bolívar de Ecuador. Tiene 1 hija de 4 anos. 

Maria es socia de la ventanilla rural Gradas Chico, que está ubicada a quince minutos en carro de la ciudad de Guaranda. Son 20 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican al cultivo de maíz, trigo, papas, y la cría de animales.  Este es el tercer préstamo que sacan con la cooperativa.

A Maria trabaja como empleada domestica en Quito y en la agricultura en su comunidad. Solicita el credito para comprar una baca. Con el apoyo del credito le ayudaria en vender la leche de la baca. Su sueno es tener un negocio de venta de ropa. Se deafia por la falta de dinero en su vida. 

Le gusta pasar tiempo con su hijo.
texts.en:
Maria Elizabeth A. P. is 26 years old. She is single and lives in the canton of Guaranda , part of the Bolivar province in Ecuador. She has one 4-year-old daughter. Erlinda is member of the Gradas Chico rural bank, which is located 15 minutes by car from the city of Guaranda. There are 20 members in total, who for the most part dedicate themselves to growing corn, wheat, potatoes and the breeding of animals. This is the third loan taken out with the cooperative. Maria works as a domestic employee in Quito and as an agricultural worker in her community. She is requesting the loan to buy a cow. Support from the loan would help her to sell the cow’s milk. Her dream is to have a commerce selling clothes. She is confronted by the lack of funds in her life. She likes to spend time with her child.

Translated from Spanish by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy a cow

loans.name: Maria Francisca

texts.es:
Maria Francisca C. tiene 50 anos. Es viuda y vive en el cantón de Guaranda en la provincia Bolívar de Ecuador. Tiene 7 hijos de 27 hasta 11 anos.

Maria es una socia de la ventanilla rural Gradas Chico, que está ubicada a quince minutos en carro de la ciudad de Guaranda. Son 20 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican al cultivo de maíz, trigo, papas, y la cría de animales.  Este es el tercer préstamo que sacan con la cooperativa.

A Maria se dedica a la agricultura. Tiene cultivos de maíz y papas. Hace las compras y las ventas de sus productos en el mercado de Guaranda cada semana. 

Solicita el crédito para comprar una bacita que la permitiría mantener la familia económicamente con la leche de la baca. Su sueno es poder mantener a sus hijos. Se desafía por la falta de alimento para las 2 bacas que ya tiene.
texts.en:
Maria Francisca C. is 50 years old. She is a widow and lives in the canton of Guaranda , part of the Bolivar province in Ecuador. She has seven children ranging from 27 to 11 years old.. Maria is member of the Gradas Chico rural bank, which is located 15 minutes by car from the city of Guaranda. There are 20 members in total, who for the most part dedicate themselves to growing corn, wheat, potatoes and the breeding of animals. This is the third loan taken out with the cooperative. Maria devotes herself to farming. She grows corn and potatoes. She gets supplies and sells her products at the weekly market in Guaranda. She is requesting the loan to buy a calf which will enable her to support her family financially through selling cow milk. Her dream is to be able to support her children. She is confronted by the lack of feed for the two cows she already owns.

Translated from Spanish by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy a cow

loans.name: Mateo Amangandi

texts.es:
Mateo Amangandi S. tiene 61 anos. Es casado y vive en el cantón de Guaranda en la provincia Bolívar de Ecuador. Tiene 6 hijos. 

Mateo es socio de la ventanilla rural Gradas Chico, que está ubicada a quince minutos en carro de la ciudad de Guaranda. Son 20 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican al cultivo de maíz, trigo, papas, y la cría de animales.  Este es el tercer préstamo que sacan con la cooperativa.

A Mateo se dedica a la agricultura. Tiene cultivos de maíz, trigo, cevada, y papas. Hace las compras y las ventas de sus productos en el mercado de Guaranda cada semana. 

Solicita el credito para invertir en una tienda general. Con el apoyo del préstamo le permitiria comprar un tanque de gas, arroz, y otras cosas para su tienda con el objetivo de tener mejor ganancia. Su sueno para los proximos 5 anos es aumentar mas la tienda, hacerlo mas grande, y para mantener la familia económicamente. Se desafia por la falta de dinero para aumentar su negocio. 

Los domingos le gusta ir a la iglesia y escuchar la palabra de Dios.
texts.en:
Mateo Amangandi S. is 61 years old. He is married and lives in the canton of Guaranda , part of the Bolivar province in Ecuador. He has six children. Mateo is member of the Gradas Chico rural bank, which is located 15 minutes by car from the city of Guaranda. There are 20 members in total, who for the most part dedicate themselves to growing corn, wheat, potatoes and the breeding of animals. This is the third loan taken out with the cooperative. Mateo devotes himself to farming. He grows corn, wheat, barley and potatoes. He gets his supplies and sells his products at the weekly market in Guaranda. He is requesting the loan to invest in a general store. Support from the loan will enable him to buy a tank of gas, rice and other items for his store in order to make better profit. His dream for the coming five years is to develop his commerce, expand the store, and provide financial support to his family. He is challenged by the lack of funds to develop his commerce. On Sundays he likes to go to church and listen to the word of God.

Translated from Spanish by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy items for his general store

loans.name: Baraka Alanine Group

texts.fr: ManZ. B. est  trésorière du groupe Baraka Alanine, âgée de 37 ans, mariée, mère de 2 enfants, son mari est vendeur de bassin plastic au marché sectoriel de Kibabi-Birere. Son fils ainé est 2e primaire et le second fait l’école maternelle. Juste l’après l’éruption du volcan Nyiragongo, qui aurait complètement détruit la ville de Goma en 2002, elle  commença son business avec son fond propre par la vente des  divers objets ménagers notamment des assiettes, casseroles, fourchettes, etc. plus tard, elle bénéficia du crédit de  Hekima en 2006 pour renforcer son business de commerce. Elle expose ses marchandises dans le marché sectoriel Alanine. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir d’approvisionner  certaines marchandises notamment les pantalons uniformes bleus pour les écouler à la rentrée scolaire d’ici début septembre 2010. Elle souhaiterait  construire une maison un peu spacieuse et faire scolariser ses enfants confortablement. En plus, elle ambitionne avoir une chambre boutique pour ses marchandises. La cliente ManZ. B. remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres citoyens exclus de banque classique.  Il sied de signaler que ce groupe Baraka Alanine est composé de 21 membres, majoritairement femmes dont un homme , monsieur Jules L. n’a pas été présent lors de prise de photo du groupe. Cet homme est le président du marché sectoriel Alanine.
texts.en:
ManZ. B. is the treasurer of the group, Baraka Alanine. She is 38 years old, married, and the mother of 2 children. Her husband is a plastic basin salesman at the Kibabi-Birere sectoral market. Her eldest son is in his second year of primary school and her second is in nursery school. Just after the eruption of the Nyiragongo Volcano, which would have completely destroyed the city of Goma in 2002, she her business with her own funds gotten through the sale of various household items, notably plates, saucepans, forks, etc. Later, she benefited from a loan from Hekima in 2006, to strengthen her shop. She displays her merchandise in the sectoral market of Alanine. This new loan will serve to restock certain merchandise, notably the blue uniform pants for students at the beginning of the school year here in the beginning of September 2010. She wishes to build a more spacious house and to comfortably fund her children's schooling. She also aspires to have a boutique room for her merchandise. The client ManZ. B. thanks Hekima for its actions to aid poor citizens excluded from classical banks. It may be noted that the group Baraka Alanine is made up of 21 members, mostly women and one man, Mr. Jules L., who was not present at the time the group photo was taken. This man is the president of the sectoral market of Alanine.

Translated from French by Martha Schmitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Blue uniform pants

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Juan Daniel

texts.es:
Juan Daniel A. A. tiene 23 anos. Es casado y vive en el cantón de Guaranda en la provincia Bolívar de Ecuador. Tiene 1 hija de 2 anos y medio. 

Juan es socio de la ventanilla rural Gradas Chico, que está ubicada a quince minutos en carro de la ciudad de Guaranda. Son 20 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican al cultivo de maíz, trigo, papas, y la cría de animales.  Este es el tercer préstamo que sacan con la cooperativa.

A Juan se dedica a la agricultura. Tiene cultivos de maíz y papas que vende en el mercado de Guaranda cada mes. Tambien trabaja en la construccion de casas en la ciudad de Guaranda. 

Solicita el credito para comprar un ganado. Con el apoyo del credito podra mejorar su vida un poco mas. Su sueno es hacerle estudiar a su hija. Se desafia porque han bajado el precio de los cultivos. 

En su tiempo libre le gusta jugar el boli y el futbol.
texts.en:
Juan Daniel A. A., 23, is married and lives in Guaranda, Bolívar Province, Ecuador. He has a two and a half year old daughter. Juan is a member of the Gradas Chico communal bank located fifteen minutes by car from the city of Guaranda. It has 20 members total who are mostly corn, wheat and potato farmers and cattlemen. This is the third loan they take out with the cooperative. Juan is a farmer. He has corn and potato crops that he sells monthly in Guaranda’s market. He also works in home construction in the city of Guaranda. He is asking for funds to buy a head of cattle. With help from the loan he will be able to improve his life a bit more. His dream is to provide an education for his daughter. It’s a challenge because crop prices have dropped. During his free time he likes to play volleyball and soccer.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a head of cattle.

loans.name: Darwin

texts.es: El Sr. Darwin tiene  23 años de edad,  tiene   un hijo, es separado   alquila un cuarto  por el Barrio San Silvestre,  El Sr. Darwin es hijo del propietario del micro el  trabaja como  chofer de su Papa  hace 5 años de la línea 41, su Papa le dio este trabajo un poco para consolarlo de su separación ya que el se quería ir fuera del País. El crédito que se le otorgo es para el mantenimiento del micro (engrase, cambio de aceite  y/otros...). El señor mostro su satisfacción  por la oportunidad  que le dio la institución al otorgarle un segundo crédito.
texts.en:
Darwin, 23, is separated and has a son. He lives in a rented room in San Silvestre neighborhood. He has worked driving a microbus, that is owned by his father, for the last five years along Route 41. His father gave Darwin this job to cheer him up after his separation because he wanted to leave the country. The loan he was granted is for maintenance for the microbus (lube, oil change and others). He expressed his satisfaction with the Institution for the opportunity it gave him by granting his second loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For microbus maintenance.

loans.name: Maria Manuela

texts.es:
Maria Manuela A. P. tiene 40 anos. Es casada y vive en el cantón de Guaranda en la provincia Bolívar de Ecuador. Tiene 7 hijos de 24, 22, y 19 anos. 

Maria es una socia de la ventanilla rural Gradas Chico, que está ubicada a quince minutos en carro de la ciudad de Guaranda. Son 20 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican al cultivo de maíz, trigo, papas, y la cría de animales.  Este es el tercer préstamo que sacan con la cooperativa.

A Maria se dedica a la agricultura. Tiene cultivos de maíz y un negocio de vender verduras. Hace las compras y las ventas de sus productos en el mercado de Guaranda cada semana. 

Solicita el crédito para ampliar el negocio y poder mantener a la familia. Con el apoyo del préstamo la permitiría tener un negocio fijo. Su sueno es tener un negocio en un lugar bien establecido en un lugar fijo. Se desafia con la competencia en su negocio. 

En su tiempo libre le gusta pasar tiempo con la familia.
texts.en:
Maria Manuela A. P., 40, is married and lives in Guaranda, Bolívar Province, Ecuador. She has 7 children who are 24, 22, and 19 years of age. Maria is a member of the Gradas Chico communal bank located fifteen minutes by car from the city of Guaranda. It has 20 members in total who are corn, wheat and potato farmers and cattlemen for the most part. This is their third loan from the cooperative. Maria is a farmer. She grows corn and she has a vegetable selling business. She makes her purchases and sales weekly in Guaranda’s market. She is asking for funds to expand her business to be able to support her family. Help from the loan will make a stable business possible. Her dream is to have a business in a well established, stable site. Her challenge is competition in her line of work. She likes to spend her free time with her family.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand her vegetable selling business.

loans.name: Marlene Mirian

texts.es:
Marlene Mirian A. T. tiene 32 anos. Es casada y vive en el cantón de Guaranda en la provincia Bolívar de Ecuador. Tiene 1 hija de 4 anos. 

Marlene es socia de la ventanilla rural Gradas Chico, que está ubicada a quince minutos en carro de la ciudad de Guaranda. Son 20 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican al cultivo de maíz, trigo, papas, y la cría de animales.  Este es el tercer préstamo que sacan con la cooperativa.

A Marlene trabaja en la agricultura. Tiene cultivos de maíz, papas, trigo y cebada.  Hace las compras y las ventas de sus productos en el mercado de Guaranda cada semana.

Solicita el credito para tener pollos. Su sueno es hacer algo mas con su vida. Se desafia por las lanchas que a veces comen sus cultivos y destruyen una gran porcion de sus cultivos. 

Le gusta jugar con sus ninos.
texts.en:
Marlene Mirian A. T., 32, is married and lives in Guaranda, Bolívar Province, Ecuador. She has a 4 year old daughter. Marlene is a member of the Gradas Chico communal bank located fifteen minutes by car from the city of Guaranda. It has 20 members total most of whom are corn, wheat and potato farmers and raise animals. This is their third loan from the cooperative. Marlene is a farmer. She has potato, corn, wheat and barley crops. He makes her purchases and sales weekly in Guaranda’s market. She is asking for the loan in order to have chickens. Her dream is to make something else of her life. Her challenge is the plant pests known as “lanchas” that destroy large portions of her crops. She enjoys playing with her children.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To raise chickens.

loans.name: Vida 2 Group

texts.en:
Felicita is the coordinator of her group, Vida 2 (life). She lives in a simple structure with her 3 children. She says that her most difficult challenge is raising her children. In the meantime, she plans to continue enjoying reading the bible.

Felicita is excited to be taking her 4th loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She has had her business for almost two years, starting with a loan from her sister. She plans to use this loan to invest in selling different products like cosmetics, beauty products, clothing and shoes. She will use the profits to invest and to buy school supplies that her children need to start school. 

This Esperanza associate began with us because she need a loan to improve her business. Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in San Pedro de Macoris, a city famous for baseball players and sugar cane industries. The main economic activities include a free trading zone and a cement factory. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity.

loans.use: to buy miscellaneous products

loans.name: Tomas

texts.es:
Tomas C. C. tiene 56 anos. Es casado y vive en el cantón de Guaranda en la provincia Bolívar de Ecuador. Tiene 6 hijos.  

Tomas es un socio de la ventanilla rural Gradas Chico, que está ubicada a quince minutos en carro de la ciudad de Guaranda. Son 20 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican al cultivo de maíz, trigo, papas, y la cría de animales.  Este es el tercer préstamo que sacan con la cooperativa.

Tomas se dedica a la agricultura. Tiene un invernadero donde crecen legumbres y tomate. Realiza las compras y las ventas de sus productos en el mercado de Guaranda. 

Solicita el préstamo para cultivar plantas en su invernadero. El apoyo del préstamo lo ayudara en ganar la vida. Su meta para los próximos anos es darles educación a sus hijos para que puedan conseguir algún trabajo bueno. Se enfrentan los precios bajos este ano para la venta de sus cultivos, especialmente el maíz y el trigo. Por eso es difícil ganar mucho por las ventas de sus productos. 

Se enfoca en su trabaja siete días a la semana, así que no tiene mucho tiempo libre.
texts.en:
Tomas C. C. is 56 years old. He is married and lives in the village of Guaranda, in the province of Bolivar in Ecuador. He has 6 children. Tomas lives in the rural village of Gradas Chico, about a fifteen minute drive from the city of Guaranda. The group is made up of 20 members and the majority of them cultivate corn, wheat, and potatoes and raise livestock. This is the third loan they have requested. Tomas is an agriculturist. He has a greenhouse where he grows vegetables and tomatoes. He makes his purchases and sells his products in the market of Guaranda. He requests a loan to cultivate plants in his greenhouse. The loan will help him find success in life. His goal over the next few years will be to provide his kids with an education so that they will be able to get good jobs. The price of his products has been driven down this year, especially for his corn and wheat harvests. It is very difficult to have an income from sales of his products. He focuses on his work seven days a week, so he doesn't have much spare time.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To cultivate plants in his greenhouse.

loans.name: Zenon Daniel

texts.es: El Sr. Zenón vive actualmente en la casa de su suegra con sus 3 hijos en el Zona los lotes Parada 17, su esposa se encuentra en España se fue a trabajar y buscar mejores oportunidades para ella y para su familia,  ella le ayuda con los gastos de su familia, el Sr. Zenón trabaja en el rubro hace 10 años, actualmente trabaja como chofer de la línea 38. El crédito que se le otorgo fue para el mantenimiento y reparación de su vehículo en general. "el cliente quedo sorprendido por la rapidez que se le otorgo el crédito".
texts.en:
Zenón is currently living in his mother-in-law’s house located along stop 17, Los Lotes zone, with his three children. His wife is in Spain where she went to look for better opportunities for herself and her family. She contributes to household expenses. Zenón is a bus driver along Route 38; he’s been in this line of work for 10 years. The loan that was granted was for general maintenance and repair of his vehicle. “The client was surprised by the speed with which the loan was granted.”

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For vehicle repair.

loans.name: Santos Alejandro

texts.es:
Santos tiene 56 años de edad, es casado, y vive junto a su esposa y su ultimo hijo en el sector Valle de los Incas del distrito de Tambogrande, una zona agrícola que produce principalmente mango y limón. Pertenece a la provincia de Piura y se encuentra ubicada en la región del mismo nombre, a mas de tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Como la mayoría de hombres de la zona, se dedica a trabajar en labores asociadas a la agricultura; por un lado se dedica a la crianza de ganado vacuno y ovino y también se dedica a la siembra de árboles frutales, específicamente de mango y limón.

La crianza de animales le provee de ingresos permanentes ya que comercializa la leche que producen sus vacas y adicionalmente suele vender sus ovejas a los negociantes que siempre visitan la zona en donde reside. En cambio la agricultura solo le genera ingresos durante las temporadas de cosecha.

Santos desea mejorar la crianza de sus animales brindándoles una mejor alimentacion, esto le permitirá vender mas leche, ya que la producción de sus vacas aumentará y además venderá sus ovejas a un mejor precio ya que estas desarrollarán de mejor manera. Para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Santos es un hombre trabajador y entregado a su familia. Su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresario y poder ampliar su negocio de crianza y venta de animales. En la zona donde vive el es bastante conocido y estimado por sus vecinos.
texts.en:
Santos, 56, is married and lives with his wife and youngest child in Valle de los Incas, Tambogrande district, an agricultural area that produces primarily mangoes and lemons. It’s part of Piura province, Piura region and is located over three hours away from the city of Chiclayo, Lambayeque region’s capital. Like most of the men in the area he’s involved in farming-related activities. On the one hand he raises cattle and sheep but also grows fruit trees, specifically mango and lemon. Raising animals for sale provides a permanent source of income because he sells the milk his cows product and sells his sheep to merchants that always come by the area he lives in. On the other hand, farming only produces income during harvest time. Santos wants to improve his animals giving them better nutrition so that he can sell more milk since his cows will produce more. He will also be able to sell his sheep for better prices because they will develop better. To reach his goal he has thought it advisable to request his first, 1000 new sol, loan from Edpyme Alternativa Santos is a hard working man who is dedicated to his family. His greatest wish is to continue to grow as a businessman to expand his cattle-raising business. In the area where he lives he is quite well known and esteemed by his neighbors.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy feed for improved cattle and sheep raising.

loans.name: Manuela Rosario

texts.es:
Manuela Rosario Q. M. tiene 38 anos. Es casada y vive en el cantón de Guaranda en la provincia Bolívar de Ecuador. Tiene 3 hijos.  

Manuela es una socia de la ventanilla rural Gradas Chico, que está ubicada a quince minutos en carro de la ciudad de Guaranda. Son 20 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican al cultivo de maíz, trigo, papas, y la cría de animales.  Este es el tercer préstamo que sacan con la cooperativa.

Manuela se dedica a la agricultura. Cultiva trigo, papas, y maíz. Realiza las compras y las ventas de sus productos en el mercado de Guaranda. 

Solicita el préstamo para comprar un terreno y una baca, si alcanza el dinero. El apoyo del préstamo lo ayudara en mandar a sus hijos a estudiar. Se enfrentan los precios bajos este ano por la venta de sus cultivos, especialmente las papas. Por eso es difícil ganar mucho por las ventas de sus productos. 

No tiene mucho tiempo libre porque trabaja 7 dias a la semana.
texts.en:
Manuela Rosario Q. M. is 38 years old and she is married and lives in the village of Guaranda, Bolivar in Ecuador. She has 3 children. Manuela lives in the rural village of Gradas Chico, about a fifteen minute drive from the city of Guaranda. The group is made up of 20 members and the majority of them cultivate corn, wheat, and potatoes and raise livestock. This is the third loan they have requested. Manuela is an agriculturist, cultivating wheat, potatoes, and corn. She makes her purchases and carries out the sale of her products in the markets of Guaranda. She requests a loan to purchase a calf and a cow, if she has enough money. The loan will help her send her kids to school. The price of her products has been driven down this year, especially for her potato harvests. It is very difficult to have an income from sales of her products. She doesn't have much spare time; she works 7 days a week.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a calf and a cow.

loans.name: Elvo Iban

texts.es:
Elvo de 53 años, tiene una tienda de víveres en donde vende arroz, enlatados, canes etc. Vive en una zona periurbana, con caminos de tierra y las casas están ubicadas en montañas. 

El tiene la tienda para no depender de un empleador y así conseguir mas dinero para mantener a su esposa y dos hijos. Vende lácteos, granos, bebidas, aceites a un bajo precio. Trabaja con su esposa desde las 07h00am hasta las 22h00pm todos los días. 

Para poder incrementar los víveres de su tienda quiere comprar con el préstamo arroz, azúcar y aceites. En el futuro quiere ampliar y surtir mas su tienda para darles un mejor futuro a sus hijos.
texts.en:
53-year-old Elvo has a grocery store where he sells rice, canned goods, meats etc. He lives on the outskirts of town where the roads are made of dirt and houses are built on the hillsides. Elvo has his own store because he doesn’t want to work for an employer, and this way he earns more money to support his wife and children. He sells milk products, grains, drinks, and oil at good prices. He and his wife work in the store from 7am to 10pm every day. In order to increase the stock in his store, he wishes to use the loan to buy rice, sugar, and oil. In the future he plans to expand the store and stock it with more items so that he can provide his children with a better future.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, and oil

loans.name: Indalisa

texts.es:
Indalisa A. tiene 30 anos. Es casada y vive en el cantón de Guaranda en la provincia Bolívar de Ecuador. Tiene 2 hijos de 12 y 9 anos.  

Indalisa es una socia de la ventanilla rural Gradas Chico, que está ubicada a quince minutos en carro de la ciudad de Guaranda. Son 20 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican al cultivo de maíz, trigo, papas, y la cría de animales.  Este es el tercer préstamo que sacan con la cooperativa.

Indalisa se dedica a la agricultura. Cultiva trigo y maíz. Realiza las compras y las ventas de sus productos en el mercado de Guaranda. 

Solicita el crédito para comprar una baca. La baca le va a permitir tener un poco de leche, para consumo no más. Su sueno es que sus hijos pueden estudiar. Se desafía por los precios bajos de los cultivos de papa, trigo, y maíz. 

En su tiempo libre hace cosas en la casa como lavar ropa y hacer quehaceres domésticos.
texts.en:
Indalisa A. is 30 years old. She is married and she lives in the village of Guaranda, in the province of Bolivar in Ecuador. She has 2 children aged 12 and 9. Indalisa lives in the rural village of Gradas Chico, about a fifteen minute drive from the city of Guaranda. The group is made up of 20 members and the majority of them cultivate corn, wheat, and potatoes and raise livestock. This is the third loan they have requested. Indalisa is an agriculturist, cultivating wheat and corn. She makes her purchases and carries out the sale of her products in the markets of Guaranda. She requests a loan to purchase a cow. The cow will give her a little bit of milk, for their own consumption only. Her dream is to send her kids to school. She is discouraged by the low price of the harvests this year, especially the potato, wheat, and corn harvests. In her spare time she does some house work, such as doing the laundry and cleaning house.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a milking cow.

loans.name: Sospó Group

texts.es:
La señora Guillermina Juárez Gómez vive en tecpatan Estado de Chiapas México. Tiene 67 años de edad, se caso con el señor Valentín Guzmán Hernández y tuvo siete hijos tres hombre y cuatro mujeres que ya están casados y está muy orgullosa de cada uno de ellos.

   Ella se dedica a su hogar y a la elaboración de embutidos como son: chorizo y longaniza,  comenzó  con esta actividad desde hace nueve años, desde entonces ha  estado practicando este trabajo el cual le va muy bien, ya que hay muchas personas que le compran su producto para mandarle a sus familiares que radican en los estados unidos y la prefieren por que  los da a muy buen precio.

  Guillermina se inspiro en esta actividad por ser un trabajo donde se obtiene buenos ingresos y es un producto, de buena calidad que se vende rápido. Nos platica que gracias a Dios y a este trabajo ha podido ingresar al programa de fundación realidad y en otros programas con los que también ha trabajado y ha salido sin ningún problema.

  Con las  ganancias que obtiene de su venta  compra más ingredientes para elaborar su actividad, a si como también  a horrar para estar pagando los prestamos en fundación realidad  y para sostenerse hasta que dios le preste vida.

  Ella paso a formar parte de este programa por las promociones que se hizo en su barrio llamado costa de oro, se informo de cómo eran los préstamos  se intereso y hoy es parte del programa. El grupo se llama sospó la razón del nombre es porque en casa de una de las señoras hay unas flores bonitas llamadas con ese nombre.

Los integrantes que conforman el grupo son la siguiente:

 Marisela Guzmán Juárez: invierte el préstamo en compra de a lajas de oro, como son: aretes, anillos, cadenas entre otros, para venderlo en el mismo municipio.
 Guillermina Juárez Gómez: es la señora que se le tomo la entrevista utiliza el préstamo para la elaboración de  embutidos y esta de vestido rosado.
 Arely Hernández Hernández: invierte el préstamo en la compra de gallinas de rancho para venderlo en el mismo municipio.
 María de Lourdes G. Gómez: invierte el préstamo en la compra de ingrediente como son: huevo, harina, margarina, entre otro para la elaboración de pasteles y flanes.
 Minerva Hernández Jiménez: invierte  el préstamo en  la compra de ingrediente para elaborar dulces típicos de la región.
 María lidia Juárez Domínguez: utiliza el préstamo en compra de  productos naturales y para recargas telefónicas.
 Adela Nañez C.: invierte el préstamo en la compra de mercancía para surtir su tienda de ropas de niños, damas  y caballeros.
 Rosalinda Pérez Gómez: invierte el préstamo en la compra  y venta de zapatos por catálogos de la marca Andrea y mega shoes. 
 Alberto Hernández Jiménez: utiliza el préstamo para pagar el  personal  de la tortillería y refracciones de maquinas.
texts.en:
Mrs. Guillermina Juárez Gómez lives in Tecpatan, Chiapas, México. She is 67 years old. She married Mr. Valentín Guzmán Hernández and had seven children, three boys and four girls who are already married. She is very proud of each one of them. She is a housewife and also makes sausages like chorizo and longaniza. She started this activity 9 years ago. Since then she has been in this line of work and has done very well because many people buy her product to send to their relatives that live in the United States and they prefer her because she sells at a very good price. Guillermina was inspired to go into this particular work because it produces good income and it’s a high-quality product that sells quickly. She relates that, thanks to God and this work, she has been able to participate in Fundación Realidad’s program and other programs that she’s collaborated with and has finished problem-free. Profits obtained from her sales are used to buy more ingredients for her activity as well as for savings to repay loans with Fundación Realidad and to support herself for as long as God wills her life. She became part of the program thanks to promotional activities held in her neighborhood, called Costa de Oro. She learned about the loans and became interested and today is part of the program. The group is called “Sospó” because in the house of one of the members beautiful flowers so named grow. The members of the group are: Marisela Guzmán Juárez: to buy gold jewelry like: earrings, rings, chains, etc. to sell in town. Guillermina Juárez Gómez: she’s the woman who was interviewed and will use the loan to buy ingredients for sausage making. She’s wearing the pink dress. Arely Hernández Hernández: to buy ranch chickens to sell in town. María de Lourdes G. Gómez: to buy ingredients like, eggs, flour, margarine and others to make cakes and custards. Minerva Hernández Jiménez: to buy ingredients needed to make typical regional sweets. María lidia Juárez Domínguez: to buy natural products and telephone recharge cards. Adela Nañez C.: to buy stock ítems for her clothing store. Rosalinda Pérez Gómez: to buy Andrea and Mega brand catalogue shoes to sell. Alberto Hernández Jiménez: to pay tortilla shop employee salaries and for machinery repairs.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients to prepare sausage like: meat, ancho chili peppers, vinegar, onions, etc.

loans.name: El Marquez Group

texts.es:
El Márquez es un grupo conformado por 13 personas, ellos viven en la Comunidad Cerro del Márquez, Estado de México, y de ahí escogieron el nombre. Los integrantes son: Damiana A. (Venta de Antojitos)), Teresita R. (Frutas y Legumbres), Placida Pérez (Venta de Antojitos), Martha B. (Tienda de Ropa). Josefina S. (Herrería), Adriana A. (Bisutería), Guadalupe C. (Frutas y Verduras), Oswaldo Q. (Frutas y Legumbres), Gonzalo S. (Albañilería), Eduardo S. (Equipo de Sonido), Isabel Reina López (Venta de Catalogo), Alejandra C. (Dulcería) y Modesta Crescencia B. (Venta de Catalogo).

Alejandra C. es integrante del grupo, tiene 31 años de edad, su familia esta integrada por su esposo y sus tres hijas quienes estudian actualmente (Secundaria, Primaria y Preescolar). Ale trabajaba en una casa realizando el aseo pero la paga era muy poca y viendo que los gastos en su familia iban incrementado día a día, decidió comenzar una actividad que le ayudara a tener una mejor solvencia económica, y que al mismo tiempo le permitiera pasar tiempo con su familia así que comenzó con la venta de dulces, frituras, refrescos, jabón, etc,. Todos los días desde muy temprano saca sus productos afuera de su domicilio, los días de mejor venta para ella son los fines de semana y en temporada de fiestas ya que es cuando vende mas refrescos, ella tiene ocho meses con su negocio y esta muy contenta y desea superarse. Ale tiene muchos planes tanto para su vida personal como para su negocio pero los mas importantes son que sus hijas salgan adelante y puedan terminar una carrera y hacer una pequeña accesoria para hacer un poco mas grande su tiendita. El crédito solicitado lo va a utilizar para la compra de mercancía como: refrescos, jabón, aceite, dulces, etc. y así tener una mejor clientela, y con las ganancias obtenidas comprar lo necesario para sus hijas..

El Márquez agradece a Kiva el apoyo brindado a través de Fundación Realidad ya que así sus metas serán cumplidas.
texts.en:
El Márquez is a group made up of 13 people. They live in La Comunidad Cerro del Márquez in the state of México and this is where they got their name. The members are: Damiana A. (snack sales), Teresita R. (fruits and vegetables), Placida Pérez (snack sales), Martha B. (clothing store), Josefina S. (blacksmith), Adriana A. (imitation jewelry), Guadalupe C. (fruits and vegetables), Oswaldo Q. (fruits and vegetables), Gonzalo S. (masonry), Eduardo S. (sound equipment), Isabel Reina López (catalog sales), Alejandra C. (sweets) and Modesta Crescencia B. (catalog sales). Alejandra C. is a member of the group. She is 31 years old, married and has three daughters that are currently in school (high school, elementary, and preschool). Ale used to work as a housekeeper, but the pay was very little. Realizing that her family's expenses were increasing day by day, she decided to find employment that would help her to better meet her financial obligations and at the same time allowed her to spend time with her family. This is how she started selling sweets, fried foods, soft drinks, soap, etc. Very early every day she sets up outside her house. The best sales are on the weekends and during the holiday season as this is when she sells the most soft drinks. She has been doing this for eight months and is very happy and wants to succeed. Ale has many plans, as much for her personal life as for her business, however the most important thing is that her daughters succeed at finishing school and to enlarge her sales area. She will use the loan that she is requesting to buy merchandise like soft drinks, soap, oil, sweets, etc., and in this way increase her clientele. With her earnings she will buy necessities for her daughters. El Márquez is grateful for Kiva's support through Fundación Realidad since this will help them to reach their goals.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Achilli, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy soap, soft drinks, oil, fried foods and sweets

location.town: Valle De Chalco Solidaridad  Estado De Mexico

loans.name: Mely

texts.es: Mely, de 28 años de edad, es soltera y tiene dos hijos, Jhordy y Lucero de 8 y 7 años respectivamente. Juntos residen en la hermosa selva cusqueña, ubicada en la localidad de Quimbiri, donde tienen su propia casa. Mely se dedica a la venta de helados, un negocio en el cual le está dando buenos resultados económicos, recuerda que esta actividad empezó desde su adolescencia, cuando sus padres elaboraban los helados y ella ayudaba en la distribución. Hoy con su propio negocio, le está yendo de la mejor manera y ese éxito mesurado lo agradece eternamente a sus padres, además sus clientes más exigentes se sienten satisfechos por el sabor incomparable que tiene los helados  con respecto a la competencia. Normalmente trabaja con dos colaboradores, de esa manera les pueda facilitar la elaboración de helados en un menor tiempo y su punto de venta lo realiza en su propia localidad. Su plan a futuro es ampliar su negocio, adquiriendo nuevas maquinas, con la finalidad de que pueda aumentar su producción y a la vez generar ingresos considerables. Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a seguir cumpliendo con su cronograma de pagos, además está comprometido con su grupo comunal, ya que obtiene muchas ventajas a su favor. Con el crédito que solicita lo piensa invertir en su heladería, comprando frutas de todas variedades, azúcar, leche, miel, con la finalidad de que pueda elaborar su producto.
texts.en:
Mely, 28, is single and has two children: Jhordy and Lucero, who are 8 and 7 years of age respectively. They live together in the beautiful Cusco backcountry in Quimbiri where they own their own house. Mely sells frozen treats, a business that is yielding good economic results. She recalls that she began this activity while still an adolescent when she helped sell the frozen treats her parents manufactured. Today, with her own business, she is doing very well and she is grateful to her parents for the success she is having. Besides, her most demanding customers are satisfied with the incomparable flavor of her product compared to the competition. She usually works with two collaborators so that manufacture can proceed more quickly and sales occur in her own location. Her plan for the future is to expand her business, to purchase new machinery in order to increase production and generate considerable income. This is her 3rd loan with MFP and she pledges to repay in a timely fashion. Besides, she’s committed to her communal group because she obtains quite a few favorable advantages. She will use the funds to invest in her ice cream shop buying all kinds of fruit, sugar, milk and honey to make her products.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fruit and other ingredients for ice cream.

loans.name: Maria Delfina

texts.en:
Maria Delfina P. L. is 60 years old. She is married and lives in the Bolivar Province of Ecuador. She has 7 children, the oldest of whom is 40 years old, and the youngest is 23. 

Maria is a member of the rural loan group Gradas Chico, located 15 minutes from the town of Guaranda. There are 20 group members, the majority of whom work in agriculture. They grow corn, wheat, potatoes, and raise animals. This is the third loan they have taken with the cooperative. 

Maria works in agriculture. She cultivates wheat, corn, and beans. She plans to use the loan to purchase a dairy cow. The loan will help her maintain her economic well-being. Maria´s dream is to own 2 or 3 of her own cows. She has struggled this year when trying to sell her crops, as the price has dropped and a large portion of her crops have been destroyed by a pest called ¨lancha.¨ 

Maria doesn´t have much free time, as she works in agriculture nearly 7 days per week. However, she enjoys the annual Carnival that takes place during the month of February in the Bolivar Province.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Marthe Ablawa

texts.fr: Z. H. Marthe Ablawa est née en 1958 à Porto-Novo, capitale administrative du Bénin. Marthe Ablawa vit depuis une vingtaine d'année au quartier Djèdjèlayé à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, avec sa famille. Marthe Ablawa est mariée à ALI Yérima Sanni et est mère de trois enfants, tous scolarisés. Marthe Ablawa vient en aide à son mari et assure avec lui, les différentes charges de la famille, grâce au revenu que lui procure son activité. Marthe Ablawa a arrêté les classes au cours secondaire. Pour faire face à ses besoins, Marthe Ablawa mène comme activité, la vente de fournitures scolaires et de façon secondaire, la vente de cartes de recharges téléphoniques. C'est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin que Marthe Ablawa achète ses produits. Marthe Ablawa exerce cette activité depuis une vingtaine d'année et a déjà obtenu cinq crédits auprès de ALIDé, avec un bon remboursement. En vue de renforcer son activité pour mieux préparer la rentrée scolaire et vendre suffisamment ses produits, Marthe Ablawa sollicite à nouveau, un prêt de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Marthe Ablawa Z. H. was born in 1958 in Porto-Novo, the administrative capital of Benin. Marthe Ablawa has lived for some twenty years in the Djèdjèlayé neighborhood of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, with her family. Marthe Ablawa is married to Yerima Sanni Ali and is the mother of three children, all in school. Marthe Ablawa helps out her husband and, along with him, assures that the needs of her family are met, thanks to the revenue brought in by her business. Marthe Ablawa left school at the high-school level. To meet her needs, Marthe Ablawa runs a business selling school furniture and as a secondary business, sells rechargeable telephone cards. It is at Dantokpa, the international market of Benin, that Marthe Ablawa sells her products. Marthe Ablawa has run this business for some 20 years and has already obtained 5 loans from ALIDé, having paid back the others well. With the goal of strengthening her business to better prepare for the start of the school year and to sell a sufficient amount of her products, Marthe Ablawa is once again requesting a loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Martha Schmitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy school furniture and rechargeable telephone cards

loans.name: Musa S.

texts.en: This is 32 year-old Musa. He is single, and has no children. He has one additional dependent, his fiance, who does not stay with him.  In 2007, Musa established his satellite cinema sport and games business. He began his business because he was watching games from other people's cinemas, then began his own.  He raised the initial capital and he started showing games. Working 4 days a week and 4 hours a day, he earns about Le 1,932,400 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000.  Musa requires a loan in order to buy a smart card and a dish decoder full set.  He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 386,480.  In the future, Musa plans to complete his university course and to get married, and also to increase his profit margin. Weather often disturbs satellite transmission but they can overcome after the rains.  He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy a smart card and a dish decoder

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es:
Beatriz, de 35 años de edad, convive con su pareja y tienen tres hijos en su haber. Juntos residen en la localidad de Quimbiri, ubicada en la hermosa selva ayacuchana, donde tiene su propia casa a base de madera. 

Tenía 27 años cuando decidió abrir su propia tienda de abarrotes, un proyecto que no tardó en conquistar a sus clientes, desde luego que sus primeras ventas salían de a pocos, pero con el tiempo sus ventas no pararon de incrementar hasta hoy; ella reconoce que la clave está en el esfuerzo y amor al trabajo, es por ello que sus clientes están satisfechos con el producto que recibe. 

Normalmente trabaja por cuenta propia, pero en tiempo de vacaciones recibe la ayuda de sus hijos. Su plan a futuro es ampliar su tienda introduciendo nuevos productos de vanguardia y de diferentes precios, con la finalidad de que pueda aumentar sus ventas. 

Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a cumplir con sus obligaciones de pago, además está satisfecha por el buen trabajo de su grupo comunal. 

Con el crédito que solicita lo piensa invertir en la compra de mercadería, de esa manera pueda abastecer su tienda.
texts.en:
Beatriz, 35, lives with her life partner and their three dependent children in Quimbiri, located in the beautiful Ayacucho backcountry, where they have their own wood house. She was 27 years old when she decided to open her own grocery store, a project that soon attracted customers. Needless to say, sales at first were meager but in time they grew and continue to do so to date. She recognizes that the key to success is effort and love of work. This is why her customers are satisfied with the products they receive. Normally she works alone but during school breaks her children help her. Her plan for the future is to expand her store introducing new, cutting edge, products of various prices with the aim of increasing sales. This is her first loan with MFP and she pledges to repay in a timely fashion. She is happy with the level of cordiality that reigns in her communal group. She will use the funds to buy merchandise to stock her store.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Diana Elizabeth

texts.es:
Diana es una joven madre de familia de 19 años de edad que vive junto a su menor hijo en el distrito de Guadalupe de la provincia de Pacasmayo, una zona perteneciente a la región La Libertad, se encuentra ubicada a mas de una hora de distancia de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica desde muy joven a vender tamales (plato oriundo de varios países de latinoamérica consistente en una masa de maíz molido rellena de carne y envuelta en hojas de plátano). Ella prepara el producto en su vivienda y los ofrece en venta en el mercado de la ciudad de Guadalupe, a veces también recorre las calles del distrito para ofrecer su mercadería. Con los ingresos que le brinda este negocio ella ayuda a su esposo, quien se encuentra trabajando en Lima, con el sostenimiento de la economía de su familia.

Diana desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de mas insumos, de modo que pueda ampliar su producción y también sus ventas, para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 700 nuevos soles.

Su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria y garantizarle a su menor hijo un futuro estable y próspero, ella siempre se esfuerza por salir adelante y progresar, las personas que le conocen le consideran una mujer luchadora y entregada a su familia. En la imagen ella nos muestra la masa del tamal antes de ser cocinada.
texts.en:
Diana is a young mother. She is 19 years old, and she lives with her young child in the Guadalupe district, Pacasmayo province. This area belongs to the La Libertad region. It is over one hour from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region. Since she was very young she has sold tamales (a native dish in many Latin America countries; which consists of dough made from ground corn, filled with meat, and wrapped in banana leafs). She prepares the product at her home, and she sells them at the Guadalupe city market. Sometimes she also traverses the district streets to sell her merchandise. With the income from this business she helps her husband, who works in Lima, with the family’s expenses. Diana wishes to expand her business with the purchase of more supplies. That way she will be able to increase her production, and her sales will also increase. To achieve this objective she believes it is advisable to request a loan for 700 soles from Edpyme Alternativa. Her greatest desire is to keep growing as a businesswoman and to guarantee her young child of a stable and prosperous future. She is always working hard to get ahead and progress. The people who know her consider her to be a tenacious woman who is devoted to her family. The photo shows her making the dough for the tamales before it is cooked.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies to make tamales to incease production in her business

loans.name: Unidas Venceremos 4 Group

texts.en:
Jisela is the coordinator of her group, Unidas Venceremos 4 (United we'll win). She makes her home in a simple structure with her long term partner and 3 children. She plans to continue to enjoy sourcing stock to make business sales.

Jisela is excited to be taking her second loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She has had her business for 8 months. She started it when she realized the need to have more income. She started selling underwear, which improved after her first loan. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying different clothing. She will use the profits to expand her business by adding more products.
 
This Esperanza associate began with us because she really want to do business and she found in Esperanza the help to. Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in San Pedro de Macoris, a city famous for baseball players and sugar cane industries. The main economic activities include a free trading zone and a cement factory. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity.

loans.use: to buy clothes

loans.name: Matha Esthefania

texts.es:
Martha de 22 años, vende ropa para ayudar con los gastos de su casa. Es madre soltera, ella y su bebe viven en una zona periurbana, con caminos de tierra y las casas están ubicadas en montañas.

Su mama tenia un negocio de ropa y decidió ayudarla para que Martha tuviera su propio negocio y pueda mantener a su hijo. Ahora realiza su trabajo sola, vende blusas, camisas, pantalones, zapatos etc. Mientas que ella sale a vender ropa su hermana le cuida a su bebe.   

Ella quiere el préstamo para poder comprar ropa y zapatos. En el futuro quiere incrementar su clientela, y así darle una buena educación a su hijo.
texts.en:
Martha, 22, sells clothes to help with household expenses. She is a single mother. She and her baby live in a periurban area with unpaved streets and houses built on hillsides. Her mother had a clothing business and decided to help her so that Martha would have her own business and be able to support her son. She now works alone selling blouses, shirts, pants, shoes, etc. When she is out selling her sister babysits her son. She wants the loan to buy clothes and shoes. In the future she’d like to enlarge her customer base thus providing her son with a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For clothing and shoes.

loans.name: Maria Mercedes

texts.es:
Maria Mercedes C. tiene 36 anos. Es casada y vive en el cantón de Guaranda en la provincia Bolívar de Ecuador. Tiene 1 hijo de 11 anos. 
  
Maria es una socia de la ventanilla rural Gradas Chico, que está ubicada a quince minutos en carro de la ciudad de Guaranda. Son 20 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican al cultivo de maíz, trigo, papas, y la cría de animales.  Este es el tercer préstamo que sacan con la cooperativa.

Maria se dedica a la agricultura y tiene un pequeño negocio de la venta de ropa. Cultiva maíz y un poco de papas. Realiza las compras y las ventas de sus productos en el mercado de Guaranda. Vende su ropa en la plaza 15 de Mayo en la ciudad de Guaranda.

Solicita el credito para aumentar su negocio de vender ropa. Su sueno es seguir avanzando en su negocio y hacer estudiar a su hijo. A veces se desafia con la competencia que existe en su negocio de venta de ropa. 
No tiene tiempo libre porque siempre hay cosas que hacer en la casa o en las chakras.
texts.en:
Maria Mercedes C. is 36 years old. She is married and she lives in the village of Guaranda in the province of Bolivar in Ecuador. She has an eleven-year old son. Maria lives in the rural village of Gradas Chico, about a fifteen minute drive from the city of Guaranda. The group is made up of 20 members and the majority of them cultivate corn, wheat, and potatoes and raise livestock. This is the third loan they have requested. Maria is an agriculturist but she also has a small store from where she sells clothing. She cultivates corn and some potatoes. She makes her purchases and carries out the sale of her products in the markets of Guaranda. She sells clothing in the plaza named 15 de Maya in Guaranda. She requests a loan to restock her clothing business. Her dream is to keep developing her business and to send her son to school. She feels discouraged sometimes over the competition that she sees in her clothing business. She doesn't have much spare time because there are always things to do in the home or in the fields.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To develop her small clothing business.

loans.name: Roberto Pedro

texts.es: El Sr. Roberto de 39 años de edad, es separado de su esposa,  tienen dos hijos el  vive en Alquiler,   en el Barrio el recreo  zona plan 3000, trabaja como chofer hace  ocho años.  El sr. Roberto  ahora es dueño de su propio microbús y de la línea 38, el trabajo mucho para poder comprarse ese micro, tanto que le costo su matrimonio, descuido a su esposa y a sus hijos y ahora se siente solo pero cuenta que saldrá adelante,  al  Sr. Roberto se le otorgo el crédito para la reparación de su microbús (reparación de caja, muelles y  cremalleras en general...). EL señor esta muy agradecido y sorprendido por la rapidez que se le otorgo el crédito.
texts.en:
Roberto, 39, is separated from his wife. They have two children. He is a renter in El Recreo neighborhood, Plan 3000 zone. He has worked as a bus driver for the last 8 years. He currently owns his microbus and works Route 38. He worked very hard to be able to buy that microbus so much so that it cost him his marriage. He neglected his wife and children and now feels alone but he states that he will continue to move forward. Roberto was granted a loan to repair the microbus (repair the gear box, gears and transmission). He is very grateful and surprised by the speed with which the loan was granted.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For microbus repair.

loans.name: Rosa Aurora

texts.es:
Rosa Aurora R. tiene 52 anos. Es casada y vive en el cantón de Guaranda en la provincia Bolívar de Ecuador. Tiene 7 hijos de 27 hasta 10 anos. 

Rosa es una socia de la ventanilla rural Gradas Chico, que está ubicada a quince minutos en carro de la ciudad de Guaranda. Son 20 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican al cultivo de maíz, trigo, papas, y la cría de animales.  Este es el tercer préstamo que sacan con la cooperativa.

A Rosa se dedica a la agricultura. Tiene cultivos de maíz, trigo, y cevada. Hace las compras y las ventas de sus productos en el mercado de Guaranda cada semana.
 
Solicita el credito para comprar un ganado. Con el apoyo del credito le permitira aumentar sus bacas. Su sueno es tener 6 bacas dentro de los proximos 5 anos. Se desafia con la falta de alimiento para sus bacas.
texts.en:
Rosa Aurora R. is 52 years old. She is married and lives in the canton of Guaranda in the providence Bolívar in Ecuador. She has seven children, ranging in age from 10 to 27 years old. Rosa is a member of the rural solidarity group Gradas Chico, which is located fifteen minutes by car from the city of Guaranda. The group has 20 members in total, the majority of whom grow corn, wheat, and potatoes and raise animals. This is the third loan this group has taken with the cooperative. Rosa is involved with agriculture, cultivating corn, wheat, and barley. She does her shopping and sells her products in the Guaranda market every week. Rosa is asking for the loan to buy livestock. With the support of the credit, she will be able to increase the number of cows she owns. Her dream is to have six cows within the next five years. She currently struggles to provide enough food for her cows.

Translated from Spanish by Lauren Fischetti, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy livestock

loans.name: G.s. Sol Naciente Group

texts.es: La señora Yanilda Del Carmen tiene 30 años, es casada y tiene 3 hijos de 3, 7 y 12 años respectivamente. El negocio a que se dedica es a la venta de oro y plata, los cuales distribuye principalmente de manera ambulante en zonas francas, distribuye al crédito a recuperarse en 30 días.  Ella ya tiene 13 años de dedicarse a esta actividad. Ella solicita el crédito con el propósito de invertirlo en comprar oro y plata. La señora Candida Rosa ella tiene 26 años de edad, es casada y tiene cuatro hijos menores de edad. Ella se dedica al comercio, ya que en su casa de habitación tiene localizada una pulpería. Ella desea invertir el crédito en la pulpería para así poder ofertar más productos, de todo un poco a como ella le llama y así obtener más ganancias. Yesica Del Socorro  tiene 27 años de edad y tiene 1 hija de 4 años de edad. Su esposo trabaja como vigilante en Managua. Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva y usada, negocio que es de manera ambulante. Ella ya tiene 5 años de tener este negocio, cabe señalarse dio inicio con recursos propios y con poca mercadería y poco a poco le fue inyectando capital. Otra integrante es  Josefina Elizabeth, tiene 26 años de edad, es casada, su esposo es conductor de microbús. Ella no tiene hijos todavía. Ella se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras, ella vende en el mercado oriental de Managua. Ella ya tiene dos años de estar vendiendo en este mercado, cabe señalarse inicio con capital propio ya que fue su esposo el que le brindo el empujón económico, ya que necesitaban ingreso adicional para auto mantenerse ellos. Es por eso que han unidos fuerzas para mejorar los ingresos de su negocio.
texts.en:
Sra. Yanilda Del Carmen, 30, is married and has 3 children who are 12-, 7- and 3-years old, respectively. She operates a business buying and selling gold and silver. She works as a street vendor, mostly in free-trade zones, selling on credit and collecting in 30 days. She has operated the business for 13 years. She is applying for a loan that she will use to buy gold and silver. Sra. Candida Rosa, 26, is married and has four young children. She operates a corner shop in her house. She will use her loan to expand the stock of goods she sells--a little of everything, she says--and, in turn, increase her earnings. Yesica Del Soccorro, 27, has a 4-year old daughter. Her husband works as a security guard in Managua. She operates a business, working as a street vendor, selling new and used clothing. She has operated the business for 5 years. She started the business with her savings, with only a small amount of merchandise at first, and building from there. Another member is Josefina Elizabeth, 26. Josefina is married--her husband is a bus driver--with, as yet, no children. She operates a business selling fruits and vegetables at the Mercado Oriental in Managua. She has operated the business in the market for two years. She started the business with savings. Her husband provided the push to start the business because they needed a larger income to support themselves. For that reason, they combined forces to improve the earnings from her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Melissa Lissette

texts.es:
Melissa tiene 24 años de edad, es separada y tiene dos hijos a su cargo, uno de seis y otro de dos años de edad. Reside en casa de sus padres ubicada en el distrito de Cayaltí, una zona agrícola de regular movimiento comercial que se encuentra situada a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

La necesidad de sacar adelante a sus hijos hizo que empezara un negocio de venta de carnes y visceras en el mercado de la localidad de Cayaltí. Ella ofrece estos productos todos los dias durante la mañana. Actualmente ya cuenta con un grupo de clientes fidelizados los cuales la prefieren debido al buen servicio que brinda. Con los ingresos que le brinda esta actividad ella se encarga de mantener a sus dos hijos.

Melissa desea ampliar su negocio comprando mas carne para aumentar sus ventas y percibir mayores ganancias, para realizar este objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles,

Ella es una mujer luchadora y entregada a su familia. Su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria para poder brindarle a sus hijos un futuro estable y prometedor. Las personas que la conocen la consideranuna mujer responsable y de confianza.
texts.en:
Melissa, 24, is separated and has two children in her care: one, six-years old and the other, two-years old. She lives with her parents in the Cayalti district, an agricultural area about an hour from the city of Chiclayo. The necessity to support her children was the impetus behind her business. She sells meat and offal at the market in the town of Cayalti. She works every morning. She can now count on a group of loyal customers who prefer her because of the good service that she provides. The income from the business allows Melissa to support her two children. Melissa wants to expand the business by buying more meat so that she can sell more and increase her earnings. She is applying to Edpyme Alternativa for a 1000 new-soles loan for this purpose. Melissa is working and striving for her family. Her greatest hope is to continue growing as an entrepreneur so that she can provide her children with a stable and promising future. The people that know her consider her to be a responsible and trustworthy woman.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies for butcher shop.

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.es: Vicenta, de 43 años de edad, convive y tiene cuatro hijos en etapa escolar. Juntos residen en la localidad de San Francisco, ubicada en la hermosa selva tropical ayacuchana, donde tienen su propia casa a base de madera. Todo comenzó, cuando Vicenta tenía las ansias de tener su propia tienda, pero no contaba con el presupuesto necesario para concretarlo, sin embargo tuvo la opción de trabajar en la actividad agrícola, por lo que se dedico a cultivar cacao desde entonces recibía una remuneración justa, al cabo de un buen tiempo decidió quedarse en la agricultura; y con los ahorros que había ganado durante un tiempo pudo invertirlo en su tienda, y poco a poco se esta estableciendo, confía que con el tiempo le genere los ingresos necesarios para ofrecer a su familia comodidad. Reconoce  que el factor más importante, es procurar abastecerlo de productos, eso le permitirá mantener a sus clientes. Usualmente trabaja por cuenta propia, pero en ocasiones recibe la ayuda de sus hijos, y su rutina diaria es a partir de las 5:30 de la mañana hasta las 9:00 de la noche. Su plan a futuro es ampliar y acondicionar su tienda, con el propósito de que pueda incentivar a sus clientes, de esa manera pueda mejorar sus ingresos económicos. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a pagar de manera puntual, además agradece a su grupo comunal, ya que le brinda ventajas positivas. Con el crédito que solicita lo piensa invertir en la compra de mercadería, con la finalidad de que pueda abastecer su tienda.
texts.en:
Vicenta, 43, has a live-in partner and four school aged children. They all live together in their own wood house in San Francisco located in the beautiful Ayacucho backcountry. It all started with Vicenta’s yearning to own her own store. However, she lacked the budget to do so. The opportunity to work in farming presented itself and she went into cacao farming. Since then she earned a fair wage. After a time she was able to invest it in her store and gradually it’s establishing itself. She trusts that in time it will generate sufficient income to provide comfort for the family. She recognizes that the most important factor is stocking it with products in order to retain her customers. She usually works alone but sometimes her children help out. Her usual work schedule is from 5:30am until 9pm. Her plan for the future is to expand and equip her store aiming at encouraging her customers so that income will improve. This is her first loan with MFP which she pledges to repay in a timely fashion. She is grateful to her communal group because it offers positive advantages. The requested funds will be used to buy merchandise with which to stock her store.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Laura Azucena

texts.es:
Laura de 58 años, vende todo tipo de bebidas, su negocio lo tienen en su casa porque no ha podido conseguir un local, vive en la Perimetral de Guayaquil (zona periurbana, a su alrededor tiene el estero salado). 

Por necesidad y después de haber muerto su esposo comenzó a vender puerta a puerta botellas de agua y también hacer empleada domestica. Poco a poco fue incrementando su clientela y surtiendo las bebidas. Ahora no tiene horario fijo porque esta trabajando esporádicamente como empleada domestica y el resto de tiempo lo utiliza para su negocio. 

Para seguir con su negocio de venta de bebidas ella quiere comprar con el préstamo bebidas como coca cola, agua y jugos. En el futuro quiere terminar de construir su casa.
texts.en:
Laura, 58, sells all kinds of beverages. She operates the business in her house because she wasn't able to find another space for the business. She lives on the outskirts of Guayaquil (an area between the city and the nearby wetlands). Laura started selling bottled water, door to door, after her husband died because she needed the income. She also works as a house cleaner. Her customer base for the water business has increased little by little. She doesn't have fixed work hours now because she occasionally gets work as a cleaner and only operates the business other times. To keep the business going, Laura has to buy beverages--Coca Cola, water and juices. For the future, she wants to finish building her house.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy beverages to resell.

loans.name: Mujeres De Fe Y Amor 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Ruth is the coordinator of her group Mujeres de Fe y Amor 1 & 2. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her husband and 3 children. She says that her most difficult challenge is to be a mother.  In the meantime she plans to continue enjoying practicing beauty services.

Ruth is excited to be taking out her first loan. She has had her business for around 3 months, starting by buying merchandise and selling by order. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business of cosmetics, underwear and women's shoes. She will use the profits to build her house block.
 
This Esperanza associate began with Esperanza International Dominican Republic to improve her business, and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) generally. Her group is located in Puerto Plata, a port town on the north coast where the economy is based on tourism. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity.

loans.use: Cosmetics, underwear and women's shoes

loans.name: Maria Simona

texts.es: Maria Simona  33 años por la falta de oportunidades ella comenzó a vender ropa desde que termino sus estudios, a pesar que no puedo completar estudios universitarios pudo sobrevivir, pues también tiene el servicio de brindar servicio en su triciclo así aprovecha y realiza  las visitas a sus respectivos clientes para mostrarles la variedad de productos que ofrece. Realiza su desde  hace mas de 5 años, pues no ha sido fácil mantenerse ya que sus hijos se enferman o los gastos del hogar. Ella quiere el préstamo para poder comprar ropa y así asegurar y pagar sus cuotas en tiempo y forma. En el futuro quiere tener su propio almacén de ropa.
texts.en:
María Simona, 33, started selling clothes when she finished her studies because of lack of employment opportunities. Despite not being able to finish her university education she was able to survive because she also provides service with her three-wheeled vehicle and is able to visit her customers to show her products. She has been in this line of work for over 5 years but is hasn’t been easy to support herself because if it isn’t a child becoming ill it’s household expenses. She wants the funds to buy clothes in order to repay her loan in a timely fashion. In the future she’d like to have her own clothing store.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothes.

loans.name: Ghislaine

texts.fr: ZANNOU Ghislaine est née en 1979 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Ghislaine vit depuis une vingtaine d'année au quartier Gankpodo à Cotonou, avec sa famille. Ghislaine est mariée à ATINDOKPO Guy, et est mère de deux enfants, tous scolarisés. Ghislaine assure avec son mari les différentes charges de la famille, grâce au revenu de son  activité. Ghislaine a arrêté l'école au cours secondaire. Depuis dix sept ans environs, Ghislaine vend des mèches en gros, et de façon secondaire, des plateaux d'oeufs frais par le système de distribution. Cette activité lui génère des revenus lui permettant de subvenir sans difficulté aux besoins de sa famille. C'est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, et aussi au Nigéria que Ghislaine achète ses produits. Ghislaine est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, ayant obtenu antérieurement six crédits qui ont été tous bien remboursés. Face à la demande de plus en plus grandissante de sa clientèle, Ghislaine sollicite un autre crédit en vue d'augmenter le volume de son activité et de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en:
ZANNOU Ghislaine was born in 1979 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin.  She has been living with her family in the Gankpodo district in Cotonou for about twenty years.  She is married to ATINDOKPO Guy and is the mother of two children, who are all in school.  Along with her husband, Ghislaine ensures that the different family expenses are covered, thanks to the revenues from her business.  Ghislaine dropped out in secondary school.  For about seventeen years, she has been selling hair extensions wholesale.
