Secondarily, she sells trays of fresh eggs by the distribution system.  This business generates the revenues enabling her without a problem to provide for her family.  She gets her supplies at Dantokpa, the international market of Benin, and also from Nigeria.  She is a previous ALIDé client having had six loans in the past that have all been repaid.  Facing the growing demands from her customer base, Ghislaine is requesting another loan with the goal of increasing her business volume and satisfying her customers more.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying hair extensions, beauty products, hair products, and eggs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy supplies for his masks.

loans.name: Artidoro

texts.es:
Artidoro tiene 37 años de edad, es casado y cuenta con un hijo dependiente, reside junto a su familia en un sector urbano – marginal de la ciudad de Lambayeque, una zona de regular movimiento comercial que se encuentra situada a veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales menores desde hace cuatro años. El cría aves de corral en un ambiente acondicionado en la parte posterior de su domicilio y cuando ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo las ofrece en venta a los negociantes y a sus vecinos. Esta actividad le provee de ingresos estables y permanentes con los cuales solventa la economía de su familia, por este motivo el siempre se esfuerza por mantenerse en el negocio.

Artidoro desea ampliar su negocio comprando mas aves de corral, así como alimento balanceado para que se desarrollen correctamente. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que le ayuden con el logro de su objetivo.

Artidoro es un padre bastante responsable y que siempre vela por el bienestar y desarrollo de su familia. El espera seguir trabajando para realizar algunas mejoras en la infraestructura de su vivienda, ya que está construida de material rustico.
texts.en:
Artidoro, 37, is married and has a dependent son. He lives with his family in a marginal urban section of Lambayeque, an area with regular commercial activity, located twenty minutes from the city of Chiclayo. He has raised small farm animals for the last 4 years. He raises barnyard fowl in his back yard in an area set aside for this. When they reach an adequate developmental level he sells them to merchants and neighbors. This activity produces steady and permanent income with which he meets his family’s expenses. For this reason, he always makes an effort to maintain the business. Artidoro would like to buy more fowl as well as nutritionally balanced feed for them so that they will develop correctly. He has therefore deemed it convenient to request his first, 1500 new sol, loan from Edpyme Alternativa that will help him reach his objective. Artidoro is quite a responsible father who is always watchful of his family’s wellbeing and development. He hopes to continue working in order to make some improvements on his home’s infrastructure since it is currently built out of rustic materials.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy barnyard fowl and nutritionally balanced feed for them.

loans.name: Elise

texts.fr: H. Elise est née le 26 Juillet 1980 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Elise est mariée et est mère de quatre enfants, tous scolarisés. Elise vit avec sa famille au quartier Ayélawadjè à Cotonou. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges de la famille. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Elise vend du pâté (fait à base de la farine de blé) dans son quartier. Elise s’approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. C’est la deuxième fois que Elise sollciite auprès de ALIDé, un crédit, en vue de rehausser le niveau de son activité et d’accroître son revenu. Le premier crédit que Elise avait obtenu a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
H. Elise was born on July 26, 1980 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin.  She is married and the mother of four children who are all in school.  She lives with her family in the Ayélawadjè district in Cotonou.  The couple jointly ensure that their family expenses are covered. To provide for her needs and those of her children, Elise sells pâté (made with wheat flour) in her area.  She gets her supplies at Dantokpa, the international market of Benin.  This is the second loan that Elise has requested from ALIDé with the goal of boosting her business and increasing her revenues.  The first loan she obtained has been repaid.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying sacks of wheat flour and some vegetable oil

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Her loan will be used to buy additional material for sale

loans.name: Claveles Group

texts.es:
La asociación comunal “CLAVELES”, es un grupo nuevo, consta de nueve integrantes, ocho mujeres y un varón,  a la cabeza  se encuentra la señora María Luisa como presidenta. 

La  señora María Luisa, casada, a sus 59 años de edad tiene a su cargo un Kiosko de golosinas, este negocio ha sido su sustento durante los últimos diez años. Con respecto a su permanencia en Pro Mujer, ella está ya tres ciclos en su asociación.

La A.C. “CLAVELES” cuenta con integrantes que también tienen sus propios negocios, entre ellos tenemos: venta de tarjetas y papel de regalo y juguetes, venta de chompas, venta de golosinas y otros, artículos deportivos, venta de repuestos de autos, venta de ropa, cafetería, confección de chamarras y tejido de manta con lana de vicuña.
texts.en:
The Communal Association “Claveles” (Carnations) is a new group consisting of nine members, eight women and one man. The group is headed by Sra. María Luisa who serves as President.

Sra. María Luisa is 59 years old, married, and manages a candy kiosk. She has looked after this business for the past ten years in order to earn a living. Regarding her tenure with Pro Mujer, she has already participated in three loan cycles with her group.

The Communal Association “Claveles” consists of members who have their own businesses which include selling cards, gift wrapping paper, and toys; selling sweaters; selling candy and other treats; selling sporting goods, selling auto parts; selling clothing; managing a cafeteria; manufacturing jackets; and weaving blankets made of vicuña wool.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a variety of candy

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en: Gladys N. displays provisions on a table for sale. She is divorced and has four children. She has no educational background. Gladys uses her income to educate, feed and clothe her children. Gladys will use the loan to purchase more provisions to sell. With the new revenues from her expanded business, Gladys plans to save to build a shop.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia, D. 53 años, es una mujer muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Artemio D. 55 años y sus dos menores hijos, a quienes desea brindarles una mejor calidad D. vida. El trabajo al que Julia se dedica, es el cultivo D. maíz, arveja y habas. Todos los días, muy temprano por L. mañana, trabaja en su cultivo, ya que sabe que el dinero que obtenga por sus productos dependerá mucho D. L. calidad D. su cosecha. ElL. venD. sus productos en L. ciudad D. Tarma, puesto que es donD. mejores precios le ofrecen. Lo que más le gusta D. su trabajo es cosechar sus tierras, ya que así siente que los meses D. trabajo han tenido sus frutos, lleva 35 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus tierras D. L. plaga D. insectos, ya que afectan mucho en L. producción, en tanto desea comprar nuevas tierras y extender su siembra. Este es el segundo crédito con MFP, siente que este aporte le ayudará mucho en el progreso D. su trabajo. En su grupo comunal es muy querida por el resto D. sus compañeros, ya que es muy solidaria con ellos. Con los mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más abono y fertilizantes para mejorar L. calidad D. sus tierras.
texts.en:
Julia, 53, is a cheerful, hard working woman. She lives in her own house with her husband, Artemio, 55, and their two youngest children for whom she’d like to proviD. a better quality of life. Julia is a corn, pea and lima bean farmer. She works her fields daily from very early in the morning because she realizes that the money she will get from her products very much depends on the quality of her harvest. She sells her products in the city of Tarma because that’s where she gets the best prices. What she most enjoys about her work is harvesting because that’s when she sees the fruits of long months of labor. She has been a farmer for 35 years and considers keeping her crops free of insect infestations to be the most difficult part of farming because they greatly affect production. She, therefore, would like to buy new fields and expand the size of her planting area. This is her second loan with MFP; she feels that this contribution will be of great help for her work’s progress. She is very well liked by her fellow communal group members because she is very supportive of them. She will use the requested 1000 new soles to buy manure and fertilizers to improve the quality of her soil.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy manure to improve crops.

loans.name: Teresa Del Rocio

texts.es:
Teresa de 40 años, ella tiene una tienda de víveres en la parte delantera de su casa, vive en la Perimetral de Guayaquil (zona periurbana, a su alrededor tiene el estero salado). 

Cuando su esposo la abandono ella se quedo con sus dos hijos, y tuvo que conseguir dinero para poder mantenerlos, comenzó a comprar víveres y a venderlos, ahora ella tiene su pequeña tienda en la parte de delantera de su casa trabaja desde las 06h00am hasta las 22h30pm todos los días, cuando se queda sola en la tienda teme por la delincuencia que se ha incrementado. 

Ella quiere comprar con el préstamo aceites, vegetales y carnes para surtir mas su negocio. En el futuro quiere incluir en su tienda una papelería para tener mas ingresos.
texts.en:
Teresa is 40 years old and manages a store in the front part of her house where she sells provisions. She lives along the Perimetral de Guayaquil, a periurban area that is surrounded by a salt marsh.

When her husband abandoned her, Teresa was left alone to care for her two children. She needed money in order to support them, so she began buying and selling provisions. Now she has a small store in the front part of her house where she works every day from 6am to 10:30pm. She is afraid to be in the store by herself since crime in the area has increased.

Teresa wants to use this loan to buy oil, vegetables, and meats to increase her business inventory. In the future, she wants to add a stationery shop to her business so that she can earn more income.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase oil, vegetables, and meats

loans.name: Abana

texts.en:
Abana F. sells plastic bowls at Takoradi. She has received senior high education and is married with three children. Her husband works in a sawmill.

Abana has been selling plastic bowls for some time now, helping her husband in the upkeep of the home. Her loan will be used to buy more plastic containers for sale.

Abana hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to build a shop.

loans.use: To buy more plastic containers for sale

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This borrower is 50 years old and is married with three children. He graduated from primary school.

The borrower owns a smithy shop and has acquired a great deal of experience in the scope of his job. His manufacturing is so good and of the best quality that it has made him lots of clients who come to his shop to purchase all their materials from him. He has good reputation in the market. He will use this loan to purchase iron bars and a welding machine.

This job, due to his seriousness, has enabled him to raise his family income because he is in charge of a big family.

loans.use: To purchase iron bars and a welding machine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more plastic bowls to sell

loans.name: Eyi Ablanvi Hélenia

texts.fr: B. Eyi Ablanvi Hélenia est née le 20 Novembre 1977 à Sègbohouè dans le département de l’Atlantique au Bénin. Hélenia est mariée à SOSSOUVE Thierry et a en charge quatre enfants, tous scolarisés, dont deux sont ses propres enfants. Hélenia vit avec sa famille depuis près de quatre ans au quartier Midombo à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Hélenia a fréquenté l’école jusqu’au cours secondaire. Pour assurer les différentes charges de sa famille, Hélenia vend divers produits de beauté et de façon secondaire, des tissus et des chaussures dans sa boutique size au marché de Midombo. Hélenia s’approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. C’est la deuxième fois que Hélenia sollicite auprès de ALIDé, un crédit en vue d’augmenter son fonds de roulement et d’élever le niveau de son activité. Le premier prêt obtenu par Hélenia a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
B. Eyi Ablanvi Hélenia was born on November 20, 1977 in Sègbohouè, in Atlantique county, Benin.  She is married to SOSSOUVE Thierry and has in her care four children, who are all in school.  Two of the children are her own.  For almost four years, Hélenia has been living with her family in the Midombo district in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin.  Hélenia has attended middle school.  To make sure that family expenses are covered, she sell beauty products, and cloth and shoes on the side, in her store located at the Midombo market.  She gets her supplies at Dantokpa, the international market of Benin. This is the second time that Hélenia has requested a loan from ALIDé for increasing her operating capital and raising her level of business.  The first loan she obtained was repaid.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying beauty products, shoes, and bags

loans.name: Matilda

texts.en:
Matilda O. is married and has a child. Her husband is a driver. She has not received any form of education.

Matilda sells secondhand clothes and slippers at Takoradi and uses her income to pay school fees and utility bills as a way of supporting her husband. She will use the loan to purchase more slippers for sale.

Matilda plans to plow back the new profits from her expanded business.

loans.use: To purchase more slippers to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more provisions to sell

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es: Victoria, D. 53 años, es una madre D. familia muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Pablo D. 51 años y sus 2 hijos menores, a quienes desea brindarles una mejor calidad D. vida. Los largos días D. trabajo que tiene Victoria en sus tierras, han hecho que se vuelva una gran conocedora D. la agricultura, sus cultivos están muy bien cuidados y siempre consigue un buen precio por la venta D. sus productos, puesto que en estos últimos meses, la demanda por la papa, arveja y maíz que cultiva se ha incrementado. Lo que más le gusta D. su trabajo es cultivar la tierra, ya que es la actividad que realiza desD. que era niña, sin embargo considera que le es difícil transportar sus productos hasta el mercado D. Tarma, pero sabe que todo esfuerzo tiene su recompensa. Ahora espera comprar más tierras y así incrementar su producción. Este es el segundo crédito con MFP y esta ahorrando para pagar sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que no quiere causarle problemas a las socias D. su grupo comunal, donD. se siente muy contenta. Con los mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará fertilizantes, para hacer más productivas sus tierras.
texts.en:
Victoria is 53 years old, and a very simple hard-working mother of a family. She lives in her own house with her husband Pablo, who is 51, and her 2 minor children. She wishes to offer them a better quality of life. The long days of work that Victoria spends on her land have maD. her very knowledgeable about agriculture. Her crops are very well cared for and always bring a good price when sold, especially since in recent months demand for the potatoes, vetch, and corn that she grows has grown. What Victoria likes most about her work is to cultivate the earth, since that is what she has done since she was a child. Nonetheless, she considers it difficult to transport her produce to market in Tarma, but understands that all effort has its recompense. Now Victoria wants to buy more land and thus, increase her production. This is her 2nd loan with MFP and she is saving to be able to make her payments on time, since she doesn't want to cause problems for fellow members in her communal bank, where she feels very content. With the 1,000 new sols she is requesting, Victoria will buy fertilizers to make her land more productive.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING FERTILIZERS TO MAKE HER LAND MORE PRODUCTIVE

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more jewelry to sell

loans.name: Cica Agnès

texts.fr: K. Cica Agnès est née en 1957 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Depuis une trentaine d’année, Agnès s’est installée au quartier Agbodjèdo à Cotonou, où elle vit avec sa famille. Agnès est mariée à KIKI Donatien et est mère de quatre enfants, tous scolarisés, dont trois sont à sa charge. Le couple subvient ensemble aux différentes charges de la famille. Agnès n’a pas été à l’école. Pour faire face à ses différents besoins, Agnès vend de la tomate fraiche à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. C’est également à Dantokpa que Agnès s’approvisionne. Agnès a déjà obtenu un prêt de ALIDé et a bien effectué le remboursement. La clientèle de Agnès se fait de plus en plus grande ; raison pour laquelle Agnès sollicite un autre crédit afin d’augmenter son fonds de roulement et donc le volume de son activité.
texts.en:
Cica Agnès K. was born in 1957 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Agnès settled 30 years ago in the Agbodjèdo borough of Cotonou, where she lives with her family. She is married to Donatien Kiki and is the mother of four children, all attending (or having attended) school, and of whom three are still under her care. The couple share responsibility for the various family expenses. Agnès has not attended school. To meet her needs, she retails fresh tomatoes in Dantokpa, Benin’s international marketplace. She also gets her supplies in Dantokpa. Agnès has already been granted one loan from ALIDé, which was reimbursed in full. Her customer base is steadily increasing, which is why she is requesting another loan, to increase her working capital and thus the volume of her business.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy bowls of fresh tomatoes.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This borrower is 48 years old and is married with four children. She graduated from intermediate school.

The borrower has been working in tailoring for more than twenty-five years and has therefore acquired a great deal of experience. She possesses a high reputation as a skilled lady and this has gained her lots of customers and led to an increase in her income.

The purpose behind this loan is to purchase a sewing machine and cloth.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine and cloth

loans.name: Martine

texts.fr: K. Martine est née en 1968 à Avrankou dans le département de l’Ouémé. Martine est mariée à TIKO Alfred et est mère de trois enfants, tous scolarisés. Martine vit ensemble avec sa famille au quartier Agbodjèdo à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, depuis trois ans environs.  C’est ensemble avec son mari que Martine fait face aux différentes charges de son foyer. Martine n’a pas été à l’école. Depuis une dizaine d’année, Martine vend des friperies à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, ce qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et d’assurer les besoins de sa famille. C’est la deuxième fois que Martine sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé, en vue de renforcer son activité et d’accroître sa clientèle. Martine a bien remboursé son premier crédit.
texts.en:
Martine K. was born in 1968 in Avrankou, in the Department of Ouémé. Martine is married to Alfred Tiko and is the mother of 3 children, all of whom have been educated. Martine and her family have lived in the Agbodjèdo neighborhood of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, for about 3 years. Together with her husband, Martine faces the varied challenges of managing the household. Martine has not been to school. For the past ten years, Martine has sold used clothes in Dantokpa, the international market of Benin, which has allowed her to meet her needs and those of her family. This is the second time Martine has sought a loan from ALIDé, with the goal of building her business and her client base. Martine repaid her first loan on time.

Translated from French by Eileen Jessop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bales of used clothes

loans.name: Ada

texts.es: Ada, de 25 años, es una madre de familia muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Edwin de 27 años y su querida hija Daniela de 2 años, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. Trabajando arduamente, Ada ha logrado sacar adelante sus sembríos, todas las mañana se levanta muy temprano para regar y brindarle el cuidado respectivo a sus cultivos. Sus productos los lleva a vender al mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma, donde la arveja, habas y maíz que cultiva, son rápidamente comprados. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que puede disfrutar de la libertad de laborar en sus campos. Con el tiempo, espera poder comprar más tierras para ampliar su producción. Este es el segundo crédito con MFP, sabe que este préstamo le ayudara bastante en el progreso y desarrollo de su negocio, es por eso que esta dispuesta a pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, en su grupo comunal es una socia muy responsable, motivo por el cual es muy querida. Los dos mil nuevos soles que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de abono.
texts.en:
Ada, 25 years old, is a very simple and hard-working mother of a family. She lives in her own home with her husband Edwin, who is 27, and her dear daughter Daniela, who is 2. They are the motive for all her efforts. Working arduously, Ada has been able to advance her sowing. Every morning she rises very early to water and offer the respective care to her crops. She takes her products to the wholesale market in the city of Tarma, where the vetch, beans, and corn that she cultivates are rapidly bought. What Ada likes best about her work is enjoying the liberty of laboring in her fields. In time, she hopes to be able to buy more land in order to expand her production. This is Ada's 2nd loan with MFP. She is certain that this loan will help her with the progress and development of her business. That's why she is so disposed to make all her payments punctually. In her communal group, Ada is a very responsible member, for which reason she is much loved. The 2,000 new sols she requests will be invested in buying manure.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING MANURE FOR HER FIELDS

loans.name: Maame

texts.en:
Maame B. is married and has three children. She has been through senior high school. Her husband is a driver.

Maame sells slippers by moving from one area to another at Takoradi and uses her income to support her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. She will use the loan to purchase additional slippers to sell.

With the new profits from her expanded business, Maame plans to save to invest in the cooking of rice for sale which is going to serve as an additional trade.

loans.use: To purchase more slippers to sell

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en:
Adwoa B. sells cassava and plantain at Takoradi. She is married with two children and has received junior high education. Her husband is into carpentry. Adwoa helps her husband in the general upkeep of the home.

Adwoa will use the loan to purchase more cassava and plantain to sell. With the new earnings from her expanded business, she plans to invest in the sale of other foodstuffs.

loans.use: To purchase more cassava and plantain to sell

loans.name: Reyna Aquilina

texts.es: Reyna Aquilina es de 38 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene dos hijos menores de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general, este negocio lo aprendió por su Mama que desde la edad de 12 años, le enseñaba a ganarse la vida, pues con el paso del tiempo fue que Reyna llego a interesarse y al mismo tiempo a independizarse y hacerse cargo de esta actividad.  Solicita su crédito para capital de trabajo y comprar sabanas, camisas, pantalones, camisas y faldas. Sus referencias personales indican que es una persona responsable y trabajadora.
texts.en:
Reyna Aquilina is a 38 year old single mother with two young children. She sells general merchandise and learned about the business from her mother since she was 12 years old. Reyna’s mother taught her how to get ahead in life, and as time passed, she took an interest in the business because she wanted to become independent.

The loan she is requesting will be used as operating capital to buy linens, shirts, trousers, and skirts. Her personal references indicate that she is a responsible and hardworking person.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase linens, shirts, trousers, and skirts

loans.name: Ssendy Margaret

texts.es:
Ssendy tiene 29 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene un menor hijo a su cargo, reside en la ciudad de Lambayeque, una zona de regular movimiento comercial que se encuentra ubicada a veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace dos años a brindar servicio de locutorio y recargas para celulares en un pequeño ambiente dentro de su domicilio. El lugar cuenta con mucha acogida debido a que es céntrico, por lo que también ha estado implementando su negocio con la venta de productos de belleza y golosinas. Los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad los utiliza para mantener a su menor hijo.

Ssendy desea ampliar su negocio con la compra demas productos parea ofrecerlos en venta, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles con los cuales piensa realizar su objetivo.

Ssendy es una mujer emprededora, siempre está buscando la manera de agenciarse de ingresos de modo que pueda sacar adelante a su hija. Las personas que la conocen la consideran una mujer tranquila y alegre.
texts.en:
Ssendy is a 29 year old single mother who has a young child under her care. She lives in the city of Lambayeque, an area that experiences regular commercial activity and is located twenty minutes away from the city of Chiclayo.

For the past two years, Ssendy has been operating a call center and providing electronic loads for mobile phones from a small room in her home. Her business has been well-received because it is centrally located and from there her customers can also buy beauty products and candy. The income she generates from her business is used to support her young child.

Ssendy wants to expand her business by acquiring other products that complement what she already sells. For this reason, she is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1000 PEN so that she can achieve her goal.

Ssendy is an enterprising woman who is always looking to manage her income in a way that will help her daughter move forward. The people who know her consider her to be a peaceful and cheerful woman.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase general merchandise so that she can start a small store within her call center

loans.name: Maame

texts.en:
Maame E. is married and has three children. She has received junior high education. Her husband is a driver.

Maame sells secondhand clothes and slippers at Takoradi and uses her income to support her husband in providing the basic needs of her family. She will use the loan to purchase more slippers.

With the new revenue that she hopes to earn, Maame plans on buying a shop.

loans.use: To purchase more slippers to sell

loans.name: Maame

texts.en:
Maame N. is married and has two children. She has received senior high school education. Her husband is a farmer.

Maame operates a provisions shop at Takoradi and uses her income to support her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. She will use the loan to purchase more provisions to sell.

With the new profits from her expanded business, Maame plans to save to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: Christine

texts.fr: H. Christine est née en 1975 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Christine est mariée à VIDJINNAGNI Anasthase et est mère de deux enfants, tous scolarisés. Christine et sa famille se sont installées depuis une dizaine d’année au quartier Gbénonkpo à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Le couple subvient ensemble aux différents besoins de la famille. Christine n’a jamais fréquenté l’école. Pour assurer ses besoins, Christine mène comme activité la vente de bassines et d’ustensiles de cuisine, par le système de distribution. C’est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, et aussi au Nigéria, Etat voisin du Bénin, que Christine s’approvisionne. Christine est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, ayant déjà bénéficié de quatre prêts et qui ont été bien remboursés. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle, Christine sollicite un cinquième prêt.
texts.en:
Christine H. was born in 1957 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She is married to Anasthase Vidjinnagni and is the mother of two children, both attending (or having attended) school. Christine and her family settled 10 years ago in the Gbénonkpo borough of Cotonou, where she lives with her family The couple share responsibility for the various family expenses. Christine has never attended school. To meet her needs, she retails basins and kitchen utensils through the distribution system. She gets her supplies from Dantokpa, Benin’s international marketplace, and from Nigeria, a country bordering Benin. Christine is a regular ALIDé client, having already been granted four previous loans, all of which were fully reimbursed. Wishing to strengthen her business and provide better response to customer demands, she is now requesting a fifth loan.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy basins, bowls and sets of dishes

loans.name: Zoila Luz

texts.es:
Zoila de 29 años, es comerciante informal de ropa y zapatos, vive en una zona periurbana de Guayaquil llamada “Paraíso”.  

Muy temprano en la mañana después de dejar a sus hijos en la escuela sale a recorrer las calles de Paraíso a vender la ropa y cosméticos, sale de su casa desde las 05h00am hasta las 20h00pm, y para tener mas ingresos los fines de semana hace comida para vender a sus vecinos. 

Para continuar vendiendo ropa ella quiere comprar con el préstamo zapatos, blusas y pantalones. Ella quiere en un futuro tener un restaurante y un local de ropa.
texts.en:
Zoila is an informal merchant who sells clothing and shoes. She is 29 years old and lives in a periurban area of Guayaquil called “Paraíso”.

Her morning starts very early after she takes her children to school. Zoila walks the streets of Paraíso selling clothing and cosmetics. She leaves her house at 5am and does not return until 8pm. To earn more income, she sells food to her neighbors on the weekends.

To continue her clothing business, Zoila wants to use this loan to buy shoes, blouses, and trousers. In the future, she wants to open a restaurant and a clothing store.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase shoes, blouses, and trousers

loans.name: Ermercinda

texts.es: Emercinda, de 47 años, es una madre de familia muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Roberto de 48 años y sus 2 menores hijos, a quienes desea brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. Trabajando arduamente junto a su esposo, Emercinda ha logrado hacer de sus cultivos de papa, arveja y maíz, los más solicitados de su poblado, todas las mañanas sin importar las condiciones del clima, salen a trabajar sus chacras, ya que saben que de ello dependen los ingresos que obtendrán por la venta de sus productos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cultivar sus tierras, lleva 26 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos hasta el mercado de la ciudad de Tarma. Con el tiempo, desea comprar más tierras, para incrementar su producción. Este es segundo crédito con MFP y espera ser muy puntual en el pago de sus cuotas, en su grupo comunal es una socia muy respetada, debido a la responsabilidad que demuestra. Con los dos mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más abono para hacer más fértiles sus tierras.
texts.en:
Emercinda, 47 years old, is a very happy and hard working mother, she lives in her own home with her 48 year old husband Roberto and their two young children, and they want to provide a better quality of life for them. Working arduously with her husband, Emercinda has managed to grow her crops of potato, peas and corn, the most needed crops in her village. Every morning no matter what the weather conditions are, they go out to work their farm, as they know that they depend on the income that they earn from selling their products. What she likes the most about her work is to farm her land, which she has been doing for 26 years and she thinks that the most difficult thing is to transport her products to the market in the city of Tarma. In time, she wants to buy more land, to increase production. This is the second loan with MFP and she hopes to be very punctual in the payment of the installments. In her communal group she is a very respected member, on account of the responsibility that she shows. With the two thousand nuevos soles that she is asking for, she will buy more fertilizer to make her land more fertile.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to keep her land fertile.

loans.name: Atta

texts.en:
Atta P. sells banku (a local dish made from corn dough) and kokonte (cassava flour) at Takoradi. She has been through junior high school and is married with five dependents. Her husband is a mason.

Atta has been selling banku and kokonte for some time now, helping her husband to maintain the home. Her loan will be used to buy more ingredients to cook for sale.

Atta hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to educate her children.

loans.use: To buy more ingredients to cook for sale

loans.name: Maame

texts.en:
Maame A. sells provisions at Takoradi. She has received junior high education. She is divorced but responsibly makes sure that her two children are properly taken care of.

Maame’s loan will be used to buy extra provisions to sell. She anticipates ploughing back her profit into her business.

loans.use: To buy extra provisions to sell

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah A. sells foodstuffs at Takoradi. She is married to a laborer and they live together with their three children. Sarah has received senior high school education. She supports her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills.

Sarah’s loan will be used to buy more foodstuffs to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to further her children’s education.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Maame

texts.en:
Maame K. sells plastic bowls, ladles, knives and other items by moving from one area to another in Takoradi. She is married to a driver and takes care of two children. She has not received any form of education. She uses her income to support her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills.

Maame will use the loan to purchase more of her goods to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to save to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: To purchase more of her goods to sell

loans.name: Soline Ablanvi

texts.fr: A. Soline Ablanvi est née en 1964 à Porto-Novo, capitale administrative du Bénin. Soline est mariée à NOUKPO Antonin et est mère de trois enfants, tous scolarisés. Soline vit avec sa famille au quartier Ayélawadjè à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, depuis une dizaine d’année. Le couple subvient ensemble aux divers besoins de la famille. Soline a arrêté l’école au cours secondaire et a appris ensuite la couture. A côté de cette activité, Soline vend des produits de mercerie et divers autres produits (papier hygiénique, savons, dentifrices, etc.) à son domicile. Soline achète ses produits à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Soline exerce cette activité depuis onze ans et a déjà obtenu un crédit auprès de ALIDé, crédit qu’elle a bien remboursé. Soline sollicite à nouveau un prêt afin de renforcer son activité et de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Soline Ablanvi A. was born in Porto-Novo, the administrative capital of Benin, in 1964. Soline is married to Antonin Noukpo and is the mother of 3 educated children. Soline and her family have lived in the Ayélawadjè neighborhood of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, for about ten years. The couple manages the needs of the household together. Soline left school in the secondary level and then learned to sew. In addition to working as a seamstress, Soline sells assorted notions and other products (toilet paper, soaps, toothpastes, etc.) from her home. Soline buys her products at Dantokpa, Benin's international market. Soline has been in this business for eleven years and has already had one loan from ALIDé, which she repaid on time. Soline is seeking a new loan to build her business and to better meet her clients' needs.

Translated from French by Eileen Jessop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sewing supplies and assorted other products (toilet paper, salad dressing, rice, soaps, etc.)

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es: Gloria, de 37 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a sus 2 queridas hijas Angie de 8 y Gimena de 5 años, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. La tienda que posee es una de las más concurridas del poblado de Casacoto (Pueblo de la provincia de Tarma), el gran carisma que posee y la amabilidad en su trato, han hecho que sea la preferida por sus vecinos, quienes no dudan en hacer sus compras desde muy temprano, ya que saben que es la primera en abrirse. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus vecinos sobre las cosas que suceden en su pueblo, lleva 1 año en esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer gran parte del día en su tienda, sin que le quede mucho tiempo para cultivar sus tierras. Para más adelante, espera ampliar las instalaciones de su tienda, para tener más productos que vender en stock. Este el segundo crédito con MFP, sabe que si lo paga a tiempo, podrá acceder a otro con mayor tranquilidad y sin traerle complicaciones a su grupo comunal, donde es muy querida por el resto de sus socias. Con los dos mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más productos para su tienda y así incrementará su stock de productos.
texts.en:
Gloria, age 37, is a very modest and hard-working woman. She lives in her own house with her two beloved daughters. Angie is 8, and Gimena is 5. They are the motivation for all of her efforts. The store that Gloria has is one of the busiest in the town of Casacoto (a town in the Tarma province). Her great charisma and her friendly service have made her neighbors prefer her store. They do not hesitate to make their purchases there starting very early. They know that her store is the first to open. What she likes most about her work is talking with her neighbors about the things that happen in her town. She has had the business for one year. She considers the most difficult part to be staying most of the day in her store. This does not give her much time to cultivate her fields. In the future she hopes to expand the store’s facilities in order to have more products in stock to sell. This is her second loan with MFP. She knows that if she pays on time she will be able to able to access another loan in a more stress free manner without causing problems for her communal bank. She is held in high esteem by the other members. She will use the 2,000 soles that she is requesting to buy more products for her store and increase her stock of products.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a variety of products to stock her store

loans.name: Awotwe

texts.en:
Awotwe D. is divorced and has one child. She has received senior high school education.

Awotwe sells different kinds of fruit at Takoradi and uses her income to pay utility bills and to educate her child. She will use the loan to purchase more fruit to sell.

With the new profits from her expanded business, Awotwe plans to save to buy a shop.

loans.use: To purchase more fruit to sell

loans.name: Yénoukoumè Blandine

texts.fr: A. Yénoukoumè Blandine est née en 1976 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Mariée à FAMBO Sylvestre, Blandine est mère de deux enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. Blandine vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari au quartier Ayélawadjè à Cotonou, depuis neuf ans. Blandine a arrêté l’école au cours secondaire. Pour assurer ses besoins et ceux de ses enfants, Blandine vend des sacs de sortie par le système de distribution. Blandine s’approvisionne au Nigéria et à Lomé au Togo, deux Etats voisins du Bénin. C’est la deuxième fois que Blandine sollicite auprès de ALIDé, un crédit, en vue de renforcer son activité et de mieux satisfaire la demande de plus en plus nombreuse de sa clientèle. Son premier crédit a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
Yénoukoumè Blandine A. was born in 1976 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She is married to Sylvestre Fambo and is the mother of two educated children. Blandine has lived with her husband and children in the Ayélawadjè neighborhood of Cotonou for nine years. Blandine stopped going to school at the secondary level. To meet her needs and those of her children, Blandine works as a distributor of handbags. Blandine buys her stock in Nigeria and in Lomé, Togo; both are countries that border Benin. This is the second time that Blandine has sought a loan from ALIDé in order to build her business and better satisfy the ever increasing needs of her clients. Her first loan was repaid on time.

Translated from French by Eileen Jessop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy handbags

loans.name: Victorine

texts.fr: K. Victorine est née à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Victorine habite depuis trente cinq ans, le quartier Ayélawadjè à Cotonou. Mariée à AHOUANSOU Paul, Victorine est mère de trois enfants, tous scolarisés. Victorine vit ensemble avec ses enfants. Le couple subvient ensemble aux besoins de la famille. Victorine n’a fréquenté que l’école primaire. Depuis vingt deux ans, Victorine vend des fruits et de façon secondaire, des sachets au CEG Dantokpa à Cotonou. Victorine achète ses produits à Adja au Mono et aussi à Pahou. C’est la deuxième fois que Victorine sollicite auprès de ALIDé, un crédit, qui lui servira à élever le niveau de son activité et à mieux faire face à la demande de sa clientèle. Victorine désire dans l’avenir s’acquérir une parcelle et avoir une autonomie financière.
texts.en:
K. Victorine was born in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin.  She has been living in the Ayélawadjè district in Cotonou for 35 years.  Married to AHOUANSOU Paul, she is the mother of three children, who are all in school.  The couple provide for their family together.  Victorine attended primary school only.  For 22 years, she has been selling fruit, and pouches secondarily, at the CEG Dantokpa in Cotonou.  She gets her supplies in Adja in Mono and also in Pahou.  This is the second time that Victorine has requested a loan from ALIDé for raising her level of business and for coping better with the demands of her customers.  Victorine would like to acquire a plot of land in the future and to be financially autonomous.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying various fruit

loans.name: Gbemako François

texts.fr: H. Gbemako François est née en 1983 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. François est marié à LOKOSSOU et est père de trois enfants, tous scolarisés. François habite le quartier Ayélawadjè à Cotonou avec sa famille, depuis trois ans. François assure les charges de la famille grâce au revenu de son activité. François a arrêté l’école au cours secondaire. Pour assurer ses besoins, François mène comme activité la vente de liqueurs et des produits de SOBEBRA, de même que des cartes de recharges téléphoniques dans sa boutique à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. François s’approvisionne aussi à Dantokpa. François exerce cette activité depuis une douzaine d’année. En vue de renforcer son activité et d’accroître sa clientèle, François sollicite pour une deuxième fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. François a bien remboursé son premier prêt.
texts.en:
Gbemako François H. was born in 1983 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Bénin. François is married to Lokossou, and is the father of three children, all of whom attend school. François has lived in the district of Ayélawadjè in Cotonou with his family for three years. François is able to meet family responsibilities with the money he makes from his work. He stopped attending school at the high school level. To meet his needs, François is in the business of selling alcoholic beverages and Sobebra products, as well as rechargeable telephone cards in his shop in Dantokpa, at the international market of Bénin. He also gets his supplies in Dantokpa. François has been doing this type of work for about 12 years. In order to build up his business and to increase his clientele, François is requesting a second loan through ALIDé. François has fully repaid his first loan.

Translated from French by Shannon Arnold, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase alcoholic beverages, SOBEBRA products. and rechargeable telephone cards

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es: La Señora  Bertha vive en  casa propia  en el Barrio Primero D. Mayo, tiene tres hijos, se dedica a la venta D. ropa principalmente  variedad D. chompas y otros desD. hace tres años en un carrito, en el mercado la cancha, no tiene puesto fijo, este crédito es para la compra D. variedad D. ropa D. temporada, su mercadería la compra en la ciudad D. la Paz, viaja hasta la ciudad a realizar sus compras y a veces compra D. Paceñas que llegan a la ciudad para vender al por mayor, su esposo también es comerciante ellos  trabajan con capital separado, la Sra. Bertha es muy trabajadora y responsable y esta muy agradecida por la oportunidad que le brindan.
texts.en:
Sra. Bertha lives in her own home in the neighborhood of “Primero D. Mayo” (First of May). She has three children and earns her living by selling clothes, primarily sweaters and other garments. For the past three years, she has been selling her merchandise out of a small cart at the La Cancha Market since she does not have a permanent stand.

With this loan, she will buy a variety of seasonal clothing. Bertha acquires her merchandise in the city of La Paz, so she must travel to that city to purchase these items. Occasionally she buys in the city of Paceñas, where she goes to sell her products at wholesale. Her husband is also a merchant, but they both have their separate capital from which they work. Sra. Bertha works extremely hard and is responsible. She expresses her appreciation for this opportunity.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a variety of seasonal clothing

loans.name: Irma Elizabeth

texts.es:
Irma de 48 años (en la foto junto a su esposo), vive en una zona periurbana de Guayaquil llamada “Paraíso”. Ella y su esposo tienen un pequeño negocio de reparación y elaboración de joyería. 

Después de haberse casado ellos decidieron comenzar con el taller de joyería para mantener a su familia, desde ese tiempo hasta ahora han estado trabajando desde las 10h00am hasta el anochecer, hacen joyería bañada en oro, plata y reparan la joyería que sus clientes dañan.  

Quiere comprar con el préstamo oro y plata para bañar su joyería y venderla a sus clientes. En el futuro quiere tener un local mejor ubicado para sus clientes.
texts.en:
Irma is 48 years old and lives in a periurban area of Guayaquil called “Paraíso”. She and her husband (who both appear in the photo) have a small business repairing and creating jewelry.

After they got married, Irma and her husband decided to open a jewelry store so that they could support their family. From that moment, they have worked from 10am until dusk making jewelry out of gold and silver. They also repair damaged jewelry brought in by their customers.

Irma wants to use this loan to buy gold and silver to overlay on her jewelry before selling them to her customers. In the future, she hopes to have a better location for her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase gold & silver

loans.name: Activo De Vitarte Group

texts.es:
La alcancía comunal “ACTIVO D. VITARTE”, está conformada por 8 socios unidos y solidarios sobre todo personas muy trabajadoras que tienen metas por cumplir.
DesD. hace 6 años Nancy se dedica a la venta D. productos D. belleza por catalogo, negocio que le ayuda a aportar con los gastos D. casa, la educación D. su hijo y otros gastos adicionales, se inicio en este negocio por unas amigas que la fueron a visitar y le propusieron vender. Es una socia muy entusiasta por eso ella representa al grupo como tesorera, con el esfuerzo D. su labor diaria en estos 6 años, ha logrado implementar su negocio, techar su casa y la educación D. sus hijos. El gran sueño D. Nancy es poner un bazar.
EL crédito recibido lo invertirá en la compra D. juguetes para venderlos en la campaña naviD.ña, todos nuestros socios se encuentran muy contentos y agradecidos por todas las oportunidades que les dan con los préstamos, porque D. esta manera ellos pueden tener una mejor calidad D. vida.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Activo D. Vitarse" is composed of 8 unified and supportive members who are, above all, very entrepreneurial people with goals to meet. For the past 6 years, Nancy has sold beauty products through a catalog, which helps her pay for household expenses, the education of her son, and other additional expenses. She started this business through some friends that went to visit her and suggested that she should sell. She is a very enthusiastic member, so she represents the group as their treasurer. With the efforts of her daily labor over the past 6 years, she has succeeded in starting her business, putting a roof on her house, and educating her children. Nancy's big dream is to be able to open a stationary shop. The loan received will be used to buy games to sell in the Christmas fair. All of our members are very happy and grateful for all the opportunities they are given with these loans, because they allow them to have a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Lauren Fischetti, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy games to sell in the Christmas fair

loans.name: Juan Alberto

texts.es: El Señor Juan Alberto es muy trabajador responsable que trabaja duro para mantener a su familia. El se dedica a la compra y venta de cerdos él aprendió este negocio gracias a su abuela que le enseño a ganarse el dinero de la manera más humilde. Debido al poco capital de trabajo que tiene se acerco a nuestras oficinas para poder solicitar un nuevo crédito, teniendo como destino la compra de tres cerdos, pues así podrá  abastecer la demanda de clientes que tiene en la actualidad. Su deseo es de terminar sus estudios y poder así mejorar la calidad de vida de toda su familia.
texts.en:
Juan Alberto is a responsible man who works hard to support his family. He buys and sells pigs, having learned this business thanks to his grandmother, who taught him how to make money in this humble trade. Because he has only a small amount of capital, he approached our offices to request a new loan which he will use to buy 3 pigs. This way he can satisfy the demand of his current customers. His desire is to finish his education so that he can improve the quality of life for his whole family.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital to buy pigs

loans.name: Mayra Sonia

texts.es:
Mayra es una mujer de 54 años de edad,  se dedica al comercio de venta de ropa, costurera, en su casa vende helados y hielo logrando a si obtener mejores ingresos para ayudar a sus tres hijos. Su esposo trabaja como vigilante siendo un sueldo bajo, es por eso tiene que trabajar para poder mejorar las condiciones.
A mucho esfuerzo y trabajo han logrado hacer su casa. Hoy en día necesita cambiar el techo de su vivienda ya que por ser muy viejo esta en malas condiciones ya que se le esta pasando el agua en este invierno. Y no cuenta con el dinero en total para poder hacer las mejoras.

A través de Afodenic, logro aumentar el inventario de ropa pues es su segundo ciclo, en donde, ahora hará la mejora del cambio de techo. Comprando: laminas de zinc, golosos, madera y poder hacer el cambio.
texts.en:
Mayra is a 54 year old woman who has a business selling clothing, working as a seamstress, and selling ice cream and ice in her home, striving to earn more income to help her three children. Her husband works as a guard earning a low wage, so Mayra has to work in order to improve their living conditions. After much effort and hard work, they have succeeded in building their home. Today the roof of the house needs to be changed because it is very old and in bad condition for the rain that will come this winter. Mayra does not have the money needed to make these improvements. Through Afodenic, she was able to increase her clothing inventory, since it is her second loan cycle, from which she will now be able to make the improvements to the roof. She is buying sheets of zinc, screws, and wood to be able to make the change.

Translated from Spanish by Lauren Fischetti, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sheets of zinc to fix the roof of her house, which is old and leaky, and needs to be improved

loans.name: Ebenezer Group

texts.es:
La alcancía comunal “EBENEZER”, está conformada por 7 personas entusiastas y emprendedores.
Desde hace 9 años Rosa se dedica al negocio de fabricación y comercio de prendas de vestir (polos, chompas, casacas) en el centro comercial de Gamarra, el cual lleva por nombre “SHONY”, negocio que le ha dado la oportunidad de confeccionar sus propias prendas mediante servicio y la crianza de sus dos pequeños hijos; debido a lo emprendedora que es, sus compañeros del grupo le ha otorgado el cargo de presidenta recientemente, con el esfuerzo de su labor diaria en estos 9 años, ha logrado implementar su negocio. El gran sueño de Rosa es tener su propio taller de confecciones.
EL crédito recibido lo invertirá en la compra de mercadería (telas, hilos, etc.), todos nuestros socios se encuentran muy contentos y agradecidos por todas las oportunidades que les dan con los préstamos, porque de esta manera ellos pueden tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
The communal bank Ebenezer is composed of seven enthusiastic and entrepreneurial people. For the past nine years, Rosa has made and sold articles of clothing (polo shirts, sweaters, coats) in the commercial center of Gamarra. The business is called Shony, and has given her the opportunity to make clothing for her own and her kids use, and to raise her two young children. Because she is so entrepreneurial, her companions in the group recently granted her the position of president. With the efforts of her daily work over the past nine years, she has succeeded in starting this business. Rosa's big dream is to have her own tailoring shop. The loan she has received will allow her to buy materials (fabric, thread, etc.). All of our members are very happy and grateful for the opportunities the loans give them, because they allow them to have a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Lauren Fischetti, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy materials (fabric, thread, etc.)

loans.name: Claudia Craoliona

texts.es: La señora Claudia tiene 32 años, tiene 2 hijos menores de edad. La señora tiene un negocio de venta de ropa y también refrescos, bolsitas. La señora dio inicio a este negocio desde hace 3 años, ella inicio porque siempre le ha gustado trabajar y mantener a su familia, poco a poco fue invirtiendo en comprar ciertos productos y futas para realizar los refrescos naturales y así crecer un poco más. Ella actualmente está solicitando un préstamo para comprar pantalones, camisas, faldas y también invertir en otros productos. Ella siempre ha soñado con tener una tienda grande que este localizado en el centro.
texts.en:
Señora Claudia is 32 years old and has 2 minor children. She makes a living selling clothing, soft drinks and purses. She started her business 3 years ago because she has always liked to work and support her family. Little by little, by investing in certain products and fruits to make natural soft drinks, her business grew a little more. She is currently requesting a loan to buy pants, shirts and skirts, and also to invest in other products. She has always dreamed of having a large store located in the center of town.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Achilli, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase more clothing to sell in her store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Clothing and shoes

loans.name: The Divine Women Of The Union Group

texts.es:
La alcancía comunal “LAS DIVINAS DE LA UNION”, está conformada por 7 socios unidos, solidarios y  muy trabajadores que tienen sueños y metas por cumplir.
Desde hace 1 año Angélica se dedica a la venta de desayuno se inicio en este negocio vendiendo refrescos y a veces lava ropa los fines de semana, con el esfuerzo de su trabajo ha logrado comprarse una carreta que le facilita su trabajo, menajes y ha logrado ahorrar un pequeño capital para ampliar su negocio. Es una socia muy entusiasta por eso ella representa al grupo como presidenta desde hace 4 meses. El gran sueño de Angélica es alquilar un local para poner ahí su negocio.
EL crédito recibido lo invertirá en la compra de mercadería para capital de trabajo, todos nuestros socios se encuentran muy contentos y agradecidos por todas las oportunidades que les dan con los préstamos, porque de esta manera ellos pueden tener una mejor calidad de vida. (Niños en la foto hijos de los socios).
texts.en:
The community bank named "The Divine women of the Union" is made up of 7 hard working members, all of whom have dreams and goals to accomplish. For the past year Angelica has been serving breakfast. It is a business that started out by only selling soft drinks. Sometimes on the weekends provides laundry services. With her hard work she has managed to purchase a trolley that facilitates her work. She has even saved enough money to have a small capital savings to expand her business. She is a very enthusiastic member, for which reason she was elected to lead the group as president four months ago. Angelica's greatest dream is to rent a space to set up her business. The loan will be invested in the purchase of merchandise and for working capital. Every one of the members are very happy and grateful to be given the opportunities granted to them through this loan. They are able to manage a better quality of life through these loans. (The children in the photo are children of the members of this group).

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise and to serve as working capital.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es: Nancy, de 23 años, es una madre de familia muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Eyner de 39 años y sus 2 queridos hijos William de 5 años y Franco de 5 meses, a quienes desea brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. Con mucho esfuerzo Nancy ha logrado trabajar sus tierras y volverlas muy productivas, ella cultiva, papa, arveja y maíz, los cuales los lleva a vender a la ciudad de Tarma, donde los vende al por mayor. Sus cultivos le han dado los ingresos necesarios para mantenerse, es por eso que desea poner todas sus ganas en sacar adelante este negocio. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus cultivos y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos hasta Tarma, ya que los sacos que lleva son muy pesados y la cansan mucho. En adelante, desea comprar nuevas tierras, para ampliar su producción. Este es el segundo crédito con MFP, ha sido muy puntual en sus anteriores créditos y espera serlo también ahora. En su grupo comunal es una socia muy participativa y siempre esta al tanto de los acuerdos a los que llegan en su grupo. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más abono con lo cual espera mejorar sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Nancy, 23, is a very unassuming and hard working mother. She lives in her own house with her husband, Eyner, 39, and their two beloved sons: William, 5, and Franco, 5 months, for whom she wants to provide a better quality of life. With much effort Nancy has managed to till her lands and make them productive. She farms potatos, peas and corn which she sells in the city of Tarma at wholesale. Her crops have provided income sufficient to support her family and this is why she wants to put everything she can into her efforts on behalf of her crops. What she enjoys the most about her work is caring for her crops and she considers the most difficult part of her work having to transport the crops to Tarma because the sacks she carries are very heavy and they exhaust her. In the future, she’d like to buy more farmland to increase production. This is her second loan with MFP and she’s been very punctual with her previous repayments and expects to be so again now. She is a very participative member of her communal group and is always cognizant of the agreements reached in the group. She will use the requested 1500 new soles to buy manure that she hopes will improve her crops.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of manure.

loans.name: Rita

texts.es: Rita, D. 59 años, es una mujer que siempre ha luchado por sobresalir en la vida, vive sola en su casa propia, puesto que hace 7 años falleció su esposo, su única alegría son sus 4 menores hijos con quienes vive y a quienes desea brindarles un mejor futuro. El trabajo al que Rita se dedica, es el cultivo D. papa, arveja, zanahoria y maíz. Todos los días, muy temprano por la mañana, trabaja en su cultivo, ya que sabe que el dinero que obtenga D. la venta D. su cosecha, dependerá mucho D. la calidad D. sus productos. Lo que más le gusta D. su trabajo es cosechar sus tierras, ya que así siente que los meses D. trabajo han tenido sus frutos, por tal motivo desea sembrar en toda el área D. terreno que posee para así obtener mejores ingresos. Este es el segundo crédito con MFP, manifiesta que este aporte le ayudará mucho en el progreso D. su trabajo. En su grupo comunal es muy querida por el resto D. sus compañeras, ya que es muy solidaria con ellas. Con los dos mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará insumos que le ayuD. a combatir D. los insectos.
texts.en:
Rita, 59, is a woman who has always struggled to get ahead in life. She lives alone in her own house because her husband passed away 7 years ago. Her only joy is her four youngest children that live with her and for whom she wants to proviD. a better future. Rita is a potato, pea, corn and carrot farmer. She goes out to work her fields every day very early in the morning because she knows that the money she’ll get from the sale of her crops will very much depend upon the quality of her products. What she most enjoys about her work is harvesting because that’s when she sees the fruit of long months of labor. For this reason, she’d like to plant on the entire field she has in order to increase income. This is her second loan with MFP and she states that this contribution will be of much help to her work’s progress. She is well-liked by the other members of her communal group because she is very supportive of them. She will use the requested 2000 new soles to buy supplies that will help her combat the insects.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies to combat insects.

loans.name: Noemi Del Rocio

texts.es:
Noemi de 33 años, tiene un pequeño salón de belleza, vive en el suburbio de Guayaquil, su esposo es taxista con el tiene dos hijos de 12 y 8 años. 

Inicio con su negocio hace 10 años atrás para ayudar con los gastos familiares, comenzó a trabajar con unas tijeras y esmaltes, poco a poco según los ingresos que tenia fue comprando todos los implementos que necesitaba. Ahora tiene una ayudante que trabajan desde las 16h00 hasta las 23h00pm todos los días.

Ella quiere comprar para su salón de belleza maquinas como planchas de cabello y accesorios para su negocio. En el futuro quiere incrementar su negocio y comprar una casa.
texts.en:
Noemi is 33 years old and has a small beauty salon. She lives in Suburbio de Guayaquil, and her husband is a taxi driver. Together they have two children, aged 12 and 8. She began her business 10 years ago, to help with the family's expenses. She began working with a few haircuts and manicures, and little by little, with the income she obtained, she bought all of the tools she needed. Now she has an assistant who works from 4 p.m. until 11 p.m. every day. She would like to buy equipment for her beauty salon business, such as hair straightening irons and other accessories. In the future, she would like to expand her business and buy a house.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Equipment for her business

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: La señora Maria tiene 32 años. Su actividad económica es la venta de mercadería en general, por lo que tiene una excelente experiencia. Pues siempre está buscando la manera de mejorar sus ingresos con sus tres hijos.  Por lo que su actividad económica le ha brindado lo necesario y necesita este financiamiento para la compra de materia prima como ropa interior, cosméticos, perfumes, colonias. Ella sueña  en el futuro tener una actividad más sólida con mejores ingresos, lo cual para ella seria en establecer una tienda en su lugar de habitación, pues quiere ganarse la vida de la mejor manera.
texts.en:
Maria is 32 years old. Her economic activity is selling general merchandise, and she has excellent experience in this field. She has three children and is always looking for ways to improve her income. Her work has provided her with the necessities, and she needs this loan to buy merchandise to sell, such as underwear, cosmetics, perfumes and colognes. She dreams of having a more solid enterprise in the future, providing a better income. For her, this would mean establishing a store in the place where she lives, since she would like to earn a living in the best way she can.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Ivan

texts.en:
Ivan S. is married. His family lives in Korolyovo. Ivan sells household cleaning products and personal products in the central marketplace of his small hometown. Small ventures like Ivan’s become the only source of income for families in remote parts of Ukraine. Ivan has been in the trade for 8 years. Currently, his inventory amounts to 40,000 Grivnas; his income is about 5,000 Grivnas a month. 

Ivan’s business is characterized by stability and positive performance. Inventory he sells is always in demand as people need dishwasher and laundry soap, shampoos, and other household products. Ivan wants to see his business growing in the future, which is why he is requesting a loan of 10,000 Grivnas to increase his turnover capital. Ivan’s business goal is to start one more business location in the nearest future.

loans.use: To increase inventory capital

loans.name: Elena Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Elena Del Carmen tiene  48 años, actualmente es madre. La señora tiene un negocio de mercadería en general, ella ofrece los productos y distribuye de manera ambulante, generalmente por encargos. La señora comenzó su negocio hace 15 años, pues inicios por cuenta propia poco a poco fue ahorrando lo suficiente para viajar al mercado oriental de Managua y comprar ropa. El crédito será invertido en la compra más mercadería que sus clientes le solicitan. Ella sueña que su negocio siga creciendo para algún día poder dejarles a sus nietos un negocio bien establecido y que no dependan de un trabajo para sobrevivir sino del negocio.
texts.en:
Ms. Elena Del Carmen is 48 years old and a mother. She has a business selling general merchandise. She offers her products for sale and distributes them on foot, generally by taking orders. She started this busines 15 years ago. On her own initiative, she saved little by little until she had enough to travel to the eastern market in Managua to buy clothing. This loan will be invested in the purchase of more merchandise that her customers request. She dreams that her business will keep growing so that one day she will be able to leave her grandchildren a well-established business, so that they won't have to depend on a job to survive, but rather on the business.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Julian Ricardo

texts.es: El Sr.Julian tiene 35 años de edad es conviviente tiene un hijo de 2 años de edad, cuentan con casa propia de material noble  de un piso, ubicado en  pasaje Orongo  mza B, lte 14 del  Distrito de Parcona. El Sr. Julian se dedica como cerrajero  no cuenta con taller propio, realiza sus trabajo en los mismos domicilios, el viene realizando esta actividad hace 11 años se inicio como ayudante de cerrajeria, actualmente tiene un contrato verbal para realizar la elaboracion de puertas, ventanas y pasamano de escaleras. El Sr. Julian tiene el sueño de poder tener su vivienda ya terminada. Con el dinero que solicita comprara una moto carga de segunda.
texts.en:
Sr. Julian is 35 years old. He lives with his partner and has a son who is two years old. He has his own one-story house of good quality materials, located in the Orongo lane, block B, lot 14 in the Parcona district. Sr. Julian works as a locksmith. He does not have his own workshop; he carries out his work in the residences where he is employed. He has been doing this work for 11 years. He began as an assistant in a locksmith's shop. Now he has a verbal contract to complete the construction of doors, windows, and the hand rail for a stairway. Sr. Julian's dream is to be able to complete his house. With the money that he is applying for, he will buy a secondhand cargo motorcycle.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a cargo motorcycle

loans.name: Ayleen Carolina

texts.es: Ayleen CA. tiene 23  años de edad, se dedica al negocio de compra y venta de cosméticos. Ella inicio con este negocio desde hace 3 años pues siempre está pensando en la forma de mejorar sus ingresos para sufragar los gastos de su hogar. Ella actualmente está solicitando un crédito para ser invertido en la compra de productos como lápiz labial, polvos, pinturas de uñas entre otros productos, ya que actualmente posee bastantes pedidos, además de esto desea invertirle un poco al local donde tiene las aves de corral. Su sueño siempre ha sido llegar a tener una tienda grande ubicada en el nuevo mercado.
texts.en:
Ayleen CA. is 23 years old. She is in the business of buying and selling cosmetics. She started this business 3 years ago and is always thinking about ways to improve her earnings, in order to defray her household costs. She is currently requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of products like lipstick, powders, and nail polish, among other items. Now that she has enough orders, she would also like to invest a bit in the space where she keeps caged birds. Her dream has always been to have a big store located in the new market.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase lipstick, powders, nail polish, etc.

loans.name: Victoria Doris

texts.es: La solicitante tiene 23 años es conviviente tiene 2 hijos vive en casa de sus padres se dedica a la crianza y venta de cerdos y su conyuge tiene una mototaxi que  la trabaja  manejando tiene experiencia crediticia y buenas referencias personales solicita dicho credito para capital de trabajo se propone por contar  con capacidad y sobre todo voluntad de pago.
texts.en:
This borrower is 23 years old and has a live-in partner. She has 2 children and lives in her parents' house. She raises and sells pigs and her partner drives a motorcycle taxi. She has credit history and good personal references. She is requesting this loan for working capital, and says she has the ability and willingness to repay her loan.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: for working capital

loans.name: Luz

texts.es: Luz, de 42 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en casa de su madre junto a su esposo Juan de 38 años y sus 3 queridos hijos, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. En el mercado Mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma, se encuentra el puesto de frutas de Luz, sus principales productos son las manzanas y mandarinas, las cuales trae desde la ciudad de Huaral. Todas las mañanas abre su puesto para atender con mucho cariño y respeto a todas las personas que desean comprar sus sabrosos productos, sabe que al brindarles una buena atención, volverán. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus compañeras de venta y así informarse de las cosas que pasan en el mercado, lleva 13 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos, puesto que el viaje es muy largo y cansado. En adelante, espera contratar un ayudante y así con su apoyo poder atender mejor a todos sus clientes. Este es el décimo crédito con MFP, siente que tiene la obligación de pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente. En su grupo comunal es una socia muy responsable, es por eso que es muy respetada por el resto de sus socias. Con los quinientos nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más manzanas, para implementar mejor su puesto de ventas.
texts.en:
Luz, age 42, is a very unassuming and hard-working woman. She lives in her mother's home with her husband Juan, age 38, and their 3 beloved children, who are the motivation for all their hard work. Luz's fruit stall is located in the wholesale market of the city of Tarma. Her main products are apples and tangerines, which she brings to the stall from the city of Huaral. Every morning she opens her stall to attend, with great care and respect, to every person who wants to buy her delicious products. She knows that they will return when she provides them with good service. What she most enjoys about her work is talking with her fellow sales people and finding out about the goings-on of the market. She has been doing this work for 13 years and finds the greatest difficulty to be the transportation of her products, since the trip is very long and tiring. In the future, she hopes to hire a helper and with this support be able to better attend to her customers. This is her tenth loan with MFP, and feels that she has an obligation to pay all of her quotas punctually. In her community group she is a very responsible member, and thus she is very respected by the rest of the members. With the 500 soles she is requesting, she will purchase more apples in order to better stock her stall.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to stock up with apples and other fruits

loans.name: Rosa Delia

texts.es: Rosa Delia tiene 50 años de edad, por lo que tiene 3 hijos pero todos trabajan de manera independiente. La señora Rosa se dedica a una pulpería, principalmente golosinas, pan, detergentes, refrescos naturales, galletas entre otros productos. Este no es el primer financiamiento que realiza, pues siempre está pensando en mejorar los ingresos de su familia. Pues los inicio con ahorros propios, para comenzar su actividad. Con este crédito comprara golosinas, refrescos, galletas y detergentes. Su meta es llegar a tener una tienda variada que en donde ofrezca muchas cosas.
texts.en:
Rosa Delia is 50 years old and has 3 children, but they all work independently. Ms. Rosa runs a small grocery store, selling mostly candy, bread, detergent, natural sodas, and cookies, among other products. This is not the first loan that she has taken out, as she is always thinking about how to improve her family's earnings. She started her business with her own savings. With this loan, she will buy candy, sodas, cookies, and detergent. Her goal is to have a more varied store where she can offer many items.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy candy, sodas, cookies, and detergent

loans.name: Jessica Jahaira

texts.es:
Jessica de 28 años, vende ropa y cosméticos para poder solventar sus gastos, desde muy joven comenzó con la ayuda de su mama porque no tenia aun un ingreso fijo. Por ahora sigue viviendo con su familia, en una zona periurbana llamada “Perimetral” ya que aun no gana lo suficiente. 

Vende por catalogo ropa y maquillaje, en ocasiones va a recorrer las calles para encontrar clientes que le compren su mercaderia, pero el estilo de venta que ella tiene es venderles a sus amigas y vecinos. No tiene horario fijo para vender la mercadería porque sale a toda hora. 

Ella quiere continuar con sus ventas por eso quiere comprar con el préstamo ropa y perfumes para tene mas variedad. Uno de sus sueños es termina de construir su casa y ya establecer un local para su negocio.
texts.en:
Jessica is 28 years old and sells clothing and cosmetics in order to pay her expenses. She started with the help of her mother, because she did not have a fixed income. For now, she continues to live with her family in a peri-urban zone called "Perimetral." She sells her clothing and makeup by catalog. Sometimes she goes out to find customers to buy them, but usually her sales style is to sell to her friends and neighbors. She does not have a fixed schedule for selling her merchandise because she goes out at all hours. She wants to keep up her sales, which is why she is requesting a loan to buy clothing and perfumes. One of her dreams is to finish building her house, and to establish a fixed location for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy clothing and perfumes

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es: Ana María tiene la edad de 50 años, su estado civil es casada. Por lo que no es la primera experiencia de financiamientos que ha obtenido. La actividad económica es pulpería hace mas de 10 años que se dedica a este negocio. La ubicación de su negocio es en su vivienda, pues diariamente recibe a nuevos clientes y a clientes que son sus vecinos. Siempre está deseando construir un local para establecer otro tipo de negocio. ella solicita este negocio para la compra de materia prima como leña, golosinas, refrescos naturales y otras cosas.
texts.en:
