Ana María is 50 years old and married. This is not the first loan she has taken out. Her business is running a small grocery store, which she has done for more than 10 years. Her business is located in her home, and every day she receives new customers, as well as customers who are her neighbors. She is always hoping to build a location for another type of business. She is requesting this loan to purchase staple goods like firewood, candies, natural sodas, and other items.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy staple goods like firewood, candies, natural sodas, and other items

loans.name: Patricia Mirell

texts.es:
Patricia de 33 años, vende ropa y joyería para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos familiares. Vive en una zona periurbana llamada “Paraíso” caracterizada por sus caminos de tierras y montañosos. 

Vende ropa y joyería recorrer las calles para encontrar clientes que le compren su mercadería, pero su estilo de venta es a sus amigas y vecinos. Después que sus dos hijos van a la escuela, ella sale a vender su mercadería. No tiene horario fijo. 

Patricia quiere continuar con sus ventas por eso quiere el préstamo para comprar ropa y joyería. En el futuro quiere terminar de construir su casa y darle una buena educación sus hijos.
texts.en:
Patricia is 33 years old and sells clothing and jewelery to help her husband with their household expenses. She lives in a peri-urban zone called "Paraíso" ("Paradise"), which is characterized by its mountainous dirt roads. She sells clothing and jewelery by roaming the streets to find customers to buy her merchandise, but her primary sales style is to sell to her friends and neighbors. After her two children go to school, she goes out to sell her merchandise. She does not have a fixed schedule. Patricia wants to keep up her sales, so she is requesting this loan to buy clothing and jewelery. In the future, she would like to finish building her house and to provide her children with a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy clothing and jewelery

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es: La señora Vilma, tiene 41 años por lo que su actividad económica es la venta de tortillas y ropa nueva. Por lo que siempre busca la manera de mejorar sus ingresos,  pues es ella tiene que llevar el pan de cada día a su hogar. Ella ha enfrentado ciertos problemas como es de salud, a pesar de sus problemas de salud ha salido adelante con el apoyo de su familia. Por lo que solicita este financiamiento para la compra de materia prima. El sueño, siempre ha sido tener una tienda grande en donde ofrezca una gran variedad de productos.
texts.en:
Vilma, is 41 years old and she has a business selling tortillas and new clothes. She is always looking for a way of improving her income, as she has to provide for her household on a daily basis. She has faced certain health problems, despite these health probelms she has gotten ahead with the support of her family. She is asking for this financing to purchase raw materials. Her dream, has always been to have a big store where she offers a great variety of products.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Hacienda Chacrasana Group

texts.es:
ALCOM: HACIENDA CHACRASANA

En esta Alcancia conforman 08 microempresarios, todos ellos se dedican al comercio; se esfuerzan por mejorar día a día su negocio,  aumentar sus ventas, y proveerles el mejor servicio a sus clientes. Tal es el caso siguiente:  
 
HayD. Rosario con 40 años D. edad, conviviente y con un hijo, hace 07 años atrás aperturó su negocio en su vivienda, HayD. empezó con la venta D. salchipapas, y hoy en la actualidad complementa su negocio con la venta D. gas, recargas virtuales D. celulares Claro y Movistar, como también el servicio D. llamadas al paso, gracias a su esfuerzo y trabajo ella ha  logrado contribuir en los estudios D. su hijo quien ahora se está preparando para  postular a la universidad.
Si ella contara con un capital D. dinero, terminaría D. construir su casa y adquirir un puesto comercial para su negocio, 
Ahora con el reciente préstamo que le otorgó EDAPROSPO-PROSPERIDAD  lo invertirá para incrementar su capital D. negocio, en la compra D. mercaderías, balones D. gas (contenido) para así mejorar su nivel D. ingreso y proporcionarles el mejor servicio a sus clientes Los gastos D. su hogar lo comparte con su conviviente Luis Enrique Luque Farfán, HayD. se siente muy feliz por tener el apoyo D. EDAPROSPO como intermediario financiero y economico.
texts.en:
Name of the group: Hacienda Charasana This community group is maD. up of 8 members. All of the members are business people. They work on their business day after day, increasing their sales, and striving to proviD. better service to their clients, as in the following case: HayD. Rosario is 40 years old and she lives with her partner and their son. Seven years ago she remodeled a section of her home to set up a business. HayD. started selling salchipapas (a national dish consisting of sausages, chicken, and potatoes). She has expanded her business to also incluD. the sale of propane gas, prepaid cell phone cards of Claro and Movistar brands, and public telephone services. Thanks to her hard work she has been able to contribute to the education of her son, who is now preparing to start university. If she is able to have a sum of capital funds she will finish building her house and set up a dedicated location for her business. The loan she has requested from Edaprospo-Prosperidad (Kiva Field Partner) will be used to supplement her capital funds, and she will purchase merchandise and gas tanks, to improve the income earn through her business. She will proviD. her clients with better service and she will be able to cover the household expenses. She shares the responsibility with her partner Luis Enrique Luque Farfan. HayD. is very happy to have the support of Edaprospo.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for their businesses.

loans.name: Luz Mariana

texts.es: La señora Luz Mariana tiene 33 años. Actualmente sigue adelante con su negocio como es la venta de ropa usada y nueva. En meses ha tenido problemas con la distribución de su producto, pero esto se debe a que las personas sin trabajo ahora están buscando como poner negocios, y este negocio de ropa usada es el más fácil de establecer, además que las ganancias son promedias. Este financiamiento es para la compra de materia prima, ya que tiene la demanda de sus clientes. Su sueño, es tener una tienda en el mercado de Managua, en el cual distribuya todos sus productos al por mayor.
texts.en:
Ms. Luz Mariana is 33 years old. She is pressing ahead with her business of selling used and new clothing. In some months, she has had problems with selling her products, but she credits this to people without work looking to start businesses, because selling used clothing is the easiest type to establish, and furthermore, the earnings are average. This loan is to buy supplies now that there is demand from her customers. Her dream is to have a store in the market in Managua, from which she could sell her products wholesale.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy used and new clothing

loans.name: Delfin

texts.es:
El señor Delfin S. de 61 años de edad está casado hace 39 años con la señora Arsenia Santacruz de 56 años, el matrimonio cuenta con 4 hijos de los cuales 2 ya están casados viven en forma independiente, uno de sus hijos tiene 25 años y vive en el extranjero; España y el  menor de todos de 16 años  está cursando el 2do de la media bachiller técnico industrial y desea culminar una carrera universitaria.
El señor Delfin se dedica a la comercialización de mercaderias varias como chorizo, pollos , cebollas, arroz, aceite, manteca desde hace 20 años, distribuye sus productos        a grandes negocios de la ciudad de Dr. Juan M. Frutos.
Solicita este préstamo para la  compra de mercaderias debido a que cuenta con mucho pedidos y de esta forma poder cumplir con todos los pedidos que cuenta.
 Más adelante desea ampliar su local para antención al publico.
texts.en:
Delfin S. is 61 years old and has been married for 39 years to Arsenia Santacruz, 56. The couple has 4 children: 2 are married and live apart from the family; 1 of the children is 25 years old and lives in Spain; and the youngest is 16, in the 2nd year of technical trade school, and wants to go on to finish university. For 20 years, Delfin has sold a variety of merchandise like chorizo, chicken, onions, rice, and butter. He distributes his products at major businesses in the city of Dr. Juan M. Frutos. He is requesting this loan to buy merchandise, because he has several orders and this way he can fulfill all of them. Later on he would like to expand his storefront to that he can sell to the public.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy chorizo sausages, chickens, rice, onions, oil, ham, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise like sugar and rice for her store

loans.name: Jose Manuel

texts.es:
José de 31 años, da el servicio de transporte en tricimoto a la zona de la Perimetral, vive en esa misma zona periurbana sector “Nigeria”. 

El ya tiene dos años trabajando en la tricimoto ya que sus ahorros los invirtió en ello. Todos los días se levanta a las 06h30 para trabajar en su tricimoto hasta las 22h00pm, el pasaje que cobrar es de $ 0.25ctv. El quiere comprar con el préstamo adecuaciones para su casa con cemento, pintura y bloques. 

En el futuro quiere construir a su totalidad su casa y poder formar una familia con niños y una esposa.
texts.en:
José is 31 years old. He provides a transportation service in the Perimetral area, with his "tricimoto" [a motorbike with a cart in back for passengers]. He lives in this same peri-urban zone, in the "Nigeria" sector. He invested his savings in his tricimoto, and has been doing this work for two years already. He gets up every day at 6:30 in the morning to work on his tricimoto until 10:00 p.m. The passage he charges is $0.25 ctv. He wants to use this loan to pay for renovations to his house, with cement, paint, and cinder blocks. In the future, he hopes to build his entire house and to form a family with children and a wife.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy cement, paint, and cinder blocks

loans.name: Martha

texts.es: La Señora Martha  vive en casa familiar de su suegro, tiene dos hijos, se dedica a la venta de ropa variada, desde hace diez años, tiene puesto fijo en el mercado San Antonio de la ciudad de Cochabamba, este crédito es para aumentar su capital, para la compra de variedad de ropa de temporada, su esposo también es comerciante, viaja a las provincias a vender en cada feria, su esposo le ayuda viajan juntos a muchas ferias provinciales a ofrecer sus producto, ella es muy trabajadora siempre pensando en el bienestar de su familia esta muy agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Ms. Martha lives in the family home of her father-in-law. She has two children. For ten years, she has sold a variety of clothing. She has a fixed stand in the San Antonio Market in the city of Cochabamba. This loan is to increase her capital, in order to purchase a variety of seasonal clothing. Her husband is also a merchant. He travels to the provinces to sell in each market. Her husband helps her, as they travel together to many provincial markets to offer their products. Martha is very hard working and is always thinking about the well-being of her family. She is very grateful for the support offered to her.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy a variety of clothing

loans.name: Jeronima Emilia

texts.es: La señora Jeronima Amalia. Ella se dedica a una pulpería, pues siempre está pensando en mejorar cada día más su actividad. es una mujer que siempre le ha gustado luchar para proporcionarles a sus 2 hijos estudios, vestimenta, su negocio se ha ampliado considerablemente, gracias en parte a que la señora es buena ahorradora y ha reinvertido la mayoría de las ganancias por lo que el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo que será destinado para la compra de golosinas, refrescos, jugos, pan entre otras cosas. Por lo que siempre sueña con mejorar su actividad.
texts.en:
Ms. Jeronima Amalia runs a small grocery store. Every day, she thinks about how to improve her business. She is a woman who has always liked to fight to provide for her two children's schooling and clothing. Her business has grown considerably, thanks in part to the fact that she is a good saver and has reinvested most of her profits. She is requesting this loan for working capital, which will be used to buy candies, sodas, juices, and bread, among other things. She always dreams of improving her business.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy candies, sodas, juices, bread, etc.

loans.name: San Rafaél Group

texts.es:
Este comité se formó en el Barrio San Rafael D. la Ciudad D. Caaguazú, con la cantidad necesarias D. señoras dispuestas a progresar  decidierón a participar del programa Comité D. Mujeres Emprendedoras, son 17(diez y siete) mujeres humildes y muy trabajadoras.
 Las mismas con  mucho entusiasmo se reunierón con el fín  D. formar un grupo solidario en donD. la responsabilidad era conjunta y  el trabajo D. equipo.
Ellas son independientes en sus labores como: vendedoras D. ropas,venta D. zapatos, venta D. comidas, tienen despensa, venta D. frutas y verduras etc.
La Sra. Ada Noelia se dedica a la venta D. perfumes, colonias, tiene buena clientela, gracias a la atención y a la variedad D. sus productos; tanto en fragancias, precios y calidad.
Desea incrementar sus ingresos abaratando el precio D. adquisición D. sus mercaderías mediante la compra al por mayor y, teniendo en cuenta la llegada D. la nueva temporada D. primaV., conseguir más variedad D. fragancias acordes a la estación para concretar esta idea solicita el prestamo.
texts.en:
This committee was formed in the San Rafael neighborhood of the city of Caaguazú. Having the necessary number of women ready to move ahead, they decided to participate in the "Women Entrepreneurs' Committee" program. They are 17 (seventeen) humble and very hard-working women. The group met with great enthusiasm with the aim of forming a communal bank, where the responsibility is shared and the work is teamwork. They all have independent businesses, such as selling clothes, selling shoes, selling food, operating a neighborhood store, selling fruits and vegetables, etc. Ada Noelia's work is selling perfumes and colognes. She has a good clientele, thanks to her good service and the variety of her products in terms of price and quality as well as fragrance. She would like to increase her income by buying her merchandise wholesale and thus reducing the price she pays for it. Taking into account the arrival of the new [Southern Hemisphere] spring season, she will acquire a greater variety of fragrances suitable for the season. She is requesting the loan to carry out this plan.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying a variety of perfumes and colognes wholesale

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen, de 46 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a sus 3 hijos, a quienes mantiene sola, ya que lleva bastante tiempo separada de su esposo. Con mucho esfuerzo, Carmen logró recuperarse económicamente, luego que cayera enferma y no pudo administrar su tienda de venta de maletas, ahora tiene un locutorio, donde ofrece servicio de llamadas nacionales e internacional, en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma, el cual le ha resultado muy rentable y beneficioso, además por estar en una zona estratégica donde son muchos los clientes que acuden a su establecimiento. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es atender a sus clientes, además sus hijos en ocasiones les ayuda en la atención del público. Lleva 2 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer por largas horas dentro de su locutorio sin poder salir. Con el tiempo espera que su negocio crezca y le pueda brindar mejores ingresos económicos. Este es el décimo crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar sus todas sus cuotas a tiempo y esta dispuesta a hacerlo, ya que no quiere perjudicar a su grupo comunal, en donde es muy querida, por la solidaridad que demuestra. Con los mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará una nueva cabina, para poder atender a más clientes a la vez.
texts.en:
Carmen, 46, is a very hard-working woman. She lives in her own home with her 3 children. She cares for them alone, as she has been separated from her husband for a long time. With great effort, Carmen was able to recuperate financially after she fell ill and was unable to run her suitcase sales store. She now has a telephone booth in the wholesale market of Tarma city, where she offers nation-wide and international calls. This has been very profitable and beneficial, as it is in a strategic location where there are many customers. She most enjoys attending to her customers, and her children occasionally help her with customer service. She has been doing this for 2 years and finds that her greatest difficulty is having to spend long hours in the phone booth without being able to leave. With time, she hopes that her business will grow and offer her better income. This is her tenth loan with MFP, and she knows that she has to repay all her quotas on time; she is ready to do so, since she does not want to drag her community group down. She is very beloved in her community group because of the solidarity that she demonstrates. With the 1000 soles she is requesting she will purchase a new booth in order to be able to attend to more customers at once.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase a new booth to better offer her call service

loans.name: Jose Ramon

texts.es: El señor José Román tiene 53 años, El señor se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado anteriormente su familia se dedicaba a este tipo de actividad, pues ha sido muy beneficioso para el obtener un medio de ingreso para que su familia sobreviva. El señor ya tiene 15 años de tener este negocio, pues no ha sido fácil pues algunos compradores no quieren pagar el precio justo. Esta solicitando este préstamo con el objetivo de comprar más vacas, toros y terneros. Su sueño siempre ha sido incrementar su negocio y además mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
José Román is 53 years old. His work is buying and selling livestock. Previously, his family dedicated itself to this kind of activity, since it has been very beneficial for obtaining a source of income so his family could survive. He has had this business for 15 years already, although it has not been easy, since some buyers do not want to pay a fair price. He is requesting this loan with the objective of buying more cows, bulls and calves. His dream has always been to expand his business and also improve his income.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Gustavo

texts.es: El Sr. Gustavo tiene 28 años de edad oriundo de Chuquisaca, es soltero no tiene hijos y desde muy joven se dedico a trabajar ahora tiene su propio microbús y además un derecho en la línea 39/85 con el dinero que  gana ayuda a su abuelita y a sus medios hermanos , a esta corta edad ya cuenta con casa propia no quiere casarse hasta cumplir sus 35 años cuenta con una novia a la cual esta haciendo estudiar para tener un futuro prometedor juntos , el crédito q ha solicitado es para hacer repara su motor ya q ha empezado a fallarle hace unos días y a el gusta manejar su microbús en optimas condiciones, esta muy agradecido por la oportunidad le  brinda la institución.
texts.en:
Gustavo is 28 years old and a native of Chuquisaca. He is single, with no children, and he has worked since he was very young. He now has his own microbus, along with a permit for the 39/85 line. With the money he earns, he helps his grandmother and his half-siblings. At this young age, he already has his own house, but he does not want to get married until he is 35. He has a girlfriend, and he is supporting her studies so they can have a promising future together. The loan he is requesting is to repair his motor, since it began breaking down a few days ago, and he likes to drive his microbus under optimal conditions. He is very grateful for the opportunity provided to him by the institution.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repairing the motor of his microbus

loans.name: Kuña Aty Unidas Group

texts.es:
Este comité se formo en el Barrio Constitución D. la Ciudad D. Caaguazú, son 18 mujeres independientes en sus trabajos diarios, cada señora tiene un deseo el D. progresar, obtenerun apoyo financiero y gracias a la Fundación Paraguaya esto es posible. 
Las mismas poseen un gran espiritu emprendedor, trabajan en equipo, se ayudan mutuamente y son un grupo solidario donD. la responsabilidad es conjunta y el compromiso es asumido por todas.
La Sra. Lucia Mabel es una D. las integrantes se dedica a la venta D. ropas, tiene buena clientela ya formada y desea incrementar sus ingresos comprando nuevas ropas y nuevos diseños teniendo en cuenta la proximidad D. la temporada primavera-verano, adquiriendo al por mayor para su venta al detalle.
Ella solicita el prestamo para la compra D. remeras, vestidos, calzados, y otros.
texts.en:
This committee was formed in the Constitución neighborhood of the city of Caaguazú. It consists of 18 women who work on an independent basis each day. Each of them has the desire to make progress and obtain a loan, and thanks to the Paraguaya Foundation, this is possible. These women possess a great entrepreneurial spirit, and they work as a team, providing mutual help. They are a solidarity group in which responsibility is shared and commitments are taken on by all. Lucia Mabel is one of the members, and her work is selling clothing. She has a good clientele that is already established, and she would like to increase her income by purchasing new clothing and new designs, taking into account the approach of the [Southern Hemisphere] spring-summer season. She will buy the clothing wholesale and sell it on a retail basis. She is requesting the loan to buy t-shirts, dresses, shoes and other items.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying seasonal clothing such as t-shirts, shorts, pants, skirts and shoes on a wholesale basis

loans.name: Edelmira

texts.es: Edelmira, de 37 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en una casa alquilada junto a su esposo Abel de 41 años, quien trabaja junto a ella en el cultivo de sus tierras y sus 2 hijas Yanilin de 18 y Yasmin de 16 años y lo que más desea es mejorar su calidad de vida. El negocio de Edelmira esta ubicado en el mercado modelo de la ciudad de Tarma, ella se dedica a la venta de verduras como, arvejas, zanahorias, tomates. Su puesto es muy concurrido, ya que vende verduras muy frescas y a un buen precio, lo cual ha hecho que se vuelva una de las vendedoras más solicitadas por los clientes. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus compradores que acuden a su puesto, de esa manera se hace más amena sus largas jornadas de trabajo, lleva 7 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día en su puesto cuidándolo. En adelante, desea seguir trabajando duro y mejorar su negocio poco a poco. Este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, siente que este aporte la ayudara bastante en el desarrollo de su negocio, dentro de su grupo comunal trabaja muy duro, para que las cosas le salgan muy bien. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más verduras, para implementar mejor su puesto de ventas.
texts.en:
Edelmira, 37, is hardworking and unassuming woman. She lives in a rented home with her husband Abel, 41, who works with her cultivating their land, and their 2 daughters: Yanilin, 18, and Yasmin, 16. What she wishes for the most is to improve her quality of life. Edelmira's business is located in the Modelo market in the city of Tarma. She sells vegetables such as: peas, carrots and tomatoes. Her stall is very busy, since she sells very fresh vegetables at a good price, which has made her one of the most sought after vendors by the customers. What she likes most about her job is chatting with the buyers who come to her post; this provides her with entertainment during her long working days. She has been doing this work for 7 years now, and what she considers most difficult is to have to remain at her post all day long. In the future, she wants to continue to work hard and improve her business little by little. This is her 4th loan with MFP, and she feels that this support will help her to develop her business. Within her communal bank she works very hard so that things will go well. With the 1,500 Peruvian soles that she requests, she will buy more vegetables to better stock her selling post.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy vegetables to restock her business

loans.name: Berbel Yessica

texts.en:
Having worked as a cook in a hotel for several years, Yessica was introduced to selling beauty products out of her home by a friend and saw it as a way to supplement her income. Since beginning four years ago she has greatly expanded not only her area of business, but has also taken on a managerial role with several other product sellers working underneath her. Yessica enjoys being her own boss and having the ability to work with different clients and other product sellers. 

Originally from El Salvador, Yessica and her husband moved to the United States with their daughters 7 years ago. Due to their lack of credit, Yessica approached ACCION USA in order to find financing for her business and help provide financial support for her family.

This is Yessica’s third loan with ACCION USA. She wants to use it to buy more products in bulk in order to sell them at a better price and expand her business. She also wants to be able to continue growing her clients' confidence in her product. This loan will increase her abilities as a businesswomen and help her continue to enhance her position within the beauty product market. 

About U.S. Microfinance and ACCION USA:

Have you ever thought about how the cute new café on your corner or the salon you frequent every month got the financial resources to start their business? Chances are, they drummed up support from their friends and family, dipped into their personal savings, used a high-interest credit card, or all of the above. An estimated ten million small businesses in the U.S. face difficulty obtaining loans from traditional banks, even prior to the current “credit crisis”. Microfinance institutions, like ACCION USA, support these “unbanked” small businesses by giving them access to fairly-priced capital and business education.

Small businesses also help stabilize low- to moderate-income neighborhoods and rebuild our economy through income growth and job creation. Self-employment provides workers with a way to increase their incomes, support their families, and strengthen their communities. As unemployment rises in the U.S., more and more people are turning to self-employment and start-up enterprises as a way to take control of their economic futures and provide employment opportunities in their communities. The need for support of small businesses in the U.S. is great, and it is one that ACCION USA has been striving to meet since 1991.


Important Information About This Loan 

Kiva realizes that access to credit is a challenge for entrepreneurs everywhere. Kiva started out as a website focused on developing-world entrepreneurs. In June 2009, Kiva began experimenting with allowing entrepreneurs in the United States to raise money on its website. If this is something you support, please feel free to fund this loan. If you have questions, including how an entrepreneur in your neighborhood might get a loan, please visit our Help Center and click on "Loans in the United States."

loans.use: Purchasing more beauty products

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.es: El señor Eduardo tiene como principal actividad económica la compra - venta de ladrillos, vive en la zona San Miguel de Alpacoma, esta zona se caracteriza por albergar a más de cincuenta fábricas artesanales de ladrillos,  lamentablemente hace seis años el tuvo que emigrar a la Argentina gracias a Dios el pudo ahorrar dinero con el que se compró un terreno y pudo iniciar su propio negocio de compra - venta de ladrillos en su propio país. Gracias a su esfuerzo el posee un terreno y una casa propios, ahora el trabaja para poder terminar de construir su casa, su esposa lo ayuda con otra actividad que es la venta de pescado crudo en ferias provinciales. El deseo de don Eduardo es sacar a su familia adelante trabajando día y noche sin importar el cansancio solo por el bienestar de su familia. El crédito le sirvió para incrmentar su capital de trabajo comprando una cantidad grande de ladrillos.
texts.en:
Eduardo is a brick merchant. He lives in the San Miguel de Alpacoma zone, an area that is known for having more than fifty artisanal brick factories. Unfortunately he had to emigrate to Argentina six years ago but, thanks to God, he was able to save money with which he bought a piece of property which enabled him to start his own brick business back in his own country. Thanks to his efforts he owns a piece of property and his own home. Now he works in order to be able to finish building his house. His wife helps out with her own business selling fish in provincial markets. Eduardo’s wish is to work day and night regardless of fatigue to have his family succeed, everything for his family’s wellbeing. The loan was to increase his working capital buying a large amount of bricks.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bricks.

loans.name: Lucia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Lucia tiene 30 años de edad, reside en el municipio de Gualococti, departamento de Morazán, es madre soltera, tiene tres hijos José, Silvia, de diez  y tres años respectivamente, posee un negocio de cafetería donde elabora y vende pan dulce, tortas, tamales de gallina y pisques ( tamal relleno de frijoles).
El negocio de Lucia consiste en elaborar pan dulce, oficio que aprendió de su tía y que ha perfeccionado con el tiempo, también sabe elaborar donas y pizza, tamales, es una trabajo que requiere de mucho esfuerzo, ella se le levanta todos los días a 3:00 am para iniciar las labores. Actualmente está solicitando un préstamo para compra de materia prima como es harina, huevos, y otros productos necesarios para la elaboración de antojitos. Esto contribuirá a mejorar los ingresos de la familia, atreves de esta inversión de dinero.
El sueño de Lucia es crecer el negocio el cual le permita garantizar el estudio a sus hijos ya sea a nivel técnico o una carrera universitaria.
texts.en:
Lucia is 30 years old and she lives in the municipality of Gualocoti in Morazan. She is a single mother and she has three children: Jose, is 10 years old and Silvia is 3 years old. She has a cafe where she makes and sells pastries, sandwiches, and tamales (chicken and bean varieties). Lucia's business is pastry making. She learned the trade from her aunt and she has perfected her skills with time. She also knows how to make donuts and pizza and tamales. This work requires a lot of energy. She wakes at 3 am every morning to start her baking. She requests a loan to purchase ingredients such as flour and eggs and other necessary products to make her pastries. This will improve her family's income. Lucia's dream is to expand her business so that she will be able to send her kids to school, either to trade school or to university.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase ingredients such as corn and eggs to make snacks.

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.es: Esmeralda, de 45 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora y alegre, vive en un cuarto alquilado junto a sus dos hijas Grisell de 25 y Linsey de 11 años, a quienes desea darles una buena calidad de vida. Recorriendo las calles de la ciudad de Tarma, Esmeralda realiza su trabajo, ella se dedica a la venta de cosméticos y es una vendedora muy convincente, motivo por el cual sus productos se venden muy rápido y tiene que suministrarse constantemente. Siente que su trabajo es muy rentable, ya que gracias a él, puede brindarles a sus hijos los estudios que se merecen. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es aconsejar a sus clientes sobre los productos que deben usar. Disfruta mucho su trabajo, aunque eso implique que tenga que caminar mucho. Con el tiempo, desea poner una tienda, donde pueda vender con más comodidad sus productos de belleza. Este es el décimo crédito con MFP y está muy feliz de poder obtenerlo, manifiesta que invertirá todo el dinero en su negocio, ya que quiere mejorar su vida. En su grupo comunal es una socia muy alegre. Con los setecientos nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más productos de belleza, para así poder ofrecer a sus clientes una mayor variedad de donde elegir.
texts.en:
Esmeralda, 45, is a hard working, cheerful woman. She lives in a rented room with her two daughters, Grisell, 25 and Linsey, 11, for whom she wants to provide a better quality of life. Esmeralda sells cosmetics throughout Tarma’s streets. She is a very convincing saleswoman so her products sell out quickly and she constantly has to restock. She feels that her work is quite profitable because, thanks to it, she’s able to provide her children with the education they deserve. What she enjoys most about the work is advising customers regarding the products they should use. She enjoys her work very much even though it entails having to walk much. In time, she’d like to set up a store where she can sell her beauty products more comfortably. This is her 10th loan with MFP and she is happy to be able to get it. She states that she will invest all the money in her business because she wants to improve her life. She is a very cheerful communal group member. She will use the requested 700 new soles to buy beauty products so that she can offer her customers a wider selection to choose from.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To acquire beauty products.

loans.name: Ivania Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Ivania Del Socorro, ella tiene 30 años. La señora tiene un negocio de venta de calzado, Ella ya tiene 6 años de dedicarse a este negocio, empezó  con muy poco dinero pero con el paso del tiempo fue ahorrando de lo poco que pudo obtener ha mejorado. Ella está solicitando este crédito para invertirlo en la compra de sandalias, zapatillas, tenis, zapatos de vestir entre otros así tendrá una gran variedad que ofrecer. Su sueño siempre ha sido llegar a establecer un tramo grande para mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Ivania del Socorro, 30, is a footwear merchant. She has been in this line of work for 6 years. She started out with very little money but, as time went by, she saved and with what she was able to save she acquired the little she has and has improved. She is asking for funds to buy sandals, slippers, athletic shoes and dress shoes, among others in order to have a wide variety of stock on hand. Her dream has always been to set up a large sales space to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy footwear.

loans.name: Las Picaflores Group

texts.en:
The communal bank, “Las Picaflores”, consists of 16 entrepreneurs from the Padre Las Casas district. These individuals' livelihoods consist of sales: including pastries, chocolates, jewellery, cosmetics, perfumes, and sales of used and new clothing items. 

Marcela is the secretary of this group. Marcela can be found in the photo, seated in the first row and in the first seat from left to right. Marcela makes baked goods from her house based on orders placed. Marcela’s most requested item is her fruit tart with whip cream. With this loan, Marcela plans to purchase flour, sugar, eggs, decorating moulds, along with additional ingredients for tarts. Marcela’s dream is to have a pastry shop with industrial ovens located in the same sector where she lives. Marcela’s motivation stems from her daughter, a nine year old, and to pay for her future studies. Marcela is happy to work with Fondo Esperanza, due to the loans that she has received and the coexistence she shares with her fellow group members, those who share their experiences and crafts. 

Padre de Las Casas is a municipality to the south of Santiago (the capital of Chile), in the city of Temuco, Araucanía Region. Padre de Las Casas municipality was named in honour of the Spanish priest Bartolomé de Las Casas, who defended the indigenous during the conquest of the America. There is still a large Mapuche population in this community. Its economy is based in agri-business and commercial services.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for tarts.

loans.name: Marisol Lina

texts.es:
cliente es originario Este del poblado de Mina el limón, actualmente se dedica a la actividad comercial específicamente pulpería, donde tiene 15 años de ejercer esta actividad, con nuestra empresa ha recibido    
7 créditos predominando los de comercio, específicamente la compra de mercadería para surtir su inventario de productos que ofrece a los clientes, su núcleo familiar se compone de solo su marido, no tiene hijos, con los créditos que ha recibido ha mejorado su negocio y por ende su nivel de vida, su marido trabaja como supervisor mecánico en la empresa tritón minera de los cuales ha apoyado a su esposa para fortalecer su negocio.
texts.en:
This individual is originally from the village of Minal el Limon. She has had her grocery store for the past 15 years. She has received 7 past loans to invest in her business. She has purchased merchandise to resupply her store, to offer a selection of products to her clients. Her immediate family consists only of her husband as they have no children. The loans that she has received have been used to improve the business and improve the quality of their life. Her husband works as a supervising mechanic in the Triton mining company. He also supports his wife in the development of her business.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise to restock her store.

loans.name: Las Positivas Group

texts.es:
ALCOM: LAS POSITIVAS

Jorge Luis G., tiene 31 años, casado, asume el cargo de presidente en la Alcancía, en la que conforman 07 integrantes, y todos ellos se dedican al comercio minorista.
Jorge desempeña su labor como obrero en la fábrica de calzados ATLAS (Ex BATA), lleva trabajando 03 años en horarios rotativos. Además también es microempresario  en “Chocolatería Artesanal”, este negocio empezó con la idea de su esposa, quien es ella quien se especializó en “Chocolatería Fina”, se dedican a la preparación de bombones surtidos, chocotejas, turrones y todo realizados para eventos especiales como cumpleaños, 15 años, matrimonios, bautizos, aniversarios o eventos.
 se debe a ese esfuerzo y voluntad de ambos que ellos lograron comprar sus cosas para su casita y utensilios para la preparación de chocolates.  

Esta pareja de esposos desean más adelante perfeccionar sus conocimientos e ir incrementando su economía. Como también abrir un stand de negocios en Chosica y ofrecer todo lo que es artesanía a base de chocolates.

Ahora con el crédito que EDAPROSPO le concedió, lo invertirá  cierta cantidad para la compra de implementos de negocio (moldes para chocolates, envolturas, y otros insumos) para chocolates; y el resto de dinero lo utilizará en los gastos y cuidados del parto de su esposa que lleva 08 meses de embarazo.
texts.en:
Group name: Positive People Jorge Luis G. is 31 years old, he is married and he assumes the role of community bank president. The group is made up of 7 members and they are all small business owners. Jorge is a clerk at a shoe manufacturing company, Atlas and Bata. He has been working there for three years on a rotating schedule. He is also the owner of a small business named "Artisan Chocolates". He started this business following his wife's idea to have a specialized, fine chocolate store. They make specialized assorted candies, chocolate bars, and nougats. They are all made for special occasions, such as Sweet 16 parties, weddings, baptisms, anniversaries and other special events. It is their combined efforts that have yielded these results and they are now able to purchase items for their small home, including equipment for their chocolate store. This married couple want to perfect their skills and keep improving their finances. They would like to set up a stand in Chosica, the local fine chocolate district. The loan requested from Edaprospo (Kiva Field Partner) will be invested in the purchase of implements for their business (chocolate molds, wrappings, and other materials) for the production of their chocolates. The rest of the funds will be put towards the health care and delivery of the new baby. His wife is 8 months pregnant.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase implements to be used for chocolate making.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María, de 46 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y alegre, vive en su casa propia y lo que más desea es mejorar su calidad de vida. Desde muy pequeña siempre le enseñaron a María a trabajar en todo para alcanzar sus metas, ahora se dedica a la venta de alfalfa y cuyes, los cuales ella misma cultiva y cría respectivamente. Paralelamente a esta actividad, también se dedica en la elaboración de quesos y manjar, negocio al cual la ayuda su hermana para llevarlos a la ciudad de Lima para su venta.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es criar cuyes y lo hace con mucho amor, lleva 16 años realizando esta actividad y espera que su negocio siga creciendo, para que le pueda brindar mejores ingresos económicos a su familia. Este es el décimo primer crédito con MFP, está dispuesta a pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, ya que no desea meter en problemas a su grupo comunal, en donde es muy solidaria con el resto de sus compañeras. Con los dos mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más comida para sus cuyes, ya que es la actividad que mejor ingresos le genera.
texts.en:
María, 46, is an unassuming, cheerful woman. She lives in her own house and what she most desires is to improve her quality of life. She was taught as a very young girl to work at everything to reach her goals. She currently sells alfalfa and guinea pigs which she herself grows and raises, respectively. In addition to these activities, she also makes cheese and manjar (sweet bread spread similar to cake frosting) that her sister helps her with to take into Lima to sell. What she likes most about her work is raising guinea pigs which she does lovingly. She’s been in this line of work for 16 years and hopes her business will continue to grow so that it will produce higher income for the family. This is her 10th loan with MFP and she’s willing to repay all her installments on time because she doesn’t want to cause any problems for her communal group where she is very supportive of her fellow members. She will use the requested 2000 new soles to buy feed for the guinea pigs since this activity is the one that generates the best income for her.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy guinea pig feed.

loans.name: Leaders Of America Group

texts.es:
La señora Nelly tiene 50 años de edad, separada, tiene cinco hijos, su domicilio está ubicado en San Gregorio, distrito de  Ate - Vitarte,  departamento de  Lima, se dedica al negocio de venta de anticuchos y alitas brosther, desde hace 2 años, se inicio en este trabajo ya que percibió que era un negocio rentable, además tiene la idea de comprarse más adelante un carrito sandwichero.
Trabaja con EDAPROSPO – Prosperidad  recientemente, porque es un grupo nuevo, actualmente asume el cargo de presidenta de la  alcancía comunal “LIDERES DE AMERICA” la cual está integrada por 7 socios quienes realizan diversas actividades como: comercio y servicios. El gran sueño de Nelly es tener una bodega y además aperturar un restaurante.
Su reciente préstamo será utilizado en la compra de un carrito sandwichero, para así implementar su pequeño negocio y captar una mayor clientela. (Niños en la foto hijos de los socios).
texts.en:
Nelly is 50 years old, she is separated, and she has five children. Her home is located in the San Gregorio region, the Ate-Vitarte district in Lima. She serves burgers and Brosther brand chicken wings, a business she has had for the past 2 years. She started the business when she saw that such a business would be very successful. She has in mind of purchasing a sandwich cart. She is a member of Edaprospo-Prosperidad (Kiva Field Partner). The group to which she belongs is new and she assumes the role of president. The community bank is named "Leaders of America" and it is made up of 7 members, all carrying out various business types, including sales and service. Nelly's greatest dream is to have a grocery store and to open a restaurant. This loan will be used to purchase a sandwich cart as a way to develop her business and capture a larger client base. (The members' children are seen in this photo).

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a sandwich cart.

loans.name: Lorgia Lourdes

texts.es: La Señora Lorgia Lourdes tiene 36 años de edad.es una mujer casada y vive con su hijo de 2 años de edad.  Esta no es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos, pues siempre se preocupa por proporcionar lo ingresos necesarios. Ella se dedica a una pulpería hace mas 10 años que se dedica a este negocio, empezó a vender golosinas a los niños que pasaban de la escuela por lo que ha luchado mucho para obtener este medio de vida. Este financiamiento es destinado para la compra de materia prima necesaria como golosinas, refrescos naturales, pan y otros productos.
texts.en:
Lorgia Lourdes, 36, is married and lives with her two year old son. This isn’t her first loan request for she is always watchful to provide the necessary income. She has had a grocery store for over 10 years. She started out selling sweets to children on their way to and from school. She has struggled much to secure this means of support. The funds will be used to buy stock items for the store like: sweets, natural beverages, bread and other products.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Aurora Claribel

texts.es:
Aurora tiene 35 años D. edad, resiD. en el municipio Yoloaquin, departamento D. Morazán, es casada, vive con el esposo y sus dos hijos D. las edades D. 10 y 6 años respectivamente. 
Aurora tiene más D. 6 años D. tener el negocio, tiene una persona que le ayuda a atender el negocio, su jornada laboral inicia a las 5:00 am- 8:00pm la ventaja del negocio es D. que le proporciona los ingresos para solventar las necesidades D. la familia, las desventajas son que ella ampliaría la jornada laboral D. lunes a domingos.
Ella solicita un préstamo para compra D. mercadería sabanas, toallas, vajillas D. cocina entre otros. Esto contribuirá a mejorar los ingresos del negocio con mas productos, que le permitan incrementar las ventas.
Los objetivos son cancelar oportunamente el crédito para tener disposición D. efectivo siempre, sus sueños es ver crecer a sus hijos y apoyarlos para terminen los estudios universitarios.
texts.en:
Aurora is 35 years old and resides in the town of Yoloaquin in the Department of Morazán. She is married and lives with her husband and two children, ages 10 and 6 respectively. Aurora has more than six years of experience managing her business. She has one employee who helps look after the store. Her work day starts at 5am and ends at 8pm. Her business provides the income to cover the needs of her family, but the disadvantages are the long hours and having to work Monday through Sunday.

She is requesting a loan to buy merchandise such as bed sheets, towels, cookware, and other products. This will help improve her income by stocking her store with more products so that she can increase her sales. Her goal is to repay this loan in a timely manner so that she can have some cash reserves. She dreams of seeing her children grow up and supporting them until they finish their university studies.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase bed sheets, towels, cookware, and other products

loans.name: Jose Gerardo

texts.es:
José Gerardo tiene 68 años de edad y vive junto a su familia en el caserío Santos V., una zona rural del distrito de Túcume, una zona conocida por su atractivo turístico ya que cuenta con un complejo arqueológico de 26 pirámides que datan de temporadas preincaicas. Pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra ubicada a mas de una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de carneros desde hace doce años, el cría estos animales en un ambiente instalado cerca a su vivienda y cuando ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a sus vecinos y a los negociantes que se encuentran en su caserío. También los ofrece en venta en los mercados de Mochumí y Tucume. El depende de esta actividad para solventar la economía de su familia.

José desea ampliar su negocio comprando mas animales así como alimentos para criarlos de mejor manera. Para realizar este objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.

José es bastante trabajador y responsable, en la zona donde vive sus vecinos y conocidos le consideran un persona tranquila y de confianza. El desea seguir trabajando para sentirse activo y poder salir adelante
texts.en:
José Gerardo is 68 years old and lives together with his family in the settlement of Santos V., a rural zone in the Túcume district. The area is known for its tourist attractions, since it has an archaeological complex of 26 pyramids which dates back to pre-Inca times. The area belongs to Lambayeque province and lies more than an hour from the city of Chiclayo. José's work is raising and selling sheep. He has done this work for twelve years. He raises the animals in an environment set up near his house, and when they have reached a good level of development, he offers them for sale to his neighbors and to the traders operating in his settlement. He also offers them for sale at the markets ine Mochumí and Tucume. He depends on this work to cover the expenses of his family. José wants to expand his business, buying more animals as well as animal feed to raise them under better conditions. To achieve this objective, he has decided to request a loan for the first time from Edpyme Alternativa, in the amount of 1500 Peruvian new soles. José is very hard-working and responsible. In the area where he lives, his neighbors and others who know him consider him a steady and trustworthy person. He would like to keep working so that he can feel active and also get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying sheep and animal feed to expand his business

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es: Nelly, D. 50 años, es una madre soltera muy amorosa y trabajadora, vive en casa D. su madre Doña Cirila D. 75 años, tiene 5 hijos pero actualmente solo vive con 3, sus otros dos hijos ya tiene familia y se mantienen por si solos. Todos los días Nelly sale junto a su inseparable carretilla a vender sus deliciosas golosinas, ella se ubica en la puerta del colegio “Santa Tereza” D. la ciudad D. Tarma, donD. tiene muchos clientes, es una vendedora muy persuasiva y siempre convence a sus clientes D. comprar más D. lo que tenían que comprar. Disfruta mucho el trabajo que realiza, y mucho más el conversar con sus amiga que también tienen negocios y casi siempre la acompañan. Para el futuro, espera juntar más dinero para poner una tienda D. abarrotes donD. pueda atender a sus clientes con más tranquilidad. Este es el octavo crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que cumplir con los pagos D. todas sus cuotas a tiempo, en su grupo comunal es una socia muy alegre y solidaria. Con los quinientos nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más golosinas para implementar mejor su negocio.
texts.en:
Nelly is 50 and is a very loving and hardworking single mother. She lives in her mother's home, Mrs. Cirila, 75. She has 5 children but currently only 3 live with her. The other two already have families and they support themselves. Every day Nelly goes out together with her inseparable cart to sell delicious candies. She sets herself up in the door of the Santa Tereza school in the city of Tarma, where she has many customers. She is is very persuasive salesperson and she always convinces her customers to buy more than they need. She enjoys the work that she does and even more, chatting with her friends who also have businesses and who almost always accompany her. In the future she hopes to put more money together to open a grocery store where she can take care of her customers in a calmer manner. This is her eighth loan with MFP. She knows that she must make all of her payments on time. In her communal group she is a very cheerful and supportive member. With the five hundred new sols that she is requesting she will buy more candy so that she can better supply her business.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more candy to supply the stand where she sells

loans.name: G.s. Evenezer Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario consta de 2 integrantes. La señora Esperanza y Placida, tienen diferentes actividades económicas, Esperanza se dedica a una pulpería, tiene más de 6 años pues ella es profesora y su salario no le ajusta por este motivo decide juntarse para realizar un financiamiento juntas para mejorar los ingresos de su hogar. Pues no ha sido fácil por las dificultades de salud que Esperanza ha presentado, pero esto no la desanima a seguir.
texts.en:
This solidarity group has 2 members, Esperanza and Placida, who have different economic activities. Esperanza's business is a general store. She has operated it for more than 6 years. Since she is a teacher and her salary does not cover her needs, she decided for this reason to join with Placida and take out a loan together, to improve her household income. It has not been easy because of some health difficulties Esperanza has experienced, but this has not discouraged her from continuing.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Rosmery

texts.es: Rosmery, de 29 años, es una joven madre de familia muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia, junto a su esposo Alex de 29 años, quien trabaja en lima y sus dos hijos, Jefferson de 9 y Grisell de 5 años, a quienes desea brindarles una buena educación. Con mucho esfuerzo Rosmery ha logrado trabajar sus tierras y volverlas muy productivas, ella cultiva espinacas, zanahorias, lechugas, productos que son llevados a vender al por mayor en la ciudad de Lima. Sus cultivos le han dado los ingresos necesarios para mantener a su familia, es por eso que desea poner todas sus ganas en sacar adelante este negocio. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus cultivos, lleva 6 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos hasta lima, ya que los sacos que lleva son muy pesados y la cansan mucho. En adelante, espera mejorar sus cultivos y poder así tener mejores ingresos. Este es el décimo crédito con MFP, ha sido muy puntual en sus anteriores créditos y espera serlo también ahora. En su grupo comunal es una socia muy participativa y siempre esta al tanto de los acuerdos a los que llegan en su grupo. Con los quinientos nuevos soles que solicita, comprará abono para que pueda mejorar sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Rosmery, age 29, is a young mother who is very cheerful and hard-working. She lives in her own house together with her husband Alex, age 29, who works in Lima, and her two children, Jefferson, 9, and Grisell, 5, for whom she wants to provide a good education. With great effort, Rosmery has been able to work her fields and make them very productive. She grows spinach, carrots and lettuce, products that are taken to sell wholesale in the city of Lima. Her crops have provided the necessary income to support her family, and for this reason, she wants to put all of her profits into improving this business. What she likes best about her work is taking care of her crops. She has done this work for 6 years, and she thinks the hardest part is transporting her products to Lima, since the sacks that she carries are very heavy and make her quite tired. In the future, she hopes to improve her crops and thus earn a better income. This is her tenth loan with MFP; she has been very punctual with the previous loans, and she plans to do the same now. Within her communal bank, she is a very participative member, and she is always up to date with the agreements made within her group. With the 500 Peruvian new soles she is requesting, she will buy fertilizer to improve her crops.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying fertilizer

loans.name: Hary Nathaniel

texts.es:
El joven Hary tiene la edad de 27 años, soltero vive en casa de sus padres.
Trabaja en una ferretería desde hace varios años, en bodega, pues se dedico a trabajar para poder cubrir sus necesidades personales. Ya que por ser de poco recursos económico no logro terminar sus estudios.

Sus padres emigraron a Costa Rica, con el objetivo de poder trabajar y lograr hacer su casa en mejores condiciones.
Hary recibe remesa que envía su papa, en donde ha logrado comprar materiales para ir cerrando primeramente el solar.
Su meta es poder ayudar a sus padres, es por eso opto al financiamiento y poder hacer la obra.
Un muro perimetral de la casa, para esto comprara: piedras, arena, cemento, hierro y pago de mano obra.
Logrando  así mejor seguridad de su vivienda que espera seguir mejorando y tener una vivienda digna.
texts.en:
Hary is a young man who is 27 years of age. He is single and lives at the home of his parents. Hary has worked at a hardware store and a grocery store for several years in order to cover his personal expenses. Since he has limited financial resources, he was not able to finish his studies.

Hary’s parents migrated to Costa Rica to find work in order to build a house with better conditions. He receives remittances from his father which are used primarily to buy the necessary materials to complete the house. His goal is to help his parents by obtaining the financing needed to perform the work. Hary plans to build a wall around the house. Therefore, he will use this loan to buy stones, sand, cement, and iron as well as pay for labor. This will provide better safety for his home.

He hopes to continue making improvements so that he will have a decent home.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials to build a security wall around his house & pay for labor

loans.name: Alejandra Herminia

texts.es: Alejandra Herminia tiene 49 años. La señora tiene en su casa de habitación una pulpería, la cual está muy surtida. Ella  tiene 3 años de tener este negocio, este negocio dio inicio con pocas cosas, como golosinas, frutas, etc. Con el tiempo fue invirtiéndole y este ha ido creciendo poco a poco hasta llegar a tener la pulpería muy surtida. Ella solicita este crédito con el propósito de realizar una inversión considerable a su negocio. Su sueño es seguir incrementando y haciendo crecer su negocio, y si es posible llegar a tener una distribuidora en el mercado.
texts.en:
Alejandra Herminia is 49 years old. This lady has a well-stocked general store in her home. She has had this business for three years. The business began with just a few items like snacks, fruits, etc. With time she began investing in the store, and it has been growing little by little until it has become a well-stocked general store. She is asking for the loan for the purpose of making a considerable investment in her business. Her dream is to keep expanding her business and making it grow, and if it is possible, even to become a distributor in the market.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Efigenia

texts.es:
Este cliente es originario del poblado de telica , actualmente se dedica a la actividad comercial ,  la que ha ejercido por espacio de 10 años, donde ha tenido 9 créditos, con   nuestra empresa para diferentes rubros, prevaleciendo las del rubro vivienda, que  donde están mejorando por lo que se dedican a otra actividad 
El núcleo familiar está compuesta por  3 hijos los que están adultos y son profesionales solo uno está casado, que es varón y están solteros siendo 1 varón y 1 mujer, son una familia bien unida, y se dedican a hacer las actividades en conjuntos incluyendo a su marido quien tiene un taller de  vulcanización en el empalme de ansca.
texts.en:
This individual is originally from the village of Telica and she has been a small business owner for the past 10 years. She has had 9 past loans for varying purposes. She has invested in the improvement of their home, and she would like to invest again in that initiative. Her immediate family is made up of 3 grown children. They all have careers and only one is married. Her other son and her daughter are still single. They are a very close family unit and they participate in everything together. Her husband has a vulcanization shop in the village of Ansca.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase construction materials to remodel her home.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Juana Gregoria

texts.es: Juana Gregoria tiene 48 años de edad con tres hijos todos ya mayores. El negocio de Doña Juana consiste en brindar el servicio de molino para masa para tortillas, pinolillo, pozol. Esta no es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos, pues para ella han sido importantes.  Su negocio lo inicio su marido pero debido a ciertas circunstancias de la vida falleció siempre ha sido una mujer luchadora y que ha sabido salir adelante. el destino del crédito es para la compra de algunos repuestos y mantenimiento.
texts.en:
Juana Gregoria is 48 years old with three adult children. Doña Juana's business is offering milling services for corn masa (dough) to make tortillas, pinolillo and pozol (two traditional corn and cacao drinks). This is not the first time she has taken out a loan; the loans have been important to her. Her husband began the business, but owing to certain circumstances of his life he passed away. Juana has always been a determined woman who knows how to get ahead. The purpose of the loan is for purchase of some spare parts and for maintenance.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Spare parts and maintenance for mill

loans.name: Johana Patricia

texts.es: Johana es una mujer muy popular, por lo que siempre busca la manera de salir adelante. Ella es una clientes que tiene mucho tiempo de trabajar con fundación. Por lo que siempre se ha preocupado por mejorar los ingresos necesarios de su familia, pues ella es una mujer luchadora. Este financiamiento que está solicitando es para comprar ropa nueva como pantalones, camisas, faldas y trajes. Ella tiene mucho tiempo de laborar con este negocio, pues todo el tiempo se ha sacrificado por mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Johana is a very popular woman, and she is always looking for ways to get ahead. She has been a long-time customer of Fundación. She has always concerned herself with improving her family's income because she is a determined woman. This loan she is requesting is for buying new clothing like pants, shirts, skirts and suits. She has been working in this business for a long time, and always she has made sacrifices in order to improve her living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Estrellas Del Sur Group

texts.es:
Esta  foto fue tomada en el negocio D. la Sra. Esther N. B. la cual es tesorera del grupo “Las estrellas del sur” que esta ubicado en Tehuacán, Puebla en México. En la foto podemos apreciar el material que utiliza para la elaboración D. las tortillas hechas a mano, las cuales se dedica a vender; ella tiene 4 años con su negocio. Sus clientes dicen comprar tortillas con doña Esther porque están echas con materias primas naturales y  además D. que siempre están calientitas, la clienta se siente contenta con su  préstamo ya que le agrada la idea D. que alguien confíe en ella  y sus compañeras, ella tiene 36 años, solo tuvo la oportunidad D. cursar hasta la secundaria, pero eso no le impidió salir adelante, es madre D. 4 hijos, dos mujeres y dos varones, con el crédito ella piensa  seguir invirtiendo en su negocio D. tortillas e incrementar el numero D. clientes, además D. que con esto contrataría a mas señoras que le ayudarían, así se sentiría feliz D. estar generando mas fuentes D. trabajo, D. igual manera proporcionarles estudios a sus hijos para que terminen una carrera y tengan mejores oportunidades en la vida.
Los otros integrantes del grupo son:

Mayra Virginia  M. C.                         Vta. D. leche
María Norma P. G.                             Vta. D. tortillas
Gabriela Maray  M. C.                         Vta. D. ropa
María Dominga G. H.                           Vta. D. carne D. cerdo
Honoria P. S.                                 Vta. D. verdura
Noemí R. C.                                   Vta. D. ropa
Anali C. S.                                   Vta. D. abarrotes
Ofelia H. L.                                  Vta. D. abarrotes
Natividad R. N.                               Vta. D. ropa
Senovia M. D.                                 Vta. D. abarrotes
Graciela M.                                   Vta. D. verdura
texts.en:
This photo was taken at the business of Esther N. B., who is the treasurer of the group “Las estrellas del sur” ["The Stars of the South"], located in Tehuacán, Puebla, Mexico. In the photo, we can see the materials she uses to prepare handmaD. tortillas, which she sells. She has operated this business for 4 years. Her customers say that they buy tortillas from Esther because they are maD. with natural ingredients and also because they are always nice and hot. The client [Esther] is very happy with her loan, because she likes the idea that someone has confidence in her and her fellow members. She is 36 years old, and she has only had the opportunity to study up to secondary school, but this has not stopped her from getting ahead. She is the mother of 4 children, two girls and two boys. With the loan, she plans to continue investing in her tortilla business and expanding her number of customers. In addition, with the funds she will contract other women to help her, and she will feel happy about this since she is generating more jobs, while also providing for her children's education so that they can learn a profession and have better opportunities in life. The other members of the group are: Mayra Virginia M. C. Milk sales María Norma P. G. Tortilla sales Gabriela Maray M. C. Clothing sales María Dominga G. H. Pork sales Honoria P. S. Vegetable sales Noemí R. C. Clothing sales Anali C. S. Grocery sales Ofelia H. L. Grocery sales Natividad R. N. Clothing sales Senovia M. D. Grocery sales Graciela M. Vegetable sales

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Continuing to invest in her tortilla business

loans.name: Lluvia De Luz Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Lluvia de luz. El nombre del grupo se debe a que la comunidad se caracteriza por tener lluvias constantes gran parte del año. Está ubicado en Puebla en México.  El grupo está conformado por 11  integrantes.
Juana L. E. es tesorera  del grupo. Tiene 43 años, estudió hasta el tercer  año de primaria, es casada tiene en total seis hijos una mujer y cinco varones.  Ella se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado, negocio que inicio hace quince años. Solicita el préstamo para la compra de pastura y forraje, con la finalidad de seguir teniendo animales en buen estado. Sus clientes consideran que es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable,  y es reconocida en la localidad por  contar con el ganado mejor cuidado, debido a gran experiencia que tiene en la crianza de ganado. Se siente contenta y agradecida con el servicio y trato que la financiera le proporciona al otorgarle un préstamo ya que debido al sector al que pertenece es difícil adquirir un crédito. Con sus ganancias pretende construir un mejor establo y así poder adquirir mas ganado, y al hacer crecer su negocio podrá al ampliar la recamara de sus hijo para que puedan estar mas cómodos

Los otros integrantes del grupo son:

Margarita R. C.		Venta de tortillas a mano	
Juana L. E.		Ganadería.
Letisia S. F.	 	Venta de ropa
Andrea C. R.		Venta de tortillas a mano
Blanca Y. C. C.		Cooperativa escolar
Rafaela R. B.		Ganadería
Claudia O. A.		Ganadería
Isabel A. L.		Fonda
Eustolia A. G.		Ganadería
Guadalupe M. C.	        Venta de productos lácteos
Julia R. P.		Ganadería
texts.en:
This group is called “Lluvia de Luz” (Raining Light), because the community is known for constant rains during a major part of the year. It's located in Puebla and is composed of 11 members. Juana is treasurer of the group. She is 43 years old and studied until the 3rd year of primary. Juana is married and has a total of 6 children, 1 female and 5 males. Juana buys and sells cattle, a business she started 5 years ago. She is requesting a loan to buy pasture and fodder, for the purpose of keeping her animals in good condition. Juana's customers consider her a very hard-working and responsible person, and she is recognized in her locality as having the best cared for cattle due to the great experience she has in raising cattle. Juana feels content and gratified with the service and treatment that this institution provides, in view of the fact that it is difficult to obtain credit in this economic sector. With her earnings, Juana intends to construct a better stable and thus, to be able to acquire more cattle. By making her business grow, she can expand her sons' bedroom so that they can be more comfortable. The remaining members of the group are: Margarita R. C. Selling hand-made tortillas Juana L. E. Cattle raising Letisia S. F. Selling clothing Andrea C. R. Selling hand-made tortillas Blanca Y. C. C. Student coop Rafaela R. B. Cattle raising Claudia O. A. Cattle raising Isabel A. L. Inn Eustolia A. G. Cattle raising Guadalupe M. C. Selling milk products Julia R. P. Cattle raising

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING PASTURE AND FODDER FOR CATTLE

loans.name: Jiparbubu

texts.en:
Jiparbubu K. is 48 years old and has three children, the youngest of whom is 5 years old.  Her husband works for the Water Association, which provides irrigation to local farmers.   After graduating from Trade College, Jiparbubu worked in the trade sector for many years. She is known as a very optimistic and hard-working person. 
  
Since her family has limited resources, Jiparbubu decided to start her own business in cattle-breeding.  She bought a horse and one milch cow, whose milk she sold to the dairy factory. Also, Jiparbubu engaged in cultivating apples and kidney beans.  She purchased and planted seeds and worked hard to get a good harvest.  All these activities allowed Jiparbubu to broaden her farm with more cattle and grow a small-scale apple garden. 

Jiparbubu will use her loan of 50,000 KGS to buy one milch cow and mineral fertilizers to fertilize the land with apple gardens. Using the revenue, she would like to acquire a drying machine to process her apples and those of other farmers. Jiparbubu believes that the loan will help her achieve new levels in her activities.

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population.  Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia E. is from the village of Nungnungan, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 40 years old. Virginia is married and has 3 school-age children. To make a living, Virginia owns & operates a business venture in the food sector running a food stall business. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling fruits and vegetable in the local community. Virginia has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 12000 PHP a month for these activities.
In 2007, Virginia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Virginia has successfully repaid a previous loan  from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Virginia is requesting a new loan of 25000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 7th loan taken out by Virginia from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie B. is from the village of Luna. She is 45 years old. Melanie is married and has three school-aged children. Melanie owns and operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Melanie has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 6000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it.

In 2009, Melanie joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business. She has successfully repaid her last loan from ASKI, which was for 10,000 PHP and was used purchase additional products to sell.

Melanie is now requesting her third loan from ASKI, for 12,000 PHP, which will be used to to purchase new items to expand her product offerings. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: expanding store inventory

loans.name: Mary Jane's Group

texts.en:
Mary Jane J. is from the village of Nungnungan, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 37 years old. Mary Jane is the group leader of a 4-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Mary Jane is married and has four school-aged children. She owns & operates a business making & selling food. The main source of income for the business comes from selling processed foods. Mary Jane has been engaged in her business for over one year and earns approximately 2,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it.

In 2010, Mary Jane joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to do business. Mary Jane is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the first group loan taken out by Mary Jane from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Agrifina's Group

texts.en:
Agrifina M. is from the village of San Roque. She is 54 years old. Agrifina is the group leader of a 6-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Agrifina M.'s Group.

Agrifina is married and has six school-aged children. Agrifina owns and operates a fruit and vegetable farm. Agrifina has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 4,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it.

In 2009, Agrifina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business. She has successfully repaid her last loan from ASKI, which was for 3,000 PHP and was used purchase fertilizers such as manure.

Agrifina is now requesting her fifth loan from ASKI, for 5000 PHP, which will be used to to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's the tuition fees.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.
