*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: purchasing additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Emmy

texts.en:
Emmy A. is thirty two years old, married and has four children aged between twenty three years and ten years old. Her business is located at Serem, a busy market in Kakamega. She has been selling fruits and vegetables for the last ten years to the local people. She says that this business is profitable and the major challenge she has is that there are many people in the area doing the same kind of business as hers so customers are spoilt for choice. 

However, she works very hard from early morning to late evening to keep her business doing well. She is using her loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to buy tomatoes and potatoes to meet customer demand. She hopes to have many business outlets and supply her vegetables in wholesale. She sees herself owning a bungalow in which she will live comfortably in the future. She describes herself as honest and hardworking.

loans.use: purchasing tomatoes and potatoes for resale

loans.name: Kennedy

texts.en:
Kennedy O. is thirty-six years old, married, and has four children aged between fourteen years old and four years old. His business is located at the busy Kakamega town. He has been selling vegetables for the last ten years to the local people. He has managed to provide employment to one person. 

He says that this business is profitable and the major challenge he has is that there are so many people in the area doing the same kind of business as his, so customers are spoilt for choice. However, he works very hard from early morning to late evening to keep his business doing well. He is using his loan of 60,000 Kenyan shillings to buy vegetables to meet customer demand. He hopes to grow his business. He sees himself diversifying to a photography business. He describes himself as a visionary man.

loans.use: purchasing vegetables for resale

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
Valentina is a widow. She has three grown children. Valentina runs a small business selling clothing and other merchandise in a little store, close to the central market, in her home town of Melitopol. Valentina has been in this trade for 10 years. She has 30,000 Grivnyas in inventory. Her profit amounts to 7,000 Grivnyas a month. 

Valentina is seeking a 10,000 Grivnya loan to purchase assorted merchandise. She is very responsible when it comes to loan repayment. She can be characterized as a hard-working and circumspect individual with clear vision, a determined nature, and a kind heart.  She hopes to use additional income to help her children and their families.

loans.use: to increase her assortment

loans.name: Pavlo

texts.en:
Pavlo is married with one adult son. He owns a small business selling various hardware items at the local market in Beregovo town. Pavlo has been at this business for 14 years. He is a very responsible and hard-working person. His monthly income is about 4,000 Grivnas. 

Pavlo sells good quality items. That is why he has many repeat customers. Pavlo hopes to expand his business to a second location. This will allow him to increase sales and receive more income. Pavlo is requesting a loan of 10,000 Grivnas to purchase inventory for the second location.

loans.use: to start another business location

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty K. M. is a married lady with one child, aged six years old. Her husband works for Service Water Trust Fund. Her business is located at Muthurwa, an open-air market in Nairobi. She sells clothes such as trousers, sweaters, shirts and coats. She has been in this business for four years now and has managed to employ two people. 

Betty sells to passers-by and also has repeat customers. She says that this business is profitable and the major challenge she has is that there are so many people in the area doing the same kind of business as hers and so customers are "spoilt of choice". However, she works very hard from early morning to late evening to keep her business doing well. 

Betty is using her loan of Kes 40,000 to increase her stock of clothes to meet the high demand by her customers. She hopes to diversify her business to property management some day which she believes brings in more income. She describes herself as hardworking, ambitious and determined.

loans.use: additional clothing for resale

loans.name: Aitgul

texts.en:
Aitgul O. is a young woman who runs her business in trade. She began this activity nine years ago, when she rented a sales venue at the local market. With the capital of 7,000 KGS, she began her business selling foodstuffs. Her activity started to bring in profit and the number of her customers increased. During her most recent years of selling groceries at the market, Aitgul has managed to raise her circulating capital to 80,000 KGS and purchase a small store. 

At the beginning of 2010, Aitgul obtained her first loan of 50,000 KGS from "Bai Tushum and Partners". She used it to enlarge the assortment of goods in her store. The loan was used as intended and repaid without any delays. Since the store has become a family business, her 10-year-old son wants to follow in his mother's footsteps and engage in trade. 

Aitgul will use this new loan of 50,000 KGS to broaden the range of food products of her store. With the revenue, she plans to give a good education to her son. Also, Aitgul intends to get a driving license this year.

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase groceries

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase the arable land and buy fertilizers for the soil

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson K. M. is a married man with no children yet. His wife is a business lady. Jackson's business is located at Muthurwa, an open-air market in Nairobi. He sells clothes such as trousers and shorts. He has been in this business for ten years now and has managed to employ one person. He sells to passers-by and also has repeat customers. He says that this business is profitable and the major challenge he has is that there are so many people in the area doing the same kind of business as his and so customers are "spoilt  for choice". 

Weather, especially when it rains, also slows business making him not able to make as much profit as he would wish. However, he works very hard from early morning to late evening to keep his business doing well. He is using his loan of Kes 50,000 to increase his stock of clothes to meet the high demand by his customers. He hopes to diversify his business to property management some day. He also hopes to buy a plot of land. He describes himself as humble, honest and hardworking.

loans.use: Trousers and shorts

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expanding her fields and buying manure

loans.name: Davronbek

texts.en:
Davronbek I. lives in Chaldovar village, in the northern part of Kyrgyzstan. He is married and has two children.  Davronbek was born into a family of farmers and was the main helper to his parents in farming and cattle breeding.  That allowed him to gain a wide experience in these activities. 

In 2000, in order to find the earnings required to support his family, Davronbek decided to start his own business in cattle breeding. Using the money, which he had put aside for a rainy day, Davronbek bought one milch cow. Owing to his persistent and hardworking personality, Davronbek managed to multiply his investments. Today, his farm has five milch cows and two bulls. 

Davronbek is applying for a loan of 100,000 KGS  to buy one milch cow and bull-calves. With the revenue, he plans to broaden his business by purchasing more cattle for fattening. In future, Davronbek plans to move near Karabalta town, where his children could go to a good school.

Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Producing and selling palm oil

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima H. is thirty-six years old. She is married and has six children aged between twenty-six years old and two years old. Her business is located within a busy market in Kakamega. She sells paraffin to local people. She has been in this business for six years now and has provided employment to twp people. She says that this business is profitable and the only major challenge she has is that there are very many people in the area doing the same kind of business as hers hence customers are "spoilt for choice". 

At times the price of paraffin is high, making it unaffordable to some people hence low sales. However, she works very hard to keep her business doing well. She is using her loan of Kes 20,000 to buy more paraffin to expand her business. In future, she hopes to open two more outlets to sell paraffin. She sees herself as having given her children good education and owning her own house. She describes herself as hardworking and strict.

loans.use: buying more paraffin

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Selling women's and children's clothing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expand her cultivable acreage

loans.name: Carolyne

texts.en:
Carolyne A. is twenty-eight years old and married. Her husband is a teacher and they do not have any children yet. Her business is located at Serem, a very busy market in Kakamega. She has been selling chickens to local people for the last five years. Besides this business, she also sells maize and bananas. 

Carolyne says that this business is profitable and the only major challenge she has is that sometimes the chickens get sick and die and that poses a risk of losing a lot of money in case of death of the chicks. Bananas are also highly perishable and so she has to sell fast lest they go bad before she can sell all of them. However, she works very hard to keep her business doing well. She is using her loan of Kes 10,000 to buy more chickens to expand her business. In future, she hopes to become a wholesaler. She describes herself as sociable and polite.

loans.use: buying more chickens

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying manure and fertilizers for his fields

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expanding his arable land

loans.name: Said

texts.en:
Said O. O. is thirty-five years old, married, and has four children aged between eight years and two years old. He and his wife hope to give them a good education to the university level. His business is located at Kakamega town. He sells bags and electronics to local people. He has been doing this business for ten years now. 

Said says that this business is profitable and the major challenge he has is financial constraints and competition. However, he works very hard from early morning to late evening to keep his business doing well. He is using his loan of Kes 60,000 to buy more bags to grow his business as well as meeting the demand of his customers.  He hopes to be a wholesaler. He also sees himself having his own car in future. He describes himself as hardworking and visionary.

loans.use: buying more bags to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expanding hsi fields and buying manure

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expanding cultivable land and purchasing agricultural inputs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expanding his field and purchasing fertilizers

loans.name: Belen Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Belen inicia su ciclo 12 con 14 socias que realizan diferentes negocios.
Como es el caso D. la señora Rocío que es la tesorera por segunda vez D. su Banco Comunal, durante este tiempo a través D. las capacitaciones aprendió a administrar su negocio.
Rocio es soltera y vive con sus padres, Rocio tiene un pequeño taller D. confección D. prendas D. vestir en su casa, cuenta con una sola maquina, pero su mayor sueño es tener maquinas modernas, Rocio brinda servicios D. composturas y ropa a medida. Además Rocio trabaja en una empresa D. confección D. polos, actividad que realiza por las mañanas. Los sueños D. Rocio son tener su propia empresa D. confección, ampliar su taller y construir su casa.
Rocio solicita un préstamo D. 600 para la compra D. hilos y telas.
texts.en:
The Belen (Bethlehem) Communal Bank has begun its 12th loan cycle with 14 members who are involved in different businesses. That is the case with Rocio (Dew) who is treasurer of the communal bank for the 2nd time. During this time, by means of the training classes, she has learned to administer her business. Rocio is single and lives with her parents. She operates a small dressmaking shop in her home. She can only count on one sewing machine and her main dream is to have modern machines. Rocio offers services such as mending and clothing maD. to measure. In addition, Rocio works mornings in a polo shirt making enterprise Rocio dreams of having her own dressmaking enterprise, expanding her shop and constructing her own house. She is requesting a loan of 600 [dollars] to buy thread and cloth.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING THREAD AND CLOTH FOR HER DRESSMAKING SHOP

loans.name: Zoila Emperatriz

texts.es:
Zoila tiene 36 años de edad reside en el Municipio de Lolotique, departamento de San Miguel, es madre soltera y tiene tres hijos de las edades de 10,7,2 años los cuales dependen económicamente del ingreso que genera el negocio que es una tienda de venta de productos básicos.
El negocio fue iniciado por la madre de Zoila hace quince años, lo atiende a lunes a domingo ;actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de productos para la tienda como son, aceite, frijoles, arroz, azúcar y otros productos que le demandan sus clientes. Este préstamo le ayudara para incrementar los productos y le permitirá tener variedad para aumentar las ventas y asi genera los ingresos necesarios para solventar los gastos familiares.

Sus objetivos son apoyar a sus pequeños hijos en sus estudios y que culminen una carrera universitaria a futuro abrir otra tienda.
texts.en:
Zoila is 36 years old and resides in the town of Lolotique in the Department of San Miguel. She is a single mother with three children (ages 10, 7, and 2) who are financially dependent on the income she generates from her business. Zoila has a store where she sells basic products.

Her mother started this business fifteen years ago. Zoila now manages the store Monday through Sunday. She is currently requesting a loan in order to buy products for her store such as oil, beans, rice, sugar, and other items that her customers demand. This loan will help expand her inventory and allow her to have more variety so that she can increase her sales and generate the necessary income to cover the family expenses.

Her goals are to support her young children with their studies so that they can earn a university degree and to open another store in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase oil, beans, rice, sugar, and other products

loans.name: Fe Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Fe inicia su ciclo 21 con 16 socias, que realizan diferentes negocios.
Como es el caso D. L. Señora Maria que es L. presidenta por primera vez D. su Banco comunal, es socia hace 5 años y en todo este tiempo aprendió a ser responsable, lo que mas le agrada son las reuniones.
Maria es casada y tiene 2 hijos que estudian, Maria junto a su esposo se dedican a L. venta D. ropa variada que venD. en las ferias D. L. región y también viaja a L. selva ayacuchana, sus productos los adquiere en L. ciudad D. Lima.
Además Maria en los días libres venD. comida D. manera ambulatoria cerca D. su casa, actividad que realiza por las noches.
Maria tiene un nieto que es sordomudo que esta a su responsabilidad y su sueño es que el pueda mejorar su calidad D. vida, también sueña con educar a sus hijos y tener una casa propia porque hasta L. fecha vive en casa alquilada.
Maria solicita un crédito D. 1800 para L. compra D. polos, pantalones.
texts.en:
The “Fe” (Faith) Communal bank is in its 21st cycle. There are 16 members, and they have different businesses. Maria is one of the members, and for the first time she is the president of the communal bank. She has been a member for five years. During all of that time she learned to be responsible. What she likes the most are the meetings. Maria is married and has two children who attend school. Maria and her husband sell assorted clothing. She sells at regional fairs, and she also travels to the Ayacuchana jungle. She gets the clothes in the city of Lima. On her days off Maria also sells food in an itinerant manner close to her house. She sells in the evenings. Maria has a deaf-mute grandson who is her responsibility. Her dream is to be able to improve their quality of life. She also dreams of educating her children and having her own house. They now live in a rented house. Maria is requesting a loan for 1,800 soles to buy polo style shirts and pants.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy polo style shirts and pants

loans.name: Fonk Sa Liguey Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité FONK SA LIGUEY est créé le 04 décembre 2007. Il est composé de 11 femmes qui sont toutes issues du même quartier. Ces femmes se sont organisées par affinité et par voisinage. 

Madame YACINE F., debout à l’extrême droite de la photo, en écharpe mauve, est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 53 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de trois enfants et tutrice de deux autres enfants.

Elle fait un commerce de tissus. Elle s'approvisionne en Gambie. Elle  vend à crédit et sa clientèle qui est composée essentiellement de grossistes du marché. En plus de cette activité elle fait de l'élevage de poulets de chaire par lot de 100 sujets

Son crédit lui permettra d’acheter des tissus et des poussins et de l’aliment de volaille pour l’élevage.
Son objectif est de constituer une épargne consistante. Participer financièrement à la prise en charge familiale.
texts.en:
The Fonk Sa Liguey solidarity group was formed on December 4, 2007. It is composed of 11 women who live in the same neighborhood. They are friends and neighbors who decided to organise a group together. Mrs. Yacine F., standing on the far right in the photo wearing a purple scarf, is the group’s leader. She is 53 years old. She is married and the mother of three children, with two other children in her care. She sells fabrics. She stocks up in Gambia. She sells on credit, and her customer base is composed mainly of wholesalers. In addition to this business activity, she also raises broiler chickens, a brood of 100 at a time. Her loan will permit her to purchase more fabrics as well as chicks and chicken feed. Her goal is to maintain a consistent level of savings whlie making a financial contribution to the family budget.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing fabrics  (retail) and chicks  (poultry farming)

loans.name: And Liggey Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité AND LIGGEY est créé le 04 décembre 2007. Il est composé de 10 femmes qui sont toutes issues du même quartier. Ces femmes se sont organisées par affinité et par voisinage. 

Madame SIGAMA C., debout à droite sur la photo, avec une écharpe orange et portant de lunettes, est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 65 ans. Elle est veuve et mère de huit enfants. Elle a aussi sous elle la responsabilité de ses 04 belles filles car ses enfants n’ont pas encore de travail fixe. 

Elle fait de l'embouche bovine, elle achète des bêtes les engraisse pendant au moins 05 mois avant de les revendre. Elle mène cette activité depuis plus de 25 ans. Elle est soutenue par ses enfants dans l'activité.

Son objectif est de prendre en charge ses besoins personnels et soutenir ses belles filles dans les charges familiales.
texts.en:
The solidarity group And Liggey was created on December 4, 2007. It is made up of 10 women who are all from the same neighborhood. These women know each other through friendship and neighborly relations. Mrs. Sigama C., standing on the right in the photo, wearing an orange scarf and glasses, is the group's leader. She is 65 years old. She is a widow and has 8 children. She is also in charge of her 4 granddaughters because her children don't have steady jobs yet. She fattens cattle, she buys them and fattens them for at least 5 months before reselling them. She has been doing this for more than 25 years. Her children help her with her work. Her goal is to take care of her personal needs and support her granddaughters. Son objectif est de prendre en charge ses besoins personnels et soutenir ses belles filles dans les charges familiales.

Translated from French by Manuel Carreiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Bok Xalaat Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité BOK XALAAT est créé le 04 décembre 2007. Il est composé de 10 femmes qui sont toutes issues du même quartier. Ces femmes se sont organisées par affinité et par voisinage. 

Madame FATMA THIOUBOU D., debout à droite de la photo, vêtue de grand boubou en thioup, est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 57 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 09 enfants.

Elle achète des matelas et chaises qu'elle met en location. En plus de çà elle vend du gaz butane en bouteille. Elle fait également de l'élevage de poulets de chaire (par lot de 50 sujets). Elle a une expérience de 05 ans dans ce domaine.

Avec son crédit elle va augmenter ses chaises et matelas et des poussins et aliment de volaille pour l’élevage. 
Son objectif est d’augmenter son niveau d'épargne. Participer financièrement à la prise en charge familiale. Par ailleurs, acheter une bâche afin de confectionner une tente et de la mettre en location.
texts.en:
The solidarity group Bok Xalaat was created on December 4, 2007. It is made up of 10 women who are all from the same neighborhood. They know each other from friendship and neighborly ties. Mrs. Fatma Thioubou D., standing on the right side in the photo, wearing a Grand Boubou made of thioup, is the group's leader. She is 57 years old. She is married and has 9 children. She buys mattresses and chairs that she rents. In addition, she also sells bottled butane gas. She raises chickens for their meat (in groups of 50). She has been doing this for 5 years. With her loan she is going to buy more chairs and mattresses, along with baby chicks and chicken feed. Her goal is to increase her sales and to help take care of her family's expenses. She would also like to buy a tarp so she can make a tent and rent it out.

Translated from French by Manuel Carreiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To develop and promote her business

loans.name: Margarita Amanda

texts.es: La señora Margarita es cliente en segunda secuencia, la actividad a la que se dedica es la comercializacion de libros , el modo en la que ellas realizan su trabajo es comprando los libros por lotes y los distribuyen por unidades en las oficinas y otros lugares a credito.  ella vive en casa de sus padres con sus hermanos , es una persona joven con ganas de superacion.  el destino del credito es la compra de un lote de libros que le estan solicitando y como trabaja a credito necesita un doble capital para poder seguir trabajando, es muy responsable ella sola mantiene a su familia esta muy agardecido con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindad en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Margarita is a client in her second cycle. She sells books. The ways she does her work is by purchasing the sets of books. She then sells them individually in offices and other places for credit. She lives in her parents’ house with her siblings. She is a young person with the desire to succeed. She will use the loan to buy a set of books that are being requested. Because she works on credit she needs double the capital to be able to continue working. She is very responsible; she alone supports her family. She is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the trust placed in her by granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a set of books

loans.name: Rufina

texts.es: La señora Rufina nació en la ciudad de Cochabamba,  Vive con el Sr.  Cipriano  ambos, tiene dos  hijos y hace 10 años que viven en el lugar de Puerto Rico a 2 km de El Torno. Tiene su propio terreno en el cual ambos trabajan en la agricultura pero el los ratos libres el esposo de la Sra. Rufina  se dedica a trabajar con moto,  en su terreno siembra  solo perejil,  y lo comercializa  en Santa Cruz,  ya son 7 secuencias que trabaja solo con Emprender, es una cliente muy antigua, el dinero del crédito lo utilizara en la siembra de perejil y los gastos que implica el preparado de la tierra, esta muy agradecida por la oportunidad que le brindaron.
texts.en:
Rufina was born in Cochabamba, lives with her husband Cipriano, and has two children. They have lived in Puerto Rico about two Km from El Torno for the past 10 years. She has her own land that they both work and where they plant only parsley which they sell in Santa Cruz. In their free time Rufina's husband works on his motorcycle. She is on her 7th loan cycle working exclusively with Emprender. She's is a long-time customer and will use the loan to plant parsley and for expenses related to preparing the soil. She is very thankful for the opportunity she has been given.

Translated from Spanish by Solson Scherman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Planting of parsely

loans.name: Benno Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité BENNO est créé le 04 décembre 2007. Il est composé de huit (8) femmes qui sont toutes issues du même quartier. Ces femmes se sont organisées par affinité et par voisinage. Madame Astou D. au milieu debout au milieu sur la photo a était considérée comme absente du fait que son visage n’apparait pas. 

Ndiagna D., debout à l’extrême droite sur la photo, vêtue de grand boubou wax multicolore, est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 50 ans. Elle est divorcée et vit avec ses 3 enfants et elle est aussi responsable de 06 enfants de sa jeune sœur. 

Elle vend de la bouillie de mil qu'elle prépare de ses mains. Elle vend également des tissus et des chaussures pour dames qu’elle achète à Dakar. Elle a une expérience d'environ de 10 ans dans ce domaine d'activité.
Son nouveau crédit lui permettra d’acheter de la marchandise en quantité plus importante pour augmenter son chiffre d’affaire. (Acheter du mil, des tissus et des chaussures pour dames)

Son objectif est de prendre en charge sa progéniture et ses neveux. Et renforcer son niveau d'épargne.
texts.en:
The solidarity group Benno was created on December 4, 2007. It is made up of 8 women who are all from the same neighborhood. They know each other due to friendship and neighborly ties. Mrs. Astou D., standing in the middle of the photo, is considered as being asbent because her face is not visible. Ndiagna D., standing on the far right of the photo, wearing a Grand Boubou made out of multicolored Wax (a colorful cloth), is the group's leader. She is 50 years old. She is divorced and lives with her 3 children and she also takes care of her sister's 6 children. She sells millet porridge that she makes herself. She also sells fabrics and women's shoes that she buys in Dakar. She has been doing this for 10 years. Her new loan will allow her to buy more merchandise so she can increase her profits. (She wants to buy millet, fabrics, and women's shoes.) Her goal is to take care of her own children and her nephews, as well as increase her savings.

Translated from French by Manuel Carreiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase millet, fabrics, and women's shoes

loans.name: Tacku Liggey Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité TACKU LIGGEY est créé le 04 décembre 2007. Il est composé de 14 femmes qui sont toutes issues du même quartier. Ces femmes se sont organisées par affinité et par voisinage. 

Madame Yaya D., debout à l’extrême droite de la photo, de boubou blanc/rouge vêtue est responsable du groupe. Elle âgée de 56 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 05 enfants. Elle a aussi la charge de sa petite fille.

Depuis trois ans elle fait de l’embouche ovine. La vente se fait lors des grandes fêtes religieuses. Parallèlement, elle est aussi vendeuse d’encens, de pâte d’arachide, de thioup, de parfums et de chaussures. Elle s’approvisionne soit en Mauritanie, soit en Gambie.

Avec nouveau crédit elle pourra acheter des moutons pour l’embouche, et acheter aussi  de l’encens, de pâte d’arachide, de thioup, de parfums et de chaussures.

Son objectif est de participer au bien-être familial. Elle est coépouse ce qui fait que mensuellement elle contribue à hauteur de 20000 francs cfa pour les dépenses de la famille. Elle assure la scolarité d'une de ses filles (17 ans).
texts.en:
The solidarity group Tacku Liggey was created on December 4, 2007. It is made up of 14 women who are all from the same neighborhood. They know each other from friendship and neighborly ties. Mrs. Yaya D., standing at the far right in the photo, wearing the white/red Boubou, is the group's leader. She is 56 years old. She is married and has 5 children. She is also taking care of her young daughter. For three years, she has been fattening sheep. She sells them during large religious festivals. She also sells incense, peanut butter, thioup, perfumes, and shoes. She buys her stock either in Mauritania or Gambia. With this new loan, she will be able to buy more sheep, as well as incense, peanut butter, thioup, perfumes, and shoes. Her goal is to contribute to her family's well-being. She is a co-wife, meaning that she contributes up to 20,000 francs CFA monthly to take care of the family's expenses. She manages the schooling costs for one of her daughters, aged 17.

Translated from French by Manuel Carreiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sheep for fattening and other various merchandise

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es: La Sra.Patricia, es una joven emprendedora que desde hace un tiempo atráz viene trabajando en la venta de abarrotes (sodas, cervezas, arroz, harina, aceite,etc.) y con el pasar del tiempo y a base de mucho esfuerzo a logrado surtir una respetable tienda de barrio en el dominilio de sus padres Don Valentín y Doña Adalia a los cuales ayuda y colabora en todo lo necesario, y al mismo tiempo de los cuales recibe todo el apoyo para seguir adelante. Como anteriormente se dijo Doña Patricia a venido surtiendo cada dia mejor su tienda motivo por el cual es bastante concurrida y se han visto en la necesidad de surtirla comprando refrescos y arroz, azucar,etc, razón por la cual nuevamente se acerco por nuestras instalaciones a solicitar un nuevo crédito para su tienda. Doña Patricia viene trabajando hace un tiempo atráz con nosotros y a demostrado cumplimiento en el pago de sus cuotas, por tal motivo no se le negó un nuevo crédito, ademas de aquello cuenta con domicilio conocido y cero deudas en otras Entidades Financieras.
texts.en:
Patricia is an enterprising young person who some time ago was working selling groceries (sodas, beer, rice, flour, cooking oil, etc.) Over time, and with a lot of effort, she managed to set up a respectable store in the neighborhood where her parents, Don Valentín and Doña Adalia, have their home. They help her with the store and pitch in when needed, and give her all the support she needs to get ahead. As previously, said Patricia, she has been stocking her store better over time, so that the store will be sufficiently busy. She sees a need to increase her inventory by buying soft drinks, rice, sugar, etc. For this reason she approached our institution to request a new loan for her store. Patricia has been working with our institution for a while, and has made her payments on time, which is why she is approved to take a new loan. In addition, she has a known address and no debt with any other financial entity.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy general merchandise (soda, beer, rice, cooking oil, flour, etc.)

loans.name: Gabriel

texts.es:
Gabriel es un joven padre de familia, tiene 21 años de edad, reside junto a su esposa y a su menor hijo en casa de su padre ubicada en el distrito agrícola de Chepén, una ciudad con bastante movimiento comercial. La zona pertenece a la provincia del mismo nombre y se encuentra ubicada a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte de carga y pasajeros en una mototaxi (vehículo motorizado consistente en una motocicleta que lleva anexada una cabina para realizar actividades de transporte) el brinda este servicio dentro de la ciudad de Chepén, la actividad goza de buena acogida ya que estos medios de transporte son accesibles a todo publico debido a su bajo costo. Con los ingresos que el percibe se hace cargo del mantenimiento de su familia. Su esposa trabaja en un locutorio, con el dinero que ambos ganan tratan de salir adelante. Actualmente tienen pensado trabajar arduamente para obtener su casa propia. 

El contínuo uso brindado a su unidad móvil ha hecho que esta empiece a sufrir algunas fallas que requieren de urgente reparación para garantizar su correcto funcionamiento, Gabriel ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a realizar las reparaciones y mantenimiento que requiera su vehículo.

Gabriel es un joven luchador y que dia a dia lucha por darle a su familia lo mejor, las personas que le conocen le consideran alguien bastante reponsable y de confianza.
texts.en:
Gabriel is a young father, 21 years old, who lives with his wife and their young son in his father's house, located in the agricultural district of Chepen, a city with a substantial amount of commercial activity. This area is part of the province of the same name, and is located an hour from Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region. He provides cargo and passenger transport services with his mototaxi (a motorized vehicle that consists of a motorcycle that has an attached cabin where he can transport people and cargo.) He provides this service in the city of Chepen, and his business enjoys a good reception from the public, since these means of transportation are accessible to the public due to their low cost. With the income he earns, he is in charge of supporting his family. His wife works in a call center, and with the money that they both earn they try to get ahead. He is now working very hard to get his own house. As he is continually using his vehicle, it is starting to have some mechanical problems that require urgent repair to guarantee its proper functioning. Gabriel is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for the first time for 1,000 Peruvian soles to help him carry out these repairs and do the maintenance on his vehicle that is needed. Gabriel is a young person who strives each day to give his family the best. The people who know him consider him to be a responsible and reliable person.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to pay expenses for the repair and maintenance of his mototaxi that he uses to provide transportation services

loans.name: Bok Jom Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité BOK JOM est créé le 04 décembre 2007. Il est composé de 08 femmes qui sont toutes issues du même quartier. Ces femmes se sont organisées par affinité et par voisinage. 

Madame Aminta F., debout tout à fait à droite sur la photo, de grand boubou blanc vêtue, est responsable du groupe de solidarité. Elle est âgée de 56 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 09 enfants. 

Elle est vendeuse de tissus et de vêtements pour homme. Comme activité secondaire elle vend de l'encens. Elle vend souvent sa marchandise à crédit et le recouvrement se fait à la fin de chaque mois. Elle a 04 ans dans ce domaine d'expérience.

Avec son crédit elle va acheter de la marchandise (ci-dessus)
Son objectif principal est de prendre en charge la maladie de sa fille de 17 ans (élève en classe de 3è secondaire et admise au concours du Brevet de Fin d'Études Moyennes).
texts.en:
The solidarity group Bok Jom was created on December 4, 2007. It is made up of 8 women who are all from the same neighborhood. These women know each other through friendship and neighborly ties. Mrs. Aminta F., standing at the far right in the photo, wearing a white Grand Boubou, is the group's leader. She is 56 years old. She is married and has 9 children. She sells fabrics and men's clothing. She also sells incense. She often sells her goods on credit and collects at the end of each month. She has 4 years of experience at this job. With her loan she is going to purchase the above-mentioned merchandise. Her main goal is to take care of her sick 17-year-old daughter (a student in the equivalent of 10th grade, she has been invited to continue her studies through the equivalent of the end of High School).

Translated from French by Manuel Carreiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fabrics, men's clothing, and incense

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
La Señora Antonia O. de 56 años, tiene 2 hijos ya jóvenes, el varón de los hijos esta cursando sus estudios Universitarios, con la colaboración de su madre quien fue abandonada por su esposo dejándola prácticamente en la miseria, habiendo vendido su casa sin consentimiento de ella, para posteriormente abandonarla. 

Gracias al empeño y perseverancia de la Sra. O. es que logro establecer como actividad generadora de ingresos un pequeño snack en el cual fue ganado experiencia y clientela, ofreciendo algunos productos de repostería oriental (Cuñape, Pan de Arroz y Otros) y jugos de frutos tropical, todos estos con su característica particular de la Sra. O., hecho que le permite pensar hoy en diversificar su actividad comercial con la inclusión de la comercialización de carne de pollo que es de gran demanda en la zona, es a la vez la razón de su solicitud de un crédito KIVA, el que le permitirá alcanzar su objetivo y de esta manera poder ayudar a su hijo a profesionalizarse y  le permitirá mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Sra. Antonia O. is 56 years old and has two children who are young adults. Her son is finishing his university studies, so she provides him with assistance. Antonia’s husband abandoned the family, practically leaving them destitute. They eventually became homeless since he had sold their house without her consent.

Thanks to her determination and perseverance, Antonia was able to start an income-generating activity by opening a small snack bar. Through this business, she was able to gain experience and establish a customer base. She offers a few baked goods from the east (such as cheese rolls, rice bread, and other products) and tropical fruit juices. Everything she offers helps to separate her business from the others. Now she believes she can diversify her business activity by selling chicken, which has great demand in the area. For this reason she is requesting a loan from KIVA, which will allow her to accomplish her goal as well as help her son become a professional and improve his quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital to diversify her food business

loans.name: Kahr Yalla Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité KAHR YALLA est créé le 04 décembre 2007. Il est composé de 09 femmes qui sont toutes issues du même quartier. Ces femmes se sont organisées par affinité et par voisinage. 

Madame Aïcha S., debout à droite sur la photo, avec une écharpe jaune sur les épaules, est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 66 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants. Elle a aussi la charge d’une nièce de 14 ans et d’une petite fille qui est à l’université. 

Elle fait du commerce, elle travaille en collaboration avec son fils. Ce dernier s'approvisionne en Mauritanie. Elle vend des tissus et des parfums. Elle vend aussi de l'huile de palme. Elle mène cette activité depuis 1974
Son nouveau crédit lui permettra d’acheter en quantité importante la marchandise ci-dessus afin de dégager une marge bénéficiaire consistante. 

Son objectif est de renforcer son niveau d'épargne et de prendre en charge ses besoins personnels et ceux de sa progéniture.
texts.en:
The solidarity group Kahr Yalla was created on December 4, 2007. It is made up of 9 women who are all from the same neighborhood. The women know each other based on friendship and neighborly ties. Mrs. Aïcha S., standing on the right side of the photo, with a yellow scarf around her shoulders, is the group's leader. She is 66 years old. She is married and mother of 5 children. She is also in charge of a 14-year-old niece and a granddaughter who is in college. She sells goods and she works in partnership with her son. Her son buys the stock in Mauritania. She sells fabrics and perfumes. She also sells palm oil. She has been doing this since 1974. Her new loan will allow her to purchase even more of the items listed above so she can have consistent profit margins. Her goal is to increase her savings and to take care of her and her family's needs.

Translated from French by Manuel Carreiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fabrics, perfumes, and palm oil

loans.name: Alcibiades

texts.es: El Señor Alcibiades  nacido el 30 de Junio en la ciudad de Cochabamba. Con 5 hijos vive con doña Jesusa nacida en Montero.   Hoy viven en una comunidad distante a 30 km de Limoncito llamado Paso el Chivo en el cual tiene su parcela por dotación del sindicato agrario Paso el Chivo, el vive y trabaja en esa comunidad, siembra maíz, yuca, poroto. El hace 4 años viene trabajando con Emprender, el dinero del crédito será utilizado para la contratación de mano de obra para la preparacion de la tierra y siembra de Maiz.
texts.en:
Señor Alcibiades was born on the 30th of June in the city of Cochabamba. He lives with his 5 children and Jesusa, who was born in Montero. Today they live in a distant community 30 kilometers from Limoncito called Paso el Chivo, where he was allocated a parcel of land from the agricultural union Paso el Chivo. He lives and works in this community, cultivating corn, cassava and beans. He has been working with Emprender for 4 years, and he will use this loan to hire workers to prepare his land and plant corn.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to hire workers to prepare the land and plant corn

loans.name: Filomena Santos

texts.es: La Señora cuenta con un negocio de venta de fruta hace 5 años aproximadamente y requiere del préstamo para mejorar dicho negocio y a la vez mejorar su calidad de vida. Vive con sus hijas que son mayores de edad y se mantienen solas. Demuestra buenas referencias perosnales por parte de sus vecinos y quienes también manifiestan que la señora es una persona muy responsable.
texts.en:
Filomena Santos has had a business selling fruit for about 5 years. She needs a loan to improve this business, and at the same time improve her quality of life. She lives with her adult daughters who support themselves. She has good personal references from her neighbors, who also state that she is a very responsible person.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: for her fruit-selling business

loans.name: Richard William

texts.es:
El solicitante es soltero, tiene un hijo en edad escolar al cual le brinda una pensión mensual. Vive en casa familiar y cuenta con un auto tico el cual lo conduce él mismo. El préstamo lo requiere para la poder asi adquirir una radio y poder afiliarse a una empresa de taxis. 
Cuenta con buenas referencias personales. Es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable en la labor que desempeña.
texts.en:
The loan requester is single and has a son who goes to a school which requires monthly fees. He lives in a house with family and has a Costa Rican car which he drives himself. He wants the loan to be able to buy a radio so he can join a taxi company. He has good personal references. He is a very hardworking person and does his job responsibly.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Fanning, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital for work

loans.name: Paul Michael

texts.es:
Paul tiene 26 años de edad, es soltero y vive junto a sus padres en el sector Caín. Una zona urbano marginal situada en el distrito de Guadalupe, perteneciente a la provincia de Pacasamayo, ubicado en la región La Libertad, a mas de una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la venta de alfalfa (forraje utilizado en la crianza de ganado vacuno, ovino y caprino), el vende este producto en el mercado de la ciudad de Guadalupe y se vale de una mototaxi (vehículo motorizado consistente en una motocicleta que lleva anexada una cabina para brindar servicio de transporte de carga y pasajeros) para transportarlo y venderlo. Por las tardes utiliza este vehículo para brindar servicio de transporte de pasajeros dentro del distrito de Guadalupe.

Actualmente sus unidad movil presenta algunas fallas producto del excesivo uso y del mal estado de algunos caminos que recorre diariamente. Estas fallas requieren de urgente reparación para garantizar su correcto funcionamiento. Para realizar esta acción Paul ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Paul es un joven activo y responsable. Sus amigos y conocidos le tienen mucha estima. En el mercado sus clientes le prefieren debido a que siempre brinda un trato amable y servicial.
texts.en:
Paul, 26, is single and lives with his parents in the Caín neighborhood. This is an urban neighborhood in the outskirts of the Guadalupe district. It is in the Pacasamayo province, located in the La Libertad region, more than an hour from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region. He sells alfalfa (forage used in raising cows, sheep and goats.) He sells this product in the market in the city of Guadalupe using a mototaxi (a motorized vehicle consisting of a motorcycle attached to a cab that is used to transport people and cargo) to transport and sell the alfalfa. In the afternoons, he uses this vehicle to provide passenger transportation services within the Guadalupe district. Now his vehicle is having some mechanical problems due to its heavy usage and the bad state of the roads where he drives it daily. These problems require urgent repair to guarantee its proper functioning. To do this, Paul has decided to request a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 1,000 Peruvian soles. Paul is an active and responsible youth. His friends and acquaintances hold him in high esteem. In the market, his customers prefer his business because he always provides them with friendly and helpful service.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to pay for expenses to repair and maintain his mototaxi

loans.name: Pasisa Magdalena

texts.es:
La solicitante se dedica a la venta de ropa hace 10 años en un mercado de la localidad y su esposo trabaja como obrero de campo en una minería artesanal fuera de la ciudad. 
Cuenta con experiencia en el negocio y se le propone el crédito por tener capacidad de pago y buenas referencias.
Solicita el préstamo para invertir en su negocio y a al vez brindar mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
This client has worked in clothing sales for the past 10 years in a market in town. Her husband works as a field worker in artisanal mining outside of the city.

She has experience in the business and is qualified for the loan by having the ability to pay and good references.

She is requesting the loan to invest in her business and, at the same time, to provide her family with a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Edin Percy

texts.es:
Edin tiene 22 años de edad, es soltero y vive junto a sus padres en el distrito de Chepén, una zona agrícola de movimiento comercial considerable que pertenece a la región del mismo nombre y que se encuentra ubicada en la región La Libertad, a mas de una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se gana la vida como trabajando como panadero, el apredió el oficio desde muy joven y actualmente se vale de sus conocimientos y destreza para ganarse el sustento, el trabaja en dos panaderías amasando y horneando el pan que se comercializará a diario. Su trabajo empieza desde muy temprano y requiere de mucho esfuerzo. Gracias a los ingresos que le brinda esta actividad el sustenta sus gastos personales y ayuda a sus padres con el sostenimiento de su familia.

Edin desea realizar algunas mejoras en su vivienda, ya que esta está construida de material rustico y tiene algunos daños en su estructura producto del paso del tiempo. Para lograr su objetivo ha creído coveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1200 nuevos soles.

Edin es un joven bastante trabajador y responsable. Las personas que le conocen le consideran alguien tranquilo y servicial.
texts.en:
Edin is 22 years old, single and lives with his parents in the district of Chepén. It is an agricultural area with considerable commercial movement. It belongs to the region with the same name, which is located in the region of La Libertad, more than an hour from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the region of Lambayeque. He makes his living working as a baker. He learned the trade when he was very young and now he uses his knowledge and skill to support himself. He works in two bakeries kneading and baking the bread which is sold daily. His job begins very early and requires a lot of strength. Thanks to the income that comes from this work, he is able to pay for his personal expenses and help his parents support the family. Edin wants to make some improvements to his house. It is currently made from rustic material and has some structural dangers as a result of time. To accomplish his goal he has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1200 nuevos soles. Edin is young, a hard worker, and responsible. The people who know him consider him to be calm and helpful.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Fanning, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To cover expenses for repairing housing

loans.name: Angulo Aquije

texts.es:
Angulo Aquije E. Y. se dedica a la venta de comida rápida (alitas y contrapierna de pollo). Su negocio está ubicado en su domicilio, tiene 3 hijos independientes quienes también la ayudan en el negocio.
Presenta buenas referencias personales y laborales.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de bebidas gaseosas, sillas y mesas para mejorar e invertir en el negocio que le brinda buen ingreso familiar.
texts.en:
Angulo Aquije E. Y. works in fast food sales (chicken wings and thighs). Her business is located in her home. She has 3 children who are independent and also help her with the business.

She presents good personal and work references.

She is requesting the loan for the purchase of soft drinks, chairs and tables to improve and invest in her business which provides her with a good family income.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Yenny Elizabeth

texts.es:
Se dedica a la venta de ropa en un mercado y a le ofrece también a los vecinos. 
Solicita el préstamo para incrementar su negocio y así contar con mas mercadería para ofrecer a sus clientes.
Tiene cinco años dedicándose a este rubro.
texts.en:
This client works in clothing sales in a market and also makes sales to her neighbors.

She is requesting the loan to expand her business and have more merchandise to offer to her clients.

She has been in this area of work for five years.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Huamaní Espinoza

texts.es:
El Sr. Huamaní Espinoza B. se dedica a realizar servicio de cerrajería y estructuras metálicas en general. También es maestro en construcción y tiene experiencia mas de 10 años.
Vive con su esposa y sus tres hijos.
Solicita el préstamo para construir un cuarto en su casa y asi brindar maor comodidad a su familia.
Le gusta mucho el trabajo que realiza y aspira a formar una empresa.
texts.en:
Mr. Huamaní Espinoza B. works in locksmith services and general hardware. He is also a master constructor and has more than 10 years of experience.

He lives with his wife and three children.

He is requesting this loan to build another room in his house so that he can provide his family with greater comfort.

He likes very much the work that he does and hopes to form a company.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a room

loans.name: Fredys Edenilson

texts.es:
Fredys  tiene 21 años de edad, reside en Delicias de Concepción, Departamento de Morazán vive con su compañera de vida y dos hijos de la edades de 6 y 2 años, un sobrino. el trabaja como panificador en un panadería.
El trabaja en la panadería en donde hace la función de panificador en hora de 1:00pm- 5:00pm y 7:00am-9:00am, el necesita un préstamo para compra de materiales de construcción, como son lamina, clavos, alambre, para cubrir al rededor de la casa la cual actualmente esta cubiertas de varas de bambú. Este préstamo ayudara a mejorar las condiciones de la vivienda, protegerlos de la lluvia, menos riesgos con esto contribuir a mejorar la calidad de vida de estas personas.
Los sueños a futuro son construir la casa de ladrillo para vivir de una forma digna al lado de la familia.
texts.en:
Fredys is 21 years old and resides in Delicias de Concepción in the Department of Morazán. He lives with his life partner, his two children (ages 6 and 2), and a nephew. Fredys has a job making bread at a bakery.

He works at the bakery between the hours of 1:00pm-5:00pm and 7:00am-9:00am. Fredys needs a loan to buy construction materials such as boards, nails, and wire to cover the sides of his house which are currently shielded by bamboo poles. This loan will help improve his living conditions, protect his family from the rain, and reduce any health risks by improving their quality of life.

His dreams for the future are to build a brick house and live a decent life alongside his family.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase boards, nails, and wire to cover the sides of his house

loans.name: Julia Esther

texts.es:
La Señorita Nuñez es egresada de la Universidad Nacional (Facultad de Odontologia), este crédito será destinado a los gastos que demandan su tesis y algunos materiales para su egreso. 
Ella acudió al préstamo de la Fundación Paraguaya mediantes sus  padres quienes son clientes excelentes y comentan que se encuentran muy contentos y orgullosos de que su hija este culminando su carrera.
A vez ella también se encuentra muy satisfecha y agradece a sus padres por toda la ayuda que le han brindado durante toda la carrera y espera muy pronto aumentar sus ingresos y poder retribuirle a los mismo de la mejor manera posible.
texts.en:
Ms. N. is a graduate of the Universidad Nacional (School of Orthodontics). This loan will be used towards the cost of her thesis and some of the materials for her graduation. She arrived at the Fundación Paraguaya loan through her parents who are excellent clients and comment that they are very happy and proud that their daughter is finishing her degree. At the same time, she is also very satisfied and is grateful for her parents for all of the help that they have provided to her during her degree program. She also hopes to increase her earnings very soon and be able to return the favor to them in the best possible way.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Payment for the cost of her thesis such as printing, binding, transport, travel allowance, and others.

loans.name: Carmen Olinda

texts.es:
La Sra. H. L. Carmen Olinda se dedica a transporte y solicia el crédito para dar mantemiento a su vehículo y a la vez para realizar acabados en su vivienda.
Tiene dos hijos en edad escolar de 11 y 13 años, su esposo trabaja como minero informal.
texts.en:
Mrs. Carmen Olinda H. L. provides transportation services. She is asking for funds for vehicle maintenance and to do some repairs to her house. She has two school aged children who are 11 and 13 years of age. Her husband occasionally works as a miner.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For vehicle maintenance and home repair.

loans.name: Juan David

texts.es:
Juan David C. es  de la ciudad de Luque, tiene 26 años y  está cursando el 2° año de la carrera de Técnico en electrónica I.P.T. (Instituto Panamericano de Telecomunicación)
El es el tercero de cuatro hemanos.
Su madre es comerciante junto con su padre.
Juan actualmente trabaja en una casa de ventas y reparación de celulares desde hace ya cinco años, donde se encuentra adquiriendo experiencia y al mismo tiempo obtiene un ingreso para sus estudios.
Su deseo es terminar esta carrera para trabajar y comenzar con la carrera de INGENIERIA EN ELECTRONICA ya que su deseo es ser un ingeniero en esa área. 
En la actualidad es solicita el préstamo para el pago de la mensualidad de su facultad y también para la compra de libros que está necesitando para estudiar.
texts.en:
Juan David C., 26, is from the city of Luque. He is enrolled in the second year of I.P.T’s (Panamerican Telecommunications Institute) Electronics Technician career. He is the third of four brothers. His mother and father are both merchants. Juan currently is employed by a cell phone sales and repair store; he’s been there for 5 years already. He is acquiring experience and at the same time earns income for his schooling. His wish is to finish his career and start work as an Electronics Engineer because he wants to be this kind of an engineer. He is asking for the loan in order to pay the monthly tuition fee to his college and also to buy the textbooks he needs for his courses.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay monthly tuition fees and buy school supplies like textbooks.

loans.name: Perla Rosana

texts.es:
Perla, tiene 23 años ella es técnico en instrumentación quirúrgica  y está cursando el tercer año de la carrera de Licenciatura en enfermería en la U.N.I.S.A.L.

Ella  tiene 9 hermanos mayores quienes ya culminaron sus estudios y ella es la única que está  estudiando actualmente en la familia.
Su madre es ama de casa y su padre es comerciante.
Perla actualmente trabaja como técnica enfermera en I.P.S., donde se encuentra adquiriendo experiencia y al mismo tiempo obtiene un ingreso para sus estudios.
Ella  viaja todos los días en bus aproximadamente 1 hora hasta su Facultad ya que la misma queda a 40 km de su casa.
Perla  tiene muchos deseos de terminar su carrera y ejercer su profesión y ayudar a su familia, especialmente a su madre quien es una mujer muy sacrificada.
Perla quiere culminar sus estudios como sus hermano y así progresar en la vida.
La carrera de enfermería actualmente en Paraguay tiene buena salida laboral ya que muchas de la terminan sus estudios en el país, viajan hasta otros países para ejercer la profesión.
Actualmente tiene algunos gasto en cuanto a materiales de estudio y transporte, además de la mensualidad que debe pagar ya que asiste en una Facultad privada, para cubrir estos gasto solicita el préstamo.
texts.en:
Perla, age 23, is a surgical instrument technician. She is in her third year of studying for a nursing degree in the U.N.I.S.A.L (San Lorenzo University). She has nine older siblings who have finished their education. She is the only one in the family who is still in school. Her mother is a housewife, and her father is a merchant. Perla currently works as a nursing technician at I.P.S. (Health and Welfare Institute). She is gaining experience there, and she is getting income for her education at the same time. Everyday she travels approximately one hour by bus to get to her school, which is 40 kilometers from her house. Perla has a great desire to finish her career studies, practice her profession, and help her family. She especially wants to help her mother, who is a very self-sacrificing woman. Perla wants to complete her education like her siblings in order to progress in life. Currently there are good job opportunities for those in the nursing profession in Paraguay. Many people finish their studies in the country and travel to other countries to practice their profession. She currently has some expenses for educational materials, transportation, and monthly payments that she needs to pay because she goes to a private school. She is requesting the loan to cover these expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy two books, pay for transportation, and for the montly payments

loans.name: Abel Matias

texts.es:
Abel S.  es  de la ciudad de Mariano Roque Alonso, tiene 20 años y  está cursando el 1º año de la carrera de Administración de Empresas en la Universidad del Norte. 
Abel es el menor de cuatro hermanos y a diferencia de los demás, recién está comenzando su carrera universitaria, todos sus hermanos han culminado estudios universitarios. 
Su padre es funcionario jubilado del Ministerio del Interior, un ex policía. 
Abel comenzó a trabajar recientemente en un supermercado, donde está adquiriendo experiencia en la parte administrativa de la empresa y a la vez ganando un salario que le ayuda a sustentar sus estudios. 

Abel cuenta con ir ganando experiencia en su actual trabajo e ir creciendo ya a nivel profesional y para cuando reciba su titulo pueda estar ya en una posición más elevada tanto a nivel profesional como de ingresos. 
El crédito solicitado será destinado al pago de inscripción de semestre y aranceles para  de su carrera.
texts.en:
Abel S., 20, is from the city of Mariano Roque Alonso. He is in the first year of Business Administration at Universidad del Norte. Abel is the youngest of four siblings and is just starting his university studies; all of his siblings have completed their university studies. His father is a retired employee of the Interior Ministry, he’s an ex-police officer. Abel started to work recently in a supermarket where he is acquiring experience in the administrative aspect of a firm while earning a salary that helps him pay for his studies. Abel relies on being able to continue to gain experience in his current job and to continue to grow at the professional level so that when he graduates he will be in a higher position both professionally and with respect to income. The loan will be used to pay the semester’s tuition and fees.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay for college tuition and fees.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a hard-working father of three sons and one daughter. His children are all under 18 years old. Mahmoud is a Palestinian National Authority employee; he works to ensure a good living and education to his children. For the last couple of years Mahmoud started working with his wife who opened a small tailoring workshop to help her husband. He is working harder as the conditions in Palestine are becoming harder. 

Mahmoud took a loan from FATEN to purchase cloth needed to answer the increasing demand for his wife's good work. The workshop produces clothes for woman and men in the city of Jenin. 

Mahmoud appears in the picture here at FATEN's office while receiving the loan.

loans.use: To purchase cloth

loans.name: Taghreed

texts.en:
Taghreed is a 40-year-old wife and mother of three sons and one daughter: Du'a, Numan, Imad and Muhamamd who are 16, 15, 12 and 10 years old, respectively. Taghreed and her family live in Rafah city in Gaza Strip. Since the deterioration of life in Rafah when power cuts off often during the day, citizens of Gaza Strip started using power generators to avoid such cut offs.

Taghreed and her husband thought of a skill that is needed under such conditions. Her husband completed a generator repair course and after two years of practice, Taghreed's husband became an excellent handyman in this field and decided to start his own workshop. Therefore he took a $1,500 loan to buy the repair tools he needed. Taghreed's husband appears in the picture in his workshop.

loans.use: To purchase tools to make repairs

loans.name: Suad

texts.en:
Suad S. is a 50-year-old mother and wife. Suad has two sons and one daughter who are all college students. Suad's husband is a National Authority employee who barely covers his housing expenses with his decent salary. Suad wanted to help her husband and started a tailoring workshop in one room of the house. She started fixing and tailoring women clothes as well as producing praying costumes.

Suad is very happy that she started helping her husband and participating in her children's education fees as well as becoming very well known after five years of work.

Suad appears in the picture above, working on the tailoring machine.

loans.use: To purchase cloth

loans.name: Muna

texts.en:
Muna A. is a 40-year-old mother and wife with six sons and two daughters. Seven of her children are school students and the eighth works in a carpet factory and helps his father pay the household expenses. 

Muna's husband works as a taxi driver in Gaza city. He has been in this profession for five years. Muna's husband needed a $1,500 loan, which he took from FATEN, to renew his car's license and perform regular car maintenance. Muna's husband is saving money to be able to buy a better car than the one he stands next to in the picture.

loans.use: To renew his car license and perform maintenance

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To re-decorate his store

loans.name: Suad

texts.en:
Suad is a young wife. Her husband rented a small vegetable and fruit shop in the city of Gaza. Shadi, Suad's husband, was working in a different vegetable and fruit shop. He saved a good amount of money to start his own shop. He started with a small stool until he could rent his own store. Suad wanted to help, so she took a $500 loan that her husband will use to fix the store and prepare it for the goods he will sell. 

Shadi appears in the picture here in front of the store.

loans.use: To fix the store

loans.name: Suhair

texts.en:
Suhair is a 30-year-old wife and mother of three daughters and two sons. Her husband, Ismael, is a plumber who has been working for 10 years.  Ismael has his own workshop.  He does plumbing and installs water networks for new houses and buildings, in addition to selling pieces of water networks.

Ismael is a National Palestinian Authority employee and a plumber. After 10 years, Ismael needed new tools for his profession. Suhair suggested taking a $1,500 loan from FATEN for this purpose.

Ismael appears in the picture at his workshop.

loans.use: To purchase plumbing tools

loans.name: Ikram

texts.en:
Ikram is a 30-year-old mother of two boys and two girls. Her husband, Ahmed, is a carpenter who has his own workshop where he produces home furniture.  Ahmed inherited his father's profession and workshop, which has been in service for 30 years now.

Ikram's husband needed to buy wood as it's the season for preparing houses due to the marriage season. Therefore, she took an $800 loan from FATEN to help her husband. Ahmed is known for his good taste and quality in producing furniture. Ahmed is in his workshop in the picture.

loans.use: To purchase wood for furniture

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
La Señora Rosa Adelaida Anguisaca es socia del banco comunal San Miguel, vive en la comunidad de San Miguel que es perteneciente a la parroquia del Valle,  su gente se dedica  a la agricultura y cría de animales, la mayor parte de su población joven sale a la ciudad a laborar en diferentes oficios y muchos han migrado en busca de trabajo para ofrecerles un mejor futuro a sus hijos.

Doña Rosa es socia de la banca comunal hace 13 años y con los créditos ha podido terminar su casa. Ella trabaja de empleada domestica 4 días a la semana y labora muchos años en esta actividad, para tener otro ingreso económico también se dedica a la cría de chanchos.

La Señora Rosa tiene 34 años, es casada y tiene 4 hijos de 21, 18, 14y 11 años de edad, su primera hija es madre soltera y vive en su casa junto a su nieto de dos meses de edad, su segundo hijo trabaja y le ayuda económicamente, sus dos últimos hijos estudian en el colegio y en la escuela, su esposo es de profesión albañil y con el trabajo y sacrificio conyugal han logrado construir su casa propia.
 
Su nuevo crédito lo va invertir a en la compra de mas chanchos.

Su meta es terminar algunos acabados en su casa.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rosa Adelaida Anguisaca is a member of the San Miguel communal bank, and she lives in San Miguel, part of the Valle parish. People there work in farming and raise animals. Most of the youth go to the city to work in various trades, and many have migrated to look for work and provide a better future for their children. Rosa has been a member of the communal bank for 13 years, and has used loans to finish her house. She has worked for many years as a housekeeper, 4 days a week. In order to have another source of income, she also raises pigs. Rosa is 34 years old, married, and has 4 children (21, 18, 14, and 11 years old). Her oldest daughter is a single mother and lives in her house along with her 2-month-old grandson. The second child works and helps her financially. The other two children are in school. Her husband is a bricklayer, and by hard work and sacrifices, they have been able to build their own house. This new loan will be used to buy pigs. Their goal is to finish some improvements to their home.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Jane Wilkie, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pigs

loans.name: Clara Elvira

texts.es:
La Señora Clara Elvira M. es socia del banco comunal San Miguel, vive en la comunidad de San Miguel que  pertenece  a la parroquia del Valle, su gente se dedica  a la agricultura y cría de animales, la mayor parte de su población joven sale a la ciudad a laborar en diferentes oficios y mucho han migrado en busca de un mejor trabajo.

La Señora. Clara tiene 52 años, es casada y tiene 7 hijos mayores de edad, 5 de ellos son casados y  viven independientemente, su hija casada que vive con ella  comparten gastos del hogar, sus dos hijos solteros estudian y trabajan, su esposo ha emigrado en busca de un mejor futuro para su familia, con el trabajo de toda su vida conyugal han logrado construir su casa propia.

Doña Clara se dedica a los quehaceres domésticos de su hogar y aprovecha para dedicarse a la cría de animales, tiene vacas que le producen leche que la vende en su comunidad, también tiene una pequeña tienda en la que vende solo en los fines de semana.
 
Es socia de la banca comunal hace 10 años y los créditos le han sido de mucha ayuda para que sus hijos salgan  adelante. Su nuevo crédito lo va ha invertir en la compra de más productos para su tienda ya que su meta es crecer en este negocio.
texts.en:
Clara Elvira M. is a member of the San Miguel communal bank. She lives in the community of San Miguel, which belongs to Valle parish. The people there work in agriculture and raise animals. Most of the young people leave for the city to work in different trades, and many have emigrated in search of better jobs. Clara is 52 years old. She is married and has seven adult children. Five of them are married and live independently. One married daughter lives with her and shares household expenses. Her two single children study and work. Her husband has emigrated in search of a better future for their family. With the work of their entire married life they have managed to build their own house. Doña Clara takes care of household chores and works raising animals. She has cows that produce milk which she sells in the community. She also has a small store in which she makes sales only on weekends. She has been a member of the communal bank for 10 years, and the loans have been a great help to her so her children can get ahead in life. She will invest her new loan in purchasing more products for her store because her goal is to make this business grow.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy rice, sugar, oil, eggs and general provisions

loans.name: Nisreen

texts.en:
Nisreen A. B. is a young woman from Dier el Balah married to Osama with no children. Osama is a Palestinian NationA. Authority employee and owns a small grocery store. Nisreen and Osama started their store two years ago.

The store helped Nisreen and Osama improve their income and they started thinking of having kids due to their improved financiA. situation. Nisreen and her husband needed a $1,500 loan, which they took from FATEN to improve their store. She stands in front of her store in the picture above.

loans.use: To improve the store

loans.name: María Dolores

texts.es:
La Señora María Dolores V. es socia del banco comunal San Miguel, vive en la comunidad de San Miguel que pertenece a la parroquia del Valle,  su gente se dedica  a la agricultura y cría de animales, la mayor parte de su población joven sale a la ciudad a laborar en diferentes oficios y muchos han migrado en busca de un mejor trabajo.

Doña María es socia de la banca comunal hace 11 años y con los créditos ha podido iniciar sus negocios, ella se dedica a la cría de animales especialmente de chanchos, hace 6 años también se dedica a una tienda que es de su propiedad, en ella labora desde las 6 a.m. hasta las 8 p.m. todos los días.

La Señora María tiene 30 años, es casada y tiene 2 hijos de 11 y 8 años de edad, su primer hijo  
estudia en el colegio y su segundo hijo en la escuela, su esposo es de profesión albañil y con el trabajo de los dos han logrado construir su casa propia.
 
El  crédito lo va a invertir en comprar más productos para su tienda ya que su meta es seguir creciendo en su negocio.
texts.en:
María Dolores V. is a member of the San Miguel communal bank. She lives in the community of San Miguel, which belongs to Valle parish. Its people work in agriculture and raising animals. Most of its young people leave for the city to work in different trades, and many have emigrated in search of a better job. Doña María has been a member of the communal bank for 11 years, and with the loans she has been able to begin her businesses. She raises animals, especially pigs. For six years she has also had a store that she owns, where she works from 6 a.m. until 8 p.m. everyday. María is 30 years old. She is married and has two sons who are 11 and 8 years old. Her first son attends secondary school, and the second son is in grade school. Her husband is a builder, and working together they have managed to build their own house. She will invest the loan in buying more products for her store because her goal is to keep her business growing.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sugar, eggs, oil, rice and general provisions

loans.name: Ibtesal

texts.en:
Ibtesal is a 36-year-old working woman from Jineen city. Ibtesal started her own project five years ago. She started a Broilers farm. It's been five years since she started working in this field. Ibtesal gave job opportunities to a lot of her family and city women who needed to make a living.

Ibtesal distributes Broilers to stores and shops in the city and has a good number of customers. As the demand is increasing for her product, she took a $1,500 loan from FATEN to purchase chicks and increase the production.

Ibtesal is at FATEN's office in the picture above.

loans.use: To purchase chicks

loans.name: Naser

texts.en:
Naser is a 42-year-old father of four daughters and one son. Naser started a shop selling poultry in Ramallah city. He slaughters and prepares chicken for cooking. Naser also works in the Ministry of Labor. Naser received a loan from FATEN before and has repaid it fully, Naser needed to fix the shop and make a few changes, therefore he took a $1,500 loan from FATEN.

Naser has noticed an increase in his income since starting the shop where he appears in the picture. This has helped him provide his family's needs.

loans.use: To fix the shop

loans.name: Rosenda Guadalupe

texts.es:
La Señora Rosenda Guadalupe I. es socia del banco comunal Yanuncay, vive en por el sector de  Fátima en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es conocida por la belleza natural, su centro histórico, los 4 ríos que la bañan,  su gastronomía y su gente que es muy cálida y amable.

Doña Rosenda tiene  58 años, es casada y tiene 4 hijos que ya son mayores de edad,  son casados y viven de manera independiente, su esposo es de profesión ebanista (trabaja la madera) y tiene su taller propio, gracias al trabajo conyugal han logrado construir su casa propia.

La Señora. Rosenda es profesora de una escuela de la ciudad, lleva 35 años en la docencia, labora medio día y el resto de su tiempo se dedica a su hogar.

Este es su primer crédito, fue invitada por sus hijas que son miembros de la banca comunal, el crédito lo va utilizar en algunas mejoras en su hogar, su meta es  llegar a tener una casita de campo.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rosenda is a member of the Yanuncay Community Bank. She lives in the Fatima section in the city of Cuenca, a city that is known for its natural beauty, its historical center, its four rivers for bathing, its food and its warm and friendly people. Rosenda is 58 years old, married and has four children. The older children are married and live on their own. Her husband is a woodworker and he has his own workshop. Thanks to their work together as a couple, they have constructed their own house. Mrs. Rosenda is a teacher at the school in the city. She has been teaching for 35 years. She works for half a day and then dedicates the rest of the day to her home. This is her first loan. She was invited to join the community bank by her children who are members. She is going to use the loan for home improvement. Her goal is to have a little house in the country.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home improvement

loans.name: María Angelita

texts.es:
La Señora María Angelita V. es socia del banco comunal Yanuncay, vive en por el sector de  Fátima en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es conocida por su belleza natural, su centro histórico, los 4 ríos que la bañan,  su gastronomía y su gente que es muy cálida y amable.

Nuestra socia se dedica a trabajar en su picantería (restaurant) en donde labora de domingo a domingo, empieza su día de trabajo desde las 6 a.m. hasta las 8 p.m., labora en esta actividad desde muy joven y ha sido su mamá quien le ha enseñado a cocinar.
