Doña María tiene 73 años, es viuda hace 14 años y tiene 7 hijos, 6  de sus hijos son casados y viven independientemente, su hija soltera vive en su casa y es quien le ayuda en su negocio, con el trabajo de su juventud ha logrado construir su casa propia. 

Este es el tercer ciclo de Doña María en la banca comunal, su crédito lo va a invertir en productos para su picantería como arroz, azúcar etc., su meta es seguir creciendo en su negocio.
texts.en:
Mrs. María is a member of the Yanuncay Community Bank. She lives in the Fatima section in the city of Cuenca, a city that is known for its natural beauty, its historical center, its four rivers for bathing, its food and its warm and friendly people. Our member works at her restaurant from Sunday to Sunday. She begins work at 6 a.m. and works until 8 p.m. She has been doing this work since she was young. Her mother taught her how to cook. Mrs. María is 73 years old and has been a widow for fourteen years. She has seven children. Six of her children are married and live on their own. Her single daughter lives in her house. This daughter helps her with her business. Because of the work she has performed since she was young, she was able to build her own home. This is Mrs. Maria’s third loan with the community bank. She is going to use the money to buy rice, sugar, etc. for her eatery. Her goal is to continue growing her business.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, meat, eggs, oil, potatoes, etc.

loans.name: Jaqueline Del Cisne

texts.es:
La Señora Jacqueline del Cisne C. es socia del banco comunal Yanuncay, vive en por el sector de  Fátima en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es conocida por su belleza natural, su centro histórico, los 4 ríos que la bañan la ciudad,  su gastronomía y su gente que es muy cálida y amable.

Doña Jacqueline tiene de 41 años, es casada y tiene 3 hijos de 18, 12 y 9 años de edad, su primera hija este año ingresa a la universidad, su segundo hijo está estudiando en un colegio de la ciudad y su ultimo hijo está en la escuela, su esposo es de profesión chofer y labora para llevar el sustento a su hogar en un taxi, con el trabajo conyugal han logrado construir su casa propia.

La Señora Jacqueline se dedica junto con su suegra a preparar y entregar comida, actividad que la realiza hace 10 años, los fines de semana son los días que hay más trabajo y el resto de su tiempo se dedica a su hogar y al cuidado de sus hijos.
 
Se encuentra en su segundo crédito, fue invitada por su suegra a formar parte de este gran grupo de mujeres luchadoras. Su crédito lo va a invertir en repuestos para el taxi.
 
Su meta es  sacar  adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Jacqueline del Cisne C. is an associate of the Yanuncay communal bank. She lives in the Fátima sector of the city of Cuenca. This city is known for its natural beauty, its historic center, the four rivers that bathe the city, its food, and its friendly people. Jacqueline is 41 years old, is married and has three children, ages 18, 12, and 9. Her oldest daughter is in her first year of university. Her middle son is studying at the local city college. Her youngest son attends school. Her husband is a driver and supports the family by driving a taxi. By working together, they were able to build their house. Jaqueline and her mother in law prepare and deliver food and have been doing so for 10 years. They are busiest on the weekends. The rest of the time [Jaqueline] works in the home and cares for her children. This will be her second loan. Her mother in law had invited her to be a part of this great group so struggling women. She will use the money from this to invest in repairs for the taxi. Her goal is to move her family ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Parts and vehicle repair

loans.name: Guillermina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “PROSPERIDAD”; este banco está situado en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Guillermina;  La socia tiene 48 años de edad;  ella es casada y tiene  2 hijos, ella se dedica al comercio minorista, ella vende frutas y verduras a los hoteles; La socia escoge la mejor mercadería en frutas y verduras y las lleva a los diferentes hoteles y restaurantes, en los que ella tiene contrata, ella provee a estos establecimientos. La socia necesita capital de trabajo para su negocio.  La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de productos para proveer a los hoteles y restaurantes. 

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Guillermina is a member of the Communal Bank “Prosperidad” (Prosperity), which is located in the District of Huanchac, Cusco Province, Department of Cusco.

She is 48 years old, married, and has two children. Guillermina is a small businesswoman who sells fruits and vegetables to the hotels. She selects the best produce and delivers it to different hotels and restaurants that have contracts with her. Guillermina acts as a supplier to these establishments. She needs operating capital for her business, so this loan she requested will be used to buy products to supply to these hotels and restaurants.

Guillermina appreciates and values the loan that has been provided. Therefore, she promises to complete her payments by the established deadlines.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fruits and vegetables to supply to hotels and restaurants

loans.name: Carina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “PROSPERIDAD”; este banco está situado en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Carina;  La socia tiene 27 años de edad;  ella es madre soltera  y tiene 1 hijo; se dedica al transporte. La socia tiene una combi la cual trabaja, ella solicita el préstamo para combustible La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de combustible. 

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Carina is a member of the Communal Bank “Prosperidad” (Prosperity), which is located in the District of Huanchac, Cusco Province, Department of Cusco.

She is 27 years old and single mother with one child. Carina owns a minibus that she uses to provide transportation services. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy fuel for her vehicle.

Carina appreciates and values the loan that has been provided. Therefore, she promises to complete her payments by the established deadlines.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fuel for her vehicle

loans.name: Katy

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “PROSPERIDAD”; este banco está situado en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.

She is 30 years old, married, and lives in San Jerónimo with her two children. Katy is a merchant who sells meat at the Vino Canchón Market. She has a vending stall in the red meats section where she sells fresh beef. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy beef in bulk directly from the slaughterhouse.

Katy appreciates and values the loan that has been provided. Therefore, she promises to complete her payments by the established deadlines.

loans.name: Novy

texts.en: Novy B. is a 55-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating a general store business. She lives in Barangay Curva, Medellin, Cebu. Novy has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2007 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her general store business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 10,000. Novy is now borrowing PHP 15,000 so that she can buy stock for her general store. This will be her 6th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 14,500, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Novy aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue in its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by visiting the NWTF lending team on Kiva to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase more stock for her general store

loans.name: Judy

texts.en: Judy P. is a married woman who lives in Barangay 8, Kabankalan City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating a general store business. Her husband, Luis P., who is 51 years old, works as a laborer and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have one child who is now 23 years old. Judy joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2008 because she wished for something better for her family. With the help of her past three loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, she has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 7,000 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of 8,000 PHP, uplifting her family's standard of living. This time, for her 4th loan, Judy is borrowing 15,000 PHP, which she intends to use to buy more stock for her general store so that she can continue to save for the education of their child and to have their house repaired. Judy is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue in its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by visiting the NWTF lending team on Kiva to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase more stock for her general store

loans.name: Adelita

texts.en: Adelita M. is a married woman who lives in Purok Apitong, Barangay Tabugon, Kabankalan City, Negros Occidental. She operates two business ventures: food vending and rice farming. Her husband, Abelino M., who is 60 years old, works as a farmer and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have three children who are from 25 to 33 years old. Adelita joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2004 because she wished for something better for her family. With the help of her past eight loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, she has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 13,000 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of 4,000 PHP, uplifting her family's standard of living. This time, for her 9th loan, Adelita is borrowing 16,000 PHP which she intends to use to buy utensils and supplies for her food stall and fertilizer for her farm. She plans to use her profits to save for future expansion of her agricultural business. Adelita is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue in its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by visiting the NWTF lending team on Kiva to join our team.

loans.name: Lhagvasuren

texts.en:
Lhagvasuren D. is a 42-year-old widower who lives with his four children in the Hovd province of western Mongolia. He started his business selling raw materials at a local market in the western region of Hovd province in 2007.

Lhagvasuren dedicates his life to his children’s happiness. He says, "All I want is to raise my children to be well-educated, good people so that they can have good jobs."

Lhagvasuren is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to buy more raw materials from the countryside to sell, such as sheep and goat skins and leather.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials to sell, such as sheep and goat skins and leather

loans.name: Munhbat

texts.en:
Munhbat G. lives with his wife and two daughters in Hovd province, western Mongolia. His wife is a construction dealer in a company and his two daughters both attend a university.
Munhbat operates a firewood and charcoal selling business at a local market in his town. He has many years of firewood and charcoal trading business experience. Because he started his business in 2006. During the summer season, his business sales are low so he helps his wife with her work. If he receive an order for charcoal, he sells it. 
Now Munhbat received an order for charcoal from Shim Us Co. Ltd. and therefore he needs to have enough funds to supply his orders. He is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan to purchase more coal to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more coal to sell

loans.name: Feliciana

texts.en:
Feliciana  F. is a married woman who lives in Prk. Pungtod, Brgy. Caceres, Oslob, Cebu. She earns her living by operating a retail  business selling frozen food products.  Her husband Rogelio F., who is 46 years old, works as a deliveryman to earn his living.  They have 6 children who are 16 to  27 years old. 

Feliciana  joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2004 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 11 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Feliciana  has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 49,500 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 5000,  uplifting the family's standard of living.  

This time, for her 12th loan, she is borrowing PHP 29,500, which she intends to use to purchase more frozen products to sell so that she can continue to save up for the education of her children. Feliciana  F. is a "Dungganon" woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Munhbayar

texts.en:
Munhbayar D., 27 years old, lives with his wife and two daughters in Hovd province of western Mongolia. His wife, Munhtsetseg, operates a construction business specializing in house decoration and plumbing with help of Munhbayar during the warm season. His two daughters both go to kindergarten. 

Munhbayar started his taxi service business in 2007. In winter time, their construction business stops due to cold weather and so he runs a taxi service in his town to support his family. He bears a good moral character. He says "In the winter season, interior decoration and plumbing businesses stop, and that is why I have to run a taxi service in order to earn a living.   Therefore, he is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan to buy a new car.

loans.use: To buy a new car

loans.name: Ana Belly

texts.en:
Ana Belly S. is a married woman who lives in Bgry. Tuguis, Hinigaran, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating two business ventures:  a general store and a small planters business. Her husband Rolando S., who is 57 years old, works as a laborer to earn his living , and also helps in his wife's business activities.  They have 6 children who are 10 to  23 years old. 

Ana Belly joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2002 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 15 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Ana Belly has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of  10,000 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of  4000 PHP,  uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 16th loan, she is borrowing 13,000 PHP, which she intends to use to buy more stock for her general store so that she can continue to save up for the education of children. Ana Belly S. is a "Dungganon" woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: 

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Sarantuya

texts.en: Sarantuya J. is 26 years old and lives with her husband and four-year-old son in Hovd province of western Mongolia. She and her family live together in an apartment. Her husband is currently working in a thermal power station as an engineer. They are a young couple. Sarantuya has been working as a hairdresser at a hair salon since 2008 and has gained much experience. She plans to open her own cosmetics shop. Sarantuya is a clever woman and works very hard.  She is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase cosmetic products for her newly opened cosmetics shop.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetic products

loans.name: Uuriintsolmon

texts.en:
Uuriintsolmon D. is 45 years old and lives with his wife and son in Hovd province of western Mongolia. The family lives together in a 'ger', a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent, renting someone else's yard. His son, 3, attends a local kindergarten. His wife is an accountant at a Great Mongolia company branch which is located in Hovd province. 

Uuriintsolmon began operating various businesses, all related to automobiles such as a taxi service and car wash as well as tire repair in 2009. He has a good moral character and says " I myself, graduated from secondary school only and don't have any profession so I want to operate my own business to support my family." Uuriintsolmon is requesting 1,000,000 MNT loan to purchase a new car.

loans.use: To purchase a new car

loans.name: Yanjinsuren

texts.en:
Yanjinsuren T., 53 years old, lives with her husband and one daughter in Hovd province in western Mongolia. She and her family live together in a 'ger', a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent.  Her daughter attends a local university and her husband is a  taxi driver. 

Yanjinsuren operates a clothes-making business in her home. She started her own business in 1974. She sews traditional Mongolian style clothing and usually sells it through the countryside. Even though she is an older woman, she still  produces high quality clothes because of her many years of work experience. 

Yanjinsuren is a hardworking businesswoman who is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more fabrics for her sewing business.

loans.use: To purchase more fabrics

loans.name: Darmaabazar

texts.en:
Darmaabazar G. is 58 years old and lives with his wife and one son in Bayanhongor province in Mongolia. Life conditions are normal. His wife receives a pension amounting to 81,000MNT every month. 

Darmaabazar operated a transport business in his local area using his own large Russian transport truck. He used to transport various heavy loads for people and local businesses. Due to old age, he gave up driving the heavy truck and bought new small car after selling his old truck. 

Now he operates a taxi service in his town using his car. He is a friendly and hardworking person and plans to provide tuition fees for his son. Darmaabazar is requesting a 700,000 MNT loan to purchase firewood and resell it.

loans.use: To purchase firewood

loans.name: Jaspher

texts.en:
Jaspher, who has a mixed farm in Nyamira town in western Kenya, has been farming for the last nine years and has employed one farmhand.  His mixed farm produces milk, bananas, maize and beans which he sells at a local market. He also earns income from his hotel business in the same area.

Jaspher is 30 years old and is married with three school-aged children.

He has requested this loan of 45,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He hopes to use the extra income from this loan to pay school fees for his children and to improve the livelihood of the family. In the future, he hopes to acquire more agricultural land and plans to buy five more dairy cows.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Benard

texts.en:
Benard has been practising mixed farming for the last seven years and has employed one farmhand. His mixed farm, which is in Nyamira town, western Kenya, produces maize, milk, coffee and tomatoes which he sells at the local market. He also earns income from his shop and restaurant business in the same location. Benard is 29 years old. He is married and has been blessed with 5 school-aged children.

Benard has requested this loan of 45,000 Kenyan Shillings from Juhudi Kilimo  to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says that he will use the proceeds from this loan to pay school fees for his children. He also hopes to provide enough milk for domestic consumption. His biggest challenge has been pests and diseases which affect his crops and animals.

In five years' time, he hopes to have acquired another piece of land and expand his farm by acquiring more dairy cows.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is a farmer from the town of Nyamira in western Kenya. He has been farming for ten years and has employed two people from his community. His mixed farm produces milk, maize, and tea, all of which are sold at a local market. He also earns income from his brick selling business in the same location.

Richard is 50 years old. He is married and has been blessed with 5 children who are between the ages of 19 and 25. Two of them are currently attending school.

Richard has requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo of 45,000 Kenyan Shillings to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says that the income from this loan will help improve the livelihood of his family and help him pay school fees for his children. He faces the challenge of a lack of ready markets and too much rain, which affects his production.

He appreciates the services that he is receiving from Juhudi Kilimo.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis A. M. is twenty nine years old and married. His wife manages their restaurant and they have three children aged between seven years and two years old and to whom they hope to give good educations up to the university level. 

His business is located at a small market in Kakamega known as Eshitinji. He owns a workshop in which he makes cupboards, couches, and coffee tables, which he sells to the local people. He also owns a restaurant in which he serves food to the same customers. The whole business is known as Third Trial Hotel and Workshop. 

He has been doing this business for ten years now and has four employees. He says that this business is profitable and the major challenge he has is financial constraints and competition. However, he works very hard to keep his business doing well. He is using his loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings to buy timber to use in the workshop to make goods that the customers have ordered. He hopes to grow his business and even diversify to real estate. He describes himself as a visionary man.

loans.use: purchasing lumber for furniture production

loans.name: Roberta

texts.es:
Roberta tiene 48 años de edad, reside en El pedernal, Municipio de Chilanga, departamento de Morazán, es casada, vive con el esposo y cuatro hijos entre las edades de 9-14 años, ella tiene un molino y una pequeña tienda de venta de productos de primera necesidad.
Ella tiene dos años de iniciar el negocio de la tienda y el molino seis meses, atiende ambos negocios de 6:00am- 5:00pm ofreciendo los servicios a los vecinos de la zona, el negocio fue por la necesidad que generar los ingresos para solventar las necesidades de la familia, ella solicita un préstamo para compra de productos para abastecer la tienda ella va invertir en compra de azúcar, frijoles, golosinas, para fortalecer el negocio. Esto contribuirá contar con variedad de producto y mejorar los ingreso atrevas de las ventas.
Los sueños son manejar un negocio estable y exitoso para mejorará las condiciones de vida de sus cuatro hijos.
texts.en:
Roberta is 48 years old and lives in El Pedernal, in the Chilanga municipality of the department of Morazán. She is married and lives with her husband and 4 children, who are between the ages of 9 and 14. She owns a mill and small grocery store. Roberta started the store 2 years ago, and the mill is 6-months old; she attends to both business from 6:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m., serving her neighbors in the area. Roberta started her businesses to generate income to cover her family's expenses. She is requesting a loan to buy products to stock her store with. She will buy sugar, beans, and candy for the business. This will contribute to the store's product variety and improve her income through sales. Roberta's dream is to build a stable, successful business that will improve the lives of her 4 children.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sugar, beans and candy to stock grocery store.

loans.name: Mariya

texts.en:
Mariya is married with a 10-year-old son, Sergyi. She is a market vendor selling men’s footwear and clothing in her home town of Khoost. The merchandise Mariya offers for sale in her kiosk is of good quality and at an affordable price. Mariya has been in business for two years. Presently, her net profit amounts to 1,350 Grivnyas a month. 

Mariya is requesting a 6,500 Grivnya loan to increase the selection of assorted clothing and footwear she offers for sale in her kiosk. She can be characterized as a consistent client and borrower. Her good standing with other market vendors and customers add to her positive reputation as a prospective entrepreneur.

loans.use: to increase her working capital

loans.name: Monika

texts.en:
Monika is a single mom. She has a 9-year-old daughter, Dominika. Monika lives and runs her small enterprise in the town of Beregovo, western Ukraine. She owns a vending facility in a local shopping center called "Image." She sells women’s clothing items and shoes. Monika started this business two years ago. Currently, she has 30,000 Grivnyas in inventory. Her net profit amounts to 6,000 Grivnyas a month.  

Monika is very customer-friendly. She is known for her polite attitude to clients. She resupplies her inventory on a regular basis. Monika is hoping to use a loan of 6,000 Grivnyas to purchase additional clothing and footwear merchandise for further retail sale in her outlet.

loans.use: To purchase additional merchandise

loans.name: Nuria Grisel

texts.es:
Nuria tiene  36 años de edad, vive con sus compañero de vida y tres hijos entre las edades de 13-6 años de edad, el trabaja como albañil y ella se dedica ha elaborar y venta de tortillas de maiz.
Nuria se dedica al negocio de la tortilla desde hace dos años lo cual lo inicio para solventar las necesidades economicas de su familia, el negocio esta ubicado en la casa de habitaciones, inicia la elaboracion de tortillas en horario de 6:00am - 2:00pm los clientes son los vecions y perosnas que transitan por la zona. Ellas solicita un prestamo el cual lo invertira en la compra de una cocina con plancha y sistema de gas, este le permitira salir ha vender al frente de su casa, para atraer mas clientes y mejorar las ventas, esto contribuira mejorar las condiciones de vida de esta familia.
Los sueños son poder darles el estudio a sus hijos para que estos en el futuro tengan un trabajo que les permita tener mejor vida.
texts.en:
Nuria is 36 years old and lives with her life partner and three children, ranging from age 6 to 13. Her partner works as a mason, and she works preparing and selling corn tortillas. Nuria has operated her tortilla business for two years. She began in order to cover her family's economic needs. The business is located in her home, and she begins making tortillas at 6:00 a.m. and continues until 2:00 p.m. Her customers are her neighbors and people passing through the area. She is requesting a loan in order to invest the funds in buying cooking equipment, including a tortilla grill and gas system. This will allow her to go out and sell her tortillas in front of her home, to attract more customers and improve her sales, thus contributing to improving the living conditions of her family. Her dreams are to be able to send her children to the university, so that in the future they will find work that will allow them to have a better life.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying cooking equipment, with a tortilla grill and gas system

loans.name: Ose Roberto

texts.es:
José tiene 30 años de edad. Reside en el Municipio de Santa Elena, Departamento de Usulután, es casado, vive con la esposa y dos hijos de las edades 2y 5 años, el posee una tienda de venta de productos de primera necesidad.
El negocio surgió gracias a la iniciativa de esposo quien le dio la idea de poner el negocio, el atiende el negocio en un horario de 7:00am -6:00pm una de la dificultades que tiene es que no cuenta con el dinero para invertir en la compra de productos. El solicita un préstamo para compra de mercadería como son aceite, azúcar, frijoles, arroz, sopas instantáneas, entre otros, esto le permitirá crecer en el negocio ya que podrá satisfacer en el negocio ya que podrá satisfacer la demanda a los clientes, incrementar las ventas, los riesgos es que los costos se eleven, bajen las ventas, mejorar las condicione de vida de la familia.
Los sueños de José son crecer el negocio y apoyar a su joven familia a solventar las necesidades atreves del trabajo.
texts.en:
José is 30 years old. He lives in the town of Santa Elena in Usulután province. He is married, and they live with their two children aged 2 and 5 respectively. He has a convenience store. The business began thanks to his wife's initiavive; she gave him the idea for the business. He runs the shop from 7:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. One problem he has is that he does not have the money to invest in his inventory. He is applying for a loan in order to purchase merchandise like cooking oil, sugar, beans, rice, and instant soup. These purchases will allow him to grow his business because he will better fulfill his clients demands and increase his sales. The risks are that the cost of products will rise or that sales will go down. He hopes to improve his family's condition. Jose's dreams are to grow his business and support his young family by fulfilling their needs.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise like cooking oil, sugar, beans, rice, and instant soup

loans.name: Larisa

texts.en:
Larisa is married with two children. She sells women's underwear and tights at the local market in Beregovo. Larisa started her business about one year ago. She's got a great location that attracts many clients. Larisa has a hardworking and determined personality. Her goal is to make this business a success and a stable source of income for her family.

Larisa would like to borrow 10,000 UAH to increase her assortment of merchandise. She hopes to receive additional income and invest most of it back into the business.

loans.use: to increase her assortment of merchandise

loans.name: Magdalina

texts.en:
Magdalina is married and sells clothing at an open market called “Belochka” which means “Squirrel”. She started this business three years ago. Today she has many repeat clients that buy clothing from her. Good prices and a large assortment are the keys to success according to Magdalina's definition.

Magdalina hopes to develop her business further and start one more location in the nearest future. She would like to borrow 6,400 Grivnas to purchase more inventory. She hopes to make additional income and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory

loans.name: Diokere Endam Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité DIOKERE ENDAME est créé le 05 décembre 2007. Il est composé de 15 femmes qui sont toutes issues du même village. Les membres du groupe se sont organisés par affinité et par voisinage. Le groupe fait partie du Banc Villageois de SIWAL

Madame ADAMA B., debout à droite sur la photo, enroulée d’une écharpe blanche, est responsable du groupe de solidarité. Elle est âgée de 57 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de quatre enfants. Elle a aussi la charge de quatre autres enfants qui lui sont confiés par des proches.

Elle pratique l'embauche bovine et ovine. Elle achète un bœuf et des moutons avec sa coépouse et elles les confient a leur mari qui les engraisses pendant au moins 5 mois avant de les revendre dans les marchés hebdomadaires

Avec son nouveau crédit elle va acheter un bœuf est des moutons 

Son objectif est de participer à la prise en charge des besoins familiaux, par exemple la nourriture et la santé.
texts.en:
The solidarity group Diokere Endame was created on December 5, 2007. It is made up of 15 women who are all from the same village. The group members know each other through friendship and neighborly ties. The group is part of the SIWAL Banc Villageois. Mrs. Adama B., standing on the right in the photo, wrapped in a white scarf, is the group's leader. She is 57 years old. She is married and has four children. She is also taking care of four other children who were placed in her care by relatives. She fattens cattle and sheep. She buys one steer and some sheep with her co-wife and they give them to their husband who fattens them for at least 5 months before selling them at weekly markets. With her new loan, she will buy a steer and some sheep. Her goal is to take care of her family's needs, for example, food and health.

Translated from French by Manuel Carreiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a steer and some sheep

loans.name: Bokk Xalaat Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité BOKK XALAAT est créé le 05 décembre 2007. Il est composé de 11 femmes qui sont toutes issues du même village. Les membres du groupe se sont organisés par affinité et par voisinage. Le groupe fait partie du Banc Villageois de SIWAL

Madame Fatimata Dikel B., debout à l’extrême droite de la photo, est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 35 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 4 enfants.

Elle fait du commerce de fruits, de  légumes, et de poissons. Elle fait aussi de l’embouche ovine. Pour le commerce de fruits, de légumes et de poisson elle s'approvisionne au marché hebdomadaire du village. 

Son objectif est de participer financièrement à la prise en charge de la famille. Elle cherche également à renforcer son niveau d’épargne.
texts.en:
The solidarity group Bokk Xalaat was created on December 5, 2007. It is made up of 11 women who are all from the same village. The group members know each other through friendship and neighborly ties. The group is part of the SIWAL Banc Villageois. Mrs. Fatimata Dikel B., standing at the far right in the photo, is the group's leader. She is 35 years old. She is married and has 4 children. She sells fruits, vegetables, and fish. She also fattens sheep. She buys her fruit, vegetables, and fish at the weekly markets. Her goal is to contribute to handling the family's expenses. She would also like to increase her savings.

Translated from French by Manuel Carreiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To develop and promote her business

loans.name: Takku Liggey Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité TAKKU LIGGEY  est créé le 05 décembre 2007. Il est composé de 13 femmes qui sont toutes issues du même village. Les membres du groupe se sont organisés par affinité et par voisinage. Le groupe fait partie du Banc Villageois de SIWAL

Madame Awa L., debout tout à fait à droite sur la photo, est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 45 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants en charge. 

Elle fait de l’embouche ovine. Elle achète les moutons au marché hebdomadaire de NGOUBA qui se tient  les lundis
Son nouveau crédit lui permettra d’acheter des moutons à emboucher. Dans le cycle de 6 mois elle peut faire deux opérations. 

Son objectif est de subvenir aux besoins de la famille tout en renforçant son épargne au niveau du Banc Villageois.
texts.en:
The solidarity group Takku Liggey was created on December 5, 2007. It is made up of 13 women who are all from the same village. The group members know each other though friendship and neighborL. ties. The group is part of the SIWAL Banc Villageois. Mrs. Awa L., standing at the far right in the photo, is the group's leader. She is 45 years old. She is married and has 5 children. She fattens sheep. She buys sheep at the Ngouba weekL. market which happens every Monday. Her new loan will allow her to buy more sheep to fattten. In the 6-month cycle, she can do two rounds. Her goal is to meet her famiL.'s needs while increasing her savings with the Banc Villageois.

Translated from French by Manuel Carreiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sheep

loans.name: Bokk Jom Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité BOKK JOM  est créé le 05 décembre 2007. Il est composé de 11 femmes qui sont toutes issues du même village. Les membres du groupe se sont organisés par affinité et par voisinage. Le groupe fait partie du Banc Villageois de SIWAL

Madame Ndèye, debout à droite de la photo, emmitouflée avec une écharpe bleu claire, est responsable du groupe de solidarité. Elle est âgée de 50 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 06 enfants en charge. 

Elle fait de la vente de bétail constitué essentiellement de moutons. Elle fait ses transactions commerciales dans le marché hebdomadaire de sa localité qui se tient tous les lundis.

Avec son nouveau crédit elle aura la possibilité d’acheter régulièrement des moutons lors des marchés hebdomadaires afin de bien mener son activité de vente de bétail.

Son objectif est d’assurer le payement de la scolarité de ses enfants et de participer à l’achat de la nourriture de la famille.
texts.en:
The solidarity group, Bokk Jom was created on December 5, 2007. It is composed of eleven women who are all friends and neighbors living in the same village. The group uses the Village Bank, SIWAL. Mrs. Ndeye, in the front right of the photo, wrapped in a light blue scarf, is responsible for the group. She is fifty years old and a married mother of six children. She sells livestock, consisting mostly of sheep. She conducts these commercial transactions weekly in the local market that takes place every Monday. With her new loan she will have the possibility of buying sheep regularly for the weekly market, in order to better manage her business of selling livestock. Her goal is to be able to pay her children's school fees and to help buy food for her family.

Translated from French by Katherine Evans, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sheep to raise and resell

loans.name: Dioubo Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité DIOUBO  est créé le 05 décembre 2007. Il est composé de 08 femmes qui sont toutes issues du même village. Les membres du groupe se sont organisés par affinité et par voisinage. Le groupe fait partie du Banc Villageois de SIWAL

Madame SEYE D., debout à l’extrême droite de la photo, est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 36 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 06 enfants en charge. 

Elle fait de l’embouche ovine. Elle a commencé à mener cette activité dès son adhésion à l’institution CAURIE-FICROFINANCE. 

Avec son crédit elle va acheter des moutons qu’elle va engraisser pendant au moins 5 mois avant de les revendre dans les marchés hebdomadaires de sa localité. 

Son objectif est d’assurer le payement de la scolarité de ses enfants et de participer à l’achat de la nourriture de la famille.
texts.en:
The solidarity group Dioubo was created on December 5, 2007. It is composed of eight women who are all friends and neighbors from the same village. The group uses the Village Bank, SIWAL. Mrs. Seye D., in the front on the far right of the photograph, is the leader of the group. She is thirty-six years old and a married mother of six children. She raises sheep. She started this business when she started her membership with the microfinance institution, Caurie-Microfinance. With her new loan she will buy sheep which she will feed and fatten for at least five months before reselling them at her local weekly market. Her goal is to be able to pay school fees for her children and to help provide food for her family.

Translated from French by Katherine Evans, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sheep to raise

loans.name: San José Group

texts.es:
El comité se denomina San Jose están en el Segundo Ciclo con 16  integrantes, es un grupo que se destaca  en el barrio por ser muy unido, solidario y responsable, las integrantes poseen un gran espíritu emprendedor, ya que están al día con las cuotas y pretenden terminar esta etapa con muy buen cumplimiento D. responsabilidad con la institución.
 Al adquirir el crédito se le abren muchas puertas para el progreso D. sus emprendimientos.

La Sra. Eulogia P. es una D. las integrantes, ella posee una pequeña granja en la cual con su familia se dedican a la cria y engorD. D. animales como gallinas, patos, cerdos, así también poseen vacas para la producción D. leche, y así también la fabricación D. queso.
El negocio es bastante fructífero, teniendo en cuenta la calidad D. sus productos y animales.
Desea ampliar el negocio mediante la compra D. más animales como pollos (pollitos) para engorD. y a la vez productos balanceados, alimentos para animales, para así aumentar sus ingresos y seguir creciendo con la actividad agrícola.
texts.en:
The community bank called San Jose is in its second loan cycle and has 16 members. It is a group that stands out in the neighborhood for being very united, mutually supportive, and responsible. The members have a great entrepreneurial spirit, since they are up-to-date with their payments and they intend to finish this cycle by continuing to carry out their responsibility to the institution. With the acquiring of the loan, many doors will be opened for the progress of their businesses. Sra. Eulogia P. is one of the members. She has a little farm on which her family raises and fattens animals such as chickens, ducks, and pigs. They also have cows for the production of milk and cheese-making. The business is very productive, taking into account the quality of their products and animals. She wants to expand the business through the purchase of more animals such as chickens (baby chicks) to fatten and also by purchasing balanced feeds for the animals. In this way she wants to increase her income and continue expanding her agricultural business.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Acquire chickens and feed to fatten animals

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es:
Luisa tiene 30 años; vive en casa propia, es casada, vive con su esposo, de 40 años de edad, ella es vendedora de varias mercaderias como edredones, ropas, y otras mercaderias dependiendo de los pedidos o sugerencias que recibe de sus clientes, esta actividad lo ayuda con el ingreso de la familia familiar.
Tienen un hijo, de 10 años quien es estudiante esta en la escuela en el quinto grado.
Luisa emprendió su  actividad por iniciativa propia primeramente vendiendo los sus mercaderias a sus vecinos primeramente a pie casa por casa.

Actualmente posee clientela formada y recorre varios kilómetros en la moto con su sobrino quien trabaja con ella,  a quien le enseña la profesión y a la vez les remunera por sus servicios.

Necesita el crédito para la compra de mercaderías como el edredón, frazadas, pues posee varias demanda por la temporada.
texts.en:
Luisa is 30 years old. She lives in her own house and is married. She lives with her husband, who is 40 years old. She sells various merchandise such as quilts, clothing, and other merchandise depending upon the requests or suggestions that she receives from her customers. This business helps with the family income.

They have a 10-year-old son who is a 5th grade student in school.

Luisa began her business with her own initiative, first selling her merchandise to her neighbors on foot from house to house.

She currently has an established clientele and travels several kilometers by moto with her nephew who works with her. She teaches him the profession and at the same time pays him for his services.

She needs this loan for the purchase of merchandise such as quilts and blankets, since there are several demands due to the season.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of quilts and blankets

loans.name: Eng Kong's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Eng K., 49, is the village bank president, having been selected by its fifteen members who are located in Pratheat village, Kandal province. The members of this village loan will use their portions to support different purposes.

Eng is a widow with five children. Two are seamstresses in a garment factory and one is a laborer, while the others are students in the local public school. Eng is a farmer who owns a plot of land which she uses to cultivate peanuts for a living.

Eng’s house is now old and uncomfortable, so she decided to ask for a loan to buy timber and construction supplies to fix her house up.

loans.use: To buy timber and construction supplies to fix her house up

loans.name: Thann's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thann T. was born in 1957 and was selected as the village bank president by thirteen members of this village bank loan located in Pratheat village, Kandal province. Each member of this group will use their portion of the loan to support their different businesses. 

Mrs. Thann T. is a farmer who owns a plot of land that she uses to cultivate corn and peanuts for a living. Now her house does not have electricity, so she decided to ask for a loan to buy cables and to pay for an electrician. With the remaining cash, she wants to buy a bicycle.

Mrs. Thann T. is a widow with five children: three are seamstresses in a garment factory and the others are students in the local public school.

loans.use: To buy cables and to pay for electrician and buy a bicycle

loans.name: Nhan

texts.en: Nhan T. N. is 29 years old  and has 2 children who attend secondary school. She is a very hard-working farmer. She grows rice in a paddy of 1,440 square meters and raises 8 pigs. She has been a client of our credit program for 7 years. During that time, she has repaid very well. Currently, she wants a loan to buy food and fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy food and fertilizer

loans.name: Khaem's Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of fifteen members, located in Pratheat village, Kandal province. Mr. Khaem K., born in 1948, was selected as village bank president by its members. Each member of this village bank loan will use their portion for different purposes. 
       
Mr. Khaem K. and his wife, Mrs. Lorn Ork, are farmers who own a plot of land that they use to cultivate sesame and peanuts to earn a living. Besides farming, Khaem K. is also a government worker who is able to earn a small salary to support his family. His spouse is also able to earn a small income through their children's selling beautician's goods. 

In order to improve the family's living standard, Mr. Khaem K. will use the loan that he has asked for from AMK to buy more beautician supplies for his children to sell. This couple has six children: Three are seamstresses in a garment factory and two sell beautician goods in the local market while one is attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy more beautician's supplies for his children to sell

loans.name: Zaina

texts.en:
Zaina N. lives in Kalerwe neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is single with four children who all attend school.  Zaina has been in business selling banana leaves for over 10 years, and she works 7 days every week. Zaina sells her products in Kalerwe market and sells both on a wholesale and retail basis.

Zaina has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bundles of banana leaves. The main business challenges for Zaina are  transportation and seasonality.  Her aspirations for her business are to deal in both bananas and banana leaves and to sell wholesale only. Zaina lives in a home that she rents and she has access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses are utility bills, food, and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bundles of banana leaves.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine N. lives in the Kisaasi neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is single and has 6 children, two of whom are in school.   She doesn’t take care of any additional family members. Catherine has a business selling bananas. She has been in this business for over 10 years and works 7 days a week. Catherine sells her products at the market. She has requested a loan of 300,000/= Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bunches of bananas.    
 
The main business challenges for Catherine include thieves and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to see her business grow and to start dealing directly with farmers. She lives in a home that she rents; she doesn't have access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is 28 years old and is married to Annah Wangari. They have one child. His source of income is his motorcycle which he uses to transport people around Naivasha town.  

He started by being employed as a taxi rider before he bought his own motorcycle with his first loan of Kshs 63,000 from KADET.  He paid the loan well and on time.

He is now requesting a second loan with which he will buy another motorbike. He will employ someone else to operate the old one for him. This will greatly increase his daily income.

loans.use: To buy a new motorcycle.

loans.name: Mary Nduta

texts.en:
Mary makes and sells metal products in Naivasha town. Her products include jikos (ovens), metal suitcases and iron sheets for roofing. She is 33 years old, married to Julius G. and they have three children.  

Mary was introduced to KADET by her friend and this will be her second loan. She finished repaying her first loan of Kshs 25,000 well and on time. She now plans to use this second loan to buy raw metals to make more metal suitcases, of which she has run low on stock. The metal suitcases are popular with high school children who go to boarding schools as they can lock all their stuff inside.

loans.use: to make more metal suitcases for sale

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
N. Jackline is a very determined and hardworking lady who is not afraid of diversity when considering business activities that can earn her profit. She is 35 years old and is a happily married lady of 6 children. She been in the agricultural produce business for some years now. She grows food crops like beans, coffee and bananas at Kacence, Rukungiri. She also sells milk and earns 300,000 Ugandan Shillings per month.

This loan is to help her purchase manure for her plantation as she is looking to diversify her business. She did not have start-up capital. This will give her a free ticket to earn more revenue, to cater for her family's basic needs and also to develop a self-sustaining livelihood: she hopes to open up a big store of her produce.

loans.use: to upgrade her plantations by buying manure.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay rent, purchase cereal stock, pay for a business license and purchase fruits for soft drink sales.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. One is in high school and two attend lower classes. Her husband works with the Kenya power and lighting company, contributing to his family basic needs. Mary has been operating her business of selling cloth materials for more than six years. She sells in shops, as wholesale, as retail, at the market, from door to door, and also from home to tailor shops operators and women. With the Kshs 40,000, she wants to purchase a bale of materials and hand bags for resale. She faces high transport costs and seasonality in her business. Her major goal is to become a big wholesaler in future. Mary decided to work with Yehu so as to get a loan to uplift her living standards. She rents a house with electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and hospital bills.

loans.use: To purchase a bale of materials and hand bags for resale

loans.name: Enid

texts.en: Enid N. lives in the Kawala neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is single and has eight children, four of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (mother). Enid has a business of a retail shop. She has been in this business for 10 years, and she works six days out of every week. Enid sells her products in a shop, by means of retail. Enid has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more merchandise like bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap, and small jerycans of cooking oil for her retail shop. The main business challenge(s) for Enid include transportation and defaulters. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to see her business grow big and start selling on wholesale only. Enid lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity and doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent, food and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more merchanandise like bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap and small jerycans of cooking oil

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Dang

texts.en: Dang T. Ngo is 42 years old. She is living with her family in Xuan Non Comune. She is a farmer. Her main income generating activities are rice growing and raising pigs for meat. She has run her business for 5 years. Since joining our credit program in 2003, she has been a good client. Currently, she wants to borrow 6,322,000 VND to invest in pig raising.

loans.use: to invest in pig raising

loans.name: Julian

texts.en: Julian N. lives in the Kawala neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has three children, all of whom are in school.      Julian has a business of a bar.  She has been in this business for 10 years, and she works 7 days out of every week. Julian sells her products from home, by means of wholesale/retail.    Julian has requested a loan of 300,000/= Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more crates of beer,soda and jerycans of local Gin. The main business challenge(s) for Julian include  Seasonality  and defaulters.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to see her business grow big and start selling on wholesale only .   Julian lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity and  piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include rent, food and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more crates of beer , soda and jerycans of local brew

loans.name: Sadagat

texts.ru:
Sadagat A. 45 let. Ona zamujem  i imeyet 4 detey starshaya doch 20 let kotoraya uchitsya v universitete ona nauchilas ot materi shit odejdu, dochka 18 let kotoraya v etom qodu postupila v universitet , sin 16 let kotoriy uchitsya v shkole i zanimayetsya tancami i dochka 14 let kotoraya toje uchitsya v shkole. Sadagat i yeyo semya jivut v Absheron regione. 

Sadagat nauchilas etomu biznessu sshitya u svoyey sosedki kotoraya uvidev chto u Sadagat mnoqo detey posovetovala yey samoy sshivat im odejdu chtobi mnoqo ne tratitsya na neyo. Sadagat reshila nauchitsya u sosedki sshityu. Po nachalu ona shila toka dlya svoix detey no potom mnoqiye uvidev kakiye krasiviye i interesniye odejdi ona shyot , nachali prosit yeyo shit im i tak posle etoqo Sadagat reshila bit partnixoy . Sadagat ochen lubit delat novshestva v svoyey rabote. Seychas ona nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chto bi kupit novuyu shveynuyu mashinu.
texts.en:
Sadagat A. is 45 years old. She is married and has 4 children. The oldest, 20-year-old daughter is studying at a university and learned how to sew clothing from her mother. Sadagat's 18-year-old daughter was accepted to a university this year, 16-year-old son is attending school and learning dancing, and 14-year-old daughter is also attending school. Sadagat and her family live in the Absheron region. Sadagat learned this sewing business from her neighbor, who saw that Sadagat had many children and advised her to make clothing for them herself in order not to spend a lot on it. Sadagat decided to learn how to sew from her neighbor. At the beginning, she only made clothing for her children, but then once others saw how nice and interesting her clothing was, they started asking her to sew for them too. So Sadagat decided to become a seamstress. She likes to create new things in her work. Now she needs 2000 AZN in order to purchase a new sewing machine.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a new sewing machine

loans.name: Mai

texts.en: Mai T. N. is 39 years old and has 2 children who attend high school and secondary school. She runs a shop that serves soft drink and draught beer. She also provides a motor cleaning service. She has been a very good SeDa client for 7 years. Currently, she wants a loan of 9,374,000 VND to invest in her shop.

loans.use: to invest in her shop.

loans.name: Vuong

texts.en: Vuong T. N. is 50 years old. She has a shop that sell fresh fruit. This kind of business, which she started in 2003, provides a stable income with which she can manage her family life. Regarding her attitude to the credit program, she is a very good client. Currently, she wants a loan of 8,938,000 VND to invest in her shop.

loans.use: to invest in her shop

loans.name: Cellestine

texts.en:
Celestine is a married woman with one child who attends a pre-unit class. Her husband is a businessman and he contributes to his family needs. She has been operating her business of selling soft drinks (juices) for the last two years. She sells in a shop to her potential customers: the neighboring community and passersby.

With the Kshs 30,000, she wants to purchase a hair drier and cosmetics for her salon. Celestine faces the major challenge of seasonality in her business. She hopes to have a well-furnished salon in the future. She decided to work with Yehu so as to get loans to modify her business. She rents a house with electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and house rent.

loans.use: To purchase a hair drier and cosmetics

loans.name: Cu

texts.en: Cu  T. T. is 38 years old and has 2 children who are at high school. She has a grocery shop in her village. Her business started in 2000. Since that time, her shop has provided a stable income with which she can manage her family life. As a client of our credit program, she is very dynamic. Currently, she needs 8,938,000 VND to buy products to meet the growing demand of her customers.

loans.use: to buy products to meet customer demand

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine K. lives in the Kisaasi neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has 4 children, three of whom are in school.  Christine has a business selling second-hand clothes. She has been in this business for 6 years and works 7 days a week. She sells her products door-to-door by means of wholesale/retail. Christine has requested a loan of 300,000/= Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bales of second-hand clothes. She also generates additional income through the canteen.

The main business challenges for Christine include seasonality and defaulters. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to see her business grow big and to own a big boutique. Christine lives in a home that she rents; she doesn't have access to electricity and doesn't have access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include rent and food

loans.use: To buy more bales of second hand clothes

loans.name: Lan's Group

texts.en:
Lan T. H. P. is 39 years old. She has 2 children who are attending high school. She is running a shop that sells materials for construction and water pipes. Her business is very good. As a client of Seda credit program, she has effectively used her loans. Currently, she needs a loan to invest in her shop.

Ha N. T. is 35 years old with 1 child. She has a fashion shop. She wants a loan to buy clothing as material.
Hau T. N. is 56 years old. She is managing a range of houses for rent. She wants to have a loan to buy some furniture for the houses.
La  T. N. is 39 years old. She has a fashion shop. She needs a loan to buy more new, designed dresses for her shop .
Van T. C. is 50 years old. She is running a shop that sell clothes for office staff. She wants a loan to invest in her shop.

loans.use: to invest in her shop

loans.name: Hoi's Group

texts.en:
Hoi T. T. is 58 years old and has 2 children who are married. She retired 5 years ago. Since then, she has raised pigs for meat to increase her family's income. Currently, she is raising 8 pigs. Ms Hoi has received 3 SEDA loans and has used them very effectively. She is a very good client. She wants a loan of 5,014,000 VND to buy more pig food.
 
Binh T. K. D. is 51 years old with 1 child. She runs a fashion shop. She wants a loan of 5,014,000 VND to invest in her shop
Hoa T. L. P. is 30 years old. She has a tailor shop. She wants a loan of 5,014,000 VND to buy more clothing and material for her work.
Hanh T. H. T. is 31 years old and has 2 children. She has been running a grocery shop for 2 years. She wants a loan of 5,014,000 VND to invest in her business
Hue T. N. is 47 years old and has 2 children. She has been running a small restaurant serving breakfast and fast food for 7 years. She hopes to receive a loan of 5,014,000 VND to invest in her shop by buying items such as sets of table and a desk.

loans.use: to buy more food for pigs

loans.name: Hadjah

texts.en: Hadjah N. lives in the Kawempe neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is single and has three children, all of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members (orphans).  Hadjah has a business selling snacks like samosas, Chapatti and pancakes.  She has been in this business for six years and she works 7 days a week. Hadjah sells her products at the market at wholesale and at retail. Hadjah has requested a loan of 300,000/= Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more cooking oil, wheat flour and charcoal. The main business challenge(s) for Hadjah include seasonality and defaulters.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to see her business grow big, own a big bakery and a plot of land. Hadjah lives in a home that she rents; she doesn't have access to electricity or piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include rent, food and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more cooking oil, baking flour and charcoal

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase more groceries for her store

loans.name: Twende Mbele Group

texts.fr:
Kabuo Tahirana Jeannine est présidente du groupe reconduit et réélu pour le nouveau cycle de crédit à diriger le groupe  Twende Mbele, elle lève sa main sur la photo, cliente au 16e cycle, âgée de 37 ans, mariée, mère de 5 enfants, tous  vont à l’école. Son mari est petit commerçant, il a une pharmacie installée à Butembo, ville commerciale située dans le territoire de Lubero à plus de 410 km de Goma.
Kabuo Tahirana Jeannine vend des souliers usagers dans le marché central de Virunga, elle a commencé son petit commerce  avec  son fonds propre environs 50$ qu’elle a reçu de son mari. Pendant ce temps, elle vendait des beignets. Après l’éruption du volcan Nyiragongo du 16  au 17 février 2002 qui a détruit complètement toute l’économie et infrastructure de base de la ville de Goma dont elle fut victime, elle a décidé de changer l’activité pour vendre les souliers usagers.  Il y a 8 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Avec  le crédit  de  l’IMF Hekima, Kabuo Tahirana jeannine souhaite augmenter son chiffre d’affaire en achetant 75 pairs de souliers usagers. Le grand défi de cette activité est que  l’écoulement de marchandise (achat de souliers) dépend de circulation de l’argent (revenu de la population). En outre la concurrence des souliers fabriqués en Ouganda/ Kampale perturbe le prix.
En outre,Kabuo Tahirana jeannine fait des petits métiers artisanaux, elle tisse des tapis pour augmenter ses revenus.
Dans le 10 ans, elle ambitionne devenir commerçante grossiste et non plus petite commerçante détaillante. Elle compte s’approvisionner à la source dans le grand centre commercial soit à Kampala ou soit à Butembo.
En plus, Kabuo Tahirana jeannine est locataire, elle aimerait acheter une parcelle et construire, étant donné que  son mari travaille loin d’elle, ceci lui permettra de d’amoindrir  les poids de la charge familiale. 
Kabuo Tahirana jeannine remercie l’IMF Hekima pour  les crédits  qu’elle reçoit sans aucune garantie matérielle car grâce à ces crédits, elle parvient à subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants. 
Ce groupe Twende Mbele  est  composé de 14 membres  femmes dont 1 malade (cliente Matunda J.) et cliente  Kavira E. n'ont pas été visibles sur la photo du groupe. D’où 12 clients visibles sur la photo.
texts.en:
Jeannine Kabuo Tahirana is the president of the renewed and re-elected group for the new credit cycle that manages the Twende Mbele group. She has her hand raised in the photograph, she is a client of the sixteenth cycle, and she is 37 years old, married, and mother of 5 children all of whom attend school. Her husband has a small business, a pharmacy at Butembo, a commercial town situated in the Lubero territory which is over 410 kilometres from Goma Jeannine Kabuo Tahirana sells second hand shoes at the central market of Virunga,she set up her small business with her own money ,a sum of about 50$ that she received from her husband. At that time she was selling fritters. After the eruption of the Nyiragongo volcano from the 16th to the 17th of February 2002 which completely destroyed the economy and the basic infrastructure of the town of Goma, and of which she was one of the victims, she decided to change her activity and sell second hand shoes. She has been doing this for 8 years. With the loan from the IMF Hekima, Jeannine Kabuo Tahirana hopes to increase her turnover by buying 75 pairs of used shoes .The main challenge of this activity is that the sale of merchandise (buying of shoes) depends on the availability of money (the revenue of the population).In addition the competition of shoes made in Uganda/Kampala disrupts the prices. Jeannine Kabuo Tahirana also practises small artisan activities, she weaves carpets to increase her income. In 10 years time, she hopes to become a wholesaler and no longer a small retailer. She aims to obtain her stock from the big commercial centre in either Kampala or Butembo. In addition, Jeannine Kabuo Tahirana is a tenant, she would like to buy a piece of land and build on it since her husband works a long way away from her, and this would allow her to reduce the burden of the family expenses. Jeannine Kabuo Tahirana is grateful to the IMF Hekima for the loans that she receives without any physical security ,for thanks to these loans she can manage to provide for her children. This Twende Mbele group is made up of 14 women members one of whom is ill (J. Matunda) and E. Kavira who are not on the group photograph, which is why there are only 12 clients on the photograph.

Translated from French by Barbara Belli, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of 75 pairs of used shoes

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Khanh's Group

texts.en:
Khanh T. L. is 50 years old and has two children. She is managing a series of small rental houses. She started this business right after she retired in 2000. Her business is developing and improving. That is why she is always an excellent client when it comes to weekly repayments.
Currently, she needs to borrow money to invest in her business by building more small houses for rent.

Thuy L. V. is 40 and has 2 children. He is managing a mechanical workshop. He needs a loan to buy raw materials
Hoai T. V. is 48. She is managing some rental houses. She needs a loan to invest in her business
Quy T. D. is 35 and has only one child. She is running a shop that sells shoes and sandals. She wants a loan to invest in her shop to meet growing customer demand
Lu T. L. is 30. She has 2 small children. She has a workshop that makes steel roller doors. She wants a loan to buy raw materials
Huong T. H. is 46 and has 2 children. She is running a small restaurant that serves breakfast and lunch. She hopes to access a loan to invest in her business.

loans.use: to invest in her business by building more rental houses

loans.name: Paul

texts.en: Paul is a single man who operates a motorcycle business. He has been operating his business for the last three years, at the market and from home. With the Kshs 20,000 he wants to purchase broilers. Paul faces the major challenge of seasonality in his business. He hopes to manage a big farm in the future and to be able to supply to the entire community. He decided to work with Yehu to get a loan to improve his poultry farm. He lives at his rental house with electricity and piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and house rent.

loans.use: To purchase broilers.

loans.name: Hadjah

texts.en:
Hadjah N. lives in the Katanga Wandegeya neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has 4 children, two of whom are in school. Hadjah has a business selling passionfruit. She has been in this business for 5 years and works 6 days a week. Hadjah sells her products at the market. Hadjah has requested a loan of 400,000/= Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of passionfruit. 

The main business challenges for Hadjah include seasonality and defaulters. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to see her business grow big, to start dealing directly with farmers and also to buy a plot of land. 

Hadjah lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and has access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include food and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bags of passionfruit

loans.name: Lona

texts.en:
Lona S. is currently in the business of selling cassava, simsim, onions and beans at the market. She is requesting a loan to stock dried tomatoes and Irish potatoes to sell. 

Lona is 40 years old and is married to a soldier. She has 7 children who go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for her family and to continue paying the school fees for her children.

loans.use: to stock dried tomatoes and Irish potatoes to sell

loans.name: Araba

texts.en:
Araba J. is currently in the business of selling sorghum, beans and maize at the market. She is requesting a loan to stock more bags of maize flour, beans and cassava to sell. 

Araba is 30 years old and is married to a farmer. She has 5 children who go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a store for her goods.

loans.use: to stock more bags of maize flour, beans and cassava to sell

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna A. is currently in the business of selling green vegetables, fish and tomatoes at the market. She is requesting a loan to stock bags of beans, maize flour and other items to sell. 

Anna is 30 years old and is married to a nurse. She has 5 children who go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a shop.

loans.use: to buy stock of bags of beans, maize flour etc to sell

loans.name: Vusal

texts.ru:
Vusal I. 30 let. On ne jenat i jivet vneste s roditelyami i pomoqayet im. Vusal jivet v Fuzuli regione. Vusal ranshe zanimalsya sportom no potom poluchil  travmu i poetomu brosil sport i teper on nachal rabotat. 

Vusal uje 4 qoda imeyet etot maqazin i prodayot produkti pisheqoqo upotrebleniya. Vusal etomu biznesu nauchilsya u svoyeqo otca. Seychas Vusal Nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chto bi kupit produkti dlya pereprodaji osobenno moyushiye sredstva.
texts.en:
Vusal I. is 30 years old. He is not married, lives with his parents and helps them. Vusal lives in the Fuzuli region. He was previously involved in sports, but stopped training due to an injury and started to work. Vusal has had this store for 4 years. He sells food products there. Vusal learned this business from his father. Currently, he needs 2000 AZN in order to buy products for resale, particularly cleaning agents.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of products for resale

loans.name: Thanh

texts.en: Thanh  T. L. is 40 years old and has 5 children. Two of them are at school. Ms Thanh is a  farmer. She grows rice in a paddy of 1,400 square meters. She also raises 400 chicken for eggs. She has run this kind of business for 5 years. Being a client of our credit program since 2005, she has  repaid very well. Currently, she needs a loan of 9,810,000 VND to buy more chicken feed and also to improve her house.

loans.use: to buy more chicken feed and to improve her house.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane N. lives in the Kazo Muganzi lwazza neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has 6 children, three of whom are at school. Jane has a business selling vegetables. She has been in this business for 3 years and works 6 days a week. Jane sells her products, retail, at the market. She has requested a loan of 200,000/= Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO which she will use to buy boxes of vegetables like cabbages, tomatoes and onions.

The main business challenges for Jane include seasonality and transport. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to see her business grow big and to start selling wholesale only. 

Jane lives in a home that she owns; she doesn't have access to electricity.

loans.use: To buy more cabbages, tomatoes and onions

loans.name: Margarete

texts.en: Margarete C. is currently in the business of selling sorghum and cassava flour at the market. She is requesting a loan to stock bags of maize flour and millet flour to sell. Margarete is 35 years old and is married to a husband who works in the service industry. She has 4 children who go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house.

loans.use: to buy stock of maize and millet flour to sell

loans.name: Fatimata Ida

texts.fr: A. Fatimata Ida est née le 13 Avril 1974 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Mariée à AMOUSSOU Bruno, un menuisier, Fatimata Ida est mère de trois enfants, tous scolarisés. Fatimata Ida vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari au quartier Suru-Léré à Cotonou, depuis onze ans. Le couple assure ensemble les dépenses de la famille. Fatimata Ida n'a fréquenté que le cours primaire. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges, Fatimata Ida mène comme activité la vente de friperies, et de façon secondaire, Fatimata Ida vend des tissus, de façon ambulante. Fatimata Ida s'approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Fatimata Ida avait obtenu antérieurement deux crédits qui ont été tous bien remboursés. Dans le but d'augmenter sa clientèle et de mieux répondre à leur demande, Fatimata Ida sollicite un troisième prêt auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Fatimata Ida A. was born 13 April 1974 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Married to Bruno Amoussou, a carpenter, Fatimata Ida is the mother of three children, all attending (or having attended) school. For the past eleven years she has been living with her husband and children in the Suru-Léré borough of Cotonou. The couple share responsibility for family expenses. Fatimata Ida has only been to primary school. To meet her various expenses she has been selling second-hand clothing, and as a side business sells clothing fabrics as an itinerant vendor. She gets her supplies from Dantokpa, Benin’s international marketplace. Fatimata Ida had already been granted two previous loans, both of which were duly repaid in full. She is now requesting a third loan from ALIDé, wishing to increase her customer base and improve her response to customer demand.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy second-hand clothing

loans.name: Huyen

texts.en: Huyen T. D. is 28 years old and has two small children. Ms. Huyen has a workshop that makes wood products, such as tables and desks, on customer order. She has run this kind of business for six years. Since joining the credit program, she has used her loans effectively and repaid very well. She is now requesting a loan of 9,810,000 Vietnamese Dong (VND) to buy material for her workshop.

loans.use: To buy material for her workshop

loans.name: Roda
