texts.en: Roda S. is currently in the business of selling foodstuffs at her restaurant. She is requesting a loan to stock more foodstuffs to cook and sell.  Roda is 40 years old and is married. Her husband is a peasant. She has 3 children who go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house and pay school fees.

loans.use: to stock more foodstuffs to cook and sell

loans.name: Jenifa

texts.en:
Jenifa A. is currently in the business of selling foodstuffs, including Sudanese local beans (ful) and kombo (a vegetable), in her restaurant. She is requesting a loan to stock more foodstuffs to cook and sell in her restaurant. 

Jenifa is 23 years old and is single. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to extend the floor of her restaurant.

loans.use: to stock more foodstuffs to cook and sell

loans.name: Joice

texts.en: Joice T. is currently in the business of selling both dried and fresh fish at the market. She is requesting a loan to stock simsim (sesame paste), onions and tomatoes to sell. Joice is 28 years old and is married. Her husband is a peasant. She has 3 children who go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open a shop.

loans.use: to buy stock of simsim, onions and tomatoes to sell

loans.name: Anh

texts.en: Anh L. N. is 25 years old and has two children. She has been running a cosmetics shop for four years. Her business creates a stable income for her family. Since she accessed her first loan in 2006, her business has greatly developed. She says that the credit program is very well suited to her business. Now, she is requesting a loan of 9,810,000 Vietnamese Dong (VND) to diversify products for her shop.

loans.use: To diversify products for her shop

loans.name: Kheng's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Kheng K., 47 years old, has been selected as the village bank president by its 15 members, who are located in Pratheat village, Kandal province. The members of this village loan will each use it to support their different purposes
.
Mrs. Kheng K. and her husband, Mr. Yeng Yi, are farmers who own 1 hectare of land that they use to cultivate rice for living. This couple has three children: Three are seamstresses in the garment factory and one is attending the local public school. 

In order to support the children who are just working in the garment factory, Mrs. Kheng K. decided to ask for a loan to pay for renting a house and food intake.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to pay for renting a house and food intake

loans.name: Lilias

texts.en: Lilias G. is currently in the business of selling beans, sorghum, maize, groundnut, onions and coffee. She is requesting a loan to stock more bags of sorghum, groundnut and maize. Lilias is 35 years old and is divorced. She has 6 children who go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a permanent house to rent.

loans.use: to stock more bags of sorghum, groundnut and maize to sell

loans.name: Cicilia

texts.en: Cicilia S. is currently in the business of selling dresses, trousers and bedsheets at the market and is requesting a loan to stock saddles and shoes to sell. Cicilia is 35 years old and is widowed. She has 6 children who go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy a sewing machine.

loans.use: to buy stock of saddles and shoes to sell

loans.name: Phuong

texts.en: Phuong T. P. is 43 years old with two working-aged children. She is an experienced farmer, growing rice and raising chickens for eggs. Currently, she is taking care of a rice paddy of 1,400 square meters. She started her business many years ago and has a stable income from it. She joined the credit program with the hope to expand her business effectively. Now, she wants to have a loan of 5,014,000 Vietnamese Dong (VND) to buy more chicken feed.

loans.use: To buy more chicken feed

loans.name: Katerina

texts.en: Katerina S. is currently in the business of selling coffee, simsim (sesame), beans and rice at the market. She is requesting a loan to stock more bags of beans and rice to sell. Katerina is 40 years old and is married to a businessman. She has 3 children who go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a restaurant.

loans.use: to stock more bags of beans and rice to sell

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Betty D. is currently in the business of selling simsim (sesame), beans and local brewed alcohol at home. She is requesting a loan to stock crates of beer to sell. Betty is 30 years old and is married to a business man. She has 2 children who go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build up a bar.

loans.use: to stock crates of beer to sell

loans.name: Margarete

texts.en: Margarete A. is currently in the business of selling tomatoes, fish and onions at the market. She is requesting a loan to stock jerrycans of cooking oil to sell. Margarete is 20 years old and is married to a teacher. They do not yet have a child. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a restaurant.

loans.use: to stock jerrycans of cooking oil to sell

loans.name: Khan

texts.en: Khan P. is married and resides with her husband and two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for Pre-Angkorean Temples. She provides laundry services for an income of USD 3 per day. Her husband is employed at a private company. P. is requesting a loan of USD 1,200 to grow mushrooms at home to generate another sauce of income. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: to grow mushrooms at home

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice J. is currently in the business of selling fish, beans and tomatoes at the market. She is requesting a loan to stock sweet potatoes and Irish potatoes to sell. Alice is 38 years old and is married. Her husband works for MAG (Mines Advisory Group). She has 5 children who go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business by stocking more goods to sell and to open up a restaurant.

loans.use: to stock sweet potatoes and Irish potatoes to sell

loans.name: Urantuya

texts.en: Urantuya D. is a 43-year-old widow who lives with her two children in Hovd province in western Mongolia. Her two children both attend university. She has been managing a dental clinic since 1990. She usually produces dentures for a price of 10,000-80,000 MNT per tooth. She has gained many years of work experience. She travels to the sub-provinces once a month to get customers' requests and to deliver dentures. Traveling through neighboring sub-provinces is very profitable as the service she provides is very rare. She has a good moral character. Urantuya is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to fund traveling to more sub-provinces to provide dental services for her customers.

loans.use: to go to more sub-provinces to provide dental services

loans.name: Meas

texts.en: Meas P., 48, is married and lives with three of her children in the Kampong Cham province. She and her husband are farmers who typically make about US$3 each day and are supported by two children working in a garment factory. The weather conditions have been difficult for farming in Cambodia this past year and, also, inflation has been out of control. These factors have resulted in a difficult economic year for many Cambodians, Meas P. included. In light of these economic difficulties, she is asking for a loan of US$800 to purchase fertilizer and a motorbike. She is confident that this loan will allow her to increase her daily income and to better support her family.

loans.use: To purchase fertiliser and a motorbike.

loans.name: Delphine

texts.fr: F. Delphine est née en 1975 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Mariée à GBETCHOU Robert, Delphine est mère de deux enfants, tous scolarisés. Il y a environs sept ans que Delphine s'est installée au quartier Agbato à Cotonou, où elle vit avec ses enfants et son mari. Delphine vient en aide à son mari et assure avec lui les différentes charges de la famille, grâce au revenu de son activité. Depuis une douzaine d'année, Delphine mène comme activité la vente de divers produits (pâtes alimentaires, huile d'arachide et de palme, couscous, savons, lait, conserves de sardine et de tomate, petits pois, etc.) dans sa boutique à son domicile. Delphine achète ses produits à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. C'est la deuxième fois que Delphine sollicite auprès de ALIDé un crédit, en vue de renforcer son activité et de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle. Delphine a bien remboursé le premier prêt qu'elle a reçu de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Delphine F. was born in 1975 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Married to Robert Gbetchou, she is the mother of two children, both attending (or having attended) school. Seven years ago Delphine settled in the Agbalo borough of Cotonou, where she lives with her husband and children. She assists her husband in taking care of various family expenses, thanks to the revenue generated by her activity. For the past 12 years, Delphine has been active as a retail merchant, selling various products (pasta, peanut and palm oil, couscous, soap, milk, canned sardines and tomatoes, green peas, etc.) in her home-based shop. She gets her supplies in Dantokpa, Benin’s international marketplace. This is the second time Delphine has requested a loan from ALIDé, to strengthen her activity and improve customer satisfaction. She fully reimbursed the first loan received from ALIDé.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy various products (pasta, peanut and palm oil, canned sardines and tomatoes, green peas)

loans.name: Rejina

texts.en: Rejina M. is currently in the business of selling rice, beans, "simsim" (sesame seeds) and millet at the market and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of beans, rice and millet to sell.  Rejina is 40 years old and is married to a husband who is a businessman. She has 8 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for her children.

loans.use: Stock more bags of beans, rice and millet to sell

loans.name: Be's Group

texts.en:
Be H. T. is 54 years old with five children. Four of them are married and live on their own. She has been farming for many years. Her main activities  are growing rice and raising pigs for meat. She sells these agricultural products to earn money. Currently, she wants to have a loan to buy fertilizer, pesticides and pig feed.

Hai T. T. N. is 32 years old with four children who attend high school and secondary school. She is running a small shop that sells fresh fruit and wants a loan to invest in her shop. Thu T. H. N. is 25 years old with one small child. She is providing a taxi service and wants a loan to pay for maintaining her service. Thinh T. N. is 26 years old with two children. She is raising 200 chickens for meat and wants a loan to buy food for them. Quyen T. L. is 33 years old with two children. She is running a shop that serves ready-cooked food and needs a loan to invest in her business.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticides and pig feed

loans.name: Mao

texts.en: Mao L., 38, is a professional tailor, making US$ 3 each day in Kampong Cham province. She is married and has four children living at home to support. Her husband makes approximately US$ 1 every day, growing rice. Mao L. would like a loan of US$ 1000 to purchase a hand tractor for her husband to plow his farmland.

loans.use: To purchase a hand tractor

loans.name: Nim

texts.en: Nim R. is married and resides with his wife and two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for Pre-Angkorean temples. R. is a carpenter and earns an income of USD 7 each per day. R. is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase a motorbike to commute to work. In the future, he would like to use any additional profit to repair his house.  This is his first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia. R.'s wife appears in the photograph because R. was not available.

loans.use: buy a motorbike to commute to work

loans.name: Jacklina

texts.en: Jacklina T. is currently in the business of selling green vegetables, pineapples, jack fruit, etc. at the market and is requesting a loan to stock dried fish, tomatoes and yams to sell.  Jacklina is 21 years old and is married to a husband who is a sub county administrator. She has 5 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for her children.

loans.use: Stock dried fish, tomatoes and yams to sell

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary D.  is currently in the business of selling beans, cooking oil and rice at the market and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of beans and some bags of charcoal to sell.  Mary is 30 years old and is divorced.   She has 2 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house to rent out.

loans.use: Stock more bags of beans and some bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Sm's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Um S., age 60, is the village bank president selected by its ten members who are located in Pratheat village, Kandal province. With their loan, each member of this village bank hopes to increase his or her income to improve the living conditions of their family.

Mrs. Um S. is a farmer who owns a plot of land that she uses to cultivate peanuts and corn for a living. Besides being a farmer, she also makes Khmer cake to sell in the local market. With both her occupations, she is able to earn a small income to support her family. In order to increase her income to improve the family's living conditions, Um S. will use the loan to buy a bicycle for cake transportation and to pay for Khmer cake supplies.  Mrs. Um S. is a widow with a child who is also a Khmer cake seller.

loans.use: To buy a bicycle for cake transportation and to pay for Khmer cake supplies.

loans.name: Soy

texts.en: Soy M. is married and resides with her husband and three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for Pre-Angkorean Temples. She sells groceries for an income of USD 6 per day. Her husband produces rice wine and raises pigs, earning an income of USD 3 per day.  M. is requesting a loan of USD 900 to purchase more groceries to stock her store. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to stock the store

loans.name: Leocadie

texts.en:
Leocadie is 56 years old and has been a widow for a long time. She struggles alone in taking care of her five children who are between 12 and 22 years old.

Leocadie owns a shop where she sells a variety of goods and this is her second successful year in this business.

Although Leocadie has been in this business for about two years, her capital is still too low to expand her business meaningfully. To solve this problem, she needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company s.a. With the use of this loan, she will expand her business through purchasing a large quantity of foodstuffs which are in high demand by a large number of her customers.

If successful, Leocadie will hopefully increase her sales as well as her profits and, in addition to that, she will improve the living style of her family.

loans.use: To buy a variety of goods including foodstuffs

loans.name: Chheng

texts.en: Chheng M., 53, is married and has three children who live at home in the Kampong Cham province. She grows and sells vegetables, typically making US$2 each day. Her husband works in construction. Her husband typically makes about US$3 each day. One of Mrs. Chheng M.'s daughters is a grocery seller. Chheng M. would like a loan of US$1000 to reinvest in her daughter's business. (Chheng M. and her husband were not available for picture so her daughter is pictured instead.)

loans.use: to invest in her daughter's grocery business.

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora is a married woman with one child who attends school. Her husband is employed and he contributes to the family income. She has been operating her motorcycle business and tailoring business for the past six years. She sells from home to her neighbors, in particular ladies' dresses. With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase an overlock and zigzag machine. She faces the major challenge of seasonality in her business. Flora hopes to open a well-furnished shop with modern machines.

She joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business. She owns a home with electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

loans.use: To purchase an overlock and zigzag machine.

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Sok T. is married and lives with her husband and four children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, an area known for its Angkorean temples.

T. and her husband are farmers and earn an income of USD 2 each per day. T. is requesting a loan of USD 1,200 to purchase more fertilizers to improve their farm production. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.

This is T.’s first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to improve her farm production

loans.name: Chem

texts.en:
Chem R. is married and lives with her husband and six childR. in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, an area known for its Angkorean Temples.

R. and her husband are farmers and earn an income of USD 4 each per day. R. is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase cows to help plow her rice fields. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.

This is R.’s first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy cows to help plow her rice fields

loans.name: Em

texts.en:
Em V. is married and lives with his wife and two children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, an area known for its Angkorean temples.

V. buys used motorbikes to resell for an income of USD 8 per day. He is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase a used motorbike to resell. In the future, he would like to use any additional profit to repair his house.

This is V.’s first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a used motorbike to resell

loans.name: Garnik

texts.en:
Garnik T. was born in 1951 and is a retired military man. He lives in Sevkar village, Ijevan area, with his wife and they have three children, all of whom are married and live separately from their parents.

Since 2006, Garnik and his wife have been engaged in selling fruits and vegetable and, since 1995, they have been running a whitener trading business as well. Thanks to incomes from their business they have supported their family, bought necessary furniture for their home, and bought a car which they use to deliver their merchandise to the different villages where they distribute their goods.

Garnik asks for a 900,000 Armenian Dram loan to buy a bigger car for his business, which will allow him to increase his trading and to distribute more merchandize to villages' shops. After buying a new car, Garnik will sell his old car and will invest the proceeds in his business.

loans.use: To buy a bigger car for his business

loans.name: Tan

texts.en:
Tan P. is married and lives with her husband and two children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, an area known for its Angkorean temples.

P. sells traditional cakes for an income of USD 10 per day. Her husband is employed at the commune hall, earning an income of USD 3 per day. P. is requesting a loan of USD 1,100 to purchase more ingredients to produce cakes. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.

This is P.’s second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy more ingredients to produce cakes

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq and is a 40-year-old married man with four children. He used to repair ovens when he decided to open his own business in 2005. He rented a place where, in addition to repairing ovens, he started selling ovens and stove-tops. He has good manners and a good reputation.

He is requesting a loan of $3,000 from Kiva partner, CHF-ACSI. He wants to invest it in renovating his shop and increasing his inventory. He is working on developing his business so he will be able to open another branch and increase his revenues in order to build his house.

loans.use: To renovate his shop and increase his inventory

loans.name: Ouk

texts.en:
Ouk S. is married and lives with his wife and two children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, an area known for its Angkorean temples. His wife is shown in the photo.

S. is a construction foreman and earns an income of USD 7 per day. His wife sells groceries, earning an income of USD 2.50 per day.

S. is requesting a loan of USD 1,200 to purchase more groceries to stock his wife’s store. In the future, he would like to use any additional profit to repair his house.

This is S.’s first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to stock his wife's store

loans.name: Modou

texts.fr:
Monsieur Modou L.  est un jeune électricien  de 37 ans qui vit dans la localité de baye laye. Il est marié et gère une famille. Monsieur L. a une expérience de plus de 10 ans dans  le métier d’électricien qu’il exerce. Il fait aussides branchements de canal  dans son quartier et en même  temps  s’adonne au commerce d’huile de palme. 
 Il a choisi l’activité d’électricien  sous la recommandation de ses parents qui  pensaient que c’est  un métier d’avenir. Il est sociétaire de la caisse de Baye Laye depuis  septembre 2005. Il emprunte 500 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de diverses marchandises (prêts à porter) qu’il va aller revendre au Fouta  durant les périodes de fêtes. Les bénéfices  récoltés de ses opérations  de commerce lui permettent  d’être  autonome et  de répondre à l’attente de ses clients pour qui il pourra préfinancer les chantiers qui lui sont confiés.
texts.en:
Mr. Modou L., 37, is a young electrician who lives in Baye Laye. He is married and responsible for a family. He has 10 years' experience in his trade as an electrician. He also does television hook-ups in his neighborhood and at the same time, he sells palm oil. He chose to be an electrician on the recommendation of his parents who thought that it is an up and coming trade. He has belonged to the Baye Laye branch since September 2005. He is borrowing 500,000 francs to buy various ready-to-wear merchandise that he is going to sell in Fouta during the holiday period. The profit from this business will allow him to be independent and responsive to the needs of his customers for whom he will be able to finance projects in advance.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Ny

texts.en:
Ny S. is married and lives with his wife and three children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, an area known for Angkorean Temples.

S. is a motor-taxi driver and earns an income of USD 7.50 per day. His wife produces and sells traditional cakes, earning an income of USD 14 per day. He is requesting a loan of USD 1,200 to purchase a new motorbike to operate his business more efficiently. In the future, he would like to use any additional profit to repair his house.

This is S.’s first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia. S.'s wife appears in the photograph because S. is not available.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike for his business

loans.name: Yoro

texts.fr:
Monsieur Yoro D. est un jeune tailleur de 35 ans qui habite à Nimzatt      dans la localité de Guediawaye. C’est un chef de famille, marié et père de 2 enfants. Il a aussi en charge deux autres parents sous sa tutelle.
N’ayant pas réussi dans les études, il s’est orienté vers l’apprentissage du métier de tailleur qui est une activité qu’il a choisi par amour. Ainsi depuis 1994 il a commencé à exercer pleinement son métier  et c’est depuis 4 ans qu’il a acquit son propre atelier. Il fait du prêt à porter  et confectionne des boubous  qui sont très sollicités par les nigérians. Monsieur D. est sociétaire à la caisse de Baye Laye depuis le mois de mai 2010. Il sollicite un crédit de 500 000 frs qui sera destiné dans son intégralité à la confection de prêts  a porter. Ce financement pourra contribuer au renforcement  du fond de monsieur D. ce qui lui permettra de répondre à la demande croissante de sa clientèle. L’augmentation de ses bénéfices lui permettra de mieux subvenir à ses besoins de chef de famille.
texts.en:
Mr. Yoro D., 35, is a young tailor who lives in Nimzatt in the Guediawaye area. He is responsible for a family, married, the father of two children. He is also responsible for two other relatives who are his wards. Since he did not succeed in his studies, he took up an apprenticeship as a tailor which is an activity he chose because he loves it. Thus, since 1994, he has been working full time at this trade, and four years ago he got his own workshop. He makes ready-to-wear and "boubous" (long flowing traditional robes worn by men and women) which are much in demand among Nigerians. Mr. D. has been a member of the Baye Laye branch since May 2010. He is requesting a loan of 500,000 francs which will be totally used to fund the creation of ready-to-wear. This loan will bolster the working capital of Mr. D., who will then be able to meet the ever-growing demand of his clientele. The increase in profit will allow him to better support his family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: making ready-to-wear clothing

loans.name: Khudash

texts.ru:
N. Khudash 35 let. On jenat i imeyet 2 detey , sin ktoromu 10 let on uchitsya v shkole i malenkiy sin 6 let on v etom qodu poydet v shkolu. Khudash i eqo semya jivut v Fizuli regione. 

Khudash uje 7 let kak zanimayestya diaqnostikoy i remontom elektrooborudivaniya i kompyuternoqo obespecheniya mashin. Etomu biznesu on nauchislya u svoyeqo otca. Posle smerti otca on nachal rabotat v yeqo masterskoy. Khudash seychas nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit noviy apparat dlya diaqnostiki.
texts.en:
Khudash N. is 35 years old. He is married and has 2 children. His 10-year-old son goes to school, and his 6-year-old son will start school this year. Khudash and his family live in the Fuzuli region. Khudash has been involved in diagnostic and repair of electric and computer equipment for 7 years. He learned this business from his father. After his father's death, Khudash started working at his shop. He now needs 2000 AZN in order to buy new diagnostic equipment.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of new diagnostic equipment

loans.name: Missikatou

texts.fr: O. Missikatou est née en 1977 à sakété dans le département de l'ouémé au BENIN. Missikatou s'est mariée avec BELLO Fatiou qui est un commerçant. Missikatou est mère de quatre enfants qui sont tous en scolarisation. Missikatou vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Missikatou et son mari supportent les différentes charges de la famille. Missikatou a pour activité principale la vente de divers (boites de conserve de sardine et de tomate,pâtes alimentaires,lait, pâte dentifrice, riz, etc.)et pour activité secondaire la vente d'oeufs. Missikatou fait ses achats au NIGERIA, Etat voisin du Bénin, et aussi au CDPA à Cotonou. Missikatou vend ses produits à la maison et a commencée cette activité depuis sept ans. Missikatou sollicite un septième prêt afin d'agrandir son activité et de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle. les six premiers prêts ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
O. Missikatou was born in 1977 in Sakété in the department of the Ouémé in Benin. Missikatou is married to BELLO Fatiou who has a little store. Missikatou is the mother of four children who are all enrolled in school. She lives with her husband and her children. She and her husband share in supporting the family. Missikatou's main business is selling various items (tins of sardines and tomatoes, pasta, milk, toothpaste, rice, etc.) Secondarily, she sells eggs. She buys her goods in Nigeria, a neighbor of Benin, and also at CDPA in Cotonou (Benin). She sells her merchandise out of her home and began her business seven years ago. She is asking for her seventh loan to expand her business and better respond to the demand of her customers. Her six prior loans have been correctly reimbursed.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of various items (tinned sardines and tomatoes, pasta, milk, etc.)

loans.name: Bun

texts.en:
Bun S. is widowed and lives with her three children in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia, an area known as the most populated city in the country.

S. sells soy sauce and vegetables for a gross income of USD 20 per day. She is requesting a loan of USD 600 to purchase more soy sauce and dried vegetables to stock her store. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.

This is S.’s first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy more soy sauce and dried vegetables to resell

location.town: Mean Chey District, Phnom Penh City

loans.name: Erdenetsogt

texts.en:
Erdenetsogt T., 52 years old, lives with his wife, Hishigjargal, and 14-year-old daughter in his own ger (the traditional nomadic housing tent) in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His family has been living together in their current home since 2003. His wife works in a local hospital and his daughter attends a local secondary school.

Erdenetsogt started his own business in 1995 by making metal and steel products in his home. In 2002, he married Hishigjargal and, since, then he has been raising and supporting his wife's children. He still operates his own steel and metalwork business.

Erdenetsogt is a humble and honest person who says, "Last year, I participated in the Gobi Festival - 2009 and received a special prize for my products. This year, I will prepare more and will participate again with improved products."

Erdenetsogt is requesting a 600,000 MNT loan to purchase twenty square meters of black steel and fifteen square meters of colored steel in order to produce steel items such as stove pipes, dippers and pokers and to participate again in the Gobi Festival.

loans.use: To purchase 20 square meters of black steel and 15 square meters of colored steel

loans.name: Mahbuba

texts.en: H. Mahbuba is 50 years old and is divorced with one child. She runs a café where she provides meals of the national cuisine, basically breakfast. The café is located in her community which allows her to have many clients as she has no competitors in her territory. The business has generated a stable income for the last eight years. Now, Mahbuba is planning to purchase foodstuffs for her café wholesale, like wheat, oil, potatoes, carrots, onions and oil. With this purpose in mind, she requests 1,200 USD. Mahbuba had been provided with seven loans by IMON International and has proved herself to be a reliable client. Today she thanks all those supporting her and promises to repay the loan promptly. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase foodstuffs for her café like wheat, oil, potatoes, carrots, onions and oil

loans.name: Antonio Pedro

texts.pt:
Antonio  Pedro B. nasceu na Provincia de Inhambane, Sul de Moçambique tem 41 anos de idade vive maritalmente, é pai de 2 filhos de 4 e 11 anos. todos vão a escola, fez a 4ª classe não concluiu devido a falta de condições, para alêm dos seus filhos responsabiliza se pelos seus dois sobrinhos que vivem com ele em sua casa.  

Antonio e recrutado para cumprir o serviço militar obrigatório durante 3 anos(tempo regular), muda se para o Distrito de Namaacha onde trabalha como ajudante numa carpentaria. Mais devido a sua ambição opta em abrir uma carpentaria em sua casa. tem como melhor encomenda (cama, cristaleira, porta, aparador mesas) tem uma receita mensal de 8,000.00mt a 10.000.00mt dependendo muito mais da clientela. Com os lucrus inicia sua obra que devido ao elevado custo de material não concluiu solicitando assim os emprestimos na Hluvuku para dar a continuidade da mesma.


Este é o quinto  empréstimo de Antonio na Hluvuku e segundo com Kiva no valor de 25.000.00mt.  com o qual pretende  comprar material de  construçao(arros, tijoleiras e cimento) para concluir as minimas partes da sua obra. Os empréstimos anteriores de (5.300.00mt, 8.000.00mt, 12.000.00 e 17.000.00mt) foram usados para a mesma finalidade, esta muito feliz porque em breve mudara para sua própria casa e esta confiante que vai pagar cem nenhum problema porque também recebe uma pensão de 3,260.00mt por mês.
texts.en:
Antonio Pedro was born in the Inhambane Province, South of Mozambique. He is 41 years old and lives in a common law marriage. He has two children who are 4 and 11 years old. Both children go to school. Antonio Pedro went to school until 4th grade and didn't finish due to lack of conditions. Besides his children, he also supports his two nephews who live in his home. Antonio was drafted for mandatory military service and served for three years (regular time). He moved to the Namaacha districted where he started working as an assistant at a carpentry shop. Due to his ambition, he decided to open his own shop at home. His best orders are beds, cupboards, doors, stands and tables. He has a monthly income of 8,000 to 10,000 meticais, depending mostly on his clientele. With his profits he started his construction. He hasn't been able to finish due to the elevated cost of materials and has requested loans from Hluvuku to continue construction. This is Antonio's fifth loan with Hluvuku and second with Kiva in the amount of 25,000 meticais. He intends to buy construction materials (iron, bricks and cement) to finish the basic parts of his construction. The previous loans in the amount of 5,300, 8,000, 12,000 and 17,000 meticais were used for the same goal. He is very happy because he will move to his own home soon. He is also confident he will pay the loan back without a problem because he also has a monthly pension of 3,260 meticais.

Translated from Portuguese by Betyna Almeida-Covarrubias, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase o building materials (iron, bricks and cement)

loans.name: Oimkhol

texts.en:
Oimkhol is married and has one child. She sells nice, quality fabrics for national dresses in a big local market. Oimkhol's family helps her with her business, which she started about 15 years ago. 

Oimkhol would like a loan of $1200 USD to increase her inventory which will help supply her until the autumn.  She believes this timely investment will help her generate additional income and increase her family's budget.

------------------------------------------------

It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing of the new fabrics in order to increase the range of goods for selling.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To make monthly payments

loans.name: Dodaroy

texts.en:
M. Dodaroy, 52, runs a drug store and sells only certified medicines.  It's located in the center of town which allows her to have many customers.  Dodaroy has been in business for over 15 years.  

Dodaroy has been a client of IMON for more than three years.  She requests a 7300 Somoni loan.  Dodaroy says she will repay the loan without any violations.

----------------------------------------------------------------------------
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

Loan has been repaid successfully 

Tillaeva Mehriniso is thankful to Kiva and all the lenders. With the loan she increased the number of her medicine in her drug store that helped her to make her drug store more famous. Mehriniso said, with the profit, she repaired the family house and improved her family living. She is looking forward for more loans from Kiva to further expand her business. Mehriniso thanks once again everyone who supported her as exactly your timely assistance allowed her developing her business.

loans.use: Expanding the business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay monthly tuition and exam fees

loans.name: Rabeca Nhacale

texts.pt:
Rabeca Nhancale Z. nasceu na Provincia de Gaza Sul de Moçambique, casada e é mãe de 5 filhos dos 13 aos 24 anos, somente os três mais novos e que vão a escola. Fez a 4ª classe não concluiu devido a falta de condições, não responsabiliza se por niguem e consegue poupar 1.000.00mt, conta com ajuda do seu marido que trabalha na Africa do Sul.

Rabeca sai de Gaza para o Distrito de Namaacha com sua mãe, Inicia os estudos muito tarde e abandona quando sua mãe perde emprego, Anos depois  junta se com seu esposo e passa a viver numa casa de aluguer, inicia com seu próprio negócio de criação e venda de frangos. Consegue um lucro de  8.000.00mt quando vende a grosso para revendidores, e de 6.000.00mt quando vende por unidade a consumidores locais.

Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, este é o quarto empréstimo  na Hluvuku e segundo  com Kiva, com o qual pretende aumentar a quantidade da sua criação. Os empréstimos anteriores foram  de (9.200,00mt, 7.000,00mt e 10.000.00mt) foram para a mesma finalidade.
Esta confiante que vai reembolsar antes do tempo previsto e pedir um novo emprestimo para construir a sua própria capoeira e sair da capoeira de aluguer.
texts.en:
Rabeca Nhacale was born in Province of Gaza, South of Mozambique. She is married and the mother of 5 children ranging from 13 to 24 years old. Only the three youngest go to school. She went to school until 4th grade but didn't finish due to lack of conditions. She doesn't support anyone and manages to save 1,000 meticais with the help of her husband who works in South Africa. Rabeca left Gaza to the Namaacha District with her mother. She started going to school very late and dropped out when her mother lost her job. Years later she moved in with her husband and started renting a house. She then started her own business raising and selling chickens. She has a profit of 8,000 meticais when she sells wholesale to vendors and 6,000 when she sells by the unit to local costumers. She has never had loans from other banks. This is her fourth loan with Hluvuku and second with Kiva. She intends to increase the amount of chickens she raises. Her previous loans were in the amount of 9,200, 7,000, and 10,000 meticais and were used for the same goal. She is confident she will pay the loan back before it is due and request a new loan to build her own coop and leave the rental coop she uses.

Translated from Portuguese by Betyna Almeida-Covarrubias, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Puchase of chicks and feed

loans.name: Pedro Javier

texts.es:
Pedro Javier B.  es  de la ciudad de Ybycui, tiene 24 años y  está cursando el 5° año de la Carrera de Contaduría Pública en la  Facultad de Ciencias Económicas de la Universidad Nacional de Asunción (UNA) Filial Paraguarí.
El es el último hijo de la familia y el único que aún vive con la madre, tiene dos hermanas una de 28 y la otra de 32 años ambas casadas y con hijos y un tercer hermano que ya falleció hace algunos años en un accidente.
Su madre es comerciante, su padre también ya falleció hace algunos años.
Pedro Javier actualmente trabaja en la Municipalidad de Acahay, como secretario donde se encuentra adquiriendo experiencia laboral.
 El solicita el préstamo para el pago de la matrícula del decimo semestre de  su facultad. 
Pedro agradece el préstamo que la Fundación Paraguaya le otorga, ya que le servirá de gran ayuda para culminar su carrera y cumplir con su metas.
texts.en:
Pedro Javier B. is from the city of Ybycui. He is 24 years old and a 5th year accounting student in the school of Economics at the National University of Asuncion (UNA), Paraguari campus. Pedro Javier is the youngest of his siblings and the only one still living at home. He has two sisters: one, 28 years old and the other, 32 years old. Both are married with children. A brother died in an accident some years ago. His father, too, died some time ago. Pedro Javier lives with his mother who is a merchant. He works as an assistant for the municipality of Acahay where he is gaining workplace experience. Pedro Javier is applying for a loan to pay tuition for his tenth semester at the university. He is grateful for the loan extended to him by the Fundacion Paraguaya because it will allow him to finish his degree and meet his goals.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: University tuition.

loans.name: Gabriela

texts.es:
Gabriela es de la ciudad de Caacupé, tiene 26 años y actualmente se encuentra trabajando en una empresa que se dedica a la venta de electrodomésticos, desempeñándose como cajera y vendedora. 
Ella tiene 5 hermanos 2 de ellos aun en etapa escolar y 3 hermanas también mayores de edad que se encuentran trabajando en distintas empresas como empleadas de las mismas. 
Gabriela se encuentra cursando el segundo año de la carrera de Ciencias Administrativas en la Universidad del Norte. 
Gabriela tiene deseos de realizar un curso de Secretariado Ejecutivo para lo cual necesita un pequeño crédito y en la ocasión decidió apostar en la Fundación Paraguaya y solicitar su crédito para solventar los todos gastos del curso.
texts.en:
Gabriela is from the city of Caacupe. She is 26 years old and works as a cashier and saleswoman for a company that sells appliances. Gabriela has 5 brothers and sisters, two of whom are in school. The other 3 are grown and working for different companies where they are paid employees. Gabriela is in the second year of an Administrative Sciences degree at the Universidad del Norte. She would like to take an Executive Assistant course but she needs a small loan to pay the fees. She decided to approach the Fundacion Paraguay to apply for a loan to pay the course fees.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Course fees.

loans.name: Juan Francisco

texts.es:
Juan es  de la ciudad de Paraguarí, tiene 24 años y  está cursando el 5° año de la carrera Contaduría Pública en la Universidad Nacional de Asunción Facultad de Ciencias Económicas de la ciudad de Paraguarí.
Tiene una hermana que está cursando el primer año de la carrera de Veterinaria, su madre es docente y su padre es empleado público.
Juan actualmente trabaja en COPACO como empleado en el cargo auxiliar técnico.
Juan tiene muchos deseos de terminar su carrera y habilitar su propio estudio contable, para a contar con un buen ingreso y ayudar a su familia.
El solicita el préstamo para   la compra de libros que está necesitando para estudiar.
texts.en:
Juan is from the city of Paraguari. He is 24 years old and a 5th-year accounting student in the school of Economics at the National University of Asuncion in Paraguari. Juan has a sister who is a first-year veterinary student. His mother is a teacher and is father is a government employee. Juan works as a paid employee at COPACO where he is a technical assistant. Juan very much wants to finish his degree and set up his own accounting firm so that he can earn a good income and help his family. He is applying for a loan to buy the books he needs for school.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy books.

loans.name: Gertrudis Antonela

texts.es:
Gertrudis es  de la ciudad de Pdte. Franco, tiene 20 años y  está cursando el 3° año de la carrera de Enfermería y Obstetricia en la Universidad del Norte  (UNINORTE) de  Ciudad del Este. Ella es una joven muy adedica a sus estudios, trabaja en un negocio en el centro de  la ciudad, mediante este empleo ella puede pagar sus estudios y otros gasto que tiene.

Los padres de Gertrudis son comerciantes y están orgullosos de su hija ya es muy responsable y estudiosa y además es hija única en la familia.Ella se  caracteriza como un joven capaz para esta profesión ya que le mediante las practicas en su estudio pudo sentir que tiene vocación y carácter para esta profesión y considera muy importante atender a las personas que necesitan de cuidados para recuperar su salud.

Actualmente quiere aprovechar los créditos ofrecidos por la Fundación Paraguaya para estudiantes ya que ayudara a pagar sus estudios y también ya podrá contar con antecedentes para otros emprendimientos que quiera realizar.
texts.en:
Gertrudis is from the city of President Franco, is 20 years old, and enrolled in her 3rd year in nursing and obstetrics at the Universidad del Norte (UNINORTE) in Ciudad del Este. She is a young person who is very dedicated to her studies and works in a business in the city's center. By means of this job she is able to pay for her studies as well as her other costs. Her parents are merchants and very proud of their daughter who is already very responsible and studious and, in addition, is the only daughter in the family. She is a young person whose character is very appropriate for this profession; seeing her practice in her studies, one can sense that she has a vocation and character for this profession. She considers it very important to attend to people who need care to recover their health. Now she wishes to seize the loan opportunity offered students by Fundación Paraguaya, that will help her pay for her studies and also, help her afford other costs that she wants to cover.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay University fees, including monthly payments and exam fees

loans.name: Muhamadamin

texts.en:
Muhamadamin S. is 49 years old. He is married and has one child.  Muhamadamin sells men’s shoes in the central market of Dushanbe  and has done so for many years and has lots of clients. 

Muhamadamin‘s business is the main source of income for his family. He requests a 7500 Somoni loan to increase the range of goods he sells. Muhamadamin would like to thank everyone for their support and he promises to pay the loan on time.  
 
-----------------------------------------------------

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchass goods for selling.

loans.name: Edith Wairimu

texts.en:
Edith is a 30 year old married mother with one six year old daughter. She has a tailoring business near a Kobil Petrol station in Nairobi, where she makes and sells clothes. She has been in the business for six years and has a number of loyal customers. 

With her loan, she'd like to purchase a sewing machine, buttons, zippers, thread, and other materials for her tailoring business. 

Previously, Edith worked in a boutique and hopes that one day she can be a supplier of ready made clothes in Nairobi and other towns.  She describes herself as social and dreams of one day buying a compound for her children and family.  Edith says she has grown more professional in the management of her business, especially finances, since becoming a member of Faulu Kenya.

loans.use: Buy a sewing machine, buttons, zippers, thread, and other materials for clothes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase new clothes for selling.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is a 46 years old married man with two children in school.  For twenty years, he has earned a living by tailoring and dress-making.  Most of his customers are from his local community.  Peter also does farming to supplement his income.  He has membership with the New Mwala group in Faulu Kenya.  He appreciates Faulu Kenya because his business is doing well.  He has requested for a loan of 50,000 KES to buy fabric.  He hopes to become a wholesaler in the future.

loans.use: Buy fabric.

loans.name: Rosalina Fernando

texts.pt:
Rosalina Fernando D. nasceu na Provincia de Gaza sul de Moçambique, é casada, mãe de 5 filhos com idades compriendidas entre os 6 aos 24 anos de idade, quatro dos filhos é que vão a escola a mais velha já esta empregada. Fez a 6ª classe e não concluiu devido a gravidez, Responsabiliza se pelos seus sogros que vivem com ela.

Depois da sua gravidez começou a trabalhar como empregada domestica, com o valor que recebia iniciou seu próprio negocio de venda de potes e panelas de alumínio. Atualmente é proprietária de um estabelecimento de potes ( panelas de aluminio) no mercado informal que funciona duas vezes por semana (quartas e sabados). Consegue um rendimento de cerca de 9.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum na sua conta bancaria.

Este é o quarto empréstimo de Rosalina na Hluvuku e segundo com Kiva, no valor de 25.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar potes e panelas de aluminio para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria.os empréstimos anteriores foram de 8.200.00mt, 15.000.00mt e 20.000.00mt todos para a mesma finalidade. 

Esta confiante que vai reembolsar antes do tempo previsto e pedir um novo empréstimo para compra de carro que lhe facilitara nos seus trabalhos diários.
texts.en:
Rosalina Fernando was born in the Province of Gaza, South of Mozambique. She is married and has five children ranging in age from 6 to 24 years old. Four of them go to school and the oldest daughter is already employed. She went to school until 6th grade and didn't finish due to pregnancy. She supports her in-laws who live with her. After her pregnancy she started working as maid. With her income she started her own business selling aluminum pots and pans. She currently owns a stand that sells aluminum pots and pans in the informal market that opens twice a week (Thursdays and Saturdays). She makes 9,000 meticais per month and spends it in household expenses and saves some in her bank account. This is Rosalina's fourth loan with Hluvuku and second with Kiva, in the amount of 25,000 meticais. She intends to buy aluminum pots and pans to increase her inventory. Her previous loans were for 8,200, 15,000 and 20,000 meticais and were all used for the same purpose. She is confident she will pay the loan back ahead of time and request a new loan to purchase a car which would help her in her daily work.

Translated from Portuguese by Betyna Almeida-Covarrubias, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of inventory (pots and pans)

loans.name: Deisy Carolina

texts.es:
Deisy es  de la ciudad de Itá, tiene 22 años y  está cursando el 2° año de la carrera de Ciencias Contables en la Universidad del Norte (UniNorte) de la ciudad de Itá. Ella es la segunda entre cuatro hermanos. Su madre es comerciante al igual que su padre.

Deisy actualmente trabaja vendiendo ropas y juguetes para criaturas en un local que comparte  con su madre, donde ella administra sus propias mercaderías que le generan buenas ganancias para sus gastos personales y al mismo tiempo obtiene un ingreso para sus estudios. Realiza viajes en forma semanal en el mercado 4 de Asunción para la compra de sus prendas de vestir y los juguetes le provee su padre de Ciudad del Este mediante los viajes que suele realizar a dicha ciudad.

Deisy tiene muchos deseos de terminar su carrera y ejercer su profesión para contar con mejores ingresos y así forjarse un mejor futuro. Ella solicita el préstamo para el pago de la mensualidad de su facultad. Deisy agradece este préstamo ya que le ayudará en su estudio, además de habilitar una línea de crédito con la Fundación Paraguaya.
texts.en:
Deisy is from the city of Itá, is 22 years old, and enrolled in her 2nd year in Accounting Sciences at the Universidad del Norte (UNINORTE) in the city of Itá. She is the second of four children. Her mother is a merchant, as is her father. Deisy presently works selling clothes and baby toys in a stall she shares with her mother. She has her own merchandise and generates good earnings for her personal expenses and at the same time, obtains an income to pay towards her studies. She travels weekly to the 4th market in Asuncion to buy her clothing items, and her father provides the toys from Ciudad del Este when he travels there. Deisy has a strong desire to finish her studies and exercise her profession, in order to count on a better income and fortify herself for the future. She requests a loan to pay the monthly payments required by her school. She is grateful for this loan, which will help with her studies and establish a line of credit with Fundación Paraguaya.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay University fees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase poultry equipment, computers and to meet internet connection expenses.

loans.name: Mutuku

texts.en:
Mutuku is a 43 year old married man. To earn a living, he sells rope in an open-air market.  He has been in business for ten years.

He requests 20,000 KES to renovate the business premise and to add to his stock of rope.  

Mutuku is looking forward to growing his business with financial resources from Faulu Kenya and to improve his living standards.  In ten years, he wants to have fully established his business and start other businesses.

loans.use: Buy sisal ropes and renovate his business premise

loans.name: Annastacia

texts.en:
Annastacia is a married lady with one child who operates Ebenezer Labour Services.  For a fee she helps people to get employment.  Annastacia has been in business for two years.  She is an enterprising lady who also sells ladies underwear.  

Annastacia has requested a loan of 20,000 KES to repair her computer at the employment bureau and to buy more underwear for resale.

loans.use: Repair her computer and buy underwears for resale.

loans.name: Ozias Andre

texts.pt:
Ozias André M., nasceu no Distrito de Moamba na Provincia de Maputo, é casado, não tem filhos. Concluiu o ensino médio e consegue ingrenar num curso no IFAPA e faz o curso de contabilidade em 3 anos (tempo regular). Vive na casa propria e não sustenta ninguém.

Saiu de Moamba para Namaacha quando seu pai foi transferido, passam a viver numa casa que dista 7km da vila, devido as machambas e criação de animais que possuem naquela zona. Após concluir o curso Ozias casa se e passa a viver com sua esposa na casa que erdou do pai em Maputo. Porém retribuindo o bom gesto pretende construir uma outra casa e curais para o pai que vive em Namaacha. Hoje é funcionario do Municipio com a categoria de Contabilista a 1 ano trabalhando das 7h as 15:30h auferindo 8.030mt que aplica nas dispesas da casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria.


Este é o primeiro empréstimo de Ozias na Hluvuku e Kiva no valor de 20.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, areia, pedra e Outros) para construir uma casa para seu pai. 

Esta confiante que vai pagar antes do tempo previsto e pedir um novo empréstimo para ampliar o cural porque já tem muitos animais e o espaço já não ajuda.
texts.en:
Born in the district of Moamba, in the province of Maputo, Mozambique Ozias André M. is married, with no children. After graduating from high school, he was accepted at IFAPA Maputo (Institute of Public Administration and Management), where he got a degree in Public Accountancy. When Ozias was younger, he moved with his family from Moamba to Namaacha, due to his father's work. There they got a place located 7 km away from the city, where they started to raise animals. This is where Ozias lives now, with his wife. He has been working as a full-time Public Accountant for a year, earning 8.030mt per month, which allows him to support himself and his wife and save some money in the bank. This is Ozias' first loan with Hluvuku and Kiva. He plans to use the 20.000mt. to buy construction material (cement, sand, stones, etc) to build a new house and corral for his father. He's confident that he'll be able to pay back his loan in a timely manner, so that he can apply for another loan to expand his own corral, which is getting too small to accommodate the growing number of animals.

Translated from Portuguese by Aline Pereira, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy construction material (cement, sand, stones, etc)

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a hardworking man who sells doughnuts to earn a living.  It is now three years since he started his business.  He sells doughnuts both in retail and wholesale.  

Peter is 31 years old and has two children who are in school.  He is the breadwinner in his family.  Since he joined Furaha Youth group in Faulu, Kenya, he has been able to save his money.  He is requesting for a loan of 20,000 to buy additional stock in his business.  He also hopes to buy a plot of land and build rental houses in the future.

loans.use: Expand inventory.

loans.name: Eunice Akinyi

texts.en:
Eunice Akinyi A. is a business-oriented lady who sells new clothes and hand bags both from her shop and as a hawker. She is 40 years old and married, with five children aged 24, 22, 19, 17, and 11. Akinyi has been in this business for the past seven years. 

She has been able to improve the living standards of her family from the income she gets from her business where she takes home a profit of about 15,000 thousand Kenyan shillings per month. She also gets additional income from her husband. She lives and operates her business from Eldoret town. 

Eunice is now applying for her third loan term with KADET which she will use to purchase more handbags for sale. She hopes to use the profits to stabilize her business and support those under here care.

loans.use: purchasing store inventory

loans.name: Joselyne

texts.en: Joselyne is a 46-year-old single lady.  For a living, she does tailoring.  She started her business twenty-one years ago.   She hopes to open other outlets for her business in the future.  She also runs a grocery for extra income.  She has requested a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to buy fabric. She dreams of buying a plot in the future.

loans.use: To buy fabric

loans.name: Lylian

texts.en: Lylian is a 30-year-old lady who is married with two children aged 9 and 4.  She sells shoes and clothes to earn a living.  She has been running her business for two years.  She also sells rice to earn extra income.  Lylian hopes to have a permanent business premise in the future.  She also hopes to boost her rice selling business.  She wants to import clothes from the neighboring country, Uganda.  Hence she has requested a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES).  This will be her first loan from Faulu Kenya.

loans.use: To import clothes and shoes for sale

loans.name: Pilpelis

texts.en: Pilpelis sells cakes, tea leaves, sugar, maize flour, and wheat flour next to Kinoo primary school in Nairobi West.  She has been in this business for one and a half years.  Someday, she hopes to open a supermarket.  Since she joined Friends group in Faulu Kenya, she has attracted more customers to her business.  She is requesting 20,000 KES to increase her stock of maize flour, wheat flour, and sugar. She dreams of building rental houses in the future.

loans.use: To add stock of maize flour, wheat flour and sugar

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en: Jacinta is 53 years old and a single mother of three. She has been raising her children with income from her rental houses.  She rents the houses to low-income earners.  Because she is a single mother with all her children in college, she sells charcoal to increase her family's income.  She has been renting the houses for four years and she hopes to build better houses for more income.  Currently, she wants to renovate her houses hence she is requesting a loan of 40,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) from Faulu Kenya.  In five years, she hopes to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: renovating rental houses

loans.name: Xavier Ordem

texts.pt:
Xavier Ordem Gazolinha  nasceu na Provincia de Zambézia, é casado, pai de 3 filhos  de 7 aos 17 anos de idade, todos  vão a Escola. fez o ensino médio não deu continuidade devido a distância que o separa de casa a universidade. Vive na casa propria e  Responsabiliza se pelos seus pais que vivem em zambezia enviando lhes em cada semestre 2.000.00mt.

Xavier é recrutado para tropa, compriu 2 anos, e de seguida é chamado para fazer um curso de formação Básica intesivo nas Forças Armadas.Hoje é Policia com catagoria de Investigador criminal (PIC) trabalha 24 sob 24 horas sendo 2 dias de trabalho e 2 dias de folga consecutivamente, auferindo mensalmente um valor de 5.500.00mt,  com ajuda da sua esposa conseguem construir uma capoeira e iniciar com a criação de pintos para aumentar a renda familiar. Mas como não tinham  fundo suficiente  e com muitas encomendas, assim aproxima a Hluvuku e Kiva e solicita um empréstimo para aumentar o volume da sua criaçao, tem criado por média 4x100 caixas de pintos gastando um valor de 30.000.00mt e tendo de lucro um valor de 10.000.00mt dependendo muito mais das mortalidades e o tempo de venda.


Este é o quarto empréstimo de Xavier na Hluvuku e segundo com Kiva no valor de 22.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar pintos para aumentar a sua criação. Os empréstimos anteriores foram no valor de 14.000,00mt, 15.000,00mt e de 22.000.00)mt foram usados na criação de pintos.
texts.en:
Xavier Ordem Gazolinha was born in the Zambezi province. He is married and has three children ages 7 to 17 who all attend school. Xavier attended school through high school, but did not continue due to the distance from his home to the university. He lives in his own home and supports his parents who live in Zambezia, sending them 2.000.00mt every 6 months. Xavier was recruited to be a soldier. He completed 2 years and then was called to do an intensive basic training course in the Armed Forces. Today he is a police officer with the rank of criminal investigator (PIC). He works two 24 hour shifts followed by two consecutive days of rest, earning 5.500.00mt per month. With his wife's help he was able to build a coop and begin raising chickens to increase his family's income. However, he did not have sufficient funds and had many orders, so he came to Hluvuku and Kiva to request a loan to increase his flock. He has raised 4X100 boxes of chicks, spending 30.000.00mt and with a profit of 10.000.00mt depending greatly on mortality rates and the time of sale. This is his fourth loan with Hluvuku and his second with Kiva. It is for 22.000.00mt which he will use to purchase chicks to increase his flock. The previous loans were for 14.000.00mt, 15.000.00mt and 22.000.00mt, which were also used to raise chicks.

Translated from Portuguese by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase chicks and feed

loans.name: Juliah

texts.en:
Juliah W. Ngugiis is 32 years old, married and a mother of two children, ages thirteen and two. She makes shampoos and detergents. She sells her products to hospitals, hostels and individuals. Juliah has three years of experience in the business. She also farms for extra income.

Juliah has been guaranteed a loan of 20,000 KES by Friends Group in Faulu, Kenya where she is a member. She will use the loan to buy ungerlo, ufacid and industrial salt for production.

loans.use: To buy ungerlo, ufacid and industrial salt (raw materials)

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce M. N. is a single mother of three ages 27, 26 and six. She is a farmer who raises both dairy cattle and poultry for milk and eggs. She sells her products to retail shops and individuals. It is now four years since she started her business, and she hopes to become a supplier of eggs to supermarkets and milk to milk-processing plants.

Since Joyce joined Faulu Kenya, she has developed an open mind to business and has thus attracted more customers. She has requested a loan of 20,000 KES to buy animal feed and vaccines. She dreams of buying more cows and chickens in the future.

loans.use: To buy animal feed and vaccines

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice A. is 54 years old, married and has five children between the ages of 12 and 28. Three of her children are still in school. She sells clothes to earn her daily bread. Most of her customers are low-income earners.

Beatrice has been in business for four years. She considers herself lucky to be a member of Faulu Kenya because she can easily access financial resources. She has requested a loan of 20,000 KES to add to her stock of t-shirts and blouses. She hopes to start selling cereals in the future.

loans.use: To add to her stock of t-shirts and blouses

loans.name: Menesa Mario

texts.pt:
Menesa Mário Mahesse, nasceu na Provincia de Inhambane sul de Moçambique, casada e é mãe de 3 filhos de 5, 14 e 16 anos, todos vão a Escola. Fez a 6ª classe e não concluiu devido a gravidez precosse. Vive na casa propria responsabiliza se pelos seus pais enviando lhes uma sexta basica de 500.000mt por mês.

Saiu de Inhambane ainda criança com seus pais para o Distrito Namaacha, faz a 6ª classe e fica gravida do seu marido, este por sua vez da lhe um fundo para iniciar o seu próprio negócio. Hoje é proprietária de 2 Bancas no Mercado Central onde tem vendido, excepto 4ª e sabados que tem estado no Mercado Informal. Tem vendido (bacias, panelas ,loiças, mesas , cadeiras e mais) gastando 10.000.00mt em cada viagem e tendo de lucro 5.000.00mt. conta com ajuda do seu marido que e funcionario da governo do distrito e do seu empregado que cuida dos negócios na sua ausência que aufere 1.000.00mt mensalmente.


Nunca teve empréstimos com outros bancos, este é o primeiro empréstimo de Minesa na Hluvuku e Kiva no valor de 20.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar (loiça de cozinha, cadeiras, mesas e outros) para aumentar o stock da sua mercadoria.

Esta confiante que vai pagar antes do tempo para aceder a outros empréstimos. O seu grande sonho e terminar a sua obra e mobiliar a casa.
texts.en:
Menesa Mário Mahesse was born in the Inhambane province, in southern Mozambique. She is married and the mother of 3 children ages 5, 14, and 16, all of whom attend school. She attended school through sixth grade but could not continue due to an early pregnancy. She lives in her own home and supports her parents by sending them a sixth of 500.000mt per month. She left Inhambane with her parents when she was still a child and moved to Namaacha. She completed school through the 6th grade and became pregnant by her husband. He gave her money so that she could start her hown business. Today she is the owner of two stands in the Central Market where she sells products, except on the 4th Saturday of the month, when she sells at the Informal Market. She sells basins, pots, tableware, tables, chairs and more, spending 10.000.00mt in each trip and earning a profit of 5.000.00mt. She receives help from her husband who works for the local government and from an employee who takes care of the businesses when she is not there and earns 1.000.00mt per month, She has never had a loan with other banks. This is Menesa's first loan with Hluvuku and Kiva, in the amount of 20.000.00mt, which she plans to use to purchase dinnerware, chairs, tables, etc. to increase her stock of merchandise. She is confident that she is going to pay off the loan early in order to access additional loans. Her dream is to complete construction on her home and furnish it.

Translated from Portuguese by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of tableware, chairs, tables, etc.

loans.name: Zulaika

texts.en:
Zulaika M. lives in Osh city, in the south of Kyrgyzstan.  She is the single mother of two children.  In 1993, in order to find a way to earn a living for her family, Zulaika began her business  in trade. She started selling woman’s clothes at the market using her initial investment of 15,000 KGS. Due to supreme efforts and her strong determination to provide a better life for her children, Zulaika managed to multiply her investment and broaden her business by opening a second sales point at the local market. To widen her assortment of goods, Zulaika got her first loan, which was used as intended and repaid correctly.

Unfortunately, in June 2010, when violent clashes caused by the deposed political regime broke out in the city of Osh, Zulaika lost her business, which was robbed and looted. But Zulaika didn’t give way to despair and braced herself to resume her lost business and continue to work. For this reason, Zulaika is applying for a loan of 135,000 KGS, which she needs to restart her activity.  Zulaika believes that the only way out of different complicated situations is mutual understanding and moving forward together.  

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase woman's clothes for resale

loans.name: Noelia

texts.es:
Noelia R. D. es de Limpio, tiene 20 años y  está cursando el 2ª año de la carrera de Ciencias De La Educación y Matemáticas en la Universidad UTCD de Asunción. Ella tiene 1 hermana y  también se encuentran estudiando en la secundaria. 
Su madre es ama de casa y su padre es constructor de obras. 

Noelia actualmente enseña particular adquiriendo para tener un ingreso y de esa forma ayudar a sus padres quienes solventan sus estudios y con esto ella también práctica su profesión futura. Ella  viaja todos los días en bus hasta su facultad ya que la misma queda alejado de su casa. 

El deseo de Noelia es la de terminar su carrera y trabajar en una institución educativa para brindar los mejores conocimientos que ella se encuentra adquiriendo.

Noelia solicita este crédito para la compra de materiales(Libros) y útiles(folletos, cuadernos) que necesita para su estudio.
texts.en:
Noelia R. D. is from Limpio. She is 20 years old and is in the second year of the Sciences of Education and Mathematics program at the Universidad UTCD de Asunción. She has one sister who is studying in high school. Her mother is a housewife and her father is a construction worker. Noelia currently teaches private classes, earning to have an income and, in this way, help her parents who pay for her studies, and to also practice her future profession. She travels everyday by bus to her school’s campus since it is far from her house. Noelia’s dream is to finish her degree and work in an educational institution to teach the higher knowledge that she is acquiring. Noelia is requesting this loan for the purchase of materials (books) and school supplies (leaflets, notebooks) that she needs for her studies.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of school materials and supplies

loans.name: Vitorino Ernesto

texts.pt:
Victorino  Ernesto M. nasceu na Provincia de  Inhambane sul de Moçambique, casado, é pai de 4 filhos de 5 aos 12 anos, todos eles vão a Escola. Vive na casa propria com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém para alem da sua família.. 

Sai de Inhambane para cumprir o serviço militar obrigatorio e trabalha como guarda presional durante 5 anos. depois faz o curso de Acção Ambiental, é afecto na Agricultura no Distrito de Namaacha como agente de serviço (guarda) e na irrigação das plantas, (17h as 7h) auferindo mensalmente 1.900.00mt. Para alêm de trabalhar na agricultura tem prestado serviços de jardinhagem na Paróquia da Nossa Senhora de Fátima nas 2ª,3ª e 5ª feira no periodo da manhã auferindo 1.000.00mt e nas 4ª e sabados  no mercado informal onde faz seus negócios de venda de material de construção de pequena escala tais como (prego, estribus, fios de energia, quadros e mais).

Este é o terceiro empréstimo de Victorino na Hluvuku e segundo com Kiva no valor de 20.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar (ferro, pregos, quadros de energia e outros) para aumentar a quantidade do seu produto. Os empréstimos  anteriores de (6.000.00 e 10.000.00mt) forão usados para aumentar e renovar o seu estabelecimento comercial (ferragem). 
Esta confiante que vai pagar antes do tempo previsto e pedir um novo empréstimo para criação de pintos.
texts.en:
Victorino Ernesto was born in the Province of Inhambane, South of Mozambique. He is married and the father of four children between the ages of 5 and 12. All children go to school. He lives in his own home with his family and doesn't support anyone other than them. He left Inhambane to comply with mandatory military service and worked as a prison guard for five years. He later took "Environmental Action" classes and was designated as a service agent (guard) and responsible plant irrigation (from 5pm to 7am) in the Department of Agriculture of the Namaacha District making 1,900 meticais per month there. Besides working for the department, he has rendered gardening services at the Our Lady of Fatima Parish on Mondays, Tuesdays and Thursdays mornings making 1,000 meticais. On Wednesdays and Saturdays he works in the informal marked where he has a business selling small construction materials such as different types of nails, power cables, switch boards and more. This is Victorino's third loan with Hluvuku and second with Kiva in the amount of 20,000 meticais. He intends to buy iron, nails, switch boards and other products to increase his inventory. The previous loans in the amount of 6,000 and 10,000 were used to increase the size and renovate her shop (hardware). He is confident he will pay back the loan ahead of time and request a new loan to raise chickens.

Translated from Portuguese by Betyna Almeida-Covarrubias, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of iron, nails, switch boards and others

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.pt:
Maria Luisa D., nasceu na provincia de Maputo, casada, é mãe de 8 filhos de 16 aos 34 anos, somente 3 mais novos é que vão a Escola.
