Fez a 8ª clase do antigo sistema e não teve condições de dar continuidade. Vive na casa do estado com seu marido e responsabiliza se pela sua afilhada que vive com ela em sua casa.

Maria, após o divorcio do seu primeiro casamento, muda se para o Distrito de Namaacha onde teve uma proposta de trabalho e acaba fixando sua residência no mesmo Distrito. Trabalha a mais de 25 anos com a categoria de Técnica de Administração durante 8h por dia auferindo 3.612.00mt que aplica nas dispesas da casa. Conta com ajuda do seu marido que é seralheiro tendo iniciado a sua obra no bairro 25 de junho do mesmo Distrito, aproximando assim a hluvuku solicitando um empréstimo para dar continuidade da mesma.


Este é o terceiro empréstimo de Maria na Hluvuklu e primeiro com Kiva no valor de 20.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (tintas, cimento, barrotes e outros) para conclusão da sua obra. pois já passa muito tempo vivendo na casa cedida pelo estado e esta prestes a mudar se definitivamente para sua próprio residência. 
Compromete se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para poder aceder a outros no futuro.
texts.en:
Maria Luisa was born in the province of Maputo. She is married and the mother of eight children ranging in age from 16 to 34. Only the three youngest go to school. She went to school until 8th grade (in the old system) and didn't have conditions to finish. She lives in government housing with her husband and also supports a goddaughter who lives with her. After the divorce from her first marriage, Maria moved to the Namaacha District where she had a job offer and ended up settling there. She has worked for more than 25 years as an Administrative Technician. She works eight hours a day making 3,612 meticais which she spends in household expenses. Her husband, who is a locksmith, helps her. She started construction in the "25 de junho" zone of the Namaacha District. She reached out to Hluvuku requesting a loan to continue such construction. This is Maria's third loan with Hluvuku and first with Kiva in the amount of 20,000 meticais. She intends to purchase construction materials (paint, cement, beams and others) to finish construction. She has been living in government housing for too long and is ready to move to her own home for good. She pledges to pay this loan on time in order to be able to have access to others in the future.

Translated from Portuguese by Betyna Almeida-Covarrubias, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials (paint, cement, beams and others)

loans.name: Julieta

texts.pt:
Julieta M. nasceu no Distrito de Namaacha, Província de Maputo, é viuva, mãe de 6 com idades compriendidas entre os 6 aos 25 anos.  cinco é que vão a escola. menos o mais velho que trabalha e lhe ajuda com as despesas de casa. Fez a 2ª classe não concluiu devido a falta de condições, não reponsabiliza se por niguem e consegue poupar 1.000.00mt.

Julieta  começou a vender potes e panelas de aluminio, já conta 10 anos a vender no mercado  de Namaacha a céu aberto que funciona duas veses por semana( quartas e sabados). Tem comprado uma media de 10 panelas gastando 12.000.00mt em cada viagem e tendo de lucro 6.000.00mt. conta com ajuda da sua filha que tem lhe ajudado nos dias em que ela se ausenta para as compras.

Este é o segundo empréstimo de Julieta na Hluvuku e Kiva no valor de 10.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar potes e panelas para aumentar a quantidade seu Produto. Os empréstimos anteriores de 8.000.00mt e 10.000.00mt foram usados para a mesma finalidade. Segundo Julieta, quanto mais produtos na barraca, mais clientes se aproximam e mais se vende.

No futuro Julieta gostaria de pedir um novo empréstimo para construir uma barraca em sua casa, onde poderia trabalhar durante os outros dias da semana que o mercado não funciona.
texts.en:
Julieta was born in the Namaacha District, in the Maputo Province. She is a widow and mother of six children ranging in age from 6 to 25. Five of them go to school, except for the oldest son who works and helps with household expenses. She went to school until 2nd grade and didn't have conditions to finish. She doesn't support anyone else and manages to save 1,000 meticais per month. Julieta started selling aluminum pots and pans. She has been selling at the Namaacha twice-a-week open market (Wednesdays and Saturdays) for ten years. She has been buying on average 10 pans, spending 12,000 meticais per trip and making a profit of 6,000 meticais. Her daughter helps her on days she is away to make purchases. This is Julieta's second loan with Hluvuku and Kiva in the amount of 10,000 meticais. She intends to buy pots and pans to increase her inventory. The previous loans, for 8,000 and 10,000 meticais were used for the same purpose. According to Julieta, the more inventory she has, the more clients approach the shop and the more she sells. In the future, Julieta would like to request a new loan to build a stand in her home where she could work on the days of the week the market is not open.

Translated from Portuguese by Betyna Almeida-Covarrubias, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of inventory (pots and pans)

loans.name: Frederico Armando

texts.pt:
Frederico Armando C. nasceu na provincia de inhambane sul de moçambique, vive maritalmente é pai de uma rapariga de 10 anos que vai a escola. Fez a 5ª classe não concluiu devido a falta de condições por parte dos progenitores,vive na casa própria e responsabiliza se pelos seu pais que vivem em Inhambane enviando lhes uma sexta básica de 500.00mt em cada 3 meses.


Frederico muda se definitivamente para o Distrito de Namaacha quando ele começa a trabalhar nas minas de exploração da Pedra Lage(pedra preciosa) e devido a distância leva sua familia para junto dele e do seu trabalho. Porque o material de exploração era precário e assim  ezigia muito esforço, ele abandona  o emprego e inicia um negócio de venda de produtos. Hoje é dono de uma banca em sua casa onde vende produtos de 1ª necessidade (feijao, amendoim, caldo) e mais, tem viajado 2 veses por semana levando consigo uma média de 5.000.00mt e tendo de lucro 2.000.00mt mensalmente que aplica nas dispesas da casa.


Este é o segundo  empréstimo de Frederico na Hluvuku e primeiro com Kiva no valor de 8.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar produtos(amendoim, feijão, óleo,temperos e outros) para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria. O empréstimo anterior foi de 5.000.00mt foi para o comercio.

 Esta muito feliz por ter conseguido alcançar as espectativas de manter seu negócio e vai  reembolsar antes do tempo previsto e pedir um outro empréstimo para construir um estabelecimento e deixar de vender clandestinamente.
texts.en:
Frederico Armando was born in the Inhambane province in South Mozambique. He is in a common law marriage and has a 10 year old daughter who goes to school. He went to school until 5th grade but didn't finish due to his parents' lack of conditions. He lives in his own house and helps his parents who live in Inhambane by sending them 500 meticais worth of groceries every three months. Frederico moved to the Namaacha District definitively when he started working mining precious stones in Pedra Lage. Due to the distance, he brought his family to live close to him and his work. He left his job and started a retail business because the mining equipment were precarious and that demanded a lot from him. He currently owns a store at his house where he sells staples (beans, peanuts, stock). He travels twice a week and takes 5,000 meticais with him and makes 2,000 meticais in profit, which he applies towards household expenses. This is Frederico's second loan with Hluvuku and first with Kiva, in the amount of 8,000 meticais. He intends to buy products (peanuts, beans, cooking oil, seasonings and others) to increase his inventory. The previous loan was for 5,000 meticais went to his business. He is very happy to have met the expectations of keeping his business. He will pay the loan back ahead of time and request another one to build a store and stop selling informally.

Translated from Portuguese by Betyna Almeida-Covarrubias, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of inventory (peanuts, beans, cooking oil, seasonings, and others)

loans.name: Martha Sofia

texts.es:
Martha Páez S. vive en el barrio Santo Domingo al sur occidente de Barranquilla, caracterizado por la celebración de fiestas como helados bailables, bazares y bingos comunitarios; ella es propietaria de la confección Martha que tiene hace mas de seis años, su  condicion de mujer casada y   madre de 3 hijos en las edades de 16 a 24 años hace que dia a dia multiplique sus esfuerzos domésticos y productivos para educarlos muy bien al lado de su esposo. Empezó con una maquina familiar y ha ido surgiendo a través de los años; en la actualidad su negocio es muy prospero y con  el apoyo de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, ha comprado maquinaria para organizar mejor su taller, que funciona en su casa donde confecciona vestidos para damas en la líneas que ellas soliciten.
El Credikiva es  su segundo crédito con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, pues requiere invertir en materia prima, telas, hilos, botones y elásticos y así gradualmente cumplirá  su sueño es ampliar su negocio y algún día ofrecerle posibilidades de empleo a otras personas que viven en su alrededor, para que sus familias prosperen también. Su mayor desafío ocurre cuando aparecen clientes muy exigentes pero esa experiencia seguramente será su base para ofrecer un mejor servicio.
texts.en:
Martha P. S. lives in the Santo Domingo district, to the west of Barranquilla. It is well known for its fairs where you may find ice cream, bazaars and community bingos. She has been the owner of Martha's Workshop for the past 6 years. She is a married woman and the mother of 3 children, between the ages of 16 and 24 years old. She works every day in the home and in her business to educate her children alongside her husband. She started out with the family's sewing machine but she has been improving over the years. Her business has grown to be very prosperous and with the support of Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo (Kiva Field Partner) she has been able to purchase the equipment she needs for her shop. The shop is located inher house where she fashions dresses for ladies in the style they request. This loan is the second through Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo. She requires this new loan to invest in materials such as fabrics, threads, buttons and elastic materials. She will gradually achieve her dream of expanding her business and to one day be able to hire others in her neighborhood, so that their families will also benefit. Her greatest challenge is meeting the expectations of some client's very high expectations. But this experience will surely be the way she can improve her level of service.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in materials such as fabrics, threads, buttons and elastic materials

loans.name: Laurentina Naife

texts.pt:
Laurentina Naife Nhachegul nasceu na Provincia de Inhambane, Sul de Moçambique casada e mãe de um filho que esta a estudar na Universidade pedagógica. Fez a 7ª classe não concluiu devido a falta de condições. Vive na casa própria e não responsabiliza se por ninguém. 

Saiu da cidade natal para Namaacha quando seu pai foi alocado para trabalhar naquele distrito. Tem um negocio próprio de venda de refeições na fronteira da Suazilândia, conta com ajuda de 2 empregadas que ajudam no estabelecimento e em casa. Consegue um rendimento de cerca de 6.000.00mt a 8.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda consegue poupar algum na sua conta bancaria.

Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, este é o terceiro empréstimo na Hluvuku e segundo com Kiva no valor de 8.500.00mt com o qual pretende comprar produtos (refrigerantes e cervejas) para acompanhar as refeições dos seus clientes. Os 2 anteriores empréstimos foram de (6.000.00mt e 10.000.00mt) foram também para a mesma actividade.

Esta confiante que vai reembolsar antes do tempo estipulado e pedir um novo empréstimo para mobilar a sua casa.
texts.en:
Laurentina Naife was born in the Inhambane Province, South of Mozambique. She is married and the mother of one son who goes to college (education). She finished 7th grade but didn't finish school due to the lack of conditions. She lives in her own house and doesn't support anyone. She left her hometown to go to Namaacha when her father was transferred there for work. She has her own business selling meals at the border with Swaziland. She has two employees who help her in her business and at home. She has an income of between 6,000 and 8,000 per month, which does towards household expenses. She manages to save some money in her savings account. She has never had loans with other banks. This is her third loan with Hluvuku and second with Kiva in the amount of 8,500. She intends to buy products (sodas and beer) to accompany her customers' meals. The two previous ones were for 6,000 and 10,000 meticais were used for the same activity. She is confident that she will pay the loan back ahead of time and request a new loan to furnish her house.

Translated from Portuguese by Betyna Almeida-Covarrubias, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise (sodas and beer)

loans.name: Angelino's Group

texts.en:
Angelino S., 50, is married and has eight adult-aged children. He is from the village of Linglingay, part of Angadanan municipality within the province of Isabela on the Luzon Islands. To make a living, Angelino sells fruits and vegetables to the community. He has been in business for over 25 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP monthly. He is also the group leader of a five-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

In 2010, Angelino joined ASKI to gain access to its financial services. He is requesting a loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional produce to sell. He plans to use all additional revenue generated to expand his business.

About ASKI:

Alalay sa Kaunlaran, Inc., or ASKI, is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishermen and -women, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional produce to sell

loans.name: May's Group

texts.en:
May F., 36, is married and has four school-aged children. She is from the village of Disimuray, a part of Cauayan City within the province of Isabela on the Luzon islands. May is just starting to raise pigs for fattening and sale. She is also the group leader of an eight-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

In 2010, May joined ASKI to gain access to its financial services. May is requesting a loan, her first, of 5000 PHP that will be used to purchase piglets to raise and sell in the future. She plans to use all revenue generated to expand her business.

About ASKI:

Alalay sa Kaunlaran, Inc., or ASKI, is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishermen and -women, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase piglets to raise and sell

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Diana P., 34, is married and has four children; her children do not go to school. Her husband is a business man. Diana is currently in the business of selling bread, tomatoes and onions at the local market.

Diana is requesting a loan to stock groundnuts to make groundnut paste. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to send her children to school.

loans.use: To buy groundnuts

loans.name: Tabu

texts.en:
Tabu is a married woman with four children: three girls who are ages 8, 5 and 3, and a boy who is 22 years old. The boy attends college while the other children are still in their lower classes. 

Tabu has been operating her vegetable stall for the past eight years, selling vegetables to her neighbors and passersby. With the Kshs 40,000, she wants to pay college fees for her son, and purchase sacks of potatoes and a sack of coconuts. 

Tabu faces the major challenge of high transportation costs, theft, and seasonality in her business. She hopes to open a retail shop in future. Her major aim of working with Yehu is because of its availability of sustainable financial services to small scale entrepreneurs. She owns a home with no electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is transportation.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of potatoes and coconuts and pay school fees

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary Z. is currently in the business of selling various items in a retail shop, such as boxes of soap, sugar, cartons of salt, etc., and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of sugar and cartons of salt to sell. 

Mary is 42 years old and is widowed. She has seven children, three of whom attend school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for her children.

loans.use: Stock more bags of sugar and cartons of salt to sell

loans.name: Agate

texts.en:
Agate K. is currently in the business of selling dresses, trousers and bedsheets at the market and is requesting a loan to stock more pairs of trousers and some shoes and women's head dresses. 

Agate is 31 years old and is married to a man who works as a driver. She has two children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house to rent.

loans.use: Stock more pairs of trousers and some shoes and women's head dresses

loans.name: Manuel Antonio

texts.es:
Manuel C. es un gran comerciante de 55 años que vive en Palmar de Varela en el departamento del Atlántico, un municipio muy cerca al Río Magdalena, río colombiano de mayor extensión y principal arteria fluvial del país; allí  tiene un expendio donde vende carne de res, vísceras y pescado y también mercancía variada  como vestidos, accesorios; en este pueblo  habita con su esposa, que lo apoya  y sus tres hijos en las edades de 13 a 20 años.
 
Manuel inicialmente vendía vísceras y carne de res en su familia y luego vendió poco a poco a sus vecinos mas cercanos, hasta que  lo organizó con una   mesa en la sala de su casa y agregó pescado, producto que le solicitaron los mismos clientes; fue así como empezaron a comprarle vecinos de otros barrios por la calidad de sus cárnicos y gradualmente ha ido creciendo. Este es su segundo crédito con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual ha podido ofrecer créditos para sus mejores clientes, porque antes contaba con muy poco capital para hacerlo. El tiene como meta adecuar un local para su negocio de cárnicos y en un futuro extender su negocio hacia el centro del pueblo. Hoy  solicita su credikiva para comprar mayor cantidad de productos de carnicería y respaldar su cartera que cada día es mayor, porque sus sueños también están concentrados en su negocio, para mejorar su nivel de ingresos.
texts.en:
Manuel Cabellero is a great salesperson, he is 55 years old and he lives in Palmar de Varela, in the Atlantico region. The municipality is very close to Rio Magdalena, the longest river in Columbia and the primary source of water in the country. He has a stand where he sells beef meat, tripe and fish, as well as various other merchandise such as dresses and accessories. In this village he lives with his wife and their three children, aged between 13 and 20 years of age. Manuel initially sold tripe and beef meat to his family but later he started selling to his closest neighbors. He later refashioned a table in his living room to store fish, a product that was highly sought out by his clients. Clients from other districts started to buy from him, given the high quality of his meat products. He has gradually expanded his business. This is the second loan he seeks through Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo (Kiva Field Partner). He will be able to provide his clients a better service. Prior to this he had very little capital to work with. His goal is to set up a store from where to sell meat products and in the future he would like to move his business to the downtown core of the village. He requests a loan to purchase greater quantities of meat from the butchers to supply his ever growing roster of clients. His dreams are to improve his business, and improve his earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase greater quantities of meat products.

loans.name: Nancy Deifilia

texts.es:
Nancy de 45 años, tiene un pequeño local de comida y también vende cosméticos en una zona periurbana de Duran. Tiene una casa de ladrillos. 

Ella empezó vendiendo platos de comida para tener dinero, poco a poco comenzó hacer comidas típicas hasta que pudo comprar mesas y sillas, ahora trabaja desde las 08h30am hasta las 14h30pm. Para tener mas ingresos ella vende cosméticos a sus clientes del comedor.  

Para poder agrandar mas su negocio ella quiere comprar cosméticos para vender a sus clientes. En el futuro quiere hacer nuevos platos para sus clientes y tener un negocio mas grande.
texts.en:
Nancy is 45 years old. She has a small restaurant and she sells cosmetics in the suburban region of Duran. She has a house made of bricks. She started selling prepared foods to have a source of income but slowly she started to make a wider variety of traditional foods until she was able to purchase tables and chairs. She works from 8:30 in the mornign until 2:30 in the afternoon. To supplement her income she sells cosmetics to the clients that visit her restaurant. In order to expand her business she would like to purchase more cosmetics to sell to her clients. In the future she would like to add to her menu, and to have a larger business.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics.

loans.name: Bonface

texts.en:
Bonface is 29 years old, married and a father of three. He is a mechanic by profession. He repairs vehicles in a busy environment and has three employees. He has operated the business for three years.  

Bonface joined Faulu Kenya under the Ukilyo group. Since then, he has been able to employ casual workers in his business. He has previously serviced two loans from Faulu Kenya. Currently, he is requesting for a loan of 80,000 KES to buy paint and vehicle spare parts. He hopes to expand his business so as to make more profit. In five years, he wants to have his own business premises instead of renting.

loans.use: To buy paint and vehicle spare parts

loans.name: Penina

texts.en:
Penina is a 51-year-old mother of six children, ages 30, 28, 26, 23, 22 and 18. Five of her children are still in school. 

Penina operates Sembe Millers. She has eight years of experience in the business. She has two employees. She was previously earning her income from dry cleaning services. Penina registered as a member of Faulu Kenya under a group called Container. She appreciates Faulu Kenya because her businesss has expanded, hence she has been able to educate her children. 

She has requested a loan of 75,000 Kes, which she will use to buy maize for milling. She hopes to open another business outlet in five years.

loans.use: To buy maize for milling

loans.name: Joice

texts.en:
Joice L. is currently in the business of selling bags of charcoal at her home and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of charcoal.  

Joice is 67 years old and is widowed. She has eight children, and her children do not go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for her children.

loans.use: Stock more bags of charcoal at her home

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a member of Bumbani group under Faulu Kenya. He is 40 years old and a father of three. 

David is the breadwinner in his family. For 18 years, he has been running DK Furniture shop and has three employees. Besides that, he does farming to supplement his family’s income. He was previously employed and at the same time, he was running a salon and a cafeteria. 

David had previously taken out two loans from Faulu Kenya with the support of his group members. Through the loans, he has managed to pay school fees for his children. He has requested a loan of 70,000 Kes, which he will use to buy timber. He hopes to make more furniture for display in his show room. In ten years, he wants to own a vehicle for transporting furniture.

loans.use: To buy timber to make furniture

loans.name: Charity

texts.en:
Charity is 32 years old, married and blessed with one child. For 11 years, she has been running Amazing Grace Tailoring shop. She has only one employee. She has membership with Faith Imani Group in Faulu Kenya. She appreciates Faulu Kenya for helping her get capital for running her business. 

Charity is requesting a loan of 60,000 KES, which she will use to buy fabric. She hopes to build her own house in the future. In ten years, she sees herself employing more people in her business.

loans.use: To buy fabric

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary J. is currently in the business of selling tomatoes, cooking oil and maize flour, and is requesting a loan to stock bags of beans, rice and pulses to sell. Mary is 41 years old and is married to a policeman. She has four children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay the school fees for her children.

loans.use: Stock bags of beans, rice  and pulses to sell

loans.name: Violet

texts.en:
Violet runs Joyous Salon to earn a living. She has had the business for five years. She has three employees. She has been able to grow her busines using the loans she gets from Faulu Kenya thanks to Bumbani Group in Faulu Kenya, of whom she is a member; the group members are her guarantors. 

Violet has requested a loan of 60,000 Kes to buy beauty products. Violet is 33 years old and a mother of two children who go to school, and she is married to a security officer.

loans.use: To buy beauty products

loans.name: Viola

texts.en:
Viola K. is currently in the business of baking and selling local Sudanese bread (legemat) at the market, and is requesting a loan to stock more baking flour and cooking oil. 

Viola is 34 years old and is married to a soldier. She has three children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a big bakery.

loans.use: Stock more baking flour and cooking oil

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is 29 years old and a single mother of two.  She runs a salon to earn a living. She was previously selling clothes and plastic containers to earn an income. 

Joyce is a registered member of Faulu Kenya under Quotet Group. Through Faulu Kenya, she was able to open up her salon, which is two years old.  She has requested a loan of 40,000 Kes to add stock of beauty products. She hopes to improve upon her former business for selling clothes and plastic containers. In ten years, she wants to have built rental houses.

loans.use: To add stock of beauty products

loans.name: Alphonia

texts.en: Alphonia K. is currently in the business of selling dried fish, green vegetables, tomatoes and onions at her home and is requesting a loan to stock more dried fish to sell. Alphonia is married to a man who works as a driver. She has one child who does not attend school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a restaurant.

loans.use: Stock more dried fish to sell

loans.name: Lala

texts.en: Lala J. is currently in the business of selling local brew and crates of beer at the bar and is requesting a loan to stock more crates of beer and soda to sell. Lala is 47 years old and is married to a mechanic. She has four children who attend school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to extend the floor of her bar.

loans.use: Stock more crates of beer and soda to sell

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose A. is currently in the business of selling bags of maize, sorghum, millet, beans and rice at the market, and is requesting a loan to stock bags of maize flour and more bags of beans and rice to sell. Rose is 41 years old and is married to a peasant. She has three children who attend school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for her family and open up a restaurant.

loans.use: Stock bags of maize flour and more bags of beans and rice to sell

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.es:
El señor Guillermo  vive en casa propia en la zona de villa nuevo Potosí de la ciudad de La Paz; está casado, tiene dos hijos de los cuales uno ya es profesional y el otro esta estudiando medicina. Los ingresos que Guillermo percibe son de una editorial ya que el es grafico y la esposa trabaja independientemente para ayudar a su familia. Fueron parte de Kiva en una anterior oportunidad. El crédito que solicita es para comprar libros para su hija que estudia medicina ya que ella se encuentra en el cuarto año de la carrera, el costo de los libros es muy caro por eso se vio en la necesidad de solicitar el crédito.

Guillermo es cliente de impro con un historial de  seis créditos; esta satisfecho con el servicio que prestamos.

Por tener un buen historial y por la actividad califica para obtener un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Guillermo lives in his own home in the region of Villa Nuevo Potosi in the city of La Paz. He is married and he has two children, one of whom already has a career and the other is studying to be a doctor. Guillermo's income is generated through a newspaper. He is a graphic artist and his wife works independently to help support the family. They have been Kiva clients in one past occasion. The loan that is requested will be used to purchase books for their daughter to study medicine. She is in her fourth year of her education and the price of the books is very expensive, which is why he saw the need to request a loan. Guillermo is a client of Impro (Kiva Field Partner) and he has had six past loans. He is very happy with the support he has received. For having a good history, he is eligible to receive a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchse school books for his daughter who is in her fourth year of medicine.

loans.name: Rodolfo

texts.es: El Señor Rodolfo dedicado a la construcción, y también al alquiler de un local que el tiene y que le genera un ingreso extra, este local durante bastante tiempo lo fue construyendo con mucho sacrificio y ahora ya lo tiene en buenas condiciones pero aun faltan algunos detalles y el crédito es justamente para que  pueda arreglar esos detalle comprar material de construcción, el mismo refaccionara el local,  el  ingreso percibido por el local le permite hacer estudiar a sus hijos que se encuentran en la universidad y que le generan bastantes gastos, este crédito ayudara al señor Rodolfo a consolidar su actividad y continuar trabajando con esta.
texts.en:
Rodolfo is a construction worker but he also would like to rent out store space, which would be a second source of income. He had been in the process of building this store space for a long time and with a great deal of effort. He has completed most of the building but a few areas still need to be finished. This loan will be used to complete these finishing touches. He will purchase building materials and other items. The additional income that will be generated by renting out this store space will allow him to keep his children in university. This loan will help Rodolfo complete his project.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To complete building a store space.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary I. is currently in the business of selling groundnut paste, bread and fried fish at the market, and is requesting a loan to stock more fresh fish to fry and sell. Mary is 40 years old and is married to a peasant. She has three children who attend school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to provide a food stall for her family.

loans.use: Stock more fresh fish to fry and sell

loans.name: Gloria Etel

texts.es:
Gloria tiene 39 años D. edad, resiD. en el Municipios Santa Elena, Departamento D. Usulután, es casada y vive con su esposo y tres hijos, D. las edades D. 22,18 y 12 años, los cuales depenD. económicamente D. Gloria, ella posee un negocio D. venta D. comida y pupusas. 
El negocio surgió por iniciativa propia, con la ayuda del esposo, atienD. regularmente el negocio por un horario D. 7:00am- 7:00pm, actualmente ella enfrenta un dificultad ya que no tiene el dinero necesario para invertir en el negocio por lo cual solicita un préstamo para compra D. mercadería como son Aceite, Pollo, vegetales, especies, harina D. maíz que son necesarios para la elaboración D. alimentos. Esto contribuirá a mejorar las condiciones del negocio, generar los ingresos necesarios para solventar las necesidades D. la familia.
Las aspiraciones son ampliar el negocio y apoyar a la familia para mejorar las condiciones D. vida.
texts.en:
Gloria is 39 years old. She lives in the Santa Elena town, departament of Usulután. She is married and lives with her husband and three children, aged 22,18 and 12, who depend on Gloria financially. She has a business selling food and pupusas. The business was started by her own initiative, with her husband's help. She tends to the business regularly from 7:00am- 7:00pm. At this time, she faces difficulties because she doesn't have enough money to invest in the business. That is why she is asking for a loan to buy merchandise such as oil, chicken, vegetables, spices, and corn meal, which are necessary to prepare the food. This will contribute to improve business conditions and generate enough income to pay for the family's needs. Her aspirations are to grow the business and support her family to improve their quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise such as oil, chicken, vegetables, spices, and corn meal

loans.name: Caterine

texts.en: Caterine K. is currently in the business of selling charcoal, bread and tomatoes at the gate of her home and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of charcoal to sell. Caterine is 29 years old and is married to a man who works as a driver. She has two children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house that she can rent out.

loans.use: Stock more bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Rosmery

texts.es: La Sra. Rosmery, tiene un negocio de venta de Pollos a la Broaster (Comida Rápida), que generalmente vende a transportistas y a personas de su zona y vecinos que conocen el lugar, su conyugue tiene la actividad de transporte, y trabaja independientemente como taxista, son personas muy jóvenes, y tienen un pequeño hijo de dos años quien es muy querido por ellos y lo cuidan como si fuera un tesoro, están muy contentos por acceder al préstamo ya que así podrán comprar una espiadera (horno para cocer pollos y otros) y así poder ampliar su negocio, están muy agradecidos con la institución por la oportunidad que les brindan en la otorgación del credito.
texts.en:
Señora Rosmery has a business selling roast chicken, generally to drivers passing through and people from the surrounding neighbourhoods who know the location. Her husband is a driver and works for himself driving a taxi. They are both very young. and have a little 2 year old son, who is very precious to them. They are very happy at being able to access this loan, as with it they will be able to purchase an "espiadera" (an oven for cooking chickens and other things), and thus be able to enlarge their business. They are very grateful to this institution for the opportunity given them through this offer of credit.

Translated from Spanish by Rosa Oswald, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy an oven

loans.name: Apio

texts.en: Apio K. is currently in the business of selling charcoal, groundnut paste and fish at the market and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of charcoal to sell. Apio is 31 years old and is married to a man who works as a driver. She has three children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: Stock more bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Jose Alberto

texts.es:
José tiene 43 años de edad, reside en el municipio de Concepción Batres, departamento de Morazán, es casado , vive con la esposa y dos hijos de las edades de 14 y 8 años respectivamente, el se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería. 
El negocio lo inicio a temprano edad ya que los padres siempre se lo inculcaron, la esposa y los hijos le ayudan a cultivar la tierra, no tiene horario fijo, la dificultad que ellos tienen es que necesitan dinero para invertirlo, lo cual están solicitando un préstamo para compra de fertilizante y compra de vacas. Esto le permitirá contar con os materiales producir una buna cosecha y mejor los ingresos de la familia, riesgo es que las lluvias no sean favorables para los cultivos.
Las aspiraciones son ser un agricultor en grande y apoyar a la familia, mejorar las condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Jose is 43 years old and he lives in the Concepcion Batres municipality of the Morazan region. He is married and he lives with his wife and their two children, aged 14 and 8 years old respectively. He is an agriculturist and a farmer. He started his business when he was very young, following his parents' footsteps. His wife and the children help him cultivate the fields. He doesn't have a fixed schedule. The challenge they face is a deficit of funds to invest, which is the reason why he has requested a loan. He will purchase fertilizers and some heads of cattle. This will permit him to have a good harvest and therefore improve the family's income, unless the rains do not permit a good yield. His aspirations are to be a large scale agriculturist to better support his family and to improve their quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: compra de fertilizante y vacas.

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Nancy Edith

texts.es: La Sra Nancy nacida en la ciudad D. La Paz, casada hace 24 años, tienen dos hijos uno D. 24 y 19 años D. edad viven en casa familiar en la Zona la Colorada D. la ciudad D. Santa Cruz, Doña Nancy y su esposo tienen un taller D. costura hace 12 años, confeccionan uniformes para los colegios. Ella es promotora D. cosmeticos hace 10 años y gracias a su esfuerzo fue elegida como lider D. la zona la colorada asi mismo; ella recibe un porcentaje D. su grupo D. promotoras D. esa manera ayuda en los gastos del hogar."El credito que se otorgo es para la compra D. sus productos D. belleza, agradecida por la rapidez y la confianza que deposito la institucion en ella al brindarle el credito".
texts.en:
La Señora Nancy, born in the city of La Paz, married for 24 years, has two children 24 and 19 years old, respectively. They live in the family home in the Colorada Zone in Santa Cruz. Doña Nancy and her husband have run a sewing workshop for 12 years. They make uniforms for schools. She has been a seller of cosmetics for 10 years, and due to her effort she was selected lead salesperson for the Colorada Zone. She receives a percentage from her group of salespeople, and in this way helps to pay expenses of her home. This loan will be used to buy beauty products. She is grateful for the rapid response and the faith that the institution has shown in her by granting this loan request.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of Cosmetics for Resale

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es: La Sra. Rosario vive en el Barrio Villa Warnes,  ella se dedica a la venta de comida por las noches junto con sus hijas, ella es profesora  y trabaja por las mañanas en colegio fe y alegría de la zona del plan 3000. El préstamo que esta solicitando es para comprar un horno, mesas y sillas para ampliar su puesto de venta ya que  su clientela  esta aumentado y desea diversificar su menú. La Sra. Rosario se caracteriza por ser una mujer emprendedora y muy trabajadora, ya que se dedica a dos actividades, Tiene una hija quien le ayuda en la pensión y tiene también el apoyo de su esposo, esta muy agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado .
texts.en:
Señora Rosario lives in the Villa Warnes neighbourhood. With her daughters, she sells food every evening; she is also a teacher and works during the day at the Fe y Alegría College in [a district called] Zone 3000. The loan she is seeking is to purchase an oven, tables and chairs so that she can enlarge her diner. The number of customers is already increasing, and she wishes to diversify her menu. Señora Rosario describes herself as an enterprising and very hard-working woman - as she has shown by dedicating herself to two jobs at once. She has a daughter who helps in the diner, and the support of her husband. She is very grateful to this institution for offering their support.

Translated from Spanish by Rosa Oswald, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy an oven, tables and chairs

loans.name: Mayas Group

texts.es:
La asociación comunal “MAYAS”, es un grupo que está iniciando el ciclo número 3, consta de ocho integrantes, a la cabeza  se encuentra la señora María Graciela como presidenta. 

La  señora María Graciela, tiene como negocio la confección y venta de chamarras. La venta es realizada de lunes a sábado, de cuatro de la tarde a siete de la noche en la feria llamada "Tihuanacu". Su experiencia en el ramo es ya de siete años.  Su solicitud actual es de Bs. 4500.- para la compra de tela.
Con respecto a su permanencia en Pro Mujer, ella ya está más de un año en su asociación.

Las integrantes A.C. “Mayas” tienen diferentes negocios, entre ellos: venta de polleras y mantas, venta de salchipapas, confección de chamarras, venta de anticuchos y refrescos, producción de peluches, venta de fierros angulares  (Cerrajería), confección de chamarras y tejidos a mano.
texts.en:
The communal bank, Mayas, is a group that is beginning their third loan cycle. It consists of eight members, the head of which is María Graciela as president.

María Graciela has a business making and selling jackets. The sales are done from Monday to Saturday from 4-7pm in a market called Tihuanacu. She already has seven years of experience in the industry. Her current loan (within the group) is for 4500 BOB, for the purchase of fabric. With respect to her continuance in Pro Mujer, she has already been in her group for more than a year.

The members of the communal bank Mayas have different businesses. Among them are: skirt and blanket sales, hot dog sales, making jackets, kebab and refreshment sales, making stuffed animals, selling angular pieces of metal (locksmith), and making jackets and knitted items by hand.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fabric

loans.name: Foska

texts.es: La Señora Foska una mujer emprendedora que trabaja muy fuerte para mantener a sus pequeños, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa  en la zona en la que vive, acomodando las prendas a sus clientas con un carisma único que es irresistible no comprarle una prenda de vestir, ella se gana la vida realizando sus ventas diarias que favorecen a sus hijos para que ellos puedan estudiar dignamente gracias al esfuerzo de su madre, es muy trabajadora, con el dinero del crédito comprara mercadería de temporada ya que  esta cerca la temporada de primavera, quiere proveerse de mercadería, esta muy agradecida con la institucion por el apoyo brindado en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Señora Foska is an enterprising woman who works very hard to support her children. She earns her living by selling clothing in the neighbourhood where she lives. Foska is very charismatic so her customers find it impossible not to buy something from her. She goes to work every day to support her children so they can study properly thanks to the efforts of their hardworking mother. With the loan Foska plans to obtain clothing appropriate to the season since Spring is approaching. She is grateful to the institution for the financial help it provides.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy seasonal clothing

loans.name: Victor Justo

texts.es: El Sr. Víctor cliente antiguo que ingreso en el año 2006, durante todo este tiempo el cliente demostró ser una persona responsable aunque en algunas ocasiones por motivos de salud ha tenido algún tropiezo en sus cuotas. El cliente esta implementando otra actividad para su esposa gracias a prestamos de Emprender.  El Señor Víctor es uno de los mejores torneros de la zona El Tejar quien tiene muchas obras y ganas de trabajar para seguir adelante con los estudios de sus tres hijos , dos de ellos con estudios superiores en la Universidad y la menor en colegio. El señor tiene una visión de que sus hijos se superen y que sean profesionales para afrontar un día mejor para el mañana.  El destino del crédito es el de comprar mercadería para su esposa ya que tiene poco capital de trabajo porque quiere colaborar para que se independice.
texts.en:
Sr. Victor is a former client who started with Kiva partner Emprender in 2006. During this time he showed himself to be a responsible individual although on one or two occasions he had to miss repayments because of health problems. Now Victor and his wife have started another business thanks to a loan from Emprender. He is one of the best lathe operators in the El Tejar area so he has a lot of work and a big desire to get ahead and support his three children with their education. Two of them are university students, and the youngest is in high school. Victor’s hope is to see his children do really well so that they get good jobs and do well in life. He will use the loan to buy merchandise (footwear) for his wife's business as she has little capital and he wants to help her become independent.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy footwear

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es: Ana Maria tiene 29 años, su actividad es venta de ropa variada, productos de medicina natural entre otras cosas. Ella es una persona que busca la forma de trabajar y proporcionarle a su familia lo necesario. Tiene 3 hijos menores de edad a su cargo, cuando inicio este negocio fue por su Mama que le enseño a trabajar de la manera más humilde y sincera. Ella tiene muchos clientes de los cuales siempre le solicitan diferentes productos. Este financiamiento es para la compra de materia prima e invertir de todo un poco. Ella sueña con mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
29-year old Ana Maria earns her living by selling clothing, natural medicines, and other items. She is the kind of person who seeks out work so she can provide the necessities for her family. She has three young children to support. When she started out, it was her mother who taught her how to work in a straightforward and sincere way. She has many customers who are always asking her for different products. Ana Maria will use the loan to buy other merchandise so she has a little of everything. Her dream is to make improvements to her house.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Shirley Lorenis

texts.es:
En San Jacinto población del departamento de Bolívar, muy cerca a la carretera troncal de occidente vive Shirley, mujer de 29 años quien desde la edad de 13, aprendió a tejer mochilas con una vecina y en la actualidad es su actividad principal, porque  la artesanía  le permite ganar dinero y estar pendiente de las labores del hogar y generar ingresos, mientras su  esposo, profesor en un colegio de primaría, y  ella sueñan y trabajan persistentemente para sacar a sus cuatro hijos adelante, que están en las edades de 2 a 10 años.
 Este es su segundo crédito con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con él   comprará  en mayor volumen hilos para tejer mochilas y bolsos, así ella, consiguiendo nuevos clientes, empieza a poner en marcha su sueño de tener un  almacén  de artesanías y de materias primas para la elaboración de las hermosas y autóctonas mochilas y hamacas, que son muy reconocidas y con su utilidad  aspira a generar mas ingresos para el bienestar de su familia, terminar de construir su casa  y en el futuro hacer de sus hijos unos profesionales.
 Shirley cuenta que en su negocio ha tenido muchos desafíos que la han enseñado, entre otros  la situación más difícil que vivió cuando dejó a  un cliente   una importante cantidad de  mercancía y este  nunca le pago, generando la  descapitalización de su negocio, por lo que tuvo que empezar de nuevo sus. Pero eso es cosa del pasado y ahora se esfuerza diariamente por tener clientes fieles y honestos.
texts.en:
Shirley lives in the town of San Jacinto in the Bolíar department, which is very close to the main road to the west. She is 29 years old, and when she was 13 she learned how to weave backpacks with a neighbor. This is currently her main activity because handicrafts have allowed her to earn money, take care of the household chores, and generate income. Her husband is an elementary school teacher. They dream and work persistently in order to get their four children ahead. The children range in ages from two to ten. This is her second loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will use the loan to buy a greater volume of yarn to weave the backpacks and handbags. That way she will be getting new customers, and she will start on her dream of having a handicraft place for storage. It will have the raw material for making her beautiful indigenous backpacks and hammocks, which are very well known. With the profits, she aspires to generate more income for her family’s well-being, to finish building her house, and that her children become professionals in the future. Shirley says that in her business she has had many challenges that she learned from. The most difficult one that she had was when she gave a customer an important amount of merchandise, and the customer never paid. This took capital from her business, and she had to start again. But, this is a thing of the past. Now she puts forth daily effort to have customers that are loyal and honest.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a greater volume of yarn to weave backpacks and handbags

loans.name: Arturo Damian

texts.es:
Arturo vive en actualmente en la  ciudad Santani pero es oriundo Gral. Aquino tiene 21 año está cursando el tercer año de Contaduría Pública en la Universidad Nacional De Asunción filial Santani. 
 En el año 2007 tuvo que dejar su hogar para cursar la carrera  
Arturo actualmente está trabajando como auxiliar administrativo en la SENEPA el cual es una institución que depende de Ministerio de Salud Publica.
El solicita el préstamo para el pago de matrícula de su facultad.
Este muy agradecido por el crédito que podrá facilita el pago de su facultad y lo podrá pagar en varias cuotas.
Su deseo es la trabajar en un buen puesto para ganar un  buen salario y de esa manera ayudar a sus padres quienes se ha sacrificado mucho para salir adelante.
texts.en:
Arturo currently lives in the city of Santani but he’s originally from General Aquino. He’s 21 years old and is in the third year of Public Accounting at the Santani campus of National University of Asunción. He left home in 2007 to pursue his studies. He’s currently employed as an Administrative Assistant at SENEPA which is an institution within the Public Health Ministry. He requests funding to pay tuition. He is very grateful for the loan which will facilitate his paying tuition and that he can repay in several payments. His wish is have a good, well-paying position so that he can help his parents who have sacrificed so much for him to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay tuition and buy textbooks.
